column45:
About the Event:

  • Embedathon is the flagship task-based hackathon hosted by the IEEE NITK Student Branch
  • Conducted in collaboration with the IEEE CAS Society
  • Now in its 7th edition, bigger and more exciting than ever
  • Features a captivating problem statement focused on embedded systems
  • Includes exclusive resources, workshops, and expert talks
  • Designed to offer an engaging, hands-on, and fun learning experience

Why Participate:

  • Enhance skills in:
  • Embedded systems
  • Coding
  • Hardware design
  • Collaborate with like-minded peers and expand your professional network
  • Learn from industry experts through workshops and technical talks
  • Gain real-world experience by solving complex technical problems
  • Work on an exciting problem statement and showcase innovative solutions
  • Strengthen your resume and technical profile
  • Win attractive prizes and earn recognition
  • Be part of a thrilling and enjoyable competition

Who Can Participate:

  • Open exclusively to 1st and 2nd-year B.Tech students
  • Students from colleges across India are eligible
  • Suitable for:
  • Beginners
  • Students with prior exposure to embedded systems

What to Expect:

  • Immersive exposure to the world of embedded systems
  • Challenging problem statements with real-world relevance
  • Opportunity to apply theoretical knowledge practically
  • Platform to innovate, collaborate, and learn

General Disclaimer:

Organizers have full authority over:

  • Participant qualification
  • Competition results
  • Prize distribution
  • All decisions made by the organizers are final and binding

Re-evaluation requests:

  • Considered only if valid and substantiated
  • Acceptance or rejection is solely at the organizers’ discretion

Prize distribution timeline:

  • May take up to one month after the event

Participation implies:

  • Full understanding and acceptance of all terms and conditions
  • Organizers reserve the right to:
  • Disqualify participants
  • Withhold prizes in case of rule violations or ethical misconduct

column45:
Step into the world of strategy, creativity, and marketing brilliance with Kotler's Maniac, the flagship marketing event of the prestigious BASH (Business Associate Special Hours). Named after the legendary marketing guru Philip Kotler, this event is designed to challenge the sharpest minds in innovative marketing and branding.

Let your ideas roar louder than the market noise—because this is where legends are made.

Rules and Regulations:

  • Participants can participate in teams of 1 - 4.
  • There must not be technical issues from the participants' side.
  • The organizing committee shall not be held responsible for any such issues.
  • No disrespect shall be shown towards the judges.
  • Strict actions will be taken against those who break the discipline of the competition.
  • No entries will be entertained after the decided time limit.
  • The presentation should not contain any sort of disrespectful content towards any caste or religion.
  • Any sort of plagiarism will lead to immediate disqualification.
  • In any sort of dilemma during the competition, the decision of the judges will be final and binding.

column45:
Think you have what it takes to turn raw data into a strategic roadmap? Statistella is the flagship Data Analytics competition organized as part of B.A.S.H., the premier business festival of the Business Club, IIT (BHU).

This competition challenges participants to demonstrate exceptional analytical and problem-solving abilities. By starting with visualization and ending with predictive modeling, the event ensures that participants understand both the "why" and the "what" of data science.

Rules & Regulations:

  • Team Size: A team can have a maximum of 4 participants.
  • Registration: A participant can register in only one team; multiple entries are not allowed.
  • Composition: Cross-specialization, cross-college, and cross-year teams are allowed.
  • Submission: Late submissions will not be accepted, and any violation of rules will lead to immediate disqualification.
  • Finality: The decision of the judges and organizers will be final and incontestable.

column45:
Think you have what it takes to be the next visionary Product Manager? This competition revolves around a real-world problem statement, inspired by those commonly asked in company interviews, offering valuable exposure. Teams will be required to submit solution slides, and based on these submissions, the top teams will be shortlisted for interviews.

About Prodhive

Prodhive is an annual Product Case Study competition organized by BASH, the flagship event of the Business Club, IIT (BHU). It offers participants an exciting opportunity to showcase their product management skills by analyzing user experience, understanding market dynamics, and proposing strategic product enhancements. Participants are expected to create innovative, audience-focused product plans with impactful features and upgrades.

About HelloPM

HelloPM is a growing community built for aspiring and experienced product managers to learn, connect, and grow together. Focused on practical product thinking, real-world problem solving, and industry exposure, HelloPM creates opportunities through learning resources, discussions, and hands-on initiatives, helping individuals build strong product sense and make meaningful impact in the product ecosystem.

Rules & Regulations

  • Participants can register in only one team; multiple entries are not allowed.
  • Cross-specialization, cross-college, and cross-year teams are allowed.
  • Further instructions will be communicated via email.
  • Any violation of rules will result in immediate disqualification of the entire team.
  • Late submissions will not be accepted.
  • Presentations must not contain disrespectful content related to any caste or religion.

column45:
Consultium, is an esteemed consulting case competition that challenges participants to tackle real-world business challenges and devise innovative solutions in a high-pressure, fast-paced environment.

The competition format is designed to simulate the rigor and demands of a consulting career, requiring participants to work collaboratively in teams to present their solutions effectively to a panel of expert judges. To excel in Consultium, contestants must demonstrate exceptional analytical and critical thinking skills, as well as proficiency in communication and research.

Don't miss this opportunity to test your abilities and showcase your talents in the field of consulting - register for Consultium today!

Rules:

  • Participants can participate in teams of 1-4.
  • Participants' devices must have a speaker, mic, and camera in proper working conditions.
  • There must not be technical issues from the participants' side.
  • The organizing committee shall not be held responsible for any such issues.
  • No disrespect shall be shown towards the judges. Strict actions will be taken against those who break the discipline of the competition.
  • No entries will be entertained after the decided time limit.
  • The presentation should not contain any sort of disrespectful content towards any caste or religion.
  • Any sort of plagiarism will lead to immediate disqualification.
  • In any sort of dilemma during the competition, the decision of the judges will be final and binding.

column11: FORE School of Management, Gurugram Campus
column45:
About:

Spark your eloquence at Clash of Icons! Brace yourself for a clash of ideas, ideologies, and personas, presented by Team FOREword, the Editorial Committee, in collaboration with SIG-Sankalp, the Hindi Committee of FORE School of Management. Step into the shoes of iconic personalities and engage in a battle of wits and intellect, where history meets contemporary challenges. Prepare for an immersive, two-round experience filled with critical thinking, creativity, spirited debates, and exciting rewards.

Event Highlights:

  • Two engaging rounds: An online quiz and an offline persona-based debate simulation, testing your skills creativity and critical thinking skills 
  • Eligibility: Open to post-grads from business schools across the country. An Opportunity to showcase argumentation, creativity and persona authenticity.
  • Prize Pool: Win big with Rs.7000 for the Winner, Rs. 5000 for the 1st Runner-Up and Rs. 3000 for the 2nd Runner-Up.

Round Details:

Round 1 – Quiz:

  • Conquer questions related to historical references and iconic personalities to be finished within a given time frame. Shortlisting will be done based on the time taken to complete the quiz and the accuracy of the responses.

Round 2 – Clash of Icons:

  • It will be an immersive persona-driven debate experience that challenges participants to step into the shoes of iconic historical or contemporary figures. Three days before the event, each participant will be assigned a specific persona. On the day of the event, participants will be presented with a contemporary issue requiring interpretation and response through the lens of their allotted persona. The round will test ideological clarity, authenticity, critical thinking, and persuasive articulation while staying in character throughout.

Event Flow:

Persona Allocation: Each participant will be assigned a historical or contemporary persona three days prior to the event.

Topic Revelation & Preparation: The debate topic will be revealed on the spot by the judges to ensure spontaneity. Participants will be given 1 minute to understand the topic, determine the stance their persona would adopt, and frame their core arguments. A 30-second clarification window will be provided to seek clarification from the moderator.

Constructive Speech: Each participant will be given 2 minutes to present their arguments, rooted in their persona’s ideology, philosophy, tone, and worldview.

Interjections and Rebuttals: Participants will engage in direct rebuttals for 2 minutes. A maximum of two rebuttals will be allowed, with each rebuttal not exceeding 1 minute. Participants must remain in character throughout the exchange.

Counter and Conclusion: Participants will be given 2 minutes to summarise their arguments, reinforce their persona’s core philosophy, and conclude with how their persona would interpret or resolve the modern issue.

Rules and Guidelines:

  • Each participant must remain in character throughout all stages of the debate.
  • A participant can take part in only one character-topic match-up.
  • Only English may be used during the debate.
  • Use of minimal and non-disruptive props or accessories is allowed.
  • Exceeding time limits may lead to score deductions at the moderator’s discretion.
  • Personal attacks or inappropriate humour are strictly prohibited; critiques must be character-based.
  • The decision of the judges will be final and binding.

Why Join?

  • Sharpen your intellect through a unique persona-based debate format.
  • Experience a blend of historical ideology and contemporary problem-solving.
  • Gain recognition for your debating, creativity, and character portrayal skills.

How to Register?

Submit your details such as name, email address, telephone number, and postal address to be part of this experience. Intellectual rigor, creative expression, and exciting prizes await you at Clash of Icons. Don’t miss your chance to participate in this one-of-a-kind debate experience, register now and let the icons clash!

column45:
In its Business Plan Competition, Concoct 2025-26, the Institutions Innovation Council (IIC) of FORE School of Management, offers you a chance to showcase your enterprising talent. Before you go out to test the waters, you have the opportunity to improve your B-Plan.

Event Structure:

Round 1 - B-Plan Submission:

This round will be conducted in an online submission format. Each participating team is required to submit a summary Business Plan adhering to the guidelines mentioned below:

  • The Business Plan must be 6–7 pages in length, excluding the cover page.

  • The submission must be in PDF format only.

  • File naming convention: TeamName_CollegeName.pdf

  • A two-page Executive Summary, followed by

The submission should be concise, structured, and specific, clearly addressing the following aspects (as applicable):

  • Business Opportunity
  • Industry Analysis
  • Competitors Analysis
  • Organizational Structure
  • Financial Plan
  • Marketing Plan
  • Operational Plan
  • Market Research

Final Round - B- Plan Presentation:

This will be the Final Round of Concoct’25 which will be held in FORE campus on January 10, 2025. The Top 10 teams selected should be there at the FORE campus for their B-plan presentation. Each Team will present its Business Plan in front of an Esteemed Panel of Judges. The top 2 teams will be awarded prizes along with the Certicates.

Format:

Submissions from Round 1 will be divided into 2 categories:

Category 1: Business plan of the operational venture which is in business for atleast 3 months.
Category 2: Startup idea which is not materialised yet or has been in business for less than 3 months.

The winner would be declared from each category.

Guidelines:

Team Formation:

  • The team may be represented by a minimum of 2 members and a maximum of 6 members.
  • Plagiarism is not acceptable. A levy of up to 30% is tolerable.
  • There is no restriction on the number of teams from an institute.
  • The contest is open to all students pursuing any postgraduate/undergraduate course.
  • The team name must not include the name of the college of participating students.
  • All the members of a team must be students of the same college.

General:

  • In case of any discrepancies, the final decision of the organizers will be final and binding for all participants.
  • Participants are expected to not indulge in any unfair or unethical means of conduct.
  • For any communications regarding the event, kindly mail queries to iic.team@fsm.ac.in

column45:
About the Event:  

GameSmith is a unique Gamathon inviting Indian entrepreneurs, startups, industry experts, and students to unleash their creativity and craft innovative games across a variety of genres. From adventure-packed quests to educational platforms, this is your chance to design the next big thing in gaming while addressing themes relevant to MyGov.  

Team Size: 2-4 members  

Genres of Games:  

  • Adventure Games  
  • Real-Time Strategy (RTS)  
  • Board Games  
  • Puzzle Games  
  • Role Playing Games (RPG)  
  • Educational Games  
  • Open Theme  

Game Design Engines:  

  • Contestants may use any free/open-source platforms like Scratch, GODOT, Unity, Cocos2d, or others to develop their games.  

Evaluation Process:  

The Gamathon will follow a structured three-stage selection process:  

Round 1: Registration and Idea Submission  

  • Teams must register and submit a presentation (4-10 slides) outlining their game idea.  
  • Evaluation Criteria:  
    1. Overall idea  
    2. Number of players in the game  
    3. Uniqueness of the concept  

Deadline: January 13, 2026 (Online)

Round 2: Submission Round  

Teams shortlisted from Round 1 must submit:  

  • Overview of the game and design/development process with screenshots/images.  
  • The game’s alignment with MyGov themes.  
  • A 4-5 slide presentation detailing:  
  • A 4-minute gameplay video showcasing interaction and gameplay.  

Event Date: January 24, 2025 (Offline)  

Round 3: Jury Round  

Selected teams will:  

  • Demonstrate their game to the Jury.  
  • Submit an executable version of the game playable on a web browser.  
  • Provide source code and libraries.  
  • Participate in a Q&A session with Jury members.  

Event Date: January 23, 2026 (Offline)  

Evaluation Criteria:  

  • Gameplay (10 Marks): Smoothness, balance, and meaningful player choices.  
  • Originality (15 Marks): Innovation and uniqueness of the design.  
  • Use of Theme (25 Marks): Relevance and clarity of MyGov themes.  
  • Overall WOW Factor (30 Marks): Engagement, fun, and shareability. 

Bring your creativity, strategy, and passion for gaming to CodeCraft and compete to create the ultimate gaming experience!

column45:
CarbonQuest is a flagship sustainability-focused competition under Adhikosh, where teams act as sustainability consultants for carbon-intensive industries.
The challenge encourages participants to identify emission hotspots and propose innovative, data-driven decarbonization strategies — supported by a comprehensive financial cost-benefit model.

Objective:

To promote climate innovation by engaging students in real-world carbon reduction challenges while enhancing analytical, technical, and financial modeling skills.

Team Structure

  • 1–4 members per team
  • Cross-disciplinary teams encouraged (Finance, Operations, Sustainability, Engineering, etc.)

What Participants Need to Do: Each team must:

Round 1:- 

  • Choose a Carbon-Intensive Sector or 5 Companies from such sectors
  • Examples: Cement, Steel, Aviation, Oil & Gas, Transportation, Textiles, FMCG, Energy, or Agriculture.
  • Identify Emission Sources
  • Scope 1, 2, and 3 emissions.
  • Propose a Decarbonization Strategy, including:
  • Problem Identification: Quantify current emission footprint using available data.
  • Innovative Idea or Intervention: Suggest new technology, process redesign, or renewable energy solution.
  • Implementation Strategy: Include stages, partners, timelines, and key enablers (policy, finance, etc.).

Round 2:- PPT + Financial Model

Financial Model:

  • Cost of implementation
  • Expected emission reduction (in tonnes COe)
  • ROI, payback period, and cost per tonne of carbon avoided
  • Net benefit to company and society
  • Measurement & Monitoring Plan: Define KPIs and metrics to track emission reduction over time.
  • Awareness/Communication Plan (Bonus): How the company can brand itself as a sustainability leader.

Submission Format

  • Round 1 (Screening): PPT (3 – 4 Slides)
  • Round 2 (Final Presentation): PPT + Financial Model
  • Optional Annexure: Technical calculations, data sources, or simulation results.

Evaluation Criteria

Criteria Weightage
Innovation & Practicality 25%
Technical & Environmental Depth 20%
Financial Model (Cost-Benefit) 25%
Implementation Feasibility 15%
Presentation & Clarity 15%

column45:
Corporate Social responsibility (CSR) is a continuing commitment by businesses to integrate social and environmental concerns in their business operations. Changes in the global environment increasingly challenges businesses worldwide to look beyond financial performance, and to integrate social and ecological concerns into their strategic management. It is the initiative to embrace responsibility for a company’s actions and positively impact society through activities involving stakeholders and the environment. Whether a force for good or an exercise in brand building, CSR remains integral to the global business landscape. In light of this, Team ANTAR, in collaboration with Team CSD, is conducting PRERNA, a CSR-based case study competition at the annual fest, GENESIS. The idea revolves around finding an innovative and effective solution to the case study provided to them. It will test their innovation, knowledge, problem-solving, and creative skills.

Guidelines:

  • The competition will be conducted in 3 rounds: 2 online and 1 Offline.
  • The First Round is the online quiz round.
  • The Second Round is the submission of the solution to the case problem.
  • The third Round will be an offline presentation round.
  • Entries are accepted from colleges/institutes all over India & participating teams can have a  minimum of 2 and a maximum of 4 members.
  • Eligibility: MBA students, Engineering students, and undergraduates from any field can participate in this competition.

Round 1:

  • This will be an online (MCQ) quiz round on the unstop platform.
  • Each team is required to register with 2-4 members.
  • Cross-college/ institute/ university teams are not allowed.
  • A person can be part of only 1 team. If a person is a part of more than one team, all such teams will be disqualified.
  • There is no restriction on the number of teams participating from a single institute.
  • There will be 20 questions in the quiz and the total time to attempt them is 20 minutes.
  • Only the team leader will be able to attempt the quiz.
  • There will be no negative marking.
  • This will be an elimination round and only the qualifying teams will be eligible to participate in the next round.
  • Elimination will be done based on accuracy and time taken.
  • The time window for the test would be 20 minutes.

Round 2:

  • Only qualified teams from Round 1 will participate in this round.
  • Each team has to submit a crisp idea of their solution in 3 slides for the CSR case study.
  • All slides should use a minimum font size of 24 points and font face "Georgia”.
  • All submissions must be sent to antar@fsm.ac.in by the given deadlines, with the subject line “PRERNA TeamName_College/Institute Name.”
  • Teams qualified for round 2 should note that the title slide should mention the team members' names, college names, e-mail IDs, and contact numbers. The file should be in PPT format.

Round 3:

  • All the shortlisted teams are supposed to make a detailed presentation of their solutions that can have a maximum of 12 slides (Excluding the Title page, appendix, etc.).
  • The Title slide should mention the team member’s name, team name, college name, e-mail IDs, and contact numbers. 
  • All slides should use a minimum font size of 24 points and font face "Georgia".
  • All submissions are to be mailed to antar@fsm.ac.in as per the deadlines given, with the subject line “PRERNA TeamName_College/Institute Name”.
  • The teams are required to present their case solution offline during GENESIS 25.
  • Teams will be evaluated on the feasibility, uniqueness, and sustainability of the solution proposed.
  • The decision of the judges will be final and binding.

column45:
This event challenges participants to design an autonomous decision-making agent that competes in a controlled environment.
Participants will receive a code template containing the required function signatures. They must implement the logic of their agent strictly within this template and submit a single Python file as their entry.

General Rules:

  • Participants must use the official template provided.
  • All logic must reside inside one Python (.py) file.
  • No additional files, libraries, or external dependencies will be accepted.
  • Only basic algorithmic techniques are permitted. Reinforcement learning or any learning-based methods are strictly prohibited.
  • Any attempt to manipulate, exploit, or bypass the evaluation mechanism (including hacking, exploiting loopholes, manipulating score outputs, hard-coding predictions, or reverse-engineering the backend) will result in immediate disqualification.
  • The agent must operate purely from the information passed to it through the provided function calls.
  • The event is competitive. Performance is determined solely by backend evaluation under identical conditions for all participants.
  • Submission : Online
  • Once the problem statement is released, the subission must be done within the next 12 hours.



  • As part of our ongoing collaboration with Devdock.AI, every participant is required to complete the registration process by following the steps provided in the document. This will help us streamline technical access, ensure authentication, and enable smooth coordination for upcoming activities. (Also this is an important criteria for participating and only participants who have successfully completed the Devdock registration and have been verified will be eligible to apply for the hackathon.)

    What you need to do (In detail instructions provided in the doc):
    1 Download the Devdock extension
    2 Sign up using your GitHub account
    3 Follow the instructions in the this PDF 
    4 Upload your screenshot in the Google Form

    Google Form

    Your quick response is important — please complete the process at the earliest!
    If you face any issues, feel free to reach out. Let’s get this done together!

    If you have any doubts contact:
    8269928840
    Atharva Waghmare

column2: Rapid Fire Tech Battle: Round 1 (The Qualifiers)
column45:
Welcome to Rapid Fire Tech Battle! >

This is the first hurdle in our 3-round technical showdown. Round 1 is an eliminator quiz designed to test your speed and technical accuracy.

Round 1 Details:

  • Format: Online Quiz.

  • Questions: 30 Questions.

  • Time: 15 Minutes (Speed is key!).

  • Topics: Programming (C++, Java, Python), Data Structures, Algorithms, and Core Tech Trends.

Note: Only the top [Number] participants will move on to Round 2.

column45:
About the National Policy Challenge:

  • Co-branded by Tata Pension Fund Management (Tata PFM)
  • Flagship event of Ka-Ching X EJCon
  • Annual economics and management festival of Sarla Anil Modi School of Economics, NMIMS Mumbai
    Hands-on policy challenge focused on:
    • Exploring key sectors across India
    • Identifying policy gaps
    • Proposing practical and implementable solutions
  • Certificates issued by Tata PFM for all teams submitting valid Round 1 entries

Purpose of the Challenge:

  • Translates policy theory into real-world policymaking
  • Moves beyond classroom learning and case studies
  • Offers exposure to national-level policy challenges
  • Helps participants understand how policies are shaped by:
  • Laws and governance structures
  • Political decision-making
  • Social and economic realities
  • Encourages interdisciplinary thinking across: Economics, Politics, Public Policy, 

Learning Outcomes:

  • Develop strong research, analytical, and advisory skills
  • Gain insights into public policy formulation and evaluation
  • Experience structured, eliminative competition rounds
  • Final round focused on reimagining India’s Pension System

General Guidelines:

  • Team-based participation:
  • 3–4 members per team
  • All rounds are submission-based
  • Submissions required in .pdf and .doc formats

Round-1:

  • Conducted online
  • Eliminative in nature

Round 2 (Final):

  • Hybrid format
  • Option to present online or in-person
  • Venue: NMIMS Mumbai campus
  • Date: 10th January
  • Only 5 teams will advance from Round 1 to Round 2

Round 1: Background & Focus

  • Introduction to public policy analysis in the Indian context
  • Encourages comparison with international policy frameworks
  • Helps assess:
  • Global best practices
  • Feasibility and alignment with Indian realities
  • Teams will:
    • Select one Indian public policy or major initiative from given options
    • Analyze its strengths, gaps, and impact
    • Compare it with a similar international policy
    • Draw relevant lessons for India
  • Emphasis on rigorous research and sensitive perspectives

column45:
Mind the Product is one of the spotlight competitions of E-Summit’26, bringing together India’s brightest young innovators to solve real-world product challenges. With leading companies presenting industry-backed problem statements, participants get the rare chance to think like product managers, conducting research, brainstorming solutions, and crafting strategies that create real impact. Designed for scale and accessibility through a hybrid format, the event transforms E-Summit’26 into a powerhouse of creativity and collaboration, offering students a launchpad to showcase their skills, learn from experts, and stand out in the country’s biggest entrepreneurial festival.

Eligibility Criteria:

  • Open to students from all colleges.
  • Team size: 3–5 members
  • Participants from any discipline can apply.
  • No prior experience required.

Rules:

  • Each team must have 3–5 members.
  • One team leader must be assigned.
  • Crosscollege teams allowed.
  • Plagiarism or use of AI tools beyond instructions will lead to disqualification.
  • All submissions must be original and adhere to deadlines.
  • All the decisions taken by jury and E-Summit Organising Team in any regard will be final and binding.

Round Description:

Round 1: Quiz

  • Date:4 January 2026
  • Eligibility: Only the Team Leader can attempt the quiz
  • Format: 40 MCQs (15 Business-based + 25 Aptitude-based)
  • Duration: 30 minutes
  • Scoring: Each MCQ will be of 1 mark.

Note: This is an eliminator round 

Round 2: Abstract Submission

  • Date:6 January - 10 January 2026
  • Submission: 5-slide deck (excluding intro & outro) in PDF format
  • File Naming: [Team Name]_MTP
  • Content Guidelines:
  • Problem Understanding – Clearly define the core problem and why it matters.
  • User & Market Insight – Highlight key user needs and market observations.
  • Proposed Solution – Present your idea and the value it delivers.
  • Impact & Differentiation – Show how your solution is unique and impactful.
  • Feasibility & Roadmap – Outline practicality and the next steps to build it.
  • File Size Limit: 20 MB

Final Round: On-Campus Presentations (IIT Roorkee – E-Summit '26) 

  • Date:  6th February
  • Format: Shortlisted teams will present their decks offline at IIT Roorkee
  • Judging: Evaluation by panel of experts on creativity, feasibility, and impact
  • Prizes: Winners will receive cash prizes & goodies

column45:
About the event:

  • Ignite your entrepreneurial journey at IdeaStorm, the premier stage where bold ideas take shape. This flagship event pushes you to develop breakthrough business models, work alongside passionate innovators, and present your vision to seasoned investors and industry experts. Engage with emerging entrepreneurs, access transformative mentorship, unlock potential funding opportunities, and earn exclusive rewards. IdeaStorm is more than a competition, it’s the springboard that propels your start-up dreams into action.

Round description:

Round 1: Registrations and abstract submission

  • Date:- 29th December 2025
  • Submission : Abstract of their idea along with their team details.
  • Submission Format :- .pdf
  • Judging :- Entries will be judges on the following criteria:
  • Innovation in your idea
  • Real world problem it mitigates
  • Market opportunity of the idea
  • Unique Selling Point (USP)

Round 2: Business Model Canvas (BMC) Submission

  • Date:- 2nd January 2026 to 6th Januray 2026
  • Submission :- BMC which clearly explains their business idea and their execution
  • Submission Format:- Maximum 7 slide deck in .pdf format
  • Note :- Plagiarism of any sort will lead to disqualification

Round 3: Live pitching round (online)

  • Date :-9th January 2026 to 13 January 2026
  • Format :- shortlisted teams will have to pitch their ideas in time slots of 5-7 mins in an online meeting
  • Judging :- Teams will be judged on the following criteria
  • Feasibility and scalability of the idea
  • Sales and Marketing Plan
  • Market opportunity of the idea
  • Uniqueness in the idea

Final round:-  Offline pitching at E-Summit’26 IIT Roorkee

  • Date :-6th February 2026 to 8th February 2026
  • Format :- Top teams will present their ideas offline to the industry leaders at IIT Roorkeeand may get on-spot investment.
  • Prizes :- Winners will receive cash prizes and goodies

column45:
About the Opportunity:  
Startup Expo is the flagship startup showcase at E-Summit IIT Roorkee 2026, designed to 
connect high-potential startups with leading venture capitalists, investors, and ecosystem 
leaders. This 3-day, sector-agnostic exhibition provides founders a high-impact platform 
to present their innovations, build strategic relationships, and unlock growth opportunities. 
With live product demos, 1-on-1 investor pitching, curated networking sessions, and 
startup-focused workshops, Startup Expo accelerates meaningful engagement between 
startups and capital providers. 
What Startups Get 
Investor Access & Funding 
• 1-on-1 pitching opportunities with 15+ global VCs and investors 
• Direct exposure to active funds and angel networks seeking deployable 
opportunities 
Showcase & Visibility 
• Dedicated kiosk for 2 days to demonstrate your product or service 
• Visibility in front of 15,000+ attendees, including founders, investors, and enablers 
High-Value Networking 
• Exclusive networking sessions with top investors and successful IIT Roorkee 
alumni 
• Curated networking lunch with VCs, industry leaders, and fellow founders 
Learning & Ecosystem Access 
• Startup-focused speaker sessions and workshops 
• Full access to all E-Summit keynote talks, workshops, and flagship events 
Hiring & Talent 
• Participate in the Internship & Talent Fair to connect with students from IIT Roorkee 
and other premier institutes for internships and hiring 
Eligibility 
• Any startup or entrepreneur developing a scalable product or service across any 
sector 
Event Format 
• Hybrid Mode 
• Round 1: Online shortlisting 
• Final Showcase: Offline at IIT Roorkee 
Why Participate 
If you are seeking funding, strategic partnerships, talent, or national visibility, Startup 
Expo at E-Summit IIT Roorkee 2026 is a high-signal platform built for serious founders. 
For further details or a quick discussion, feel free to reach out. 
We look forward to hosting your startup at E-Summit IIT Roorkee 2026.

column45:
Event Overview

The East India Blockchain Summit (EIBS) 2.0 is a flagship hackathon and innovation challenge curated by the Kharagpur Blockchain Society, bringing together some of the brightest student innovators from across disciplines.

This high-impact platform enables participants to ideate, design, and scale solutions in the rapidly evolving blockchain and Web3 ecosystem. Teams will work on real-world problem statements, blending technical depth with creative thinking to push the boundaries of decentralized innovation.

Beyond the competitive aspect, EIBS 2.0 offers direct exposure to industry leaders, mentors, and founders, along with hands-on learning and high-value networking.

Get the opportunity to witness keynotes and workshops from top industry leaders, and network with the brightest of minds in the Web3 space

Top-performing teams will compete for a substantial prize pool, incubation and mentorship opportunities, and exclusive rewards, positioning EIBS 2.0 as a true launchpad for the next generation of blockchain builders.

Eligibility & Participation Guidelines

  • Open to undergraduate and postgraduate students (full-time or part-time) from any discipline, enrolled in any recognized Indian college or institution.
  • Participants may register in teams of 2-4 members
  • Cross-discipline and cross-college teams are allowed, promoting diverse collaboration.
  • Each participant can be part of only one team throughout the event.
  • All team members must individually verify and confirm their details for the team to be considered valid.
  • Any violation of these guidelines will result in immediate disqualification of the entire team.

Student Verification & Documentation

  • Participants must be currently enrolled in a recognized degree or diploma program (full-time or part-time) in India.
  • Valid proof of enrollment, age, and address must be submitted upon request by East India Blockchain Summit 2025 for eligibility verification.
  • Failure to provide the required documents may lead to disqualification.

Submission Format (Important)

  • The initial submission round is PPT-only.
  • Working prototype or project submission is optional at the PPT Submission Round.
  • Shortlisted teams advancing to the Grand Finale must present a working prototype during the Final Round.

column45:
Overview:

  • A high-impact growth challenge for founders and growth operators
  • Focuses on building distribution before product perfection
  • Emphasises hands-on execution over theory
  • Designed for fast-moving, experiment-driven growth thinkers

Who It’s For:

  • Growth marketing founders & operators
  • Builders who turn experiments into repeatable systems
  • People who believe distribution is a product
  • Those who build in public, test aggressively, and learn fast
  • Individuals who value ownership, leverage, and real outcomes

About Entrext:

  • A collective of high-velocity builders, founders, and growth operators
  • Core beliefs:
  • Growth is engineered, not guessed
  • Ownership matters more than resumes
  • Speed and clarity beat over-planning
  • Learning happens by shipping in public
  • Mission: Create builders and growth leaders, not interns

What You Will Build:

  • A real growth system for a Distribution Product MVP
  • A working growth engine, not just marketing slides

Your Mission:

  • Design and execute a growth & distribution strategy
  • Help creators, teams, and businesses distribute content effortlessly
  • Prove the strategy works with real execution and results

Core Growth Requirements:

Go-To-Market (GTM) Strategy:

  • Clear Ideal Customer Profile (ICP)
  • Defined primary use cases
  • Positioning and messaging framework

Distribution Engine:

  • Growth loops (viral, content, referral, community-driven)
  • Channel strategy (Email, Telegram, Slack, Discord, Twitter/X, LinkedIn, etc.)
  • Trigger-based or behavior-driven campaigns

Experimentation System:

  • Clear growth hypotheses
  • Rapid experiments with measurable outcomes
  • Metrics: activation, retention, engagement, distribution reach

Analytics & Tracking:

  • Defined north-star metric
  • Funnel tracking
  • Message and campaign performance insights

Documentation:

  • Growth playbook
  • Experiment results
  • Analysis of what worked, what failed, and why

Bonus (Optional):

  • Landing page and onboarding flow
  • Community-led growth strategy
  • Automation using tools (Zapier, APIs, webhooks, no-code tools)
  • Case-study style breakdown
  • API-first or product-led growth ideas

Rewards:

First Place:

  • 10% ownership in every product built at Entrext Tech
  • Growth Lead / Growth Founder track role
  • Priority access to future Entrext missions
  • Spotlight across Entrext platforms
  • Lifetime access to Entrext Builder Network

Second Place:

  • Collaboration on selected Entrext products
  • Early access to paid growth challenges
  • Social media and community feature

Third Place:

  • Access to builder and growth events
  • Sprint programs
  • Certificate of participation
  • Priority consideration for future Entrext challenges

Extra Benefits for Top Builders:

  • 1:1 feedback sessions with Entrext founders
  • Access to internal Entrext growth playbooks
  • Official Entrext Growth Builder Badge
  • Opportunity to shadow a real product growth sprint

Submission Requirements:

  • Growth strategy document (Notion or Google Docs)
  • Experiment logs with metrics
  • 2–4 minute demo or walkthrough video
  • Clear GTM and distribution plan
  • Optional long-term growth roadmap

Judging Criteria:

  • Clarity of growth thinking
  • Quality of experiments
  • Measurable results
  • Creativity in distribution
  • Ownership mindset
  • Speed and execution

Why Join:

  • Ship real growth systems, not just plans
  • Gain ownership-driven experience
  • Build products from zero to real traction
  • Join a community of serious builders and growth leaders

column45:
CodeWarz is a structured competitive programming event designed to evaluate participants' proficiency in coding, algorithms, and problem-solving. The competition features multiple rounds that test theoretical knowledge, analytical capability, coding accuracy, and response speed.

Event Overview:

  • Participants compete in teams of two and progress through a preliminary screening followed by an intensive multi-round main event. Each stage is designed to assess different dimensions of technical competence.

Round Structure:

Preliminary Round:

  • An MCQ-based assessment covering Programming Fundamentals and Data Structures & Algorithms (DSA).
  • Top-scoring teams will qualify for the Main Rounds.

Main Rounds:

The main event consists of four sub-rounds:

Coding Round:

  • Five programming problems of varying difficulty levels (Easy, Medium, Hard).
  • Evaluation focuses on logic, efficiency, and correctness.

Fill the Algorithm:

  • Teams analyze and correct incomplete algorithms.
  • Tests understanding of algorithmic flow and optimization.

Rapid Fire:

  • A quick-response technical round aimed at testing fundamental knowledge and presence of mind.

ReelsRiddle:

  • A visual interpretation round where participants identify programming concepts based on short video clips.

Evaluation Criteria:

  • Correctness of solutions and number of problems solved
  • Time taken to arrive at the solution
  • Quality of logic and optimisation (time & space)
  • Debugging skills and ability to handle edge cases
  • Team coordination and strategy

Rules & Guidelines:

  • Each team must consist of exactly two members.
  • Only the permitted languages and compilers in the lab may be used.
  • Internet access and external code templates are strictly not allowed.
  • Use of AI coding assistants is not permitted unless explicitly allowed by organisers.
  • Any malpractice will result in immediate disqualification.
  • Organisers and judges reserve the right to modify problems or scoring if required.

column45:
About the Hackathon:

  • AutonomousHacks 2026 is one of India’s largest autonomous AI + Agents hackathons
  • Organized by Google Developer Groups Gandhinagar and Google Developer Groups Cloud Gandhinagar
  • Focuses on building real autonomous, agentic, logic-driven AI systems

Online Hackathon (Round 1):

  • Mode: Virtual
  • Date: 20 December 2025
  • Designed to identify top builders, thinkers, and problem-solvers across India
  • Participants must build agentic systems, multi-step workflows, and autonomous solutions
  • Not a prompt-writing or single-LLM-based hackathon

Why This Hackathon Is Unique:

  • Strong focus on autonomous AI, agents, and workflows
  • Team-based participation (1–4 members per team)
  • Problem statement released on the spot to ensure fairness
  • Short and intense format testing real execution skills
  • Open to students, professionals, and makers across India

What’s at Stake:

  • Prizes worth up to 1.5 Lakhs
  • Participation certificates for all valid submissions
  • Winners and top performers get priority access to the offline finale
  • Chance to qualify for the Offline Grand Finale
  • Seed fund opportunity
  • Opportunity to win exclusive credits

Offline Grand Finale:

  • Shortlisting of top teams from the online round
  • 36-hour offline hackathon
  • Location: Gandhinagar
  • Dates: 10–11 January 2026
  • Includes deep collaboration, mentoring, judging, and final prize distribution

Who Should Participate:

  • AI and automation enthusiasts
  • Developers and system builders
  • Product thinkers and problem-solvers
  • Anyone interested in building autonomous AI systems

Important Dates:

  • Online Hackathon: 20 December 2025 (Virtual)
  • Offline Finale: 10–11 January 2026 (Gandhinagar)

column45:
All That You Need to Know About DataQuest 2026

Step into the future, data warriors! Megalith 2026, IIT Kharagpur presents DataQuest 2026, an online data science and AI hackathon that challenges participants to design and build intelligent systems capable of reasoning over information and generating meaningful outputs.

DataQuest 2026 focuses on applied AI, system design, and problem-solving using modern machine learning approaches.

 

Overview

Calling all data analysts, AI enthusiasts, and machine learning practitioners!

DataQuest 2026 invites you to work on a real-world inspired AI challenge centered around building a Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) pipeline. Participants are expected to design an end-to-end solution that can retrieve relevant information efficiently and generate accurate, context-aware responses.

 

Problem Statement

The problem statement has been attached on the platform.

Participants are required to carefully review the attached problem statement, understand the use case, and start working on their RAG-based solution immediately after registration.

 

Team Formation

  • Team size: 1 to 5 members

  • Solo participation is allowed

  • Inter-college and inter-specialization teams are permitted

Collaboration is encouraged to bring diverse technical strengths together.

 

Eligibility

  • Open to all graduating students

  • Students from any discipline or specialization may participate

  • No restriction on academic background

 

Prizes & Rewards

Prize Pool: Up to 50,000
StockEdge Vouchers for winners to support analytics and AI education
Certificates for top-performing teams

Detailed prize distribution will be announced on the platform.

 

Mandatory Registration Requirement

As part of the registration process, all team members must star the following GitHub repositories:

  • https://github.com/pathwaycom/llm-app

  • https://github.com/pathwaycom/pathway

Only teams that complete this requirement during registration will be eligible to proceed further in the competition.
Proof submission is mandatory and will be verified.

(This requirement is also reflected in the registration form for transparency.)

 

Register now, review the problem statement, and start building your RAG-based solution.
Let intelligence meet implementation.

column45:
Details:

  • A 48-hour, build-focused hackathon scheduled on 10th and 11th January.
  • Registrations open today, with the official kickoff call on 10th January.
  • Designed for builders who want to ship a real AI product, not just concepts or demos.
  • Participants will design, develop, and deploy a complete end-to-end agentic AI system.
  • Covers the full lifecycle, including problem framing, system architecture, tool integration, and a final working demo.
  • Involves working on real-world problem statements.
  • Focuses on building production-ready AI agents capable of reasoning, using tools, and executing workflows autonomously.
  • Emphasizes hands-on execution and product-thinking, alongside modern AI engineering practices.
  • By the end of the hackathon, participants will have a fully functional AI product.
  • The final product can be showcased in portfolios, interviews, or real-world applications.

Indian Institute of Management, Raipur brings Data-De-Cypher, an Excel Treasure Hunt Event organized by Anasys, Analytics and Systems Club of IIM Raipur. Datasets will be given from which you have to solve some questions. It will be an Offline event

Rounds:

  • Only one round will be there which will take approximately 1-2 hours. It will be organized on 24 December from 5 PM at IIM Raipur campus. 
  • Winners will get attractive cash prizes.
  • 1st position - Rs4500, 1st Runner Up - Rs3500, 2nd Runner Up - Rs2000

Rules and Regulations:

  • The event is open to all undergraduate and PGP/MBA students
  • Team size should be 1-2 members.
  • All team members should be from the same institute.
  • All decisions in matters of eligibility, authenticity, and final judgment lie with the Anasys Club, IIM Raipur

column45:
Guidelines:

  • Students pursuing an MBA, from both first-year and second-year batches, are eligible to participate.
  • Participants must form a team of 1–4 members, all from the same college/institute.
  • A student can be part of only one team; each team must consist exclusively of either first-year or second-year students.
  • Any number of teams can participate from a single institute.
  • All shortlisted/qualifying teams must strictly adhere to the instructions provided by the organizing committee regarding submission formats and the designated virtual platforms.
  • Teams must comply with all deadlines; no extensions will be granted under any circumstances.
  • The decisions made by the organizers will be final and binding on all participants.

Rules:

  • Each team shall consist of 1–4 members.
  • All team members must belong to the same college/institute.
  • A team must consist entirely of either first-year or second-year students; mixed-year teams are not permitted.
  • No replacement of team members will be allowed after registration.
  • A student may participate in only one team for this competition.

column45:
Pitch Tank is a pan-India startup pitching competition curated for innovative student-led startups aiming to present their ideas to venture capitalists, angel investors, and industry experts.

The competition acts as a launchpad for early-stage, bootstrapped startups, offering participants an opportunity to gain funding support, expert mentorship, industry exposure, and valuable networking opportunities.

Pitch Tank is designed to encourage innovation, validate business ideas, and connect promising founders with key stakeholders in the startup ecosystem.

What Pitch Tank Offers:

  • Opportunity to pitch in front of Venture Capitalists, Angel Investors, and Industry Leaders
  • Cash prizes for top-performing startups
  • Exposure to experienced professionals from the startup ecosystem
  • Mentorship and constructive feedback to refine business ideas
  • National-level recognition and visibility

Who Can Participate?

  • Undergraduate and Master’s students from any university across India
  • Individuals or teams with an early-stage startup
  • Startups must be:
    • Bootstrapped (no external funding received)
    • Operational for less than 2 years
  • Previous Pitch Tank podium finishers are not eligible to participate

Event Details:

  • Event Date: 13th February
  • Finale Venue: Manipal Academy of Higher Education (MAHE)

Prizes & Rewards:

  • Winner: 75,000 + Certificate
  • First Runner-Up: 50,000 + Certificate
  • Second Runner-Up: 25,000 + Certificate

Terms & Conditions:

  • By registering, participants grant permission to the organizers to use their names, images, and startup details for publicity and promotional purposes.
  • All submitted entries and documents will not be returned.
  • Participants confirm that their submissions do not violate any intellectual property rights.
  • The organizing committee reserves the right to disqualify any team for non-compliance with eligibility criteria or rules.
  • All decisions made by the organizers and judges will be final and binding.

column45:
Eligibility:

  • Open to all students.
  • Inter-college team members allowed.
  • Inter-department / inter-specialization team members allowed.
  • Each team must have 3 to 6 members.
  • Every team must register with an appropriate Team Name.
  • Team name cannot be changed after submission.
  • A Team Representative must be assigned at registration.
  • All communication will take place through the Team Representative.
  • Team Representative must provide accurate contact details and college details.

Event Format:

Dry Run (Round 1):

  • Bot starts from the Start Zone.
  • The bot must navigate the arena and reach the End Zone (300 mm × 300 mm white box).
  • The bot must glow an LED when it senses the white box.
  • Bot may store path/turns in its memory.
  • No requirement to cover all checkpoints.
  • Purpose: explore, map, and learn the shortest path.

Restart rule in Dry Run:

  • If restart occurs, bot starts from the last checkpoint.

Actual Run (Round 2):

  • Bot must again start from Start Zone.
  • Must use the optimized path explored during the Dry Run.
  • Timer resets to zero at the start of the Actual Run.

Restart rule in Actual Run:

  • Bot restarts from Start Zone only.
  • Timer does not reset or pause.

Duration:

  • Dry Run: 3 minutes
  • Actual Run: 2 minutes 30 seconds
  • Total allotted time: 5 minutes 30 seconds

Number of Problem Statements / Tasks:

  • One arena-based problem with two performance rounds (Dry & Actual run).
  • Task: Follow the line, explore the arena, optimize the route, and complete the run.

Bot & Safety Guidelines:

  • All electrical connections must be properly insulated.
  • Bots with unsafe circuitry may be disqualified if not corrected in time.
  • Protect the bot’s batteries and pneumatics.
  • Robots must only be activated inside the arena/testing area or with organizer consent.
  • Participants must ensure safety of themselves and surroundings.
  • Any act causing damage to venue/team may lead to disqualification.

Rules:

Restart Rules:

  • Maximum 3 restarts allowed (entire match).
  • No additional chances for Dry Run once completed.
  • No giving arena information during restart.
  • Hardware and sensor adjustments are allowed during restart.
  • Bot weight cannot be altered; organizers may intervene.

Penalties:

  • 20 points penalty for every restart during Actual Run.
  • Exceeding 5:30 min total duration → 10 points penalty per extra 30 seconds.
  • In case of a tie in Round 2:
  • Round 1 scores are compared.
  • If still tied, bot with higher weight wins (max allowed weight: 10 kg).

column11: Indian Institute of Technology (IIT), Kanpur, Uttar Pradesh, India
column45:
What’s in it for Your Startup?

  • Product Launch- The expo provides an exclusive spotlight where startups can launch their product to a dynamic audience of VCs, investors and corporate leaders and make a lasting impression
  • Startup Castle: Startups get Stalls with provisions like Nameplate, Table, Chairs etc. Special Provisions can also be availved to showcase with cutting edge technologies.
  • Pitching Opportunities - Pitching events and Buzz events will be organized where startups can pitch in front of a panel of VCs and Dignitaries and get funding and mentoring opportunities.
  • Upstart Conference Startups are granted access to an exclusive panel discussion “UpStart Conference” where they can engage in meaningful discussions with executives from top VC firms.
  • Fund Raising Opportunities Expo offers mentoring stations for one-on-one sessions with top dignitaries
  • An exclusive Networking Dinner where startups, investors, and industry leaders connect over conversations that turn ideas into opportunities.

column45:
Guidelines:

  • A team must comprise a minimum of 2 and a maximum of 3 participants, all from the same institute.
  • Any number of teams may participate from an institute; however, a participant may be part of only one team.
  • Submissions must be in PDF or PPT format only.
  • Proper references must be mentioned wherever applicable.
  • No changes in team structure will be allowed after registration.
  • The organizers reserve the right to modify rules at any stage of the competition.
  • All decisions regarding eligibility, evaluation, and final judgment shall rest with the organizing committee.
  • Plagiarism in any form will result in immediate disqualification.
  • Use of unethical means or misrepresentation will lead to disqualification.
  • Naming Convention: Team Name_College Name

Evaluation Criteria:

Round 2:

  • Feasibility of the solution (10)
  • Frugal thinking & originality (10)
  • Clarity of reasoning & impact logic (10)

Round 3:

  • Strength & depth of the frugal idea – 10
  • Logical reasoning & operational impact – 10
  • Presentation clarity, structure & delivery – 10

Important Dates & Eligibility:

  • Round 1 (Quiz): 27th December, 2025
  • Round 2 (Case Submission): 3rd January, 2026
  • Round 3 (Offline Round): 10th January, 2026

column45:
DATAFORGE 2026 is IIT Roorkee’s flagship AI/ML innovation challenge under E-Summit 2026, designed to turn curious minds into intelligent-solution creators.

From analyzing real-world datasets to building deployable machine-learning models, participants will experience the complete lifecycle of AI product development. DATAFORGE brings together coders, data scientists, ML engineers, and problem-solvers to push the limits of artificial intelligence.

Across structured rounds—quiz, concept proposal, and an intense 24-hour on-ground finale—teams will tackle industry-grade challenges ranging from predictive analytics and generative AI to computer vision and NLP.

With domain experts, mentorship, and the high-energy atmosphere of E-Summit’26, DATAFORGE is where India's brightest innovators gather to forge AI solutions that scale to real impact.

Eligibility Criteria:

  • Open to students from all colleges across India.
  • Team size: 2–4 members.
  • Participants from any discipline can join.
  • Cross-college teams allowed.
  • No prior AI/ML experience required — beginners welcome.
  • One team leader must be designated.

Rules:

  • Each team must have 2–4 members with one registered team leader.
  • Cross-discipline and cross-institute teams permitted.
  • All submissions must be original and created solely for DATAFORGE 2026.
  • AI tools allowed only within ethical and provided guidelines.
  • Deadlines must be followed strictly.
  • Decisions taken by jury and E-Summit Organising team in any regard will be final and binding .

Round 1 — AI Aptitude & ML Fundamentals Quiz (Online)

Date:4th January 2026

A fast-paced assessment evaluating foundational ML, data, coding, and analytical reasoning skills.

Format:

  • Auto-proctored MCQ quiz
  • 30 questions total: 20 AI/ML + coding fundamentals 10 aptitude
  • Attempted only by the team leader
  • One attempt per team
  • Evaluation:
  • Accuracy
  • Time taken

Round 2 -Abstract Submission (Online)

  • Date:6 January - 10 January 2026

Submission Requirements:

  • Problem understanding
  • Proposed AI/ML solution approach
  • Dataset understanding / assumptions
  • Model architecture / pipeline
  • Expected output, feasibility, impact
  • Tech stack details

Process:

  • Upload PDF on Unstop
  • Editable until deadline
  • Automated formatting & plagiarism checks

Outcome: Shortlisted teams qualify for the on-ground finale at IIT Roorkee.

Round 3 — On-Ground 12-Hour AI/ML Finale 

The final round is a 12-hour offline hackathon during E-Summit 2026.

Finalists will:

  • Work on a full-scale AI/ML problem statement
  • Perform data cleaning & EDA
  • Build ML/DL models
  • Create APIs/dashboards
  • Present their live demo to expert judges
  • A real-world simulation of fast-paced AI development.

column45:
Registration:

  • Register individually on Unstop, and the team will be formed during onboarding.
  • Further updates regarding onboarding will be sent to your email by 30th December.
  • For any queries, contact: 9125466700.

About the Event:

Get ready to showcase your audio-mixing talent in this exciting competition! Participants will craft a 2-3 minute track using only the in-app default samples and a mandatory set of additional samples provided by us by January 17, 2025. With a tight 3-hour time limit, the track must feature at least one drop and demonstrate your technical expertise and creativity in audio production. This is your chance to shine as a music producer!

Software to Use:

  • FL Studio
  • Logic Pro
  • Ableton

Guidelines:

  • Track Duration: 2-3 minutes
  • Time Limit to Complete Track: 3 hours
  • Additional Instruments: Not permitted
  • Mandatory Drop: At least one drop in the track
  • Samples: Only in-app default and provided samples allowed

Judging Criteria:

  • Audio Quality: Clarity, balance, and overall production.
  • Technical Proficiency: Effective use of mixing techniques, arrangement, and adherence to event rules.

Disqualification Grounds:

  • Use of inappropriate content, including offensive language.
  • Plagiarism or copyright violations.

Event Dates:

  • Final Submission: January 23-24, 2026

column45:
Competition Structure:

Round 1 – Online Quiz:

  • It will test participants on marketing fundamentals, branding concepts, consumer behavior, digital media, and campaign strategy.
  • Teams will be shortlisted based on quiz performance.

Round 2 – Marketing Case PPT Submission:

  • The deck should include: Market research and analysis
  • Consumer insight and problem framing
  • Marketing strategy and channel mix
  • Creative ideas and execution plan
  • Metrics, KPIs, and expected impact

Round 3 – Offline Finals:

  • Selected teams will present their solutions on campus at IIM Indore.
  • Each team will receive a fixed presentation and Q&A slot (details to be shared).
  • Final evaluation will be conducted by a panel of marketing professionals and faculty.

column45:
Market Sphere is a flagship marketing competition designed to evaluate creativity, analytical thinking, and strategic marketing skills. Teams compete to solve real-world marketing challenges provided by partner companies and brands. Participants build innovative campaigns, perform consumer analysis, and design go-to-market strategies. Conducted in a hybrid format (online + offline) for maximum participation and reach. Acts as a collaborative platform connecting industry leaders and emerging marketing talent.

Objectives:

Provide exposure to actual marketing problems through company-driven problem statements.Enable participants to apply marketing principles such as consumer psychology, branding, positioning, and market research.Encourage creative thinking, strong storytelling, and data-driven decision making.Offer end-to-end experience across the complete marketing lifecycle, from insight to campaign execution.

Eligibility Criteria:

  • Open to students from all colleges.
  • Team size: 3–5 members
  • Participants from any discipline can apply.
  • No prior experience required.

Rules:

  • Each team must have 3–5 members.
  • One team leader must be assigned.
  • All the decisions taken by jury and E-Summit Organising Team in any regard will be final and binding.
  • Crosscollege teams allowed.
  • Plagiarism or use of AI tools beyond instructions will lead to disqualification.
  • All submissions must be original and adhere to deadlines.

Round 1: Marketing Fundamentals Quiz (On Unstop)

  • Format → 40 MCQs (20 Marketing + 20 Aptitude)
  • Eligibility → Open to all registered teams
  • Duration → 30 minutes
  • Scoring → +1 per question
  • Evaluation → Score + time tiebreaker
  • Outcome → Top 40 teams qualify
  • Date -4th January 2026

Round 2: Case Submission Round (Via Unstop)

  • Format → Written abstract submission (Slide submission. Limit: 12)
  • Task → Teams prepare a short marketing abstract/campaign design including: Target audience analysis, problem understanding, creative central idea, key USP, and projected marketing impact.
  • Evaluation → Based on clarity, creativity, feasibility
  • Outcome → Shortlisted teams move to the final round
  • Date-6 January - 10 January 2026Round 3: Offline Pitch Round (On-Campus)
  • Format → Offline marketing pitch during the summit
  • Task → Finalists will receive a new problem statement beforehand, after finalization of the qualifying teams. They must prepare a complete marketing pitch b ased on this new statement.
  • Pitch Includes: Consumer insight + research, campaign idea, media strategy (digital + offline), budget allocation, positioning & brand message.
  • Evaluation → By company representatives and marketing experts
  • Outcome → Winners will receive cash prizes & goodies
  • Start (Offline): 6th February 2026

column45:
About ACIC–BMU | Propel

ACIC–BMU Foundation (ACIC–BMU), established at BML Munjal University (BMU) with support from the Atal Innovation Mission (AIM), NITI Aayog, is dedicated to promoting innovation and entrepreneurship. The center empowers innovators within the university and the broader community by providing resources, mentorship, and a thriving ecosystem for idea development and venture creation.

Vision:

To build an ecosystem that nurtures entrepreneurs who are innovative, resilient, ethical, and committed to generating economic value and positive social impact.

Mission:

  • Conduct programs, courses, challenges, and events to fuel innovation and entrepreneurship among students, faculty, and the community.
  • Build a strong network of entrepreneurs, mentors, experts, and service providers to support emerging start–ups.
  • Foster strong industry engagement to drive innovation and collaborative growth.

About Propel Pitchfest 2026:

Propel Pitchfest26, organized by ACIC–BMU | Propel at BML Munjal University, is designed to encourage bold ideas, innovative solutions, and early-stage start-ups. It provides budding entrepreneurs with the platform to pitch to investors, showcase their ventures, participate in industry challenge statements, and gain access to funding, acceleration, and strategic support to scale.

Theme: Pitch to Scale-Up

Highlights of Pitchfest26:

  • Pitch to 20+ Angel Investors & VCs: Backed by an investment pool exceeding USD 1 Million.
  • Opportunity to Apply for Startup India Seed Fund Scheme (SISFS)
  • Eligibility for ACIC–BMU Accelerator Cohorts
    • Women in Tech
    • Deep Tech / AI
    • Tier 2 / Tier 3 Startups
  • Panel Discussions with leading voices from the startup ecosystem.
  • Masterclasses, Bootcamps & Fireside Chats delivering insights from industry leaders.
  • One-on-One Mentoring & Networking opportunities with investors, founders, legal experts, and industry professionals.

Focus Areas:

Startups across the following domains are encouraged to apply:

  • Women in Tech
  • AI in Manufacturing
  • Deep Tech / AI
  • MedTech
  • Sustainable Mobility
  • Others — Startups outside the listed focus areas are also welcomed.

Eligibility Criteria:

  • Applications are open to individuals or teams (up to 5 members).
  • Founder or Co-founder must be present during the pitch.
  • Startup should be less than 5 years old.
  • Startups incubated at ACIC–BMU | Propel are eligible.
  • ACIC–BMU | Propel and BMU employees are not eligible unless their startup is incubated at ACIC–BMU | Propel.
  • Startups applying for SISFS must meet DPIIT eligibility criteria.

The Benefit Basket:

Investment Opportunities:

  • Collective investment potential exceeding USD 1 Million from: Real Time Angel Fund, ah! Ventures Fund, Fluid Ventures, and other investor networks.
  • Investors may fund individually or jointly, with final decisions formalized via a mutually agreed Term Sheet.

ACIC–BMU Accelerator Program:

Selected startups will gain entry into structured acceleration cohorts:

  • Women in Tech
  • Deep Tech / AI
  • Tier 2 / Tier 3 Startups

Includes long-term mentorship, resources, and ecosystem support.

Access to SISFS:

Startups may be invited to apply for the Startup India Seed Fund Scheme, subject to DPIIT compliance and internal evaluation.

Networking & Partner Benefits:

Get access to:

  • Investor interactions
  • Partner credits
  • Mentorship from domain experts
  • Corporate and industry connections

All benefits are subject to applicable terms and conditions.

column45:
IIT Roorkee’s signature product-building challenge under E-Summit 2026, designed to push participants from idea thinkers to product creators.

  • Across intense, fast-paced rounds, participants will decode real-world problems, craft actionable solutions, and experience the thrill of building products end-to-end.
  • Whether you’re a tech enthusiast, designer, product thinker, or simply curious about innovation, Productathon 2026 offers the perfect launchpad to create solutions that can scale to real impact.
  • With expert mentorship, structured stages, and the high-energy atmosphere of E-Summit’26, this is where India’s brightest minds come together to build the future — one product at a time.

Eligibility Criteria:

  • Open to students from all colleges across India.
  • Team size: 3–5 members.
  • Participants from any discipline are eligible.
  • Cross-college teams allowed.
  • No prior experience required.
  • One team leader must be designated.

Rules:

  • Each team must have 3–5 members with one team leader.
  • Cross-college and cross-discipline teams permitted.
  • All submissions must be original and created for Productathon 2026.
  • AI/online tools allowed only within given limits; misuse may lead to disqualification.
  • Deadlines must be strictly followed.
  • Jury and E-Summit organizing team’s decisions in any regard will be final and binding.

Round Descriptions:

Round 1 — Quiz Round: Unleash the Minds (Online):

  • Date: 4 January 2026
  • A fast-paced online quiz evaluating foundational skills across tech and problem-solving domains.

Format:

  • Auto-proctored MCQ test
  • 40 questions total: 20 tech-based + 20 aptitude
  • Domain-wise question balance
  • Single attempt per team
  • Only the team leader can attempt the quiz on behalf of the team

Evaluation:

  • Accuracy
  • Time taken
  • Difficulty-weighted scoring

Round 2 — Abstract Submission: Idea Showcase (Online):

  • Date: 6 January - 10 January 2026
  • Teams submit a concise 1–2 page PDF presenting their idea direction and product thought process.

Submission Requirements:

  • Problem understanding
  • Proposed solution
  • Tech stack & architecture
  • Feasibility, innovation, and impact

Process:

  • PDF upload on Unstop
  • Editable until deadline
  • Automatic formatting & plagiarism checks

Outcome:

  • Shortlisted teams qualify for the on-ground finale.

Round 3 — Finale at IIT Roorkee (Offline):

  • The final stage is an offline 24-hour hackathon hosted at IIT Roorkee during E-Summit 2026.
  • Teams will build, refine, and present their product prototypes on campus in a high-energy, immersive environment.

column45:
Inquizzitive, the Open General Quiz of SprintxOjas'26, returns this year with a journey through the Khel Kala Cosmos, a theme that blends sport, art, culture, science, and imagination.

Participants will take on a carefully curated mix of questions from current affairs, pop culture, science, sport, history, world events, and everything under the sun. The quiz is designed to reward not just memory, but analytical skill, the ability to link concepts, and the confidence to take smart risks.

Inquizzitive Is a  celebration of intellect, curiosity, and creative thinking. Whether you are an experienced quizzer or entering for the first time, prepare for a challenging and enjoyable experience.

About the Quiz Master:

The quiz will be hosted by Major Chandrakant Nair, fondly known as Captain, one of India’s most respected and dynamic quizmasters. He is a graduate of the Armed Forces Medical College in Pune and served in the Indian Army from 2006 to 2013 across counterinsurgency zones, high altitude regions, and peace postings.

Major Nair has been a dedicated quizzer for more than twenty-five years. He won Asianet’s Mafatlal Tele Quiz, the Kuttikalodano Kali Quiz on Mazhavil Manorama, and India’s biggest open quiz, the Landmark Quiz. He is also a seven-time winner of the World Quizzing Championship Kerala edition.

His work as a quizmaster spans more than 850 quizzes conducted for colleges, corporates, schools, international forums, and even at border locations. Expect an engaging, tightly crafted, and intellectually stimulating quiz under his guidance.

General Guidelines:

  • The quiz will be conducted on campus in a single day.
  • All teams must report to the venue at least 30 minutes before the start.
  • Participants must carry a valid ID (college or government-issued).
  • Use of mobile phones or smart devices during the quiz is strictly prohibited.
  • Any form of cheating or misconduct will lead to immediate disqualification.
  • On-spot registrations will be allowed.

Rules and Regulations for Team Formation:

  • Teams must consist of 1 to 3 members.
  • The quiz is open to everyone - students, and the general public. 
  • A participant cannot represent more than one team.
  • Team composition cannot be changed after registration.
  • Entry fee per team: 350

Quiz Format:

Round 1: Written or Preliminary Round

  • All registered teams attempt a mixed-question set.
  • Top-performing teams qualify for the finals.

Round 2: Stage Finals:

  • The structure and scoring will follow the quizmaster's discretion.Any changes in the quiz format will be subject to the quizmaster's discretion. 

Terms and Conditions:

  • The decision of the organizers will be final
  • Teams pulling out of the tournament will not be eligible for a refund
  • Participants should adhere to the event guidelines, any violations would result in direct disqualification
  • The use of unfair means will result in direct disqualification
  • This event is open only for business school sports teams
  • Teams shall face disqualification if they do not meet the eligibility criteria
  • Rules, Schedules, and prize money are subject to change based on the number of registrations. The final decision in all matters rests with the SPrint team
  • Participants must be from the same college and enrolled in an MBA or an equivalent postgraduate management program.
  • Registration will be confirmed post-payment. A Google Form will be circulated post-registration which would give the payment details
  • The organizers are not responsible for any injuries sustained during the tournament.

column45:
SPoritfy Quiz, the flagship Sports and Entertainment quiz of SprintXOjas'26 for college students, invites students to dive into the thrill of the Khel Kala Cosmos, a space where stadiums meet screens, athletes meet actors, and iconic moments from sport and pop culture collide.

Participants will face a curated blend of questions across sports, cinema, OTT, music, gaming, and pop culture. The quiz is designed to reward recall, pattern recognition, intuitive thinking, and the ability to connect clues across formats and fandoms.

SPoritfy Quiz is a celebration of passion, memory, and competitive spirit. Whether you are a die-hard sports buff, an entertainment enthusiast, or someone who enjoys a fast and fun challenge, this quiz promises an engaging and high-energy experience.

General Guidelines:

  • The quiz will be conducted on campus in a single day.
  • All teams must report to the venue at least 30 minutes before the start.
  • Participants must carry a valid college ID card.
  • Use of mobile phones or smart devices during the quiz is strictly prohibited.
  • Any form of cheating or misconduct will lead to immediate disqualification.
  • On-spot registrations will be allowed.

Rules and Regulations for Team Formation

  • Teams must consist of 1 or 2 members.
  • Participation is restricted to college students only (Full-time UG &PG Students).
  • Cross-college teams are not allowed. All team members must belong to the same institution.
  • A participant cannot represent more than one team.
  • Team composition cannot be changed after registration.
  • Entry fee per team: 200

Quiz Format

Round 1: Written or Preliminary Round

  • All registered teams attempt a mixed-question set.
  • Top performing teams qualify for the finals.
  • The structure and scoring will follow the discretion of the Quizmaster.

Round 2: Stage Finals

  • The structure and scoring will follow the discretion of the Quizmaster.
  • Any changes in the quiz format will be subject to the Quizmaster's discretion.

Terms and Conditions:

  • The decision of the organizers will be final
  • Teams pulling out of the tournament will not be eligible for a refund
  • Participants should adhere to the event guidelines, any violations would result in direct disqualification
  • The use of unfair means will result in direct disqualification
  • This event is open only for business school sports teams
  • Teams shall face disqualification if they do not meet the eligibility criteria
  • Rules, Schedules, and prize money are subject to change based on the number of registrations. The final decision in all matters rests with the SPrint team
  • Participants must be from the same college and enrolled in an MBA or an equivalent postgraduate management program.
  • Registration will be confirmed post-payment. A Google Form will be circulated post-registration which would give the payment details
  • The organizers are not responsible for any injuries sustained during the tournament.

column45:
Case Quest is a thrilling business case study competition built to spark the strategic brilliance of aspiring consultants. Bringing together sharp minds from across the country, the event challenges participants to analyze real-world business scenarios, craft innovative solutions, and demonstrate exceptional strategic thinking. Designed to recognize top consulting talent, foster collaboration and creativity, and develop practical, industry-ready skills, Case Quest empowers students to think boldly, solve effectively, and shine as future leaders in the world of consultancy.

Eligibility Criteria:

  • Open to students from all colleges.
  • Team size: 3–5 members
  • Participants from any discipline can apply.
  • No prior experience required.

Rules:

  • Each team must have 3–5 members.
  • One team leader must be assigned.
  • Cross-college teams allowed.
  • Plagiarism or use of AI tools beyond instructions will lead to disqualification.
  • All submissions must be original and adhere to deadlines.
  • All the decisions taken by jury and ESummit Organising Team in any regard will be final and binding.

Round Description:

  • Round 1: Online Quiz (Eliminator Round)
    • Date: 4 January 2026
    • Eligibility: Only the Team Leader can attempt the quiz
    • Format: 40 MCQs (20 Business-based + 20 Aptitude-based)
    • Duration: 30 minutes
    • Scoring: 1 × 40 = 40 marks
    • Note: This is an eliminator round
    Round 2: Abstract Submission
    • Date: 6 January – 10 January 2026
    • Submission: 5-slide deck (excluding intro & outro) in PDF format
    • File Naming: [TEAM NAME]_[COLLEGE NAME] (ALL CAPS)
    • Content Guidelines:
      • Identify key pain points for SMEs and provide segmentation rationale
      • High-level Go-To-Market (GTM) strategy
      • Hypothesis of expected results (adoption rates, revenue impact, etc.)
    • File Size Limit: 20 MB
    Final Round: On-Campus Presentations (IIT Roorkee – E-Summit ’26)
    • Date: 6th February – 8th February 2026
    • Format: Shortlisted teams will present their strategies offline at IIT Roorkee
    • Judging: Evaluation by a panel of experts on creativity, feasibility, and impact
    • Prizes: Winners will receive cash prizes & goodies
