column45:
Overview:

IEEE Mega Project 8.0 is a flagship project-based competition designed to encourage innovation, problem-solving, and real-world application of technology. Participants will conceptualize and build a working solution and get the opportunity to present their work before experienced professionals from leading tech organizations. Exciting rewards, recognition, and valuable industry exposure await the best teams.

Who Can Participate?

  • Open to undergraduate and postgraduate students from all branches and disciplines
  • Participation is team-based
  • Each team must consist of 2–3 members

Competition Flow:

Phase 1: Project Building & Submission

Teams must design and implement a fully working project based on an original idea.

Submissions must include (before the deadline):

  • GitHub repository link containing complete source code
  • Live deployed project link (working demo)

Note: A PPT is not required in Phase 1.

Submissions will be evaluated on originality, practicality, and technical soundness.

Phase 2: Final Presentation Round:

Selected teams will be invited to deliver a live project demonstration and presentation.

Teams must present a Project PPT covering:

  • Problem identification and proposed solution
  • Tools, frameworks, and technologies used
  • System design and implementation strategy
  • Obstacles faced and how they were resolved
  • Scope, impact, and future enhancement possibilities

A panel comprising industry professionals and domain experts will judge the teams based on:

  • Depth of technical implementation
  • Creativity and uniqueness of the idea
  • Real-world relevance and usefulness
  • Communication and presentation effectiveness

Guidelines & Regulations:

  • All projects must be new and independently developed specifically for IEEE Mega Project 8.0
  • Any form of plagiarism or reuse of existing templates/projects will lead to immediate disqualification
  • Teams must strictly follow all submission timelines
  • Decisions made by the evaluation panel will be final and non-negotiable

Evaluation Parameters:

  • Innovation & Originality – Freshness of the idea
  • Technical Strength – Design complexity and execution quality
  • Practical Impact – Applicability to real-world problems
  • Scalability – Potential for expansion and long-term use
  • Presentation & Defense – Explanation clarity and response to questions

Important Dates:

  • Registration Closes: 24 December 2025
  • Phase 1 Submission Deadline: 24 January 2026
  • Final Presentation Round: Schedule to be announced

Awards & Recognition:

  • Top Teams: Cash prizes worth up to 25,000 along with Certificates of Achievement
  • All Participants: Official Participation Certificates

Important: Official Communication Channel:

To ensure that you do not miss any important updates, announcements, instructions, or deadline changes, it is mandatory for all participants to join the official IEEE Mega Project 8.0 information group.

All future communication related to the event will be shared exclusively through this group.

WhatsApp Info Group: https://chat.whatsapp.com/ICeN2GZLaOBFokdiLuF5pU

column45:
About the Competition:

  • SHARE, IIT Kharagpur, presents an exciting multi-round case competition under the banner of Spring Fest 2025. The event is designed to test participants’ analytical thinking, business acumen, creativity, and problem-solving skills through real-world challenges inspired by consulting and strategy.

Eligibility:

  • Open to all undergraduate and postgraduate students across India.
  • Inter-college teams are allowed.
  • Inter-specialization teams are allowed (Management, Engineering, Commerce, Humanities, etc.).
  • Students from different years are also allowed to team up.

Team Formation:

  • Team size must be 1 to 5 members.
  • One participant cannot be a part of more than one team.
  • Teams must register with a single team name.

Competition Format:

The competition consists of three rounds:

Round 1: Online Quiz Round

  • Format: Objective quiz testing aptitude, business fundamentals, and consulting concepts.
  • Number of questions: 20–25 questions.
  • Duration: 20 minutes.
  • Mode: Online on Unstop.
  • Evaluation: Score + time taken.
  • Top teams move to Round 2.

Round 2: Case Submission Round

  • Shortlisted teams will receive a detailed case problem statement.
  • Teams must submit a PPT (6–8 slides) outlining their analysis and solutions.
  • Duration: 5–7 days for case preparation and submission.
  • Evaluation: Structure, creativity, feasibility of recommendations, and depth of analysis.
  • Top 10 teams qualify for the Final Round.

Round 3: Offline Final Presentation Round (On Campus – IIT Kharagpur)

  • Mode: Offline during Spring Fest, IIT Kharagpur.
  • Finalists will present their case solution to a jury of SHARE members, industry professionals, and faculty.
  • Presentation time: 10 minutes + 5 minutes Q&A.
  • Winners & runners-up will be declared based on clarity, insight, innovation, and defence during Q&A.

Rules:

  • All submissions must be original. Plagiarism will lead to immediate disqualification.
  • Teams must adhere strictly to submission deadlines.
  • Decisions of the organizing committee and judges will be final and binding.
  • The same team composition must be maintained throughout the competition.
  • Any attempt to influence judges or organizers will result in disqualification.
  • For the offline round, at least 2 members of the team must be physically present for the presentation.
  • Use of AI tools is allowed only for ideation and research, not for generating final slides verbatim.
  • Any violation of rules may lead to removal from the competition.

Process Flow:

  • Team Registration on Unstop
  • Round 1: Online Quiz
  • Shortlisting for Round 2
  • Round 2: Case Analysis & PPT Submission
  • Top 10 Finalists Announcement
  • Round 3: Offline Presentation at IIT Kharagpur
  • Declaration of Winners & Prize Distribution

column2: ChainX : The Supply Chain Case Competition
column45:
Details:

  • ChainX, the Supply Chain Case Competition by the Symbiosis Institute of Operations Management (SIOM), Nashik, challenges participants to decode complexity and design resilient, future-ready supply chains. Anchored in the pursuit of operational excellence, this theme invites participants to analyze end-to-end supply networks, optimize processes, and craft data-driven strategies that enhance efficiency, responsiveness, and sustainability.
  • ChainX emphasizes systems thinking, analytical rigor, and strategic decision-making, empowering participants to tackle real-world disruptions and uncertainties with precision. It serves as a platform to reimagine supply chains as strategic enablers, driving value creation and shaping the backbone of modern global enterprises.

Guidelines:

  • Students pursuing an MBA, from both first-year and second-year batches, are eligible to participate.
  • Participants must form a team of 1–4 members, all from the same college/institute.
  • A student can be part of only one team; each team must consist exclusively of either first-year or second-year students.
  • Any number of teams can participate from a single institute.
  • All shortlisted/qualifying teams must strictly adhere to the instructions provided by the organizing committee regarding submission formats and the designated virtual platforms.
  • Teams must comply with all deadlines; no extensions will be granted under any circumstances.
  • The decisions made by the organizers will be final and binding on all participants.

Rules:

  • Each team shall consist of 1–4 members.
  • All team members must belong to the same college/institute.
  • A team must consist entirely of either first-year or second-year students; mixed-year teams are not permitted.
  •  No replacement of team members will be allowed after registration.
  •  A student may participate in only one team for this competition.

column2: Cultiv8: The Agri Supply Chain Case Study Competition
column45:
Details:

  • Cultiv8, the Agri Supply Chain Case Study Competition by Symbiosis Institute of Operations Management (SIOM), Nashik, brings focus to the evolving ecosystem of agriculture, sustainability, and value-chain transformation. Rooted in the idea of “cultivating” growth and innovation, this theme challenges participants to optimize agri processes, strengthen farm-to-market linkages, and design solutions that enhance efficiency and resilience.
  • Cultiv8 encourages thoughtful analysis, innovative supply chain strategies, and impactful interventions that uplift stakeholders across the agricultural landscape. It is a platform to reimagine the future of agri supply chains with clarity, sustainability, and purpose.

Guidelines:

  • Students pursuing an MBA, from both first-year and second-year batches, are eligible to participate.
  •  Participants must form a team of 1–4 members, all from the same college/institute.
  •  A student can be part of only one team; each team must consist exclusively of either first-year or second-year students.
  •  Any number of teams can participate from a single institute.
  •  All shortlisted/qualifying teams must strictly adhere to the instructions provided by the organizing committee regarding submission formats and the designated virtual platforms.
  •  Teams must comply with all deadlines; no extensions will be granted under any circumstances.
  • The decisions made by the organizers will be final and binding on all participants.

Rules:

  • Each team shall consist of 1–4 members.
  •  All team members must belong to the same college/institute.
  •  A team must consist entirely of either first-year or second-year students; mixed-year teams are not permitted.
  •  No replacement of team members will be allowed after registration.
  •  A student may participate in only one team for this competition.

column45:
Event Overview:

  • A fast, real-world research face-off where participants analyze the “Stock of the Week” using the StockFox (formerly Investschool) app and credible external sources.
  • The participant with the sharpest, best-evidenced analysis wins.

What’s in it for you:

  • Competitive learning – apply a clear 5-step research flow on a real stock.
  • Big cash prizes every week – real rewards for number-backed insights.
  • Certificate of participation.
  • No entry fee – 100% free.

Prizes Worth 1,000 Every Week:

  • 1st Place: 500
  • 2nd Place: 300
  • 3rd Place: 200

Timeline (IST):

  • Research Form Submission Link Goes Live in TG Group: Friday, 6:00 PM.
  • Research Form Submissions Link Closes: Monday, 11:59 PM (end of day).
  • Results: Thursday – announced in Telegram Group.

How to Play & T&Cs:

  • Read the Guide on How to Play.
  • Join the TG community before Friday 6 PM (required; non-joiners not eligible for rewards).
  • Open the StockFox app and analyze the stock as shared in TG group using the guided flow. Credible external sources may be used with proper links in the form.
  • Submit analysis via the official Form (link shared in TG on Friday 6:00 PM IST). Deadline: Monday 11:59 PM IST.
  • One participant = one final submission. Resubmissions before the deadline will overwrite the previous entry.

Winner Selection & Tie-Breaker:

  • Judged on clarity, depth, evidence, originality, and practical takeaway.
  • Tie-breaker: earlier valid submission ranks higher.

Quick Rules:

  • Keep entries original; plagiarism or AI-generated content without sources leads to disqualification.
  • Cite credible sources (company filings, exchanges, reputed portals).
  • Organisers’ decision is final.
  • Multiple entries from the same participant will be disqualified.

column45:
Step into the Logic League, where every Sunday challenges you to think sharper, code faster, and level up your problem-solving game!
Take on 5 coding questions spanning multiple difficulty levels — crafted to simulate real-world interview rounds and industry-grade assessments used by top tech companies.

If you’re ready to test your logic, this is your arena to shine.

Why Participate:

  • Compete with some of the best coders in a fair and proctored test environment
  • Solve questions covering Data Structures, Algorithms, and Interview Prep topics
  • Experience the pressure and precision of real hiring challenges
  • Strengthen your coding strategy, speed, and analytical thinking
  • Earn ranks, certificates, and recognition for your skills

Join our WhatsApp community – Logic League – to stay updated with contests and coding discussions!

Marking Scheme:

The assessment includes 5 coding questions:

  • 1 Hard Question – 30 marks
  • 2 Intermediate Questions – 20 marks each
  • 2 Easy Questions – 15 marks each

Total Marks: 100
Duration: 2 Hours
Negative Marking: None

Full marks only for solutions that pass all test cases.
No marks for partial or sample-only outputs.

Competition Guidelines:

  • The contest runs in full-screen mode. Switching tabs or background activity may lead to disqualification.
  • Once you start, you must complete the test in one sitting. No pauses or retakes allowed.
  • Only the first submission for each question will be considered — no resubmissions.
  • Use of AI tools, copied code, or external assistance is strictly prohibited. Any plagiarism results in disqualification.
  • Ensure a stable internet connection and avoid refreshing or closing the test window mid-assessment.

Ready to Prove Your Logic?

Gear up, code smart, and rise through the ranks.
Power up your Sunday with the Logic League on Unstop!

column2: Quantinuum, The Analytics Case Study Competition
column45:
Quantinuum, the Analytics Case Study Competition by Symbiosis Institute of Operations Management (SIOM), Nashik, brings focus to the continuous evolution of data-driven decision-making.

Rooted in the idea of an unbroken “quant” continuum, this theme challenges participants to navigate complex datasets, uncover hidden patterns, and transform insights into impactful business solutions.

Quantinuum encourages analytical precision, predictive thinking, and innovative use of data to solve real-world challenges. It is a platform to harness the power of analytics and shape the future of intelligent decision-making with clarity, depth, and purpose.

Will your vision grow into a legacy of change?

Guidelines:

  • Students pursuing an MBA, from both first-year and second-year batches, are eligible to participate.
  • Participants must form a team of 1–4 members, all from the same college/institute.
  • A student can be part of only one team; each team must consist exclusively of either first-year or second-year students.
  • Any number of teams can participate from a single institute.
  • All shortlisted/qualifying teams must strictly adhere to the instructions provided by the organizing committee regarding submission formats and the designated virtual platforms.
  • Teams must comply with all deadlines; no extensions will be granted under any circumstances.
  •  The decisions made by the organizers will be final and binding on all participants.

Rules:

  • Each team shall consist of 1–4 members.
  • All team members must belong to the same college/institute.
  • A team must consist entirely of either first-year or second-year students; mixed-year teams are not permitted.
  • No replacement of team members will be allowed after registration.
  •  A student may participate in only one team for this competition.

column2: Arthascope : The Finance Case Study Competition
column45:
Arthascope, The Finance Case Study Competition by Symbiosis Institute of Operations Management (SIOM), Nashik, brings a focused lens to the evolving landscape of financial strategy and decision-making. Rooted in the idea of viewing “Artha” (wealth) through a sharper scope, this theme challenges participants to analyze financial complexities, uncover hidden value drivers, and craft solutions that strengthen organizational resilience.

Arthascope encourages strategic thinking, precise evaluation, and innovative financial insights that elevate business performance. It is a platform to sharpen perspectives, decode financial dynamics, and shape the future of finance with clarity and confidence.

column2: Opscura : The Operations Case Study Competition

Opscura, the Operations Case Study Competition by Symbiosis Institute of Operations Management (SIOM), Nashik, brings focus to the hidden layers of processes and systems that often remain unseen. Rooted in the idea of uncovering the “obscure,” this theme challenges participants to explore operational blind spots, reveal inefficiencies, and transform uncertainty into intelligent, data-driven solutions. Opscura inspires deep analysis, sharp insight, and innovative problem-solving, empowering participants to decode complexity and elevate operational excellence. It is a platform designed to illuminate the unseen and shape the future of operations with clarity and purpose.

column45:
Equity Research Challenge Overview:

  • The Finance and Economics Club (FEC) at IIT Guwahati is hosting this challenge as a platform for students to showcase and enhance their skills in equity research, analysis, valuation, and presentation. Participants act as research analysts, gaining hands-on experience.

Details About FEC:

  • The Finance and Economics Club (FEC) is a student-driven club dedicated to promoting knowledge and enthusiasm in finance and economics. It offers beginner-friendly sessions, interactions with industry experts, and specialized courses like the Fundamental Analysis BootCamp, BlockBase and Introductory Options Course. The club's mission is to inspire practical application of financial principles, with the motto: "To be an asset to everyone—liability to none."

Competition Details:

  • Participation: Individual or team (max 4 members).
  • Eligibility: Inter-college teams allowed.
  • Cost: Free of charge. Report any registration fee demands.
  • Prizes: Prize pool worth INR 2,00,000 (includes cash prizes, subscriptions, goodies, and courses).

Important Information:

Top 10 Teams:

  • Invited to IIT Guwahati for the Final Presentation Round during Udgam 2026 (24th January 2026).
  • Travel vouchers and food provided.
  • Certificates: Awarded to Top 10 teams. Participation verification provided if needed.
  • Equity Report Submission: Max 20 slides/pages (intro and last page excluded).

Additional Highlights:

  • Free AMA sessions for all participants during the competition.
  • Deadlines will be enforced but are subject to changes by FEC without notice.
  • Unethical activity may lead to disqualification and loss of prize money.

column45:
About PIS:

Pravega Innovation Summit (PIS) is a flagship innovation initiative of Pravega, IISc Bengaluru, sponsored by the Foundation for Science, Innovation & Development (FSID) ,IISc’s dedicated incubator and innovation hub. It is a pitching-focused event that invites startups, students, and innovators with bold ideas to present their vision and become part of the next wave of science & technology-driven development.

FSID plays a pivotal role in nurturing deep-tech startups emerging from academia by providing incubation support, mentorship from IISc experts, access to advanced infrastructure, and pathways to funding. Through this summit, FSID aims to identify high-potential ideas and early-stage startups and guide them towards real-world impact.

PIS offers participants a direct opportunity to pitch to FSID and its ecosystem, compete for a cash prize pool of 75,000+, and be considered for incubation under FSID. This is not just a prize-based competition, but a gateway into IISc’s innovation and incubation ecosystem for founders, students, and innovators across the country!! 

Who Can Apply:

  • Early-stage startups
  • Students (UG / PG / PhD)
  • Researchers and innovators
  • Individuals or teams with idea-stage or prototype-stage concepts

Tracks / Categories:

  • Applicants must choose one track during submission

Startup Track:

  • Registered startups
  • Unregistered startups
  • Early traction preferred but not mandatory
  • Prototype preferred but not mandatory

Idea Track:

  • Students with innovative ideas
  • Individuals with innovative ideas
  • All innovative ideas are welcome
  • Encouragement to apply one’s research while developing a solution

Selection Process:

Online application submission

  • Applications open until January 10, 2026
  • Participants register via Unstop
  • Detailed application submitted through Google Form - https://forms.gle/BfrK1b9gFdQLbHLY9
  • Applications will be reviewed by Pravega’s team and FSID and qualifiers will be notified

Online pitching round

  • Tentatively scheduled for January 17–18, 2026
  • Shortlisted teams pitch their ideas to FSID and panel members online
  • Final selection and awards
  • Selected teams receive prize money from a prize pool of 75K
  • Selected teams may receive incubation opportunities
  • Details of subsequent rounds shared with shortlisted candidates upon qualification

Rewards

Compete for a prize pool of 75,000 and unlock an opportunity to be incubated by FSID. Be part of the next revolution in deep science and technology.

FAQs:

Is this opportunity only for registered startups?

  • No. The summit is open to registered startups, early-stage ventures, students, researchers, and individuals with idea-stage concepts. Startup registration is not mandatory to apply.

What stage should my idea or startup be at?

  • Applications are welcome from idea stage, prototype stage, and early traction stage teams. The focus is on the strength of the idea, its scientific or technical grounding, and its potential for real-world impact.

Do I need a working prototype to apply?

  • A prototype is preferred but not mandatory. Strongly articulated ideas with a clear problem statement, approach, and potential applicability are equally encouraged.

How will applications be evaluated?

  • Applications will be reviewed based on innovation, clarity of problem–solution fit, feasibility, technical depth, and overall potential. Shortlisted candidates will be invited to the pitching round.

What happens after I get shortlisted?

  • Shortlisted teams will receive instructions and guidelines for the pitching round, including format, duration, and submission requirements.

Will I receive feedback on my idea?

  • Select participants may receive feedback or guidance from experts during or after the pitching round, subject to the structure of the session.

Is participation free?

  • There is no application or participation fee to apply for Pravega Innovation Summit.

Can teams apply, or only individuals?

  • Both individuals and teams upto 5 members can apply. 

Is this an online or offline event?

  • The application and shortlisting process will be conducted online. Even the pitching round will be online.

What are the outcomes of participating?

  • Participants gain exposure to IISc’s innovation ecosystem, an opportunity to pitch to FSID and experts, compete for cash prizes, and receive guidance on taking their ideas forward.

Who should apply?

  • Anyone with strong ideas rooted in science, engineering, or research-driven innovation, and the motivation to explore real-world translation, is encouraged to apply.

column45:
Shark Bowl is an India-wide online entrepreneurship challenge where participants identify a real-world problem and propose a practical solution through a concise PPT submission. This event is designed to nurture core entrepreneurial qualities — clarity, creativity, independent thinking, resourcefulness, and the courage to act with what you already have. In Shark Bowl, you don’t just submit an idea — you think, strategize, and communicate solutions like an entrepreneur.

Top Performers:

  • Chance to get selected as Campus Ambassador and win additional incentives
  • Opportunity to interact with the GUESSS India Team from IIT Mandi
  • Recognition on the final leaderboard

Participant Benefits:

  • Free access to 3 HCL GUVI courses
  • Access to live workshops with Prof. Puran Singh (IIT Mandi) upon completion
  • Unstop certificate of participation
  • Eligibility for 500 lucky draw (1 out of 300) and iPad giveaway

Eligibility Criteria:

  • Open to students across all departments, years, and majors
  • No prior entrepreneurship background required
  • Individual participation only
  • Only one PPT submission per participant
  • AI-generated not encouraged

Guidelines:

  • Zero-AI challenge — your ideas only
  • PPT must be original, concise, and visually clear
  • Address one real-life problem and propose a practical solution
  • Include:
  • Problem description
  • Target audience affected
  • Proposed solution
  • Implementation plan
  • Expected impact
  • Complete both rounds before 19 December
  • Mandatory completion of GUESSS India survey after registration to qualify

Rewards & Benefits:

Top 3 Winners:

  • 1st Prize — 100
  • Runner-Up — 50
  • 2nd Runner-Up — 50
  • Chance to become Campus Ambassador and win additional incentives
  • Opportunity to interact with the GUESSS India Team from IIT Mandi

All Participants:

  • Free access to 3 HCL GUVI courses and workshops
  • Certificate of participation
  • Entry to lucky draw prizes

Challenge Stages:

Stage 1: Registration

  • Register individually on Unstop
  • Registration closes on 19 December

Stage 2: Mandatory Survey – GUESSS India

  • Complete the GUESSS India survey via the official link
  • Survey ID: CA-086
  • Fill a short feedback form on the survey experience
  • This stage is compulsory to advance to Shark Bowl

Stage 3: Shark Bowl Submission

  • Prepare a PPT (3–7 slides) addressing one everyday-life problem
  • Include:
  • Problem & pain points
  • Target audience
  • Proposed solution
  • Implementation approach
  • Expected impact
  • Submit before 19 December

Stage 4: Final Leaderboard & Winner Announcement

  • Top submissions will be featured on the leaderboard
  • Winners will receive cash prizes and may be shortlisted for Campus Ambassador selection
  • Selected participants may interact with the GUESSS India Team from IIT Mandi
  • All participants gain access to HCL GUVI courses and workshops

What We Expect From You:

  • Independent thinking and reflection
  • Realistic, implementable solutions
  • Creative communication in PPT format
  • Zero-AI involvement
  • Entrepreneurial clarity, resourcefulness, and initiative
  • Completion of both survey and submission before 19 December

column45:
Details:

  • This assessment is designed to evaluate the core technical problem-solving skills of Front-End Developers. It focuses on the fundamentals of building web interfaces, including DOM manipulation, JavaScript logic, and CSS layout mechanics.
  • The questions are scenario-based, requiring candidates to troubleshoot common UI bugs, manage user events, and understand how the browser renders content.
  • This is an application-based challenge suitable for developers who want to demonstrate their hands-on coding ability and understanding of web standards, rather than just memorized theory.

Pollution Quiz in collaboration with TGPCB challenges participants on environmental pollution, its causes, impacts, regulations, and sustainable solutions, testing awareness of one of today’s most pressing global issues.

Rewards and Benefits:

  • Prizes worth 10,000
  • Certificates from Elan & nVision, IIT Hyderabad
  • Complimentary access to all concerts and events, with additional discount on accommodation.

Eligibility:

  • Open to all individuals across India
  • Team size: 1 - 3 
  • Participants may join only one team

Rules:

  • Use of mobile phones or another electronic gadgets during the event will lead to disqualification.
  • Judges and Organizer's decisions are final and binding.

column45:
Eligibility:

  • The competition is open to UG students pursuing Agriculture and Allied Sector courses.
  • Participants can take part as individuals or in teams (team size: 2–3 members, if allowed by the organizers).
  • Each participant/team can submit only one idea.
  •  Themes: Participants must submit their business ideas under any one of the following themes: 
    • Sustainability 
    • Entrepreneurship 
    • Supply Chain Management 
  • Ideas should be relevant to agriculture and allied sectors.

Competition Structure:

  • The competition will be conducted in two rounds:

Round 1: Idea Submission:

  • Participants must submit a brief written concept note of their business idea.
  • The idea must clearly mention: Problem identification
  • The idea should demonstrate innovation, novelty, and feasibility.
  • All submissions must be made within the stipulated deadline.
  • Based on evaluation, shortlisted ideas will be selected for Round 2.

Round 2: Final Presentation:

  • Shortlisted participants/teams will be invited to give a final presentation before the jury in offline mode .
  • Presentation duration and format will be communicated to shortlisted participants.
  • Judges’ decisions will be final and binding.

Idea Requirements:

  • The idea must be original and not copied from existing business models.
  • It should address a real-world problem in agriculture or allied sectors.

General Rules:

  • Participants must adhere to all deadlines and submission guidelines.
  • Use of unfair means or misconduct during the competition will lead to disqualification.
  • The organizing committee reserves the right to: Modify rules if necessary
  • Reject any entry without prior notice
  • Certificates will be provided to all participants, and prizes will be awarded to winners.

column45:
This edition celebrates advertising's power to make grown adults cry over insurance policies, chocolate bars, and internet searches. From P&G's "Thank You, Mom" Olympic tribute to Thai Life's "Unsung Hero," from Google's "Loretta" to Tanishq's progressive love stories, discover campaigns that proved data and emotion aren't opposites they're partners in creating advertising that resonates long after the screen fades to black.

Format:

  • Time Duration: 7 minutes
  • Number of Questions: 20
  • Event Type: Individual

Scoring:

  • 1 point per correct answer
  • No negative marking
  • Tie-breakers decided by organizers

column2: E- Impetus | The Social Case Competition
column45:
Competition Structure:

Round 1 – Online Quiz:

  • It will assess participants on social issues, public policy awareness, sustainability, ethical decision-making, and impact frameworks.
  • Teams will be shortlisted based on quiz performance.

Round 2 – Social Case PPT Submission:

  • The deck should include: Social problem identification and stakeholder mapping
  • Root-cause analysis and contextual understanding
  • Proposed solution and theory of change
  • Feasibility, scalability, and impact assessment
  • Implementation roadmap and success metrics

Round 3 – Offline Finals:

  • Selected teams will present their solutions on campus at IIM Indore.
  • Each team will receive a fixed presentation and Q&A slot (details to be shared).
  • Final evaluation will be conducted by an esteemed panel of judges. 

General Guidelines:

  • College students from across India are eligible to participate.
  • The final round will be conducted at the IIM Indore Campus.
  • Participants must adhere to all rules and guidelines shared by the organizing committee.
  • Further detailed guidelines will be communicated to participants post-registration.
  • The decision of the judges will be final and binding.
  • Any form of misconduct, plagiarism, or rule violation may lead to disqualification.
  • The organizing committee reserves the right to modify the event or any of its rules if required.

column2: E- Consultant | The Consulting Case Competition
column45:
Competition Structure:

Round 1 – Online Quiz Round:

  • The quiz will be released on January 7.
  • It will test participants on business fundamentals, case-based reasoning, analytics, and consulting aptitude.
  • Based on quiz performance, teams will be shortlisted for the next round.

Round 2 – Case PPT Submission:

  • Shortlisted teams must submit a five-slider case solution deck (excluding cover page and appendix) by January 15 EOD.
  • The deck should clearly outline: Problem Understanding, Structured Analysis, Key Insights and Assumptions, Final Recommendations and Implementation Roadmap.

Round 3 – Offline Finals:

  • Selected teams will present their case solutions on campus at IIM Indore.
  • Each team will be allotted a fixed presentation and Q&A time (to be communicated).
  • Presentations will be evaluated by a panel of industry experts and faculty.

General Guidelines:

  • College students from across India are eligible to participate.
  • The final round will be conducted at the IIM Indore Campus.
  • Participants must adhere to all rules and guidelines shared by the organizing committee.
  • Further detailed guidelines will be communicated to participants post-registration.
  • The decision of the judges will be final and binding.
  • Any form of misconduct, plagiarism, or rule violation may lead to disqualification.
  • The organizing committee reserves the right to modify or cancel the event or any of its rules if required.

column45:
Bitathon is a Data Analytics and Mining Championship hosted by Cognition-The Data Science and Analytics Club, Goa Institute of Management in association with SAS. This hackathon is open to graduate and postgraduate students across India who are passionate about data crunching, data manipulation, and analysis. The event encourages young minds to take up challenging data problems and tackle them meticulously.

Why should you participate? Coveted SAS Data Science Training and Certifications and Cash Prizes worth up to INR 19 Lakhs!

How to Participate?

  • Only those students who are currently enrolled in any full-time UG or PG program are allowed to participate in the hackathon.
  • Each team can have a minimum of 1 person and a maximum of 3 people
  • Accommodation: Free accommodation will be available for Bitathon Rounds 2 & 3 ( February 12-14, 2026) at GIM, Goa Campus. 
  • Bitathon Gala Dinner: The dinner and musical events can provide an excellent opportunity to chat and have a good time with fellow students from across the country, together with our guests, on February 13, 2026, at GIM, Goa Campus
  • Eligibility: Only those students who are currently enrolled in any full-time UG or PG program are allowed to participate in the hackathon

column45:
About the event:

  • Hosted by: Macon – The Official Entrepreneurship Cell of IBS Hyderabad
  • Part of: Trishna 2026 – Annual Management Fest of IBS Hyderabad
  • StartSmart: The AI Challenge is an exciting and fast-paced entrepreneurial event designed to spark creativity, innovation, and practical problem-solving among participants.
  • Organized by Macon, the entrepreneurship cell of IBS Hyderabad, this flagship event forms a key attraction of Trishna 2026, the institute’s prestigious annual management festival.
  • StartSmart challenges participants to transform simple ideas into intelligent, AI-powered business concepts.
  • Through a structured, engaging, and intellectually stimulating format, teams identify real-world problems, pair them with randomly assigned AI capabilities, and craft powerful startup ideas with strong real-world impact.

column45:
Launched in 2015, NBC Idea Factory is a flagship initiative that aims to Inspire, Ideate, and Innovate among India’s brightest young engineering minds. This annual technical competition serves as a platform for engineering students to showcase their talent, creativity, and problem-solving skills. With each passing year, NBC invests its expertise and resources to discover and nurture emerging talent, fostering a culture of innovation and excellence.

Eligibility and Team Formation Guidelines:

  • NBC Idea Factory Season 10 is open to students across a select list of engineering colleges in India who are pursuing the following degrees: 
    • BE/ B.Tech. full-time programs - Batch of 2026 and 2027 (Pre-Final and Final year students)
    • Dual degree full-time program -  Batch of 2026 and 2027 (Pre-Final and Final year students)
  • Students must register in teams of 2-4 members.
  • Cross-specialization teams can participate.
  • Only students from the same campus can form a team.
  • There is no restriction on the number of teams from an institute.
  • Teams with gender diversity will earn bonus points.

Competition Structure:

MCQ Assessment:

  • All registered teams will have to take an MCQ assessment.
  • The assessment will consist of 30 questions to be answered in 30 minutes.
  • The assessment window will be open for 8 hours, and participants can attempt the assessment anytime within the provided window.
  • Participants will be tested on aptitude and computer fundamentals.
  • Each participant will be evaluated based on their accuracy and speed. If two participants answer a question correctly, the one who responds faster will be ranked higher.
  • The average score of all team members will be considered for final evaluations.
  • Teams will move on to the next level based on their performance in this quiz.

Idea Submission:

  • Shortlisted teams from Round - I can participate in this round.
  • Teams are required to submit an idea summary as a 2-slider PPT.
  • You'll be able to make submissions until the deadline for this round anytime during the provided window.

Mentorship Phase:

  • Shortlisted teams will be mentored by leaders from NBC.
  • They will work with their respective mentors to prepare their innovative submissions for the upcoming phases.

Detailed Submission and Virtual Presentations:

  • Shortlisted teams from the Idea Submission Round can participate in this round.
  • Teams must submit a comprehensive 8-10 slider PPT (excluding cover and annexure slides), showcasing their innovative ideas and problem-solving strategies derived from insights gained in the previous round.
  • You'll be able to make submissions until the deadline for this round anytime during the provided window.
  • Teams will then present their solutions to the judging panel, consisting of senior leaders and alumni.
  • The top teams will be invited to the Grand Finale to compete for the winning title.

Grand Finale:

  • The top teams will advance as National Finalists.
  • The Finalists will also present their solution to a panel of eminent leaders of NBC.
  • Results will be declared and the national winners and runners-up will be rewarded in a glittering ceremony.

Prizes and Rewards:

  • The winning team will be rewarded with a cash prize of INR 1,50,000.
  • The first runners-up team will be rewarded with a cash prize of INR 1,00,000.
  • The second runners-up team will be rewarded with a cash prize of INR 50,000.

column45:
Problem Statement:

In India, marketing and distribution of digital asset investments such as crypto and Bitcoin operate under significant regulatory and compliance constraints. Government advisories, ASCI guidelines, and platform-level policies restrict mass advertising through channels like billboards, print media, TV, and social media due to concerns around investor protection, mis-selling, and financial risk disclosure. Promotions cannot promise returns, target uninformed audiences, or resemble traditional investment advertising. Additionally, frequent regulatory ambiguity and evolving policy positions create hesitation among both investors and financial intermediaries, making trust-building and compliant communication a core challenge rather than scale-driven marketing.

Against this backdrop, Grade Capital seeks a highly compliant, executable, and trust-led acquisition strategy that can be implemented within 7 days to acquire (a) direct investors (D2C) and (b) advisors such as Chartered Accountants and finance professionals (B2B) across India. The strategy must bypass restricted mass advertising, focus on quality over volume, and leverage lawful digital, community, referral, and relationship-driven channels. Participants must design an approach that enables advisors to confidently associate with Grade Capital and responsibly introduce digital asset exposure to their existing equity and mutual fund–investing clients, while ensuring full compliance, clear risk communication, and seamless sales handover.

Overview:

  • Organized by Grade Capital
  • A live business challenge focused on investor and advisor acquisition
  • Winning strategies may be directly implemented by Grade Capital
  • Domain: Digital Assets Management

Rewards:

Cash Prizes:

  • First Prize: 11,000
  • Second Prize: 5,000
  • Third Prize: 2,000

Career Opportunities:

  • PPO / PPI (Pre-Placement Offer / Pre-Placement Interview) with Grade Capital
  • Opportunity to work closely with the core growth and sales leadership team

Who Should Participate:

  • IIT and IIM students
  • Students from top management institutes
  • Marketing, growth, and strategy professionals
  • Consultants, founders, and finance professionals

The Business Challenge:

  • Grade Capital is a Digital Assets Management company with a proven track record
  • Participants must design a strategy to acquire:
  • Direct investors
  • Advisors (Chartered Accountants and financial professionals)

Target Profile:

  • Region: Delhi NCR
  • Age Group: 28–55 years
  • Profile: Individuals already investing in Equity and Mutual Funds

Constraints & Flexibility:

  • Digital Assets advertising is restricted
  • Paid advertising is allowed only if fully legal and compliant
  • Strategy must be executable within 7 days
  • Focus on quality of investors and advisors, not vanity metrics

Team & Participation Rules:

  • Team size: 1 to 3 members
  • Individual (lone wolf) participation allowed
  • Cross-institute teams are permitted

Originality Requirements:

  • Ideas must be original and clearly articulated
  • Generic, recycled, or AI-generated strategies will be disqualified
  • AI tools may be used only for proofreading or formatting
  • Strategic thinking and ideation must be human-driven

Competition Structure:

Round 1: PPT Submission (Shortlisting Round)

  • Submit a PPT with 6 slides covering:
  • Introduction – Team overview and problem framing
  • Company Analysis – Positioning, strengths, constraints, opportunity
  • Competitor Analysis – Direct and indirect competitors, gaps
  • Core Idea – Central investor and advisor acquisition concept
  • Execution Strategy – Step-by-step plan (online, offline, paid if legal)
  • Lead Qualification & Sales Conversion – Funnel design, advisor onboarding, sales handover, tools

Round 2: Video Presentation (Final Round)

  • Recorded video presentation
  • Duration: 6–8 minutes
  • Must explain:
  • Investor acquisition approach
  • Advisor (CA) onboarding and activation strategy
  • Practicality, compliance, and immediate executability of the idea
  • All team members are encouraged to appear in the video

Evaluation Criteria:

  • Clarity and originality of the core idea
  • Strategic depth and feasibility
  • Effectiveness in acquiring both investors and advisors
  • Compliance with legal and platform restrictions
  • Ease of execution within 7 days
  • Scalability across India

About Grade Capital:

  • Grade Capital is a Digital Assets Management firm
  • Focused on structured, compliant, and risk-aware digital asset exposure for long-term investors

column2: Code at Christmas Powered by Lovable
column45:
This Christmas, we’re not solving world problems.
We’re building weird, useless, funny, and cozy projects, just for the joy of it.

Code At Christmas is a 4-hour virtual vibe coding hackathon exclusively for girls, where creativity matters more than perfection and fun matters more than feasibility. No pressure. No judges. No mentors. Just vibes, AI tools, laughter, and the freedom to build anything your imagination wants.

If you’ve ever wanted to build that ridiculous idea you never took seriously, this is your sign.

Join Whatsapp Group for all updates: https://chat.whatsapp.com/B8k1rFRIlglKacwizdfUt8

Who Can Join?

  • Girls only.
  • Solo participation

What Will You Build?

  • The most weird
  • The most useless
  • The most fun project you can imagine
  • Built using vibe coding only
  • All AI tools are allowed

Your project must be live-hosted on GitHub and contributed to the GLT repository.

Event Details:

  • Date: 24 December 2025
  • Time: 12:00 Noon – 4:00 PM IST
  • Duration: 4 Hours
  • Mode: Virtual
  • Live Stream: Girls Leading Tech LinkedIn

What’s in It for You?

Winners Get:

  • Canva Pro Subscription (1 year) worth 4,000
  • Featured on LinkedIn, Instagram, Twitter, Newsletter & Community
  • A podcast episode on our official channel
  • Winner certificate

Every Participant Gets:

  • Participation certificate
  • Lovable Credits for vibe coding worth Several Dollars
  • Feedback from fellow hackers
  • A memorable Christmas coding experience

Cozy Things Happening Alongside Hacking

While you code, we’ll keep things fun and warm:

  • Hourly quizzes
  • Live podcast station
  • Continuous mini-games in the hackathon server
  • Christmas networking rooms (matched by interests, with a moderator)
  • A virtual feedback wall to share thoughts, memes, and feels

The Fun Part: Live Pitch & Roast

After the hackathon:

  • Each hacker/team gets 5 minutes to pitch their project
  • Pitch theme: Why this project is absolutely useless (and why you love it)
  • Our team will playfully roast your idea, all in good fun

How Are Winners Chosen?

  • No judges
  • No mentors
  • Winners are selected through community voting on LinkedIn

Top 10 Selection Criteria For Voting Round:

  • Most weird project
  • Most useless project
  • Creativity in vibe coding
  • Pitch delivery
  • Live GitHub-hosted project (GLT repo contribution)

Why Code At Christmas?

Because not everything has to be impactful, scalable, or revolutionary.

Sometimes, coding is about:

  • Laughing at your own ideas
  • Building without fear
  • Creating something just because it feels right

Code At Christmas is your safe, cozy space to experiment, vibe, and celebrate coding as play.

column2: Startup Series - A Startup Pitching Competition
column45:
Startup Series - A Startup Pitching Competition 2026, hosted by E-Cell IIT Madras, is a startup picthing competiiton designed to support early-stage startups get funding and the valuable feedback from India's Top Investors. This competition offers a unique opportunity for startups to gain understanding of their sector speicifc landscape and connect with a network of industry professionals.

Key Features of Startup Series 2026:

  • Valuable Feedback from India's Top VCs and Angel Investors
  • Access to the Networking Arena of Entrepreneurship Summit 2026 
  • Extensive networking opportunities with investors, entrepreneurs, and professionals.
  • A chance to win 6.25 Lakh in cash prizes.
  • Incubation opportunities to support growth and innovation.

Startup Series 2026 features five specialized tracks:

  • AI & DeepTech
  • Energy & Sustainability
  • Healthcare
  • Fintech
  • Sector Agnostic

Thereby, allowing participants to select the track most aligned with their startup’s focus.

Why Apply:

  • Startup Series 2026 is not just a startup pitching competition; it is a collaborative ecosystem of innovators committed to driving meaningful impact across industries. If you are looking to scale your startup, connect with industry leaders, and create innovative solutions, Startup Series 2026 provides the ideal platform to achieve your goals.

column45:
Code Clash is a premier competitive programming competition hosted at Elan & nVision, designed to challenge participants’ analytical thinking and technical expertise. Contestants solve a diverse set of algorithmic and logical problems under strict time constraints, testing both accuracy and efficiency.

Competition Structure:

  • Online Round - An online round will be hosted at unstop.

Rewards and Benefits:

  • Prizes worth 15,000
  • Certificates from Elan & nVision, IIT Hyderabad

Eligibility:

  • Open to all individuals
  • Individual participation
  • Every participation can only register once.

Rules:

  • Any form of plagiarism and use of AI tools is sctrictly prohibited and will lead to immediate disqualification.
  • Decision of Judges and Event organizers is final and binding.

column45:
About the Opportunity:

  • E-Cell IIT Patna in collaboration with the Quiz Club, IIT Patna presents the Bizz Quiz, the ultimate arena for anyone who loves exploring the dynamic world of business and the surprising stories behind it.
  • From legendary corporate rivalries to breakthrough innovations, brand twists, startup journeys, global markets, and even business in pop culture—this quiz brings it all together.
  • Whether you're a seasoned quizzer, a budding entrepreneur, or simply someone who loves discovering how the business world really works, the Bizz Quiz promises a fun, fast paced, and knowledge packed experience you won’t want to miss.
  • Join us at E-Summit 2026, put your wits to the test, and compete for glory among some of the sharpest minds around.

Participation Rules:

  • Participation is allowed solo or in teams of 2 members.
  • Team members can be from different colleges/institutions.
  • No registration fee is required.
  • Each participant/team may register only once.

Event Structure:

  • Preliminary Round
    • All registered participants/teams must attempt the online prelims on the scheduled date and time.
    • In case of team of two members only the Team Captain is allowed to attempt the preliminary round.
    • Use of AI tools, external help, multiple accounts or unfair means is strictly prohibited.
    • Top 8 teams will qualify for the Finals. (Can be adjusted by organizers.)
    • Answer Discretion: The organiser’s discretion is final answer.
  • Final Round
    • Only Top teams selected from the online prelims must come to IIT Patna campus.
    • If a shortlisted team fails to report on campus, the seat will be offered to the next highest ranked team.
    • Pounce/Bounce round (with negative marking on pounce).
    • Participants must report to the venue at least 30 minutes before the offline finals.
    • Answer Discretion: The organiser’s discretion is the final answer.

Conduct & Fair Play Rules:

  • Use of mobile phones, smartwatches, calculators, AI tools, or any external assistance is strictly prohibited.
  • Talking or signaling between teams during the quiz is not allowed.
  • Respect the Quizmaster, volunteers, and fellow participants.
  • Any disorderly conduct will result in immediate disqualification.

Judging & Authority:

  • The decision of the organizers is final and binding.
  • E-Cell IIT Patna and Quiz Club reserve the right to:
    • Modify rules at any time
    • Disqualify participants for violating rules
    • Resolve any disputes
  • Rules may change without prior notice.

column45:
About the Event

Kalinga University, Raipur, is hosting KU Hackathon 2026, a 24-hour national-level innovation sprint organized by the Department of Computer Science & Faculty of Information Technology. The hackathon invites students and young professionals across India to code, create, and contribute towards solving real-world challenges.

Theme: “Code. Create. Contribute: Solving Real-World Problems through Technology”

Participants will ideate, prototype, and pitch their solutions in interdisciplinary teams, guided by expert mentors and evaluated by a distinguished panel of judges.

Participants can choose one domain to work on:

  • FinTech – Secure, inclusive, and efficient digital finance solutions.
  • Gaming & Gamification – Games and gamification for learning, health, or social impact.
  • Cybersecurity – Tools & systems to protect data, devices, and networks.
  • Waste Management – Smart, tech-driven solutions for sustainability.

Prizes (Total worth 77,500/- INR )

  • 1st Prize: 25,000
  • 2nd Prize: 15,000
  • 3rd Prize: 10,000
  • 4th Prize: 7,500
  • Consolation Prizes: 5,000 each (Total 20,000)

Eligibility & Team Size

  • Open to all university students & young professionals across India.
  • Team Size: Maximum 2 members (+1 optional mentor).

Registration Details

  • Registration Fee: 200/- per team (initial submission)
  • Final Round Fee: 2,000/- per team (includes food & accommodation)
  • Mentor Fee (optional): 1,000/- (includes food & accommodation)

Important Dates:

  • Registration Deadline: 25th January 2026
  • PPT Submission Deadline: 30th January 2026

column45:
Are you a curious mind eager to harness the latest advancements in AI to transform the world? Or do you have the vision to invent solutions for the future? EnCode is here with an exciting opportunity for you! UDGAM 2026, IIT Guwahati proudly presents the fifth edition of its flagship AI Hackathon, EnCode, designed to inspire, challenge, and empower innovators.

In EnCode, participants will be provided with an industry-level problem statement. Teams are expected to devise a feasible solution and develop a working prototype to address the challenge.

Format of the Competition

  • The hackathon will be conducted in two rounds.
  • The problem statement for Round 1 will be released in the third week of December.
  • Round 1 will be conducted online.
  • Teams must submit their code along with a presentation explaining their solution.
  • The top 10 teams will qualify for Round 2.
  • Round 2 will be conducted offline at IIT Guwahati.
  • This round will include a hackathon followed by final presentations.

What’s in it for you?

  • Prizes worth 1.5 lakh+
  • Internship opportunities
  • CV-ready project
  • Merchandise and other exciting incentives

Points to Note

  • Resources to tackle the problem statement will be provided before release; hence, no prerequisites are required.
  • Participants must register in teams of 2–4 members.

So, what are you waiting for? Register now and leave your mark in the world of AI with EnCode 2026!

column45:
Platform:

  • Communication — Google Meet + Discord
  • Submission — Google Form + GitHub
  • Final Demo — Google Meet

Event Dates: 15th December – 20th December 2025
Registration Deadline: 20th December 2025

Participants will receive confirmation emails upon successful registration.

Overview

The HackWise Hackathon 2025 is an innovation challenge bringing together bright minds from across the nation to solve real-world problems through creativity, coding, and collaboration.

Participants will brainstorm, design, and build impactful solutions aligned with the provided problem statements — all within an intense, time-bound hackathon experience.

Eligibility Criteria

  • Open to all undergraduate and postgraduate students
  • Inter-college teams — Allowed
  • Inter-specialization teams — Allowed
  • Team Size: 1 to 4 members
  • One participant can join only one team

Format & Rounds

Round 1: Idea Submission (Online)

  • Submit a short abstract describing the idea.
  • Evaluation based on originality, feasibility & impact.

Round 2: Prototype Development (Online)

  • Shortlisted teams develop a working prototype.
  • Mentorship support available.

Round 3: Final Presentation (Online)

  • Teams pitch their project before the judges.
  • Evaluation: innovation, usability, technical depth & presentation.

Rules & Guidelines:

  • All submissions must be original and created during the hackathon
  • Strict adherence to deadlines
  • No plagiarism or pre-built project reuse
  • Open-source libraries allowed with citation
  • Judges' decisions are final
  • Professional behaviour is mandatory

Duration

  • Total Duration: 24 Hours
  • Detailed timelines for each round will be shared.

Why Participate?

  • Boost your resume
  • Build impactful tech solutions
  • Collaborate with peers & mentors
  • Gain visibility among recruiters

Prizes & Recognition

  • 1st Place: 1,499
  • 2nd Place: 999
  • All Participants: Certificate of Participation

Judging Criteria

Category Weightage
Innovation & Creativity 25%
Technical Implementation 25%
Feasibility & Impact 25%
Presentation & Clarity 25%

column2: AI Venture Sprint: AI-Based Entrepreneurship Competition
column45:
Overview:

  • Innovation and Entrepreneurship Committee (IEC), Jaipuria Institute of Management, Jaipur presents AI Venture Sprint, a national-level AI-based entrepreneurship competition hosted on Unstop
  • The competition encourages students across India to develop AI startups, AI SaaS solutions, and GenAI ventures that address real-world problems
  • The event provides a structured platform to ideate, validate, and pitch AI-driven business ideas

Eligibility:

  • Open to students from engineering, management, design, and interdisciplinary backgrounds
  • Participation is open to students across India

Competition Format:

  • 3-round competition conducted in a 100% online mode
  • Round 1: AI Idea Screening
  • Round 2: AI Pitch Deck Evaluation
  • Round 3: Live AI Pitch Finals (Zoom)

Incentives:

  • Prize pool of 40,000
  • Certificates for participants
  • Digital badges
  • Incubation opportunities

column45:
About:

  • Decrypt is a classic case study competition that tests entrepreneurial thinking
  • Focuses on reading situations, making decisions, and solving real-world business problems
  • Designed to simulate real-world entrepreneurship challenges
  • Cases test analytical, strategic, and decision-making abilities
  • Provides hands-on exposure to business problem solving

Guidelines:

  • Students must register before 20th December
  • Once the case goes live, teams must analyze a real-world business problem and develop innovative strategic solutions within the given deadline
  • Shortlisted teams will advance to the Real-Time Challenge round
  • In the Real-Time Challenge, a live dynamic scenario such as competitor entry or market disruption will be announced
  • Teams must prepare and submit a strategy report with actionable solutions within the allotted time
  • This round evaluates adaptability and quick decision-making skills
  • Selected teams will move to the final presentation round
  • Finalists must present problem understanding, role clarity, in-depth analysis, data-backed recommendations, and measurable impact to the judges

Rules:

  • Teams must consist of 2–5 members
  • Inter-college teams are allowed
  • A student cannot be part of more than one team
  • Top 20 teams will be shortlisted for the final round
  • Final presentation format will be 7 minutes presentation followed by 5 minutes Q&A
  • Judges’ and organizers’ decisions are final and binding

column45:
E-Cell, IIT Kanpur’s trademark event, UpStart Nationals, was recently conducted across Seoul, Mumbai, Bangalore, Delhi, and Hyderabad and received an overwhelming response from the startup ecosystem. Over 80 startups pitched their ideas to leading investment firms including Antennae Ventures, Unicorn Incubator, Hyderabad Angels, Sucseed Ventures, Sequoia Venture, Ankur Capital, among others. Several startups advanced to funding discussions, with total potential funding estimated at over $8 million.

Following the success of UpStart Nationals, E-Cell, IIT Kanpur presents UpStart Campus—a new opportunity for early-stage and student-led startups. Through this initiative, founders will get the chance to pitch their ideas to a panel of investors from organizations such as Pedal Start, Campus Fund, and others.If you are a startup founder in the initial stages and looking for an opportunity to pitch in front of a VC panel, this platform is for you.

Guidelines:

  • Students who are working on their startup ideas or are still in the ideation phase are eligible to participate.
  • Participants can register individually or in teams of 1–4 members.
  • Startups must submit a pitch deck of not more than 10 slides, covering all key aspects of the idea, including problem statement, solution, target market, value proposition, business model, traction (if any), competitive landscape, go-to-market strategy, revenue model, and future roadmap.
  • Shortlisted startups will pitch their ideas in front of a VC panel in a 7+5 format, consisting of 7 minutes for presentation followed by 5 minutes of Q&A.
  • Pitch decks must be original and should not be copied from existing startups or publicly available templates.
  • Winners will get a chance for on-the-spot funding for their ideas.

Rules:

  • The pitch deck must be original and should not copy existing startup ideas or decks.
  • The decision of the judges and organizers will be final and binding.

column2: Ka-Ching X EJCon'26 Grand Case Competition
column45:
The Grand Case Challenge is the National Case Study Competition of Ka-Ching X EJCon’26 – The Economics and Management Fest of NMIMS. It is the ultimate pressure test of strategic vision, where academic theory collides with real-world market dynamics.

Participants are dropped into a high-stakes business scenario demanding precision, insight, and disruptive execution. This competition challenges teams to think faster, collaborate smarter, and decode the hidden variables that truly drive business success.

Competition Structure:

  • The competition begins with an online qualifier round, consisting of fast-paced puzzles and strategic reasoning questions designed to test participants’ ability to connect clues under time pressure.
  • Following this, a case will be released on the Unstop platform. Teams are required to analyze the case from a business and strategic perspective and propose a well-structured, implementable solution.
  • Submissions must go beyond surface-level analysis, clearly demonstrating potential for market-shifting growth, sustainable competitive advantage, and strategic clarity.
  • In this battleground, the best teams don’t just react, they redefine industries, engineer the future, and claim victory through strategic brilliance.

Guidelines:

  • A team must comprise a minimum of 1 and a maximum of 3 participants, all from the same institute.
  • Any number of teams may participate from an institute; however, a participant may be part of only one team.
  • The submission must not exceed 10 slides, excluding the introductory slide(s) and references.
  • Submissions must be in PDF or PPT format only.
  • Proper references must be mentioned wherever applicable.
  • No changes in team structure will be allowed after registration.
  • The organizers reserve the right to modify rules at any stage of the competition.
  • All decisions regarding eligibility, evaluation, and final judgment shall rest with the organizing committee.
  • Naming Convention: Team Name_College Name

Important Dates & Eligibility:

  • Preliminary Round Submission: 2nd January
  • Case Submission: 10th January
  • Open to students currently enrolled in Undergraduate, or Postgraduate programs

column45:
Startup Expo is the flagship startup showcase at E-Summit IIT Roorkee 2026, designed to connect high-potential startups with leading venture capitalists, investors, and ecosystem leaders. This 3-day, sector-agnostic exhibition provides founders a high-impact platform to present their innovations, build strategic relationships, and unlock growth opportunities.

With live product demos, 1-on-1 investor pitching, curated networking sessions, and startup-focused workshops, Startup Expo accelerates meaningful engagement between startups and capital providers.

What Startups Get

Investor Access & Funding

  • 1-on-1 pitching opportunities with 15+ global VCs and investors
  • Direct exposure to active funds and angel networks seeking deployable opportunities

Showcase & Visibility

  • Dedicated kiosk for 2 days to demonstrate your product or service
  • Visibility in front of 15,000+ attendees, including founders, investors, and enablers

High-Value Networking

  • Exclusive networking sessions with top investors and successful IIT Roorkee alumni
  • Curated networking lunch with VCs, industry leaders, and fellow founders

Learning & Ecosystem Access

  • Startup-focused speaker sessions and workshops
  • Full access to all E-Summit keynote talks, workshops, and flagship events

Hiring & Talent

  • Participate in the Internship & Talent Fair to connect with students from IIT Roorkee and other premier institutes for internships and hiring

Eligibility

  • Any startup or entrepreneur developing a scalable product or service across any sector

Event Format

  • Hybrid Mode
  • Round 1: Online shortlisting
  • Final Showcase: Offline at IIT Roorkee

Why Participate

If you are seeking funding, strategic partnerships, talent, or national visibility, Startup Expo at E-Summit IIT Roorkee 2026 is a high-signal platform built for serious founders.

For further details or a quick discussion, feel free to reach out.
We look forward to hosting your startup at E-Summit IIT Roorkee 2026.

column45:
Guidelines:

  • Humain-I, the HR Club of IIM Indore, is thrilled to present 'Indite 2025', the National Article Writing Competition.
  • This event allows you to showcase your knowledge of the Organizational Behaviour/ Human Resources domain. It provides you with a great platform to collaborate your critical thinking with creative writing.

The competition would require submissions on any one of the following topics:

  • Gen Z vs. Milennial: Preparing for the Most Divergent Workforce Ever
    How HR should adapt to drastically shifting expectations, values, and motivations.
  • Silent Resignation and Cognitive Fatigue: The Next Wave of Employee Disengagement
    How should HR identify and mitigate these new forms of workplace withdrawal?

Important Details:

  • Eligibility: MBA (1st or 2nd year) students
  • Team Size: Individual
  • File Format: PDF
  • Article Word Limit: 500 Words

Submission Guidelines:

  • The naming convention to follow 'Firstname_Lastname_Institutename'
  • Plagiarized articles won’t be considered 
  • It is advisable to mention references for all details borrowed from other sources
  • The cover page should include your name, institute name, year, course details & contact information
  • Deadline: 11:59 PM, 24th December 2025

Prizes:

  • Cash Prizes worth 5K
  • The top 3 positions would be rewarded with cash prizes
  • A digital participation certificate to each participant with the original submission

column45:
About:

  • ProdExpo is the Annual Product Summit of IIM Calcutta, conducted by the PMTech Club.
  • The fest aims to promote PM culture and technical acumen among the budding leaders of tomorrow.
  • The events organized in ProdExpo’25 will revolve around solving real-life pain points and building a holistic understanding of product management through competitions and keynotes.
  • Through this summit, we plan to promote creativity, enhance customer empathy, and enable participants to design better solutions for tomorrow.
  • Product Decode is an exciting competition where you break down a product and present your observations.
  • Understand the product by having first-hand experience and analyze the problem statement. Study the user and the market to strategize the improvements for the problem.
  • Focus on your audience, the features, and the scope of improvements for the product and win exciting prizes.

Guidelines:

  • There will be only one round i,e., Case submission on product decode
  • Please submit your deck with not more than 5 slides
  • Submissions will be accepted in PDF format
  • The case submission deadline is 23:59 hours on 21/12/2025

Rules:

  • The event is open to all current college students
  • Students cannot be a part of Multiple teams
  • Inter-college teams are not allowed
  • All decisions regarding eligibility and final judgment shall rest with the PMTech Club of IIM Calcutta
  • The PMTech team reserves the right to change the format or rules for any round in the competition

column45:
Details:

  • OriginX 2.0 is a pan-India problem-solving championship organized by the School of Business Management, NMIMS Hyderabad. The event is entirely student-managed and aims to foster entrepreneurial thinking, interdisciplinary innovation, and structured business problem-solving among undergraduate and postgraduate students.
  • The competition follows a hybrid format with two national-level online rounds hosted on Unstop, followed by an on-campus Grand Finale at NMIMS Hyderabad. Participants solve real-world business problems across domains such as Marketing, Finance, HR, Operations, Technology, Sustainability, and Social Impact.
  • A key highlight of OriginX 2.0 is its corporate simulation-based finale. Shortlisted teams present refined solutions to a jury of startup founders, industry professionals, and academic experts, followed by a signature Market Shock Challenge that tests real-time business agility and strategic adaptability.
  • OriginX 2.0 reinforces NMIMS Hyderabad’s commitment to innovation-driven education while enhancing industry-academia engagement through experiential learning.

column45:
Details:

  • Behind the Brand is an immersive, inter-college competition designed for students who believe successful businesses are powered not just by creativity, but by deep consumer insight and strategic thinking. In today’s dynamic market, every colour, price point, message, and customer touchpoint is shaped by research and psychological understanding. This event brings participants into that world where behavioural science meets branding, and where strategy is built on evidence rather than intuition. 
  • The journey begins with an online qualifier, a fast-paced quiz that tests participants on concepts related to branding, marketing, and decision-making. Accuracy and speed are crucial here, as only the highest-performing teams earn a place in the offline rounds. This stage acts as the first filter, identifying quick thinkers who can apply knowledge under pressure. 
  • Teams that advance move on to the on-campus analytical round, where the challenge becomes more immersive and intellectually engaging. Participants are introduced to a unique analytical task that requires sharp observation, conceptual clarity, and the ability to decode subtle strategic cues. They must analyse elements that hint at deeper marketing intent and translate those insights into a concise, compelling presentation. This round demands both creativity and structured thinking, as teams must balance intuition with logic to build a narrative that makes sense from both a consumer and business standpoint. 
  • Finalists then progress to the grand culmination, a high-energy presentation arena where strategy, communication, and depth of research come together. Teams deliver a structured pitch that showcases their understanding of brand strategy, behavioural principles, and market implications. They must present clear recommendations supported by strong justification while demonstrating feasibility and expected business outcomes. The judging panel, comprising industry professionals and academic experts, evaluates presentations not only on content but also on delivery, originality, teamwork, and clarity of thought. The Q&A segment further tests the teams’ ability to defend their logic with confidence and analytical rigour. 
  • Beyond the competition, Behind the Brand offers participants a chance to explore how brands truly function, how they influence decisions, create loyalty, and differentiate themselves in saturated markets. Students learn to identify the subtle psychological triggers and strategic frameworks that guide consumer behaviour. The event fosters collaboration, sharpens research skills, and encourages innovative thinking rooted in real-world marketing dynamics. 
  • With a rewarding prize pool and certificates, the event becomes more than a challenge it becomes a platform for aspiring strategists to showcase talent, learn by doing, and experience the thrill of solving brand puzzles under pressure. If you are ready to decode the hidden science behind successful brands and present insights that can shape real business decisions, this is your arena. Register, analyse, compete, and discover the strategist in you.

column45:
• How sharp is your business savvy? Put your knowledge to the test with our exciting quiz and see if you're a true business whiz or if it’s time for a little refresher!
  • The Entrepreneurship Cell of IIT Guwahati is thrilled to announce a Business Quiz for all enthusiasts and business buffs as part of its annual entrepreneurship summit, UDGAM '26. The quiz will take place on Unstop on December 24, 2025.
  • The evaluation consists of three rounds: Prelims, Semi-Finals, and Finals, all of which are eliminatory.

Round 1 Details:

  • Participation is individual.
  • The quiz will be conducted on the Unstop platform.
  • The quiz comprises 30 questions, with each question worth one point.
  • Participants will have 45 minutes to complete the quiz, with 90 seconds allotted per question.
  • Participants who qualify for semi-finals will be notified.

column45:
Guidelines:

  • Teams must consist of exactly 3 members as CEO, CFO & CMO
  • The team will be provided with 3 aspects of problem statements with respect to Finance, Marketing, and Management of a Company, respectively.
  • Each team member will research and solve the problem pertaining to their respective field. During Round 1, The teams will submit one of their solution aspects as a doc.
  • The document must be in Arial font, size 11.
  • Based on the submissions, teams will be invited to IIT Kanpur for the Table Round.
  • The table will consist of 4 such teams, along with 1 Elder(Judge).
  • Teams will get 4 minutes each to present their solution in a rotational format.
  • This will be followed by a 30-minute moderated discussion and debate.
  • As each problem is raised, the designated CXOs will present their solutions and raise contentions about other’s solutions. Overall, it will be a discussion plus debate for the emergence of the best solution.
  • Only the designated CXO may speak or intervene on matters related to their domain. For example, in a team, only the CFO can present the company's financial case to the High Table, and only s/he can intervene in the proceedings of other CFOs.
  • The whole discussion is presided over by the judges at their sole discretion.

Rules:

  • Each participant may be part of only one team.
  • Team roles (CEO, CFO, CMO) must be finalized before submission and cannot be changed later.
  • Participants must strictly adhere to their assigned CXO role during all rounds.
  • Teams must adhere to time limits during presentations and discussions.
  • All decisions by the judges and organizers are final and binding.

column45:
All that you need to know about Sell your Sole

Even the best items can only reach their full market potential with clever marketing. In this competition, you must put yourself in the shoes of a Chief Marketing Officer (CMO) to present a marketing strategy. You will be given a pair of shoes from an existing brand and have to build a marketing campaign. Your team will be given a region and a budget to make the best campaign strategy for your company. The campaign must include different verticals like Digital Marketing, Event Marketing, Product Marketing, and Brand Management Marketing. Participants’ marketing skills will also be evaluated through an in-person Marketing Video Making round, where creativity and presentation matter. Define your customer persona and make sure you get the highest return on your investment.

Guidelines:

  • Participants will take on the role of a Chief Marketing Officer (CMO) and create a marketing campaign for an existing brand. Each team will get a region and budget to maximize campaign impact.
  • Teams must prepare a Marketing Strategy Presentation across the defined verticals.
  • Shortlisted teams will be invited to IIT Kanpur for the next round, which will test marketing skills through a Marketing Video Making round, where teams showcase their product creatively.
  • In the final round, teams will present their strategy to a panel of judges, highlighting creativity and analytical decision-making.
  • Presentations should clearly show the use of budget, expected ROI, campaign feasibility, and metrics.
  • Teams are encouraged to bring catchy slogans, trendy hashtags, and eye-catching posters for the video campaign.

Rules:

  • The competition is open to undergraduate and postgraduate students from all domains.

  • Cross-college and cross-disciplinary teams are allowed.

  • Teams must have 2–5 members, and each participant can join only one team.

  • Each team will be assigned a budget and demographics. Marketing strategy and video will be evaluated based only on the information provided.

  • Teams must submit a Marketing Strategy Presentation of maximum 8 pages.

  • Shortlisted teams will participate in on-campus rounds at IIT Kanpur, including a live marketing video and final presentation.

  • The Marketing Video must be 60–120 seconds, shot offline at IIT Kanpur in either landscape or portrait format. AI clips may be used creatively.

  • All decisions by judges and organizers are final and binding.

column45:
About the Event:

  • A flagship management competition focused on analytical thinking, structured problem-solving, and leadership under pressure.
  • Immerses participants in dynamic, real-world business scenarios that require clarity, adaptability, and confident decision-making.

Event Structure & Nature:

  • Multi-stage competition combining consulting, leadership, and crisis-management skills.
  • Rapid data-driven decision-making
  • Creative and structured reasoning
  • Cross-functional problem-solving
  • Crisis response and leadership behaviour
  • Challenges grow increasingly complex across rounds.

Key Highlights of Mentorship Trifecta:

  • Emphasis on practical, real-time decision-making in unpredictable environments.
  • Business breakdowns
  • Organisational challenges
  • Crisis-management situations
  • Rewards teams that show:
  • Strong business instincts
  • Sharp communication skills
  • Strategic adaptability
  • Team coordination under pressure

Why This Competition Stands Out:

  • Integrates real-time decision-making with cross-functional strategic thinking.
  • Encourages participants to move beyond theoretical frameworks.
  • Focuses on trade-offs, organisational dynamics, and long-term impact of decisions.
  • Simulates real corporate roles and pressure environments.

Overall Value:

  • Aligned with INSPIRE’s mission of mentorship-driven learning.
  • Helps students sharpen managerial instincts and leadership acumen.
  • Builds confidence to perform under high-pressure corporate scenarios.
  • Attracts nationwide participation with a strong prize pool.
  • Offers a transformative experience for aspiring leaders and management enthusiasts.
