column45:
All that you need to know about THE SUMMONING: WHEN PURPOSE BECOMES POWER

“Unbowed. Unbent. Unbroken.”

Forged in the spirit of House of Martell, NISHCHAY - The Student Social Responsibility Committee of NMIMS Hyderabad, calls upon leaders who can think with purpose, defend with clarity, and adapt under heat. Step into the Circularity Boardroom, where ethics meet strategy and agility becomes your greatest weapon. 

You will design CSR blueprints that are practical, strategic, and socially meaningful. You will be challenged to defend your perspective, shift your approach when required, and demonstrate composure under pressure.

In this arena, purpose is your strongest asset. And those who lead with integrity, clarity, and intention will stand out.

This event blends:
 CSR thinking
 sustainability strategy
 ethical decision-making
 circularity challenges
 real-world problem solving

to help you craft the next generation of purpose-powered corporate leadership.

General Rules

  • Teams must consist of 4 members from the same institute.
  • All submissions must be original and created solely by the team, and must be submitted on the Unstop portal before the deadline.
  • Only publicly available information may be used for research.
  • Only teams that qualify for Round 1 will be eligible for Round 2.
  • Round 2 will be held offline, and all qualifying team members must be physically present on campus.Any plagiarism, misconduct, or misuse of AI tools will lead to disqualification..

column45:
Overview:

A national brand-transformation arena challenging participants to rebuild mainstream brands into future-ready, sustainable icons. Teams must reimagine an existing brand through a sustainability-first lens, combining strategic precision, ESG intelligence, and imaginative storytelling. Inspired by the dramatic intensity of Westeros, the competition adds a thematic edge that tests both creativity and conviction.

 

Participants are rewarded for:
• Powerful brand narratives
• Responsible yet ambitious sustainability ideas
• Visually compelling and coherent concepts

 

Only teams demonstrating:
• Strong strategic logic
• Smart, original creativity
• A clear vision for sustainable brand evolution
will rise to the top.

column2: People Ops: The Ultimate Change Management Challenge
column11: SVKM's Narsee Monjee Institute of Management Studies. Plot no. B 4, Green Industrial Park, TSIIC, Polepally SEZ, JADCHERLA, Mahbubnagar Dist., Telangana- 509301
column45:
• People Ops is an exhilarating inter-college competition hosted by the HRizon club at NMIMS Hyderabad, designed for students to conquer real-world organizational crises through strategic simulations. Teams of four represent dynamic companies navigating high-stakes scenarios like mergers, digital transformations, employee resistance, and downsizing, delivering people-first change interventions under intense pressure. Judged by senior HR leaders from top organizations, the event sharpens skills in rapid decision-making, stakeholder alignment, and crisis leadership.
  • In this immersive championship, teams tackle evolving challenges from identifying key issues and crafting action plans to engaging diverse stakeholders like angry employees, boards of directors, and union representatives while adapting to surprises such as budget cuts, media leaks, key resignations, productivity drops, talent exits, and overruns. The journey progresses from online submissions to live simulations at NMIMS Hyderabad, where participants allocate limited resources to training, retention bonuses, communication campaigns, process improvements, and mental health support, all tracked via outcome dashboards measuring morale, retention, productivity, and change adoption success. This structure mirrors authentic HR volatility, blending strategic frameworks with empathy to demonstrate how leaders stabilize organizations amid chaos.
  • The event underscores HR's pivotal role in driving transformation and business continuity, providing hands-on experience in negotiation, communication, conflict resolution, and resource optimization. Participants emerge with practical tools for handling employee wellbeing alongside high-pressure demands, plus opportunities to network with industry professionals and benchmark against top talent. Hosted by NMIMS Hyderabad's HRizon club, People Ops equips future leaders with resilience and clarity essential for real-world impact, turning theoretical knowledge into actionable expertise through every high-pressure moment.
  • This championship offers a unique platform to test and refine crisis management abilities in a competitive yet collaborative environment. Future HR professionals leave equipped not just with strategies, but with the confidence to lead through uncertainty.

column45:
Key Highlights:

  • Immersive Simulation: Teams act as global shipping managers handling complex, real-world logistics scenarios.
  • Dynamic Challenges: Includes uncertainties like fuel price volatility, piracy threats, port congestion, weather disruptions, and ESG compliance.
  • Strategic Decision-Making: Participants must evaluate trade-offs, manage risks, and balance cost, speed, and safety.
  • Operational Optimization: Focus on optimizing delivery timelines while navigating global constraints and resource limitations.
  • High-Stakes Environment: Encourages quick thinking, agility, and confident decision-making under pressure.
  • Analytical Skill Development: Enhances analytical reasoning, forecasting, and operational strategy formulation.
  • Justification-Focused: Teams must back every decision with strong operational and strategic rationale.
  • Real-World Relevance: Mirrors the complexity and urgency of international logistics and supply chain management.

column11: SVKM's Narsee Monjee Institute of Management Studies. Plot no. B 4, Green Industrial Park, TSIIC, Polepally SEZ, JADCHERLA, Mahbubnagar Dist., Telangana- 509301
column45:
Beyond the Wall Street: The Challenge – House of Mormont

Step into a world where strategy meets spectacle, and finance is forged in the fires of competition.

Beyond the Wall Street:

  • The Challenge – House of Mormont, organized by Finnacle -NMIMS Hyderabad, it is more than an event, it is an immersive arena inspired by the epic saga of  ‘Game of Thrones’. Here, you are not mere participants but contenders vying for honor, glory, and tangible reward, representing the steadfast and resilient House of Mormont in a battle of wits and vision.
  • This challenge unfolds as a high-stakes 'Shark Tank' simulation, where budding innovators and strategists pitch groundbreaking ideas to a panel of judges, the “Sharks”. This is a call to all domains a rare convergence of diverse minds where teams of three to four members must unite to craft solutions that are as viable as they are visionary. Set against the backdrop of January 2026, the competition bridges the digital and physical realms, commencing online before culminating in a gripping on-campus finale.
  • The journey begins with Round 1: The Duel, a preliminary trial of clarity and creativity. Teams must distill their essence into a pitch deck of just three slides excluding title slide and thank you, focusing on the theme of FinTech & Digital Disruption. This round tests the core: the sharpness of insight into a real-world problem, the ingenuity of the proposed solution, and the scope of its potential impact. It is here that ideas are tempered, and only the most compelling 6 to 8 teams advance to the hallowed grounds of the finale.

Round 2:

  • The Council transforms concept into theatre. In a dynamic Shark Tank-style arena, teams deliver a polished 10-minute presentation followed by an intense 10-minute negotiation round with the Sharks. The focus shifts decisively from what to how scrutinizing business models, market strategies, competitive edges, and financial sustainability. This is where persuasion meets pressure, and where prototypes and numbers speak as loudly as passion.
  • Beyond the thrill, the stakes are substantial: a winner’s purse of 40,000, with runners-up receiving  20,000 and 15,000, alongside certificates. More than prizes, however, this event offers a transformative platform a chance to hone presentation skills, defend ideas under fire, and network within a community of future leaders. In essence, the House of Mormont challenge is a  microcosm of entrepreneurial reality. It rewards not just brilliance, but resilience; not just innovation, but execution. For any student seeking to test their mettle, articulate a vision, or simply experience the adrenaline of high-stakes pitching, this is where legends begin. Prepare your deck, rally your house, and step beyond the wall your audience awaits.

column45:
Eligibility:

  • Open to individuals and teams of up to six members.
  • Participants may be students, professionals, founders, or aspiring entrepreneurs.
  • A participant must be part of only one team.

Round 1- Preliminary Screening:

Evaluation Parameters:

  • Clarity of Problem & Solution
  • Market Potential
  • Innovation / Differentiation
  • Feasibility & Execution Capability
  • Presentation Quality

Round 2- Final Pitch:

Pitch Format:

  • 10 minutes presentation
  • 5 minutes Q&A with investors
  • Total: 15 minutes per team

Judging Panel:

  • Investors
  • Seed/Pre-Seed VCs
  • Micro-VCs
  • Incubators & Accelerators

Evaluation Criteria:

  • Market Need & Opportunity
  • Viability of the Business
  • Scalability & Long-Term Potential
  • Revenue Model & Financial Logic
  • Clarity, Structure, and Delivery of Pitch
  • Team Capability

Results & Communication:

  • Only shortlisted teams proceed to the final round.
  • Jury decisions are final and binding.

Terms & Conditions:

  • Participation implies acceptance of all rules.
  • Submissions must be original; plagiarism results in disqualification.
  • Teams are responsible for accuracy of all information submitted.
  • The organizing committee may modify rules or timelines if required.
  • By participating, teams permit use of their pitch material, names, and visuals for event-related promotions.
  • All disputes will be resolved by the organizing committee.

column45:
PromptVerse 2.0 is the ultimate arena for honing the essential skill of the AI era: Prompt Engineering. Featuring a uniquely crafted digital treasure hunt, this event pushes developers, creatives, and AI enthusiasts to generate high-quality results through precision and logic. Master the art of the prompt and unlock the true capabilities of machine intelligence.

Guidelines:

  • Undergraduate and postgraduate students from recognized colleges can participate.
  • Inter-college team members are not allowed.
  • Keep the solutions relevant to the theme.
  • Participants are encouraged to use any AI tools and resources they deem necessary. The organisers will not provide any software subscriptions or paid tools.

Rules:

  • A team comprises 2-4 members including one team leader.
  • Modification of the team details is not allowed once the registration is over.
  • No participant should be part of more than one team.
  • The team cannot consist of members of different colleges and institutes.
  • Further details of Rounds 2 & 3 will be shared with the qualifying teams.
  • Presentation for Round 3 will be conducted at FORE School of Management, Gurugram on 10th January 2026.

column45:
Pitching your idea to a group of investors is incredibly nerve-wracking. Always puts you in a dilemma whether investors like your idea or not. Most of all, you wonder if they’re going to fund you or not. Even if one has money in the bank, there sure is going to be a point where one simply has to get additional funding to grow their startup, to start scaling up. To achieve this, you need to understand the perspective of the person sitting on the other side of the table. So we bring to you a competition that will actually put you in the shoes of investors thereby teaching you a lot about what investors want and how to position the companies for successful pitches in the future.Students participating here are the investors, not the entrepreneurs. They do not have to come up with startup ideas. Rather, they would play the role of Angel Investors/Analysts in a VC firm assessing the startups being posed to them as potential investments

Guidelines:

  • Participants will play the role of an angel investor with $15 million to invest in one or more of the startups presenting. They will assess the investment opportunities and pitch their investment strategy to the VC judges.
  • Participants will be provided with detailed information about 8 startups, including their target user persona, market segment, target sectors, profitability, market size CAGR, and other relevant details.
  • The task is to evaluate the startups and make a calculated investment decision, specifying which startup(s) to invest in and the equity expected in return. An Investment Report (maximum 3 pages) must be submitted online.
  • Shortlisted teams will be invited to IIT Kanpur for the next round, where a fun surprise awaits! An unexpected market update—such as a boom, recession, or tech shake-up—will be revealed on the spot. Teams must quickly adapt and showcase their revised strategy. Teams will be divided into panels, and auctions will be conducted within each panel.
  • In the third round, teams must prepare a presentation outlining their updated investment strategy based on the market twist. They will present their reasoning in front of a panel of judges (VCs), who will evaluate and question them offline at IIT Kanpur.
  • Investments must be made such that the new valuation lies between the asked valuation and the valuation from the previous round.
  • Pitch decks will be provided for companies from the following sectors: EdTech, FinTech, Web3, Crypto, Blockchain, Pharma, Biotech, and Product.
  • Teams shortlisted from Round 1 will get the opportunity to visit IIT Kanpur for Round 2 and Round 3 during E-Summit’25.

Rules:

  • The competition is open to undergraduate and postgraduate students.
  • Cross-college and cross-disciplinary teams are allowed.
  • Teams must consist of 2–5 members; each participant can be part of only one team.
  • Each team will act as an angel investor with a total capital of $15 million, which can be invested in one or more startups.
  • Teams must submit an Investment Report (maximum 3 pages) based on the provided startup pitch decks.
  • The proposed investment valuation must lie between the asked valuation and the previous round valuation.
  • Shortlisted teams will participate in on-campus rounds at IIT Kanpur, including a live market twist and final presentation.
  • All decisions by the judges and organizers will be final and binding.

column45:
Important Details:

  • PrizePool : 1,20,000
  • A 24-hour on-the-spot hackathon happening from January 4th, 2026, 12 noon to January 5th, 2026, 12 noon!
  • Dive into the world of machine learning and software development with four intriguing problem statements to choose from. Whether you're a coding ninja or an aspiring tech wizard, this is your chance to showcase your skills.
  • Looking for an opportunity to shine? Register before the deadline(January 4th, 1:00 PM) to secure your spot. Don't miss out on the chance to tackle real-world challenges, collaborate with like-minded innovators, and craft solutions that could revolutionize the tech landscape.
  • This is more than a hackathon; it's a platform to demonstrate your expertise, problem-solving prowess, and creativity. Plus, gain recognition and publicity as you present your innovative solutions. Embrace the challenge and unlock your potential.

Note:

  • All the rounds of the hackathon will be offline(participants will be shortlisted based on a round that'll happen in the campus itself).
  • On-spot registrations are also available.
  • Shaastra 2026 Passport(You'll have to get it from shaastra.org, but it's not updated yet) for each student outside IITM is necessary for participating in the event. 
  • You'll have to buy one of the shaastra passports if you're a non IITM student.
  • (not updated yet on the website)
  • You'll have to book your own accommodation

Both of these can be done in shaastra.org (try on the laptop for a better experience)

Guidelines:

  • This event is open to all students.
  • A student cannot be part of more than one team.
  • Each team can submit only one entry for the competition.
  • The problem statements will be revealed on 4th Jan, 1  pm to the offline present participants.
  • Bring your laptops and chargers.
  • Refreshments will be provided at regular intervals.
  • Join this Whatsapp Group for regular updates.

Rules:

  • This is a team competition consisting of one to four members.
  • The decision of the organizers and judges will be final and binding on the team.

column11: Indukaka Ipcowala Institute of Management, CHARUSAT UNIVERSITY
column45:
Details:

  • Charotar University of Science and Technology (CHARUSAT) has been conceived to make Charotar – the Land of Sardar Patel the Global Education Hub. The university has been awarded with “A+” Grade by NAAC, Bangalore. It has been accorded the status of Centre of Excellence by the Government of Gujarat.
  • Presently, CHARUSAT offers more than 70 undergraduates, postgraduate, and PhD programs under the tutelage of 10 Institutes and 7 Faculties. CHARUSAT has a student strength of more than 10000. CHARUSAT has highly qualified and dedicated 700+ faculty and staff members trained in IITs, IIMs, leading Universities and industries.

About IIIM:

  • The Indukaka Ipcowala Institute of Management (IIIM), a constituent of CHARUSAT, was established with the support of IPCO Industries. IIIM began its management education journey in 2006–07 with its AICTE-approved MBA Programme and has since expanded to offer Undergraduate, Post-Graduate, and Doctoral Programmes tailored to meet evolving global industry needs.
  • The Institute is known for its full-time specialized programmes, including BBA in Business Analytics and BBA in Entrepreneurship & New Venture Management, which allow students to build strong domain-specific skills. IIIM offers multiple specializations in its BBA and MBA programmes and is committed to delivering contemporary, industry-relevant education.
  • IIIM has consistently strengthened its academic reputation, earning commendable recognition in the GSIRF (Gujarat State Institutional Rating Framework) rankings. The institute actively engages students through flagship events such as Prabandhan – The Management Conclave, Entrepreneurship and Innovation Summits, expert lecture series, national competitions, and other academic development activities, fostering a culture of learning, leadership, and industry interaction.

About the Competition:

  • National Case Study Competition 2026 is the second edition of IIIM’s national-level academic event designed to encourage analytical thinking, business problem-solving, and evidence-based decision-making. The competition invites participants to explore real organizational challenges and develop innovative and practical solutions.
  • It serves as a platform for students, researchers, and professionals to showcase strategic insights, communicate ideas effectively, and engage with industry-experienced evaluators.

Competition Structure:

  • Round One – Abstract Submission: Each team is required to identify a company and align their case idea with the competition theme before preparing and submitting an abstract (maximum 500 words).

Competition Theme – Business & Management:

  • (Participants may choose topics related to Analytics, Finance, General Management, HR, Marketing, or any allied area of Management.)

Final Round – Case Study Presentation at IIIM, CHARUSAT Campus:

  • Teams shortlisted from Round One will submit the full case (up to 6,000 words) and present it before the judging panel at IIIM, CHARUSAT.

column45:
Rules:  

  • The competition is scheduled to take place in two stages, with the preliminary round set for December 18th to 23rd and the finals scheduled for December 27th 2025.
  • A team of 2-4 members is allowed.
  • In the Prelims round, participants will need to attempt the quiz within a stipulated time period of 25 minutes to qualify for the next round and prelims will need to attempt only by Team Leader. The quiz will be taken for a duration of 25 minutes. This is an elimination round, hence the participants will be required to attempt the questions diligently to qualify for the final round of competition.
  • A total of 10 teams will be selected for the final round.
  • Problem statements will be given to the qualifying teams on 25 December through Mail before 12:00 PM. The participants will have exactly 24 hours to work on the case solution, after which the PowerPoint presentations must be submitted. No further change in the presentations is allowed henceforth.
  • On the final day, qualifying teams are required to present their case solution in a PowerPoint presentation before the Judge's Panel. 
  • The time allotted for the presentation by each team will be strictly 10 minutes and 5 min for cross questioning from judges if any.
  • The panel's decision would be final and binding.
  • The Finals will commence at 11 am IST on 27th December. Participants are advised to be present at the meeting platform in advance to avoid the last-minute hustle.
  • Each submitted entry will undergo a plagiarism check, and disqualification will occur if any instances of plagiarism are detected.
  • Each team will be provided their cases 24 hours before the event. They will need to work on them and create a ppt that they will have to present in front of the jury.
  • The judges can question them after their presentation and the team will have to answer them to the best of their ability.

column45:
Everything You Need to Know About Divulge'25 - Meme Buster (2025 Edition)
Divulge'25’s Meme Buster is a unique platform to debunk popular HR and OB myths through creativity and humour. Below is a concise overview of what you should keep in mind:

Select a Myth:

  • Identify a widely believed HR or OB misconception like “AI will replace HR by 2025” or “Hybrid work means no real work happens.”

Design a Meme:

  • Create a humorous and respectful meme that showcases the myth in a light, engaging manner. Ensure that content remains appropriate and non-offensive.

Format Requirements:

  • Accepted file types: JPEG, PNG, or GIF (GIFs must not exceed 10 seconds).
  • Naming convention: “[Your Name]_[Meme Title]” (e.g., “Koyel_Mythbusted”)

Myth-Buster Write-Up:

  • Breaks down the selected myth and clarifies why it is inaccurate.
  • Presents a quick fact or practical insight into the actual HR/OB practice.
  • Optionally supports the explanation with relevant HR policies or examples

Sample Myth-Buster Explanation:

  • Myth: “AI will replace HR in the future”
  • Myth-Buster: AI can automate routine HR tasks, but it cannot replace the human empathy, ethical judgment, and relationship-building that people management requires. HR professionals interpret context, resolve conflicts, and shape workplace culture- capabilities AI cannot replicate. Instead of replacing HR, AI enhances its effectiveness by supporting data-driven and efficient decision-making. 
  • Tip: Engage with HR-led development or wellness initiatives to gain a deeper understanding of their role and responsibilities.

Submission:

  • Design your meme, follow the formatting guidelines, and pair it with your myth-buster note. This will help combine humour with meaningful HR and OB learning experiences. All the best!

column45:
Event Overview:

MarketWise is a machine learning and data science hackathon, which will be held on Unstop for round 1 and offline on Kaggle for round 2. The contest will be like any other Machine learning and data science hackathon that takes place on various platforms. It is designed to ignite creative and productive thinking that revolves around harnessing the potential of machine learning and data science.

Eligibility Criteria & Team Formulation:

  • Open to all from any discipline in any college based out of India.
  • Participants can register individually or in teams with at most 4 members.
  • Cross-specialization and cross-college teams are allowed.
  • All the team members are required to verify and confirm their details to form a team.
  • A student can be a part of only one team.
  • Any deviation from the above-mentioned guidelines will result in the immediate disqualification of the entire team.
  • The Participant(s) should be an Indian citizen, residing in India only and above 18 years of age on the date of the participation.
  • The Participant(s) should be students currently enrolled in a degree/diploma course (part-time or full-time) from any discipline in any college based out of India.
  • The Participant should not have a criminal conviction or an arrangement or a contract that prevents the Participant from participating in the Competition.

Competition Structure:

Round 1 - Online Quiz:

  • The online round is a quiz format, and participants will be tested on their knowledge of basic programming concepts and their awareness of current technology trends.
  • Questions will cover a wide range of topics related to data science and machine learning.
  • Participants will have a limited time to answer each question, and their scores will be recorded.
  • The top performers in the online round will qualify for the offline round at the IIITN Campus.
  • Only one member from each team will be allowed to participate in the quiz.

Round 2- Offline Round at IIITN Campus:

  • The offline round is a 24-hour coding competition held at the IIITN Campus.
  • Participants will be given a dataset to solve a corporate-life-related problem statement.
  • Participants can choose their preferred programming languages and are allowed to use AI models of their choice.
  • The competition will commence at a specified time and conclude 24 hours later.
  • Participants must submit their solutions within the allotted time.

Two ways to participate:

  • Participate in Event:
    • Register and participate in the online quiz on 6th Jan 2026.
    • Selected participants will compete for the prize on 16th & 17th Jan during E-Summit’26.
  • Attend as an Observer:
    • Even if you're not participating, you can attend the event as an observer.
    • Witness the excitement, learn from others, and network with fellow students.

General Rules:

  • Event Oversight: The conducting team is the primary authority responsible for managing and addressing any issues during the event.
  • Enforcement of Rules: The conducting team has the authority to enforce event rules and maintain decorum. Rule breaches may result in appropriate action.
  • Reporting Problems: Participants can communicate concerns or issues to the management team via designated representatives at the venue.
  • Event Supervision: A dedicated team will oversee all activities and proceedings.
  • Originality of Ideas: Plagiarism or use of pre-existing business plans may result in disqualification.
  • Ultimate Authority: All decisions, including selecting winners or providing feedback, are solely at the discretion of the esteemed panel of judges.

column11: Regionals will be held across 6 cities: Delhi, Guwahati, Chennai, Mumbai, Bangalore, and Jaipur. Shortlisted candidates will receive the exact venue details for the city they have selected in the registration form
column45:
Welcome to IIT Delhi’s Entrepreneurship Cell flagship Business Plan Competition 2026! This competition is a platform for budding entrepreneurs to showcase their innovative ideas, gain knowledge through insightful workshops , business acumen, and strategic thinking with four exciting tracks and competitions in six major cities: Delhi (31st Jan'26), Bangalore(10th Jan'26), Mumbai(10th Jan'26) , Chennai(10th Jan'26), Jaipur(10th Jan'26) and Guwahati(10th Jan'26 tentatively).

Why should you participate:

  • Networking: Gain networking opportunities with investors and startup founders.
  • Prizes: Compete with other participants for 1 Cr+ worth of prizes.
  • Workshops: Participate in workshops led by startup founders and investors.
  • Benefits: Enjoy exclusive perks and offers from top companies.
  • Mentoring: Gain valuable insights and tailored guidance from seasoned industry experts and skilled mentors.

Tracks:

Track 1: Sustainability, Energy & Environment

  • Examples: Clean energy solutions, waste management, sustainable agriculture, climate tech, eco-friendly products etc.

Track 2: Health, Education & Social Impact

  • Examples: Healthcare technology, biotech, medtech, edtech, mental health platforms, social impact enterprises, nonprofit tech solutions etc.

Track 3: Fintech, Business & Consumer Services

  • Examples: Payment gateways, blockchain, B2B SaaS, e-commerce, marketing platforms, consumer apps etc.

Track 4: Deep Tech, AI & Emerging Technologies

  • Examples: Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Quantum Computing, Web3, IoT, robotics etc

Eligibility:

  • The maximum allowed Team size is 3
  • A participant cannot participate in multiple teams
  • The maximum age limit is 35
  • Cross-college teams are allowed

Contact us:

  • In case of any queries , just drop an email at  becon.regionals@edciitd.com !

column45:
About Beach Hack Season 7:

BeachHack is the flagship event of the Department of Computer Science and Engineering, a legacy event hosted by the Community Of Developers (CODe) from Christ College of Engineering, Irinjalakuda.

It is a national-level hackathon that dares to be different-held not in classrooms or auditoriums, but at a beach resort right beside the shoreline, where creativity flows as freely as the waves.

Returning for another season of innovation, BeachHack 7 invites developers, designers, and entrepreneurs to collaborate, create, and conquer under the open sky. This isn’t just a coding competition; it’s a 36-hour celebration of technology, creativity, and community spirit.

This year, we are thrilled to present the 7th edition of Beach Hack, proudly celebrated as India’s one and only beachside hackathon.

We offer a prize pool of 1.5 lakhs, with two competitive tracks:

  • Beach Hack – for participants from other colleges (1,00,000 prize pool)
  • Hack4Christ – exclusively for students of Christ College of Engineering (50,000 prize pool)

Why BeachHack?

  • The Only Beach Hackathon: Experience the unique thrill of debugging with a sea breeze.
  • Legacy of Excellence: Organized by the face of the CSE Department at CCE, adhering to a tradition of quality and student-centric events.
  • Networking & Mentorship: Connect with industry experts, like-minded peers, and tech leaders in an informal, high-energy setting.
  • 150K+ Prize Pool: Compete for substantial cash prizes and exclusive swag.
  • Zero Registration Fee: Innovation should have no barriers. Admission is completely free.

Format:

  • Team Size: 4 Members
  • Duration: 36 Hours
  • Selection: Abstract-based shortlisting

Tracks: 

  1. AI Pipelines & MLOps Orchestration
    The track focuses on the engineering layer behind AI - pipelines, automation, monitoring, reliability, and optimization. Participants are expected to deliver solutions that enhance the scalability, trustworthiness, and operational robustness of modern AI systems.
  2. Web3 Infrastructure & On-Chain Forensics
    A deep dive into the structural and analytical components of blockchain ecosystems. This track emphasizes transparency, secure infrastructure development, cross-chain operability, and identity management in decentralized systems.
  3. Cloud-Native & DevOps Intelligence
    Here we look for innovations that elevate cloud efficiency and system intelligence. From infrastructure observability to automated optimization, the focus is on systems that improve performance, reduce overhead, and strengthen cloud-native workflows.
  4. Cybersecurity & Threat Intelligence
    The track expects participants to push the boundaries of digital security. Emphasis is on identifying vulnerabilities, strengthening security posture, analyzing threat patterns, and building systems capable of proactive protection.
  5. Algorithmic FinTech & RegTech
    Centered around the data and compliance backbone of financial technology. Participants will work on intelligent systems that enhance regulatory accuracy, financial transparency, risk assessment, and backend financial automation.
  6. Defense Tech & Situational Awareness
    Participants explore technologies that improve monitoring, decision-making, and secure communication in defense contexts. The focus is on awareness, precision, and reliability in mission-critical environments.
  7. Industrial IoT & Predictive Maintenance
    The track spotlights innovations in connected industrial environments. You are expected to engineer systems that enhance operational intelligence, minimize downtime, and refine the interaction between machines, sensors, and data.
  8. Health Data Systems & Bio-Informatics
    The focus here is responsible handling of complex medical data, intelligent diagnostic workflows, and secure bio-information processing. Participants are expected to elevate healthcare systems through accuracy, security, and computational insight.

Beach Hack isn’t just an event.
It’s a movement of ideas, collaboration, passion, and engineering excellence.

Learn more: https://www.beachhack.in/

column45:
Arthat is the National Case Study Competition of Econs- The Economics Club of IIM Kashipur. 
In the fourth edition of Arthat, an economic case will be floated on Unstop platform. The participants have to solve the case with the help of economic concepts and propose a solution on the same basis. The participants are required to submit the solution in the form of PDF/PPT in the Unstop platform. The evaluation will be based on some pre-defined parameters with the support of our Economics Professors.

General Rules & Guidelines:

  • A team shall comprise a minimum of 1 and a maximum of 3 participants from the same institute.
  • Any number of teams can participate from an institute, but no student can be part of more than one team.
  • The submission should be made in not more than 5 slides (excluding introductory slides and references).
  • The submission should be made in PDF/PPT format.
  • References should be mentioned.
  • No changes in the team structure would be entertained post-registration.
  • Any changes in rules are up to the discretion of the organizers.
  • All decisions regarding eligibility and final judgment shall rest with the organizing team.
  • Naming convention for submission is Team Name_College Name

column11: National Institute of Bank Management, Pune
column45:
About:

  • AIB is a competition which is inspired by MUN (Model United Nations) where we will be allotting different teams with different Banks instead of countries unlike in MUN to discuss the recent 2 agendas that are going on in the Banking Industry e.g.- Global Recession, Future of new banking in India by integrating Artificial intelligence, tighter Norms by RBI on Personal loan sector.
  • The event will be headed by individuals (NIBM Students) representing the RBI Governor and Deputy Governor who will provide motions (reasons/solutions for the agendas) and the team will be speaking on it.
  • There will also be 2 moderators (faculty/guests/alumni) who will be judging the whole competition.
  • There will be 3 prizes for this event.
  • Food and comfortable accommodation will be provided for one day to all finalists traveling from outside Pune, ensuring a seamless and welcoming experience.

Procedure:

  • An online screening, in the form of a quiz, will be conducted before the event on the same website.
  • The interested teams consisting of 2-3 members in each team, must register themselves on Unstop.
  • Participants should be from the same college.
  • No member can be a part of more than one team.
  • There will be no negative markings in the online quiz.
  • Based on the results, 6 teams will be shortlisted and will be given their respective banks (banks based on the time of the event will be decided) and a common agenda which will be communicated through an email.
  • On the event day, the shortlisted team will be given a platform where the second round or discussion round wherein every team shall break into a full-fledged discussion on the agenda, putting forward their views, taking a stand, and challenging their fellow teams through interjections (counter).
  • Results will be announced on the same day. 

Round 1 - Quiz (Elimination Round):

  • An online quiz based on banking and financial services will be conducted on the Unstop platform.
  • 40 questions must be answered in 30 minutes.
  • There will be no negative markings in the online quiz.
  • Only team leaders will be allowed to play the quiz.
  • The top 6 teams will qualify for the second round. 

Round 2 - Discussion Round (Final Round):

  • AIB is a MUN-inspired competition wherein 6 teams consisting of 2-3 students.
  • Qualified teams will be representing a bank from a host of banks to discuss and put forth their views on a recent agenda relevant to the Banking Industry.
  • This is followed by the discussion round. In this, every team shall break into a full-fledged discussion on the agenda, putting forward their views, taking a stand, and challenging their fellow teams through interjections (counter).
  • The limit per team is 1.5 minutes - 2 minutes followed by a Real-Time News Segment wherein the house shall be presented with real-time news that shall take the event ahead with discussion on the same.
  • The event will be headed by a NIBM Student representing the RBI Governor who will provide motions (reasons/solutions for the agenda) on which the house shall speak.
  • The agenda shall be notified beforehand and shall run for an hour.
  • There will also be a moderator to chair the session.
  • Results shall be announced at the end of the event.
  • Further details will be shared with the teams who will qualify for this round.

Timeline:

  • Quiz date - 20th Dec 2025
  • Date for the Final round - 16th Jan 2026 (Final round will be on campus)

column45:
All that you need to know about Product Alchemy - ProdExpo 5.0!

ProdExpo, the annual product summit hosted by IIM Calcutta in collaboration with the PMTech Club, is a vibrant celebration aimed at cultivating a culture of project management (PM) and technical proficiency among the leaders of tomorrow. At the heart of ProdExpo lies Product Alchemy, a flagship national-level case competition designed to ignite the passion of product enthusiasts, challenging their skills, creativity, and comprehensive understanding of product development.

Guidelines:

  • The contest welcomes both undergraduate and postgraduate students.
  • Teams should consist of 2 to 3 members, who must register together.
  • All team members should be full-time students attending the same campus.
  • It's allowed to form teams with students from different specializations and academic years.
  • Each student can only participate in one team.
  • The initial phase involves submitting the case, followed by a final round of presentations.
  • The top 6-8 teams selected from Round 1 will advance to present their submissions in the final round.
  • Only the submissions from Round 1 will be considered for the final presentation. Any alterations to these submissions may result in disqualification.
  • The PMTech Club of IIM Calcutta holds the authority to determine eligibility and final decisions.
  • The PMTech team retains the right to modify the competition's format or rules for any round.

Rules:

  • Stage 1: Case Submission Round
    • Teams will submit their ideas in the form of a presentation with not more than 4-5 slides (excluding cover slides) for the given case.
    • The problem statement will be live on 14th December.
  • Stage 2: Final Presentation Round (Online)
    • The top 6-8 teams shortlisted from Round 1 will present their submissions in front of the panel.
    • The panel will evaluate the performance based on the 10-minute presentation + 5-minutes of Q&A

column45:
Utkrama 2026: The GTM Battle Plan & Brand Stretch

Organized By: Entrepreneurship Cell, SIMS Pune

About the Event

"Strategy is not about being better. It's about being different."

Welcome to Utkrama 2026, the flagship Entrepreneurship Summit of Symbiosis Institute of Management Studies (SIMS), Pune.

In the real world, a great product doesn't guarantee success, and an established brand doesn't guarantee survival. This year, Utkrama is testing the full spectrum of a strategist's mind: Knowledge, Execution, and Innovation.

We aren't just looking for ideas; we are looking for the roadmap to domination. From making an invisible product famous to taking a giant brand into uncharted waters—do you have the agility to survive?

Register now to prove your mettle.

Stages and Timelines

Round 1: The Intel Brief (Online Quiz)

Know your terrain before you enter the battlefield.

  • Format: Online Quiz via Unstop.

  • The Challenge: You will face 30 questions testing your knowledge of business fundamentals, startup terminologies, unicorns, and market giants.

  • The Pressure: You have exactly 30 seconds per question. Quick thinking is non-negotiable.

  • Elimination: Only the top teams with the highest speed and accuracy will advance to the Strategy Round.

Round 2: The GTM Battle Plan (Submission Round)

Make the Invisible, Visible.

  • The Concept: Shortlisted teams will be provided with a docket containing multiple GTM cases. These are products that are functionally brilliant—solutions people need—but they suffer from a critical flaw: Invisibility. They have no hype, no market presence, and no traction.

  • The Task: Your team must choose ONE case from the docket. You must construct a comprehensive, creative, and cost-effective Go-to-Market Strategy to turn this silent product into a roaring success.

  • The Constraint: Efficiency is key. You are allowed a maximum of 6 Content Slides (Excluding Cover Page and Thank You Slide).

  • Deliverables: Target Audience (STP), Marketing Channels, Unique Value Proposition, and Launch Timeline.

Round 3: The Brand Stretch (Grand Finale - Live Pitch)

Innovate. Expand. Disrupt.

  • The Concept: In the final showdown, teams will face the ultimate test of brand logic. You will be assigned a Global Superbrand (e.g., Nike, Tesla, Google) and a Conflicting Industry (e.g., Agriculture, Insurance, Food).

  • The Task: You must launch a new product line for that brand in the assigned industry. You cannot change the brand's core values; you must convince the judges that this radical extension fits the brand's DNA.

  • The Constraint: The Power Pitch. You have a strict limit of 4 Content Slides (Excluding Cover Page and Thank You Slide). You must be concise, visual, and impactful.

  • Format: Live Pitch Presentation (Online/Offline) + Q&A.

Rules & Guidelines

  1. Team Size: Teams must consist of 2 to 3 members.

  2. Eligibility: Open to all students from recognized institutes.

  3. Submission Limits:

    • Round 2: Max 6 Content Slides (Total deck size not exceeding 8 slides).

    • Round 3: Max 4 Content Slides (Total deck size not exceeding 6 slides).

  4. Plagiarism: Originality is paramount. Any content found to be plagiarized will result in immediate disqualification.

  5. Final Verdict: The decision of the judges and the SIMS Pune organizing committee will be final and binding.

Evaluation Criteria

  • Round 2: Clarity of Thought, Feasibility of GTM Strategy, Creativity in Marketing Channels, Adherence to Slide Limit.

  • Round 3: Innovation, Justification of Brand Fit, Business Viability, and Presentation Skills.

column45:
Eligibility:

  • Open to groups of 2–3 members.
  • Participants must be currently pursuing a degree (any discipline).

Round Details:

  • Round 1: Online Quiz
    • An elimination round to test basic financial and analytical knowledge.
  • Round 2: Online Company Presentation
    • Teams will receive details of a hypothetical company (industry, balance sheet, P&L, and business model).
    • Participants must perform a fundamental analysis, valuation, and propose an expected price band.
    • A report must be submitted, followed by a virtual presentation before judges.
    • Use of tools, including AI, is allowed, but teams must take full responsibility for their analysis and results.
  • Round 3: Offline Round (at NIBM)
    • Top 7 shortlisted teams will be invited to NIBM for the final simulation.
    • Each team will receive a virtual wallet of 30,000 crore.
    • A company (mid-to-large cap) will be assigned to each team with detailed financial and market information.
    • Teams will have 10 minutes to prepare and deliver a sales pitch explaining why investors should bid for their company.
    • After each pitch, an IPO bidding round will be conducted in an auction format.
    • Bids can include premiums or discounts on the price band based on team valuation.
    • The highest bidder must justify their bid — speculative bids without reasoning may be rejected by judges.
    • Post-bidding, a market event (boom, crash, or industry-specific news) will influence listing prices by ±2–5%.
    • After all IPOs, the team with the highest profit wins.

Additional Information:

  • Teams must have a minimum of 10,000 crore in their wallet to bid.
  • After each successful purchase, 10,000 crore will be deducted from the wallet (excluding profit/loss).
  • Food and one-day accommodation will be provided to finalists traveling from outside Pune.

column45:
Appian is a software company that automates business processes. The Appian AI Process Platform includes everything you need to design, automate and optimize even the most complex processes from start to finish. The world's most innovative organizations trust Appian to improve their workflows, unify data and optimize operations-resulting in better growth and superior customer experiences.

Stages:

  • Round - 1: Brand awareness quiz. Mandatory for all participants to give this quiz.
  • Round - 2: Online PPT submission round (15th December 2025 - 26th December 2025)
  • Final Round: Shortlisted teams should present their work to judges in IIT Madras

 

Guidelines:

  • You have to select any one of the listed two problem statements and solve it.
  • This event is open to all.
  • A student cannot be part of more than one team.
  • Each team can submit only one entry for the competition.
  • The problem statement(Attached below) will be released on 15th of December.

Submission format:

  • Submitting the ppt is mandatory (this will be presented by you to judges in the finals round)
  • The first slide of the ppt should also contain the link to the GitHub repository where you have to upload your code. Ensure you have given view access to everyone.
  • Keep the PPT simple and logical.
    Start by explaining the problem in your own words, then clearly say what you’re trying to solve. Walk us through your idea at a high level—what data comes in, what your system does, and what comes out. Explain the main intuition behind your approach and how it would actually work in practice. Add one concrete example to show a real scenario. Mention any assumptions you’re making and what you’re not covering. End with the impact and why this would help in the real world.
  • The code should contain the model and a basic working UI.
  • Note: Code is preferable but not mandatory.

Rules:

  • This is a team competition consisting of one to four members.
  • The first round will be the submission round, where the team needs to submit their submission through Unstop (online) before the deadline mentioned above.
  • The decision of the organizers and judges will be final and binding on the team.

column45:
Overview:

  • ReGen Hackathon 2.0 (2026) is the next edition of the flagship innovation challenge dedicated to advancing sustainability in technology.
  • This edition invites talented students to develop impactful solutions in software, hardware, and industrial applications that address real-world sustainability challenges.
  • Participants will collaborate across disciplines, applying creativity and technical skills to build transformative ideas aligned with eco-friendly and sustainable technological practices.
  • ReGen Hackathon 2.0 aims to foster innovation, teamwork, and practical problem-solving, accelerating the path toward a greener and more sustainable future.

Benefits:

  • Skills Developed
    • Gain hands-on experience working with cutting-edge technologies, sustainability-focused problem statements, and real-world challenges that enhance your technical, analytical, and problem-solving skills.
  • Networking Opportunities
    • Connect with participants from across India, industry experts, mentors, and potential employers.
    • Build valuable professional relationships that can shape your career.
  • Prizes and Recognition
    • Compete for exciting prizes, PPIs, and certificates.
    • Outstanding teams will be recognized and showcased for their innovative contributions.

Eligibility:

  • Target Participants
    • Open to UG and PG students across India with a passion for technology, innovation, and sustainable development.
    • A basic understanding of smart industry concepts is recommended.
  • Qualifications
    • Students from all disciplines are welcome. No specific academic background is required beyond enthusiasm and creativity.
  • Team Formation
    • Cross-year teams: Allowed
    • Cross-college teams: Not allowed

Selection Criteria:

  • Participants will be evaluated based on:
    • Creativity and originality
    • Technical feasibility and execution
    • Relevance to sustainability objectives
    • Alignment with hackathon themes
    • Bonus points for diverse teams

Timeline (Tentative for 2026):

  • Round 1: Proposal Submission
    • Start: 01 Jan 26, 12:00 AM IST
    • End: 10 Jan 26, 11:59 PM IST
  • Round 2: Shortlisted Proposals
    • Start: 17 Jan 26, 12:00 AM IST
    • End: 2 Feb 26, 11:59 PM IST
  • 48-Hour Hackathon: Jury Review & Development Phase
    • Start: 26 Feb 26, 12:00 AM IST
    • End: 28 Feb 26, 12:00 PM IST
  • Event Finale: Result Announcement & Valedictory
    • 28 Feb 26, 5:00 PM IST

Coordinator: Dr. Sabindra Kachhap, Assistant Professor (ME)

Convenor: Dr. Kh. Johnson Singh, Assistant Professor (CSE)

Support & Inquiries:

  • Email: hackathon@nitmanipur.ac.in
  • Phone: +91 79818 04134 (Karthik)

column11: Thakur ramnarayan college of arts and commerce
column45:
Overview:

 

Visit Our Website for more : https://trcac.org.in/hackcrypt

There are several changes in this hackathon please refer to website and brochure , please contact us via below contacts for any queries.

  • 30-hour offline hackathon hosted at TRCAC, Mumbai
  • Focus domains: AI/ML, Web & App Development, Cybersecurity, FinTech, EdTech, Smart Automation
  • All registered teams are directly shortlisted for the 24-hour Final Build Round
  • Prize pool of 1,00,000
  • Includes professional evaluation, mentorship, and project showcase
  • Scheduled for 16–17 January 2026

Prizes & Rewards:

  • 1st Prize: 40,000 + medals for all members + trophy
  • 2nd Prize: 25,000 + medals for all members + trophy
  • 3rd Prize: 15,000 + medals for all members + trophy
  • 4th Prize: 10,000 + medals for all members
  • 5th Prize: 10,000 + medals for all members
  • All participants: E-certificates, T-shirt, Swags & Merchandise (stickers, badges, keychains)

Eligibility & Participation:

  • Open to undergraduates and graduates (2024 onwards)
  • Teams of 2–5 members
  • Cross-college teams allowed
  • Students from any department/year can participate

Round Details:

Round 1: 24-Hour Hackathon Build

  • From 10:00 AM, 16th January to 10:00 AM, 17th January
  • Teams receive 10–15 problem statements across domains
  • Choose one problem statement and build a working MVP
  • On-ground mentors available for guidance

Round 2: Final Pitch & Evaluation

  • From 10:00 AM to 12:00 PM on 17th January
  • Demo and pitch to the judging panel
  • Evaluation criteria: innovation, technical quality, usability, problem-solution fit, presentation

Problem Statements:

  • To be updated
  • Teams must select one official problem statement
  • Domains include AI/ML, Cybersecurity, Web/App Development, FinTech, EdTech, Smart Automation
  • Projects must be built entirely during the hackathon

Facilities Provided:

  • Continuous electricity and extension boards
  • Food and refreshments throughout the event
  • Resting rooms (separate for boys and girls)
  • Wi-Fi connection
  • Participants may use mobile hotspots

Rules & Regulations:

  • Teams must have 2–5 members
  • No participant can join more than one team
  • Code must be pushed hourly to assigned repository
  • Copying full projects or using pre-built solutions is prohibited
  • Use of open-source libraries/frameworks and AI-assisted tools allowed (final product must be original)
  • All development must occur within the 24-hour window
  • Valid student ID required
  • Participants must stay inside the venue as scheduled
  • Final evaluation and pitching is mandatory
  • Misconduct leads to disqualification
  • Judges' decisions are final

Contact 

Technical: 
   Shivang – 8788083267 
   Soujas – 8451069187
Management: 
   Omkar – 8591116173 
   Nirrav – 9321732444

column45:
Participation:

  • Individual (no teams)

Eligibility:

  • Open to all undergraduate and postgraduate students
  • Inter-college participation allowed
  • All specializations and branches eligible
  • No prior competitive programming experience required

Format:

  • Single coding rounds
  • 3–6 coding questions per round of varying difficulty
  • Topics: Data Structures & Algorithms, Problem-solving, Logic building, Optimization, Real-time coding challenges
  • Accepted languages: C, C++, Java, Python, etc.

Round 1: Coding Round

  • 3–4 DSA/logic-based questions
  • Duration: 60–90 minutes
  • Online via Unstop

Scoring & Evaluation:

  • Based on number of correct submissions and time taken
  • Penalty for wrong submissions (if applicable)
  • Automatic leaderboard ranking

Rules:

  • Individual participation only
  • Plagiarism or copying solutions leads to immediate disqualification
  • AI tools not allowed unless specified
  • Internet usage restricted as per round
  • Complete all questions within allotted time
  • Judges’ and platform decisions are final
  • Misconduct or cheating not permitted
  • Participants must use their own laptops and accessories

column45:
Event Overview:

Prastaav is a Case Study Challenge designed to test participants’ strategic thinking, creativity, and problem-solving skills. Engage with real-world business cases and showcase your innovative solutions.

Eligibility:

  • Everyone can apply

Team Formation:

  • Teams of 1–3 members from the same institute.
  • No team changes are allowed after registration.

Originality:

  • Solutions must be original. Plagiarism will result in disqualification.

Competition Structure:

  • Teams will solve a business case and will be judged on creativity, feasibility, and presentation.

Decision of the Jury:

  • The jury’s decision is final and binding.

Certificates and Prizes:

  • Participation certificates for all teams.
  • Attractive prizes for winners.

Code of Conduct:

  • Participants must maintain professional behaviour. Disrespectful actions will lead to disqualification.
  • Grand Finale will be Conducted Offline 

Submission Guidelines:

  • Submissions must be on time. Late entries will not be accepted.

Organiser Rights:

  • Organisers reserve the right to modify rules. Any changes will be communicated to participants.

How to Register:

  • Visit Unstop to sign up for the Prastaav Case Study Challenge.
  • Provide complete team details (names, contact information, and institute affiliation) by the registration deadline.
  • Result Declaration of Round 1 - 06/01/2026
  • Result Declaration of Round 2 - 14/01/2026

Join Prastaav!

Put your strategic thinking and problem-solving skills to the test with a real-world business challenge.

column11: Lal Bahadur Shastri Institute of Management
column45:
Presented by Sparsh – The Social Initiatives Society of LBSIM

"In the business world, the successful companies are those that integrate social responsibility with their strategies." — Howard Schultz

Event Structure:

Round 1: CSR Insight Quiz (Elimination Round)

The competition begins with an online quiz designed to evaluate participants’ understanding of CSR initiatives undertaken by Indian and global organisations.

This round features a blend of:

  • Real-time corporate case-based questions that test awareness of CSR strategies and their outcomes.
  • Situational judgment scenarios that assess ethical reasoning, decision-making, and the ability to interpret CSR-driven business situations.

Teams will be shortlisted for the next round based on accuracy, analytical interpretation, and overall performance.

Round 2: Design the Future – CSR Innovation Sprint

  • Qualified teams will move into a creative and strategic challenge: designing a CSR campaign for a specific product or service. The objective is to craft a campaign compelling enough for an MNC to fund, aligning with its CSR mission and long-term sustainability goals.
  • Participants are expected to integrate technology or AI-based solutions—whether through sustainable innovations, digital tools, or community-impact tech interventions. This round encourages teams to combine creativity, feasibility, and purpose-driven thinking to develop a campaign with real-world potential.

Round 3: Pitch for Impact – The Final Showdown:

Shortlisted teams will present their CSR campaign to a panel of MNC representatives. This is the moment to bring the idea to life—clearly articulate the campaign’s objectives, demonstrate how it works, and showcase the technological or AI-driven solution embedded within it.

To strengthen their pitch, teams must include a prototype or mock-up, such as:

  • An app interface
  • A process flow diagram
  • A promotional concept or visual asset

Judges will evaluate each pitch based on creativity, practicality, sustainability, and measurable impact, ultimately deciding which campaigns merit CSR funding.

Additional Highlights:

  • Interactive Expert Session: Participants will attend a live Q&A session with an industry expert on CSR trends, helping them refine and strengthen their campaign ideas before the final round.
  • Sustainability Recognition: Winning teams will receive a Certificate of Excellence in CSR Innovation from LBSIM, endorsed by CSR professionals.
  • Social Media Integration: Teams must create a 30-second video reel showcasing the core idea of their campaign. Creativity, clarity, and engagement will earn bonus points.

Rules & Eligibility:

  • Open to all undergraduate and postgraduate students.
  • Team Size: 2–3 members from the same institution.
  • All submissions must be made within the specified deadlines.
  • Plagiarism must not exceed 10%; exceeding this limit will result in disqualification.
  • Team names are mandatory.
  • Decisions by the organising team and judges will be final.

column45:
A National-Level Innovation & Ideation Challenge by E-Cell, MIT Manipal

Concepti (Ideathon 2026) is a premier national-level innovation and ideation initiative organized by the Entrepreneurship Cell (E-Cell), MIT Manipal. Designed to spark creativity and entrepreneurial thinking, the event serves as a launchpad for young innovators across India to convert their raw ideas into impactful, real-world solutions.

  • Participants embark on a structured journey that includes ideation, creation, validation, mentorship, and proof-of-concept (PoC) development. With guidance from seasoned mentors, industry experts, and startup professionals, students gain invaluable insights while refining their concepts. The initiative fosters a collaborative and innovation-driven environment, encouraging participants to think critically, identify opportunities, and build solutions that address contemporary challenges.
  • By empowering students with the right mentorship and tools, Concepti 2026 aims to nurture the next generation of entrepreneurs and changemakers, strengthening their problem-solving abilities and enabling them to create sustainable, high-impact solutions for society.

Rules:

  • The pitch deck must not exceed 10 slides, including the "Thank You" slide.
  • Clearly articulate how your idea is practical and feasible in real-world scenarios.

Eligibility:

  • Open to all college students across India, regardless of graduation year.
  • Pitch decks will be evaluated by E-Cell, MIT Manipal, and the top teams will advance to the PoC round.

column45:
ProdExpo 5.0, the annual product summit conducted by the Product Management and Technology Club of IIM Calcutta, marks its fifth edition with a sharper focus on applied product thinking. The summit brings together a suite of rigorous, competition-driven events that push participants to break down real product problems, analyse user behaviour, and design practical, insight-led solutions.

Guidelines:

  • The competition has two stages: an online submission followed by an online case round.
  • Teams submit a micro-case in Stage 1, and shortlisted teams advance to a timed final case round with additional constraints where they work end to end on the assigned product problem.
  • Open to undergraduate and postgraduate students.
  • Teams must have 3 full-time students from the same campus. Cross-specialization and cross-year teams are allowed.
  • A student can participate in only one team.
  • PMTech Club of IIM Calcutta has full authority over eligibility, evaluation, and rule or format changes.
  • External assistance is prohibited and may result in disqualification.

DreamFrame is a creative poster design competition where participants use Canva to produce visually compelling posters based on a theme revealed at the start of the event. The challenge highlights creativity, message clarity, effective layout, and visual communication skills.

About the Event:

  • DreamFrame is for students who enjoy design, visual storytelling, and communication. Participants receive a theme or problem statement at the beginning and must convert it into a powerful poster conveying the message instantly.

The focus goes beyond aesthetics, emphasizing clarity, layout balance, and strong idea representation.

Event Format:

  • Theme Reveal: A theme or storyline is announced at the start (e.g., awareness, innovation, social cause, fest branding).
  • Design Duration: Participants get 60 minutes to create their poster in Canva.
  • Resources: Allowed elements include shapes, icons, illustrations, typography, and Canva's built-in tools.
  • Submission: The final poster must be exported (PNG/JPEG) and submitted before the deadline.
  • Short Presentation: Each participant delivers a 1–2 minute explanation of their concept and design choices.

Judging Criteria:

  • Creativity & Originality: How unique and imaginative is the concept?
  • Visual Appeal: Overall look and feel, use of colors, fonts, spacing and layout.
  • Message Clarity: Is the main idea/theme immediately understandable?
  • Relevance to Theme: How well does the poster align with the given topic or brief?
  • Composition & Balance: Proper alignment, hierarchy of text, and focus points.
  • Presentation & Explanation: How confidently and clearly the participant describes their design choices and story behind the poster.

Rules & Guidelines:

  • Participation is strictly individual (solo); no team entries are allowed.
  • All designs must be created using Canva during the event duration.
  • Pre-made templates may be used as a base, but the final design must show clear customisation and originality.
  • Participants should not use any copyrighted images/logos without permission, except those available inside Canva’s free resources.
  • Obscene, offensive, or inappropriate content is strictly prohibited and will lead to disqualification.
  • Late submissions beyond the allotted time may receive penalties or be rejected.
  • The organisers and judges reserve the right to modify rules and their decision will be final.

PromptCraft is a solo event focused on prompt engineering where participants design effective prompts to generate meaningful outputs using AI models – text, images or code – with clarity, creativity and control.

Event Format:

PromptCraft is a single-round event consisting of two tasks:

Prompt Writing:

  • Participants are given with 3 or 4 Scenarios as Input on Required Sheets.
  • The Participants should write the best and effective prompts to each scenario that should match the requirements of scenario.
  • The Evaluation of Prompts should be done on Clarity, Structure.

AI or Human?

  • Participants are given 10 short passages, each taken from various writing styles such as stories, explanations, opinions, and descriptions.
  • The task is to identify whether each passage is written by a human or generated by an AI model.
  • Participants must mark each passage as "AI-written" or "Human-written".
  • Evaluation is based on the Number of Correct Responses.

Judging Criteria:

  • Clarity, specificity and structure of the prompts
  • Creativity and originality in approach
  • Relevance of generated AI output to the task
  • Efficient use of constraints and instructions
  • Ethical and safe use of AI (no harmful content)

Rules & Guidelines:

  • Participants must only use the AI tools and accounts provided for the event.
  • External help, collaboration or use of others' prompts is not allowed.
  • Content that is offensive, unsafe or violates guidelines is strictly prohibited.
  • Multiple attempts may be allowed in some tasks; best outputs will be considered.
  • The organisers' and judges' decisions regarding scoring and selection are final.

column45:
Accomodation is also provided for free for pre-registered members (limited) please visit https://rvrjcce.ac.in/xcsm/aikshetra2K25/  for more details and registrations.

The main objective of Build with AI is to encourage students to convert their ideas into practical AI solutions. Teams can work on domains like healthcare, education, agriculture, smart campus, automation, environment, and more.

Participants are expected to think end-to-end: from clearly defining the problem and choosing data, to model design, implementation, evaluation and a realistic demonstration of impact.

Rounds & Format

Round 1 – Screening (MCQ Quiz)

  • Objective quiz on AI/ML basics, Python, data handling and logical reasoning.
  • Approx. 25–30 questions, time-bound.
  • Shortlisted teams qualify for the prototype round.

Round 2 – Prototype & Pitch

Note: Problem statements for Round 2 will be given at the event time only.

  • Teams build a functional prototype / demo for their chosen problem within the time limit.
  • They present:
    • Problem statement and motivation
    • Dataset used and AI/ML techniques applied
    • System architecture and workflow
    • Demo of the working solution
    • Impact, limitations, and future scope

Judging Criteria:

  • Relevance and clarity of the problem statement
  • Innovation and creativity in applying AI
  • Technical correctness and feasibility of the solution
  • Quality and completeness of the prototype / demo
  • Clarity of presentation and ability to answer questions
  • Scalability, impact and future potential

Rules & Guidelines:

  • Each team must have 2–4 members; one member should be the designated team leader.
  • All members must be registered students of a recognised institution.
  • Use of AI tools, open-source libraries and frameworks is allowed, with proper acknowledgement.
  • Any form of plagiarism or copying another team’s work will lead to disqualification.
  • Participants must adhere to the time limits and instructions given by organisers.
  • The decision of judges and organisers will be final and binding.

column45:
Event Description:

  • CaseCrux is the Flagship Case Study Competition organised by the Entrepreneurship Cell, IIT Patna.
  • The competition assesses participants on structured problem solving, analytical reasoning, and the ability to present clear, actionable solutions to a real world business challenge.

Competition Structure:

Round 1: Assessment Round (Online)

  • An initial screening assessment designed to evaluate basic aptitude and business awareness.Top performings teams will proceed to the next round.

Round 2: Case Submission Round (Online)

  • Shortlisted teams will receive the official case study and must submit a structured presentation outlining their solution approach.
  • Submission format: PPT/PDF
  • Slide limit: 7 content slides + 1 title slide + 1 concluding slide
  • Evaluated on: clarity of analysis, strategic depth, feasibility of recommendations, and coherence of presentation
  • Top teams from this round will move to the final presentation stage.

Round 3: Final Presentation Round (Online)

Finalists will present their solutions before a judging panel comprising industry experts and an E-Cell representative.

  • Mode: Live online presentation
  • Evaluation will consider analytical depth, originality of approach, practicality of solutions, and communication effectiveness.

Top-performing participants will receive prizes provided by E-Cell IIT Patna and PPI opportunities offered by Pulse, based on their final performance.

Eligibility:

  • Open to all undergraduate and postgraduate students across India.
  • Team size: 1–3 members
  • Inter-college teams are permitted.

column45:
Pulse Quest is a prestigious data science competition that challenges participants to transform raw data into meaningful insights. Competitors apply statistical analysis, machine learning, and visualization techniques to solve real-world problem statements. The event encourages innovative thinking, data-driven decision-making, and technical excellence in the rapidly evolving field of data science.

Competition Structure:

  • Online Round: The competition will be conducted on Kaggle, the link for the same will be shared with the teams upon registration. 

Eligibility:

  • Open to all individuals
  • Team size: 1- 4 members
  • Participants may be part of only one team.

Rules:

  • Participants engaging in any sort of plagiarism will be disqualified on the spot.
  • Decision of Judges and Event organisers and final and binding.

column45:
Presented by the University of Maryland – Robert H. Smith School of Business

Only 0.4% of startups ever reach $100M in revenue.
In the SEED Business Challenge 2026, you will take a hypothetical mid-stage company stuck at a critical scale-up point and design a strategic roadmap that propels it to $100M—using real datasets and real business constraints.

If you have the mindset, strategic thinking, and innovative ideas to solve this challenge, we invite you to participate, submit your solution, and compete for cash prizes + scholarship opportunities.

Who Can Participate?

Undergraduate Students

  • Students in pre-final year (3rd year of a 4-year program / 2nd year of a 3-year program)
  • Students currently in their final year of undergraduate studies

Graduate Students

  • 1st and 2nd-year students enrolled in MBA, MTech, MA, M.Com., MSc, or equivalent master’s programs at any Indian university

Early-Career Professionals

  • Working professionals with up to 3 years of full-time experience (as of competition start date)
  • Team Size: 2–3 members
  • Participation Fee: Free

Competition Timeline

Date Stage Description
25 Nov 2025 Registration & Team Formation Form your team and register
22 Dec 2025 Essay Submission Deadline Submit ONE essay topic from the three options
24 Dec 2025 (6 PM IST) Shortlist Announcement Top 25–30 teams announced
24 Dec 2025 Problem Statements Released Challenge topics shared
25 Dec 2025 – 07 Jan 2026 Brainstorming Phase Develop your strategic plan
03 Jan 2026 – 06 Jan 2026 Mentorship Phase Access to expert guidance
07 Jan 2026 (6 PM IST) Final Submission Deadline Submit Report + Dashboard + Presentation
08 Jan 2026 Grand Finale Winners announced

 

Essay Themes (Choose ONE)

1. Solving the Growth Equation

A B2B SaaS company at $12M revenue has a broken growth engine—CAC has doubled to $16,400, conversions have fallen to 2.3%, and competitors are winning deals.

Essay Topic: When Growth Stalls: Diagnosing and Fixing Customer Acquisition Challenges in Scaling Businesses

Key Focus Areas:

  • Customer segmentation of 15K prospects & 50K leads
  • Funnel breakdown analysis
  • ROI-focused channel strategy across a $95K monthly budget
  • Growth roadmap to scale from $12M → $100M ARR

2. The Profitability Engine

A food delivery platform making $15M revenue loses $2.60 per delivery due to inefficient routing, semi-manual dispatching, and poor technology.

Essay Topic: Scaling Without Breaking: How Technology and Operations Drive Profitable Growth

Key Focus Areas:

  • Operational optimization using 2.5M delivery data points
  • Designing routing algorithms to increase driver efficiency
  • Full-stack technology redesign to automate workflows
  • Profitability and market expansion strategy across 25 cities

3. The Retention Game Plan

A cloud security SaaS company at $10M ARR loses 28% of customers annually. LTV ($11.2K) is lower than CAC ($12K), and only 15% buy a second product.

Essay Topic: Beyond Acquisition: Building Business Models Where Existing Customers Drive Growth

Key Focus Areas:

  • Churn prediction models using 8K customer accounts
  • Retention + expansion interventions
  • Product adoption and cross-sell strategy
  • Net revenue retention plan to move from 85% → 115%+

Essay Submission – What It Means

Your essay is the first gateway to the SEED Business Challenge 2026.
Choose ONE theme—Acquire, Operate, or Retain—and craft a strategic, analytical, and actionable essay.

Your essay should:

  • Demonstrate your understanding of the core business problem
  • Present a clear, strategic approach
  • Show analytical reasoning and innovative thinking

Requirements:

  • Must be original (No plagiarism, no AI-generated content)
  • Maximum 1000 words
  • Focus on strategy, not lengthy descriptions
  • Use the provided template for structure

column45:
Pitch Please is an inter-college sales pitch competition hosted on the Unstop platform. This event challenges participants to showcase their persuasiveness and enthusiasm as they pitch a product, concept, or sellable item.

The judges will select winners based on four key criteria: creativity, originality of the idea, content, and communication skills.

Round 1:

  • Participants will take part in a time-bound quiz designed to test their knowledge and quick thinking.
  • The quiz will feature 30 questions covering various topics and must be completed within 20 minutes.
  • This will be an elimination round.

Round 2:

  • The product list for Round 2 will be shared immediately after Round 1 concludes.
  • Teams will have to select any one product from the shared list.
  • Teams will be tasked with pitching the product assigned by the panel, showcasing their creativity and ingenuity.
  • This round will feature live presentations conducted via a Live meeting online.
  • Teams can enhance their pitch using tools like PowerPoint, advertisements, or other innovative methods.

Rules:

  • Team size: 2-3 members
  • Medium: Unstop
  • Round 2: Product and slots shall be sent via email after Round 1.
  • No participant should be a part of more than one team.
  • Only one entry per team for the competition is allowed.

column45:
Study Group Quiz Festival 2025 is an online knowledge competition designed to bring together students and learners from across India. The quiz aims to promote learning, challenge young minds, and recognize emerging talent.

Participants will compete in an online quiz covering General Knowledge, Logical Reasoning, Technology, and Current Affairs. The winner will receive a cash prize of 20,000, and all participants will be awarded an E-Certificate of Participation.

This event is completely free, open to all students, and will be conducted entirely online through Unstop.

Join the official WhatsApp Group:


CLICK HERE =  https://tinyurl.com/rk8cjdth

Key Highlights

  • Prize Pool: 20,000 for the Winner
  • Certificate: E-Certificate for all Participants
  • Mode: Online
  • Eligibility: Open for all students (school/college/working professionals)
  • Participation: Individual
  • Quiz Topics: GK, Reasoning, Technology, Current Affairs

Quiz Format

  • Total Questions: 20–30
  • Type: MCQ
  • Time Limit: 10–20 minutes
  • Auto-evaluation through Unstop

Why Participate?

  • Improve your knowledge
  • Earn a recognized certificate
  • Chance to win 20,000
  • Compete with learners nationwide

column45:
Opportunity Details: The Inter B-School Product Management Competition, organized by ProdX, the Product Management Club of IIM Trichy, offers an exciting platform to showcase product management skills and compete with the brightest minds from top B-schools across the country.

Event Dates:

  • Round 1: Case Submission – 20th December 2025
  • Final Round: Case Presentation – 21st December 2025

Guidelines:

Eligibility:

  • Open to all B-schools across the country.
  • Teams must consist of 1-3 members.
  • Cross-specialization and cross-year teams are allowed.
  • Team members should be from the same college.

Format:

Round 1: Case Submission

  • Teams will work on a real-world product management problem statement.
  • Submission Deadline: 20th December 2025

Final Round: Online Presentation

  • Finalists will present their solutions via Zoom.
  • Teams will be judged on their presentation skills, problem-solving depth, and actionable insights.

Duration of Rounds:

  • Case Submission (Round 1): Submission window from till 20th December 2025.
  • Case Presentation (Final Round): 21st December 2025

Rules:

  • Teams must adhere to the stated deadlines for each round.
  • Plagiarism or unethical practices will lead to immediate disqualification.
  • Participants must ensure their submissions are original and innovative.
  • All decisions by the organizing team and judges will be final and binding.
  • Any misrepresentation of team details will lead to disqualification.
  • Only the team leader would submit the answers. More than one submission from a single team will lead to disqualification.
  • A student cannot be part of more than one team.
  • One team from each college will be selected and thereafter top 6 teams will be shortlisted by the judge for the final presentation.

Participate:

  • Showcase your product management acumen on a national platform.
  • Compete with the brightest minds from top B-schools.
