column45:
Tagline: Innovating for a Sustainable Future through Data & AI

Event Rounds:

Round 1: Problem Solving Approach

  • Topic Selection: Teams must choose one of three themes: Revival of Cottage Industry (SDG 9), Revamping Education (SDG 4), or Smart Nutrition for Infants (SDG 2).
  • Task: Submit a conceptual document that demonstrates a clear understanding of the core issue and proposes a novel solution direction.
  • Data Requirements: Identify tentative data sources that are not from Kaggle or CHI. Teams must focus on open data, assumed data, or synthetic datasets.
  • Submission Format: A 1–2-page PDF document.

Round 2: Detailed Strategy & PPT Walkthrough

  • Task: Shortlisted teams will refine their initial idea into a detailed strategy.
  • Content: The presentation must cover methodology, analytical techniques, system architecture, and specific evaluation metrics.
  • Data Plan: Submissions must include a realistic data integration plan, including cleaning strategies, assumptions, and validation logic.
  • Submission Format: A PPT presentation (as per guidelines) and a 4–6 minute recorded walkthrough video.

Round 3: Prototype / Working Model Demonstration

  • Task: Final teams must build and showcase a working prototype, simulation, dashboard, or proof-of-concept.
  • Content: The demonstration should highlight technical execution, real-world applicability, and output insights.
  • Submission Format: A working model and a 6–10 minute demo video explaining the solution.

Rules and Guidelines:

  • Teams must strictly adhere to the chosen problem domain (SDG 9, 4, or 2).
  • Round 1 submissions must not exceed 2 pages.
  • No Kaggle/CHI Data: Use of these specific sources in Round 1 is prohibited.
  • All work must be original; AI models and working prototypes are expected in the final round.
  • Video time limits must be strictly followed: 4–6 minutes for Round 2 and 6–10 minutes for Round 3.

Eligibility & Logistics:

  • Eligibility: Engineering/BBA/BCA/MCA/BSc/BE/B. Com, MBA, and M. Tech students.
  • Team Size: 2–4 members per team.
  • Event Format: Rounds 1 & 2 are online submissions; Round 3 is a Live Model demonstration  via Zoom.

Round-Specific Submission Details:

Round 1: Problem Solving Approach

  • Submission Format: PDF Document: A 1–2 page document.
  • Task: Submit a problem-solving approach covering four key areas: Problem Understanding, Proposed Solution Direction, Tentative Data Sources (excluding Kaggle/CHI), and Expected Outcomes.
  • Evaluation: Judges will assess Problem Understanding (25%), Proposed Solution Direction (30%), Tentative Data Source Identification (20%), Expected Outcomes and Impact (20%), and Presentation Quality (5%).

Round 2: Detailed Strategy & PPT Walkthrough

  • Submission Format: PPT Presentation (per guidelines) + Recorded Walkthrough Video (4–6 minutes).
  • Task: Refine the idea and explain the solution in detail. The submission must include Data Sources (real or assumed), Methodology/Analytical Techniques, Proposed Implementation Framework, and Evaluation Metrics.
  • Evaluation: Focus is on Depth of Analysis & Technical Understanding (30%), Use of Data (20%), Proposed Implementation Framework (20%), Expected Outcomes & Metrics (15%), and Video/PPT Quality (15%).

Round 3: Prototype / Working Model Demonstration

  • Submission Format: Demo Video (6–10 minutes) showcasing the model + Final Deliverables (Prototype/Dashboard).
  • Task: Build and showcase a working prototype, simulation, dashboard, or proof-of-concept. The demo must explain the model, output insights, learnings, and implementation potential.
  • Evaluation: Judges will look for Prototype Functionality & Technical Execution (35%), Real-World Application & Feasibility (20%), Insights & Learnings (20%), Demo Video Storytelling (15%), and Innovation & Creativity (10%).

Important Dates:

  • Registration Opening: 10th Dec 11 AM
  • Registration Deadline: 15th Dec 11:59 PM
  • Submission Deadline (Round 1): 18th Dec11:59 PM
  • Round 2 Submission Deadline: To be announced.
  • Round 3 Live Finale: To be announced.

Additional Information:

  • Participation is free.
  • Ensure adherence to deadlines and guidelines to avoid disqualification.
  • If using software tools, the model submission on the tool should be included in the submission folder for round 3.

column45:
Event Name: Case Code-X

Type: Premier inter-college case competition

Organized By:

  • Infinit-I (IIM Indore)
  • Analytica (IIM Indore)
  • Analytics Club, IIM Calcutta

Powered By: StockGro

Prize Pool: 1,80,000+

About the Competition:

Case Codex is a premier case competition jointly organized by the analytics clubs of IIM Indore and IIM Calcutta. The initiative brings together three powerhouse bodies—Infinit-I (IIM Indore), Analytica (IIM Indore PGP students), and the Analytics Club of IIM Calcutta—to create a rigorous platform for analytical problem-solving, structured thinking, and real-world business application.

This event is proudly sponsored by StockGrow, India’s largest social investment platform known for simplifying financial learning, making investing accessible, and nurturing the next generation of informed investors. Their association adds a unique industry-oriented dimension to the competition.

Team Requirements:

  • Each team must consist of 3 members

Mandatory Rule:

  • Female team member(s) must attend the StockGro seminar (Round 1)
  • Non-attendance will result in automatic disqualification from further rounds

Competition Structure:

Round 1: ‘Basics of Fundamental and Technical Analysis in Stock Market’ Seminar

A kick-off learning session conducted by StockGrow, focusing on financial literacy, modern investment tools, and data-driven decision-making.

  • Mandatory attendance for female team members

Date: 18th December

Time: 6:00 PM – 7:30 PM

Round 2: Online Quiz

A timed online assessment covering:

  • Analytics-based questions
  • Aptitude and logical reasoning
  • Basic data interpretation

Date: 20th December

Time: 2:00 PM – 10:00 PM

Round 3: Case Release & Submission

Shortlisted teams receive an analytics-driven business case focusing on areas:

  • Structured reasoning
  • Data-backed insights
  • Actionable business recommendations

Case Release: 20th December, 11:59 PM

Submission Deadline: 25th December, 11:59 PM

Round 4: Final Presentation

Finalists present their solutions to a distinguished panel with these evaluation criterias:

  • Analytical depth
  • Clarity of presentation
  • Feasibility of recommendations
  • Creativity and innovation

Date: 27th December

Format: Live online

column45:
At Dentsu, we exist to create new solutions and new beginnings. Through connecting the creativity and ingenuity of diverse talent, both within and beyond our organisation, we offer an invitation to the never before.

Our vision is to be at the forefront of people-centred transformations that shape society. For over 120 years, innovation has been a core tenet of dentsu’s offering – exploring new ways to reach, engage and nurture relationships with audiences. 

How We are using AI to Shape the Future and Why You Should Be Part of It:

At Dentsu, we see artificial intelligence (AI) as more than just a trend - it’s a way to help our clients, brands, and people grow in exciting new ways. While other companies may use AI mainly to make things faster or cheaper, we use it to find bold opportunities and push boundaries. For us, “AI for Growth” means helping everyone move forward, not just doing the same things a little better.

We believe growth is about thinking big and working together with clients to create new and meaningful solutions. At Dentsu, AI is becoming part of everything we do - how we think, create, and deliver value for our clients. It’s not just a tool, it’s a key part of our culture.

Our Promise: More Than Just Efficiency

We promise to help brands go further, not just improve what they already do. Our teams work side by side with clients, using AI to spark new ideas, create content, and make smarter decisions. We want our clients to feel empowered and involved in every step, so they can grow with us.

Why Dentsu should be your Preferred choice to build your career:

  • Collaboration & Creativity: You’ll work with the latest AI technology and some of the world’s top brands to solve real-world problems.
  • Learning & Growth: We invest in training and hands-on experience, helping you build skills that will shape your career.
  • Diverse Partnerships: Our platform, dentsu.Connect brings together top companies like Adobe, Meta, Microsoft, AWS, and Google, giving you exposure to a world-class ecosystem.
  • Agility: We move quickly - testing and learning at a local level, then scaling what works globally. You’ll have the chance to make a real impact right from the start.
  • Supportive Team: You’ll join a team that values empathy, intelligence, and purpose, and that’s known for turning innovative ideas into practical solutions.

Our Mindset: AI-Native:

We’re on the journey to become the first global advertising network where AI is built into everything we do. As part of our team, you’ll get access to AI tools, training, and a culture that’s all about learning and growing together. We’re honest about what AI can and can’t do, and we put people at the centre of our work.

Join us at dentsu to help shape the next chapter in our 124-year story - where AI isn’t just about technology, but about creating new opportunities for brands, for you, and for society. This is AI for Growth, and you don’t want to miss being part of it!

Eligibility:

  • AIgnite is open to students from the listed colleges across all streams, and we also welcome final year participants from anywhere in India, provided they are pursuing a full-time degree.
  • Alumni who graduated in 2024 and 2025 are eligible as well.

Rules 

  • Team formation can be of 1-2 people
  • One student cannot be part of more than one team
  • Only full-time final year post-graduate students can participate 
  • There is no restriction on the number of teams from an institute
  • Ideas that are found to be plagiarised will be disqualified

How to get your idea/entry to stand out:

To succeed in this hiring challenge, your idea must move beyond theory to address the specific, complex, real-world problems facing the advertising and media industry today. To impress the Dentsu India team, make sure your proposal checks all these boxes:

  • Real-World Relevance & Strategic Depth: Your idea must be relevant to a genuine, immediate challenge faced by Dentsu's clients or the wider industry. Demonstrate your ability to think like a future leader. Your solution shouldn't be a one-off trick; it needs to show Strategic Depth by connecting different dots together.
  • Practicality - Scalability & Feasibility: Your concept must be Feasible. Avoid proposing sci-fi solutions; show us the nuts and bolts of how it can be implemented using available resources and technology. Prove your idea has the potential for growth. Scalability means the solution can be easily rolled out to multiple clients, different industries, or larger markets without needing to be completely rebuilt.
  • Innovation & Measurable Outcomes: We want to see you Embrace Industry Mega-Trends, particularly by integrating AI tools and Machine Learning. Show how you'd use new technology to gain a competitive edge in personalisation, prediction, or automation. Every great proposal needs a payoff. Clearly define the Measurable Impact / Return on Investment. Use specific numbers: How much money will it save? How much engagement will it drive? Sound outcomes are key to proving business value.
  • Command the Room- The Ultimate Presentation: Your presentation is your professional debut. Ensure your presentation makes us sit up to listen to your proposal and is incredibly compelling. Clarity and a strong visual narrative are the secret sauce here.

Competition Structure:

AIgnite  - Your career Path to dentsu India

Ready to go from student to Game Changer? This is your opportunity to solve real-world problems for Dentsu India's biggest clients.

Round 1:

It's all about cracking the code with a swift and focused online assessment

  • Each team will tackle 40 questions in 40 minutes, covering DI, Analytics, Critical Thinking & Logical Reasoning.
  • Points will be awarded based on both accuracy and speed, so answering quickly and correctly is key.

Round 2:

The stage is set, and Dentsu India is looking for the next generation of Game Changers! This is your opportunity to dive deep into real-world client challenges, where your creativity and strategic thinking can truly redefine possibilities. It all starts with the Open Challenge Submissions, where we scout for bold, practical, and impactful ideas that combine innovation with real-world applicability. Submit your solutions and prove you have what it takes to be one of the "First Wave of Ideators" moving forward.

  • Shortlisted teams from the online assessment round will be provided with problem statements to choose from. Teams need to choose one problem statement to submit their solutions.
  • Teams have to submit a 2-3 slider deck presenting their idea in the respective problem statement
  • Preferred submission method is PDF.

Round 3:

For those who pass round 2, the challenge shifts from Idea to Impact in the Detailed Proof of Concepts (POCs) round. This is where you showcase how your concept works, demonstrating feasibility, scalability, and measurable results. Our internal team will be "Shifting Through a Microscope," focusing on innovators who can execute, because the ability to scale is what truly sets the finalists apart. Successful candidates will be our "Second Wave of Innovators". 

  • Each team need to submit a detailed Proof of Concept that demonstrates scalability, innovation, and measurable outcomes through a 4-5 slide deck and/or prototype outlining their solution. 
  • The preferred submission method is PDF.

Round 4:

The journey culminates in the Final Selection process. This is the final stage to prove your ability to solve complex problems and deliver results under pressure. 

Get ready - your journey to making a real impact is almost complete! 

Prizes:

  • All Finalists stand a chance to win internship offers and goodies from Dentsu
  • Top 100 participants will be awarded a 6-month paid internship (Stipend - 15,000 – 20,000 per month) and, on successful completion, a full-time offer with dentsu (CTC - 4-4.5 LPA).
  • All round 1 participants receive certificates for participation.

column45:
Theme: Data Visualization Challenge  -“Turning Raw Data Into Real Insights”

Event Rounds:

Round 1: Dashboard Thinking & Video Response Assessment Participants will receive the actual dataset (inspired by Rail India, data.gov.in, etc.) that will be used throughout the competition.

  • The task is to demonstrate structural thinking by answering 6 specific analytical questions regarding trends, visualization choices, and storytelling flow.
  • Teams must identify top trends, select appropriate visualization types for specific columns, and prioritize insights valuable for leadership.
  • The objective is to ensure candidates possess the necessary analytical thinking before moving to the design phase.

Round 2: Dashboard Design & Insight Extraction Shortlisted teams will build a single-page dashboard using the full dataset provided in Round 1.

  • The dashboard must include a KPI section (high-level metrics), 4–6 core visualizations (charts reflecting time-based or categorical changes), and interactive elements if supported by the tool.
  • Teams must also submit a short PPT summarizing 3–5 key insights derived from their dashboard.
  • The focus is on translating raw data into a clean, well-structured layout that highlights meaningful patterns.

Round 3: Presentation and Operational Recommendations (Finale) Finalist teams will present their dashboard and insights via a live video conference (Zoom).

  • The presentation must explain the "story" behind the dashboard, justifying design choices and the significance of the trends identified.
  • Teams must propose 2–5 practical operational strategies or recommendations based on their analysis to improve efficiency or service quality.
  • This round tests the ability to go beyond creation and demonstrate strategic thinking.

Rules and Guidelines:

  • Dataset Adherence: Teams must strictly use the dataset provided.
  • Originality: All work must be original. Plagiarism will lead to immediate disqualification. Use of AI for content generation is prohibited; however, AI tools for coding assistance (e.g., Python scripts) are permitted if disclosed.
  • Tools: Dashboards can be created using any standard visualization tool, including Power BI, Tableau, Excel, Python (Plotly/Matplotlib), or Google Looker Studio.
  • Presentation Time: Final presentations must not exceed the allotted time (approx. 10-15 mins + Q&A).
  • Meeting Etiquette: Ensure clear audio and video quality during the live Round 3 presentation.
  • Final Decision: The organizing committee’s decisions regarding evaluation and shortlisting will be final and binding.

Eligibility & Logistics:

  • Eligibility: Engineering/BBA/BCA/MCA/BSc/BE/B. Com, MBA, and M. Tech students.
  • Team Size: 1–3 members per team.
  • Event Format: Rounds 1 & 2 are Online Submissions; Round 3 is a Live Presentation via Zoom.

Judging Criteria:

  • Insight Depth (40%): Are insights meaningful, non-obvious, and derived directly from the data? Do they address the operational reality?
  • Visualization Quality (30%): Correct choice of chart types, logical layout, balanced spacing, and effective use of the chosen tool's features.
  • Storytelling & Flow (20%): Logic of the narrative (Summary → Trends → Deep Dive) and clarity in explaining why these trends matter.
  • Actionability (10%): Feasibility and relevance of the proposed operational recommendations.

Round-Specific Submission Details:

Round 1:

  • Submission Format: Video responses + Supporting Document (if applicable).
  • Task: Record short video responses answering 6 questions specific prompts about the dataset (e.g., "What top 3 trends would you highlight?", "Which tool would you choose and why?").
  • Evaluation: Judges will assess whether the participant understands dataset trends (25%), justifies visualization choices correctly (20%), and communicates with clarity (15%).

Round 2:

  • Submission Format: Dashboard file (PBIX, TWBX, Excel) OR Public Link + 1 Short Summary PPT.
  • Task: Create a functional single-page dashboard containing KPIs and 4-6 main charts. Include a short summary slide listing the top 3-5 insights.
  • Evaluation: Focus is on Dashboard Structure (25%), Visualization Appropriateness (25%), and Depth of Insights (30%).

Round 3:

  • Submission Format: Live Presentation (Screen Share of Dashboard + PPT).
  • Task: Present the dashboard live. Cover Key Trends, Narrative Explanation (Storytelling), and Operational Recommendations.
  • Evaluation: Judges will look for strategic thinking, presentation quality, and the practicality of the suggested actions.

Important Dates:

  • Registration Deadline: 18th Dec 11:59 PM
  • Submission Deadline (Round 1): 21th Dec11:59 PM
  • Round 2 Submission Deadline: To be announced.
  • Round 3 Live Finale: To be announced.

Additional Information:

  • Participation is free.
  • Ensure adherence to deadlines and guidelines to avoid disqualification.
  • If using Python/R, the code file used for preprocessing should be included in the submission folder.

column45:
About the Challenge:

  • The DSL is not just a game; it is a test of engineering endurance . We challenge students to move beyond "assembling kits" to "designing systems" . The Goal: Build a custom ESP32 drone under 2500, code its flight stability from scratch, and pilot it to victory in a high-intensity 1v1 aerial duel .

Eligibility & Team Structure:

  • Team Size: Maximum of 5 Members per team .
  • Roles: Teams may distribute responsibilities (design, coding, soldering, piloting) as they see fit .
  • Requirement: At least one member must be in the "Pit Area" for repairs, and only one member (The Pilot) controls the drone during the match .

Technical Regulations (The Build): Strict adherence to these specs is required. "Stock" components are banned.

  • Budget Cap: Maximum 2500 per drone (excluding the controller) . Teams must submit a Bill of Materials (BOM) during the Tech Check .
  • Microcontroller: ESP32 Development Board (e.g., DevKit V1) .

The "Custom ESC" Challenge (Mandatory):

  • Ready-made ESC modules (like L298N) are BANNED .
  • You must build your own Motor Driver on a Perfboard/PCB using N-Channel MOSFETs .

Motors & Power:

  • Allowed: 8520 Coreless Motors (Brushed DC, 3.7V) .
  • Banned: Brushless motors .
  • Battery: 1S-2S LiPo, Max 600mAh .
  • Frame: Custom Fabrication Only (3D Printed, Wood, PCB, PVC) . Pre-made carbon fiber frames or "Tiny Whoop" kits are prohibited .
  • Sensors: MPU-6050 (6-Axis) only. Barometers and Optical Flow sensors are banned .

Gameplay Format:

  • Arena: A fully netted cage (5m x 3m x 4m) with two hoop goals suspended 2m high .
  • Match Structure: 1v1 Duel, Best of 3 Sets .
  • Duration: 2 Minutes per set .
  • Pit Stop: A strict 5-minute technical break is allowed between sets for repairs (soldering, gluing, coding fixes) .

The Scoring System:

  • +1 Point (Goal): Drone passes completely through the opponent's hoop .
  • -1 Point (Own Goal): Drone passes backward through its own hoop .
  • +2 Points (TKO): If the opponent crashes and cannot take off for 10 seconds, the flying drone gets 2 points and the set ends immediately .

Judging Criteria (Total 100 Points):

Part A: Engineering Excellence (40 Pts)

  • Circuit Quality (20 pts): Clean soldering of the Custom ESCs (no cold joints) .
  • Design Innovation (10 pts): Unique frame design and lightweight build (<15g) .
  • Code Review (10 pts): Implementation of a proper PID loop .

Part B: Flight Performance (60 Pts)

  • Match Result (40 pts): Winning the match .
  • Stability Test (20 pts): Pre-match hover test (10 seconds without drifting) .

Connectivity & Safety:

  • Protocol: Wi-Fi (UDP/TCP) via Mobile Hotspot (2.4 GHz) .
  • SSID Format: Must be named DSL_TeamName (e.g., DSL_Phoenix) .
  • Interference: It is the team's responsibility to write robust code to handle packet loss .
  • Safety: Fire-safe bags for LiPo batteries and safety glasses for the crew are mandatory .

column2: Dentsu AIgnite - Your Creativity. Our Canvas.
column45:
At Dentsu, we exist to create new solutions and new beginnings. Through connecting the creativity and ingenuity of diverse talent, both within and beyond our organisation, we offer an invitation to the never before.

Our vision is to be at the forefront of people-centred transformations that shape society. For over 120 years, innovation has been a core tenet of dentsu’s offering – exploring new ways to reach, engage and nurture relationships with audiences. 

How We are using AI to Shape the Future and Why You Should Be Part of It:

At dentsu, we see artificial intelligence (AI) as more than just a trend - it’s a way to help our clients, brands, and people grow in exciting new ways. While other companies may use AI mainly to make things faster or cheaper, we use it to find bold opportunities and push boundaries. For us, “AI for Growth” means helping everyone move forward, not just doing the same things a little better.

We believe growth is about thinking big and working together with clients to create new and meaningful solutions. At Dentsu, AI is becoming part of everything we do - how we think, create, and deliver value for our clients. It’s not just a tool, it’s a key part of our culture.

Our Promise: More Than Just Efficiency

We promise to help brands go further, not just improve what they already do. Our teams work side by side with clients, using AI to spark new ideas, create content, and make smarter decisions. We want our clients to feel empowered and involved in every step, so they can grow with us.

Why Dentsu should be your Preferred choice to build your career:

  • Collaboration & Creativity: You’ll work with the latest AI technology and some of the world’s top brands to solve real-world problems.
  • Learning & Growth: We invest in training and hands-on experience, helping you build skills that will shape your career.
  • Diverse Partnerships: Our platform, dentsu.Connect brings together top companies like Adobe, Meta, Microsoft, AWS, and Google, giving you exposure to a world-class ecosystem.
  • Agility: We move quickly—testing and learning at a local level, then scaling what works globally. You’ll have the chance to make a real impact right from the start.
  • Supportive Team: You’ll join a team that values empathy, intelligence, and purpose, and that’s known for turning innovative ideas into practical solutions.

Our Mindset: AI-Native:

We’re on the journey to become the first global advertising network where AI is built into everything we do. As part of our team, you’ll get access to AI tools, training, and a culture that’s all about learning and growing together. We’re honest about what AI can and can’t do, and we put people at the centre of our work.

Join us at dentsu to help shape the next chapter in our 124-year story - where AI isn’t just about technology, but about creating new opportunities for brands, for you, and for society. This is AI for Growth, and you don’t want to miss being part of it!

Eligibility:

  • AIgnite is open to students from the listed colleges across all streams, and we also welcome final year participants from anywhere in India, provided they are pursuing a full-time degree.
  • Alumni who graduated in 2024 and 2025 are eligible as well.

Rules 

  • Team formation can be of 1-2 people
  • One student cannot be part of more than one team
  • Only full-time final year post-graduate students can participate 
  • There is no restriction on the number of teams from an institute
  • Ideas that are found to be plagiarised will be disqualified

How to get your idea/entry to stand out:

To succeed in this hiring challenge, your idea must move beyond theory to address the specific, complex, real-world problems facing the advertising and media industry today. To impress the Dentsu India team, make sure your proposal checks all these boxes:

  • Real-World Relevance & Strategic Depth: Your idea must be relevant to a genuine, immediate challenge faced by Dentsu's clients or the wider industry. Demonstrate your ability to think like a future leader. Your solution shouldn't be a one-off trick; it needs to show Strategic Depth by connecting different dots together.
  • Practicality - Scalability & Feasibility: Your concept must be Feasible. Avoid proposing sci-fi solutions; show us the nuts and bolts of how it can be implemented using available resources and technology. Prove your idea has the potential for growth. Scalability means the solution can be easily rolled out to multiple clients, different industries, or larger markets without needing to be completely rebuilt.
  • Innovation & Measurable Outcomes: We want to see you Embrace Industry Mega-Trends, particularly by integrating AI tools and Machine Learning. Show how you'd use new technology to gain a competitive edge in personalisation, prediction, or automation. Every great proposal needs a payoff. Clearly define the Measurable Impact / Return on Investment. Use specific numbers: How much money will it save? How much engagement will it drive? Sound outcomes are key to proving business value.
  • Command the Room- The Ultimate Presentation: Your presentation is your professional debut. Ensure your presentation makes us sit up to listen to your proposal and is incredibly compelling. Clarity and a strong visual narrative are the secret sauce here.

Competition Structure:

AIgnite  - Your career Path to dentsu India

Ready to go from student to Game Changer? This is your opportunity to solve real-world problems for Dentsu India's biggest clients.

Round 1:

Real briefs. Real constraints. Real possibilities.

  • Create a brand-based case problem.
  • Submit a concise pitch deck showcasing clarity, relevance, and imagination.

Remember - Good ideas excite. Great ideas solve.

Round 2:

Idea → Prototype → Potential

  • Submit a 4–5 slide Proof of Concept or working prototype.
  • Focus: Scalability. Innovation. Outcome. Impact.
  • Preferred submission method is PDF.

Remember - Execution is the loudest form of creativity.

Round 3:

This round tests your ability to design for different industries, personalities, tones, and visual cultures.

  • You must complete all tasks from the selected 2 options

ART TEST - ORIGINAL BRIEF

OR

COPY TEST - MODERN BRIEF (YOUR NEW INPUT ADDED)

  • Option Details and Deliverables - Click Here
  • Each team also need to submit a 50-word strategic explanation for any one of the brands mentioned in the selected option.
  • The preferred submission method is PDF.

Round 4:

  • This interview is about your brain, not your resume. So give it your best Shot

Be ready to explain choices, defend insights, and showcase thinking.

Round 5:

  • A conversation to understand who you are beyond the output - our mindset, collaboration style, curiosity, and ambition.

Get ready - your journey to making a real impact is almost complete! 

Prizes:

  • All Finalists stand a chance to win internship offers and goodies from Dentsu
  • Top 25 participants will be awarded a 6-month paid internship (Stipend - 15,000 – 20,000 per month) and, on successful completion, a full-time offer with dentsu (CTC - 4-4.5 LPA).
  • All round 1 participants receive certificates for participation.

column2: Intellectica 2026 : A Delegate Discussion Based on MUN Caucus Framework
column45:
Eligibility:

  • Engineering Students
  • MBA Students
  • Graduates
  • Postgraduates

Round 1 - Online Quiz:

Timelines & Questions:

  • Assessment Window: 17 Dec 2025, 10:00 AM IST to 22 Dec 2025 11:59 PM IST
  • Assessment Duration: 00:30:00 (hh:mm:ss)
  • Total Questions to be answered: 30 Questions
  • You can attempt the assessment anytime between the provided assessment window.
  • Please ensure that you attempt the assessment in one sitting as once you start the assessment, the timer won’t stop.

Key Instructions:

  • You can access the assessment from the opportunity page itself where you registered.
  • You’ll see a button in the respective round if you’ve registered to initiate the assessment.
  • Only the team leader will be able to take the assessment.
    You’ll be able to browse through the questions.
  • You’ll have to submit answers/code/solutions to all the questions within the provided duration.

Marking:

  • Each participant's ranking will be determined based on the accuracy of their answers. If two participants achieve the same score, the one who completes the assessment in the least amount of time will be ranked higher.

Round 2 - Submission Round:

  • This will be a submission round. You will see the “Submit” button here, once the round is live.
  • In this round, showcase your research skills by exploring various country policies and crafting innovative solutions. Submit your research outcome in a Word document format. The focus should be on addressing global issues with fresh perspectives, aligning with the Model United Nations (MUN) framework. The document should clearly articulate your understanding and solutions based on research.
  • Final Word document and any other supporting documents should be submitted on this platform before the deadline. The naming convention of the submission should be "Intellectica_TeamName".
  • The results of Round 1 & 2 will be evaluated to determine the finalists for the event. Selection is at the discretion of the judges, and decisions once made will be treated as final.
  • This is a submission round. You will see the “Submit” button here, once the round is live.
  • Start: 5 Jan 2026, 10:00 AM IST to 9 Jan 2026, 11:59 PM IST

Final Round:

  • Top 8 teams will participate in a delegate discussion at Symbiosis Institute of Digital & Telecom Management (SIDTM), Lavale Campus.

column2: The Virality Playbook: Decoding What Makes Ideas Spread
column45:
Marque, The Marketing Club of IIM Rohtak, invites you to feature your article in the upcoming edition of our monthly magazine, Insights!

This edition explores “The Virality Playbook: Decoding What Makes Ideas Spread””- In a world where trends rise and die within hours, virality is no longer a mystery it's a mix of psychology, timing, culture, and clever storytelling. This theme explores what truly makes content explode across platforms, whether virality can be engineered, and why some ideas turn into movements while others vanish in the scroll. Dive into the mechanics, magic, and mayhem behind what the world can’t stop sharing.

  • The Anatomy of a Viral Moment. What Truly Sparks the Spread?
    Break down the psychological triggers behind virality: emotions, relatability, humour, shock, social currency, timing, and community behaviour.
  • Chaos or Strategy? The Hidden Science Behind ‘Accidental’ Virals
    Explore famous accidental virals, the algorithmic luck factor, and whether brands can actually engineer moments that feel organic.
  • The Risk Factor: When Going Viral Backfires
    Analyse failed viral attempts, controversies, brand cancellations, and how virality can turn into vulnerability.

Guidelines:

  • Participants are required to submit an article under any one of the given themes.
  • The article should be between 800-1000 words with Font type: Times New Roman; Size: 12.
  • Any submissions made outside the given theme will be disqualified.
  • Any form of plagiarism will lead to mere disqualification.
  • On the first page of the submission, include the following: a short author bio (30-50 words), a passport-size photograph, the Name of your institution, Email ID, Contact Number, LinkedIn Profile link, and UPI ID (for prize money disbursement).
  • Any image without the source or label will not be accepted.

Rules:

  • Submission Deadline: 11:59 PM, 26th December 2025.
  • Only College students are eligible to participate.
  • The use of AI tools will lead to disqualification for the next five editions.
  • Submissions are to be made in .doc/.docx format through Unstop only.
  • The article should be original and should not have been/should not be published elsewhere.
  • You will be disqualified if you violate the same.

column45:
Welcome to the first edition of the College Snap Star Program! This is the first of its kind competition open to all budding student Creators. 

The Snap Star Campus Challenge is Snapchat India’s premier competition for college students - a nationwide hunt for the next generation of creative powerhouses! This flagship challenge is designed to uncover raw campus talent and transform them into polished Snap storytellers - ready to shine in the digital spotlight.

Eligibility:

  • Open to all full-time undergraduate and postgraduate students from any discipline, studying at colleges across India.
  • Participants must be based in India.
  • Must be 16 years of age or older at the time of registration.
  • Open to students from all streams - no creative or technical background required!
  • Ideal for aspiring creators, storytellers, and campus trendsetters who wish to build an audience on Snapchat.

Rules and Guidelines:

  • Participants must follow Snapchat’s Community Guidelines at all times: https://values.snap.com/policy/policy-community-guidelines
  • All submissions must be original and NEW videos - no repurposed or previously published content will be accepted - even if it’s videos the same creator has made.
  • Videos should tell a story and highlight the participant’s creativity and individuality.
  • Content must be shot vertically and uploaded to Snapchat Spotlight.
  • Each entry must include the official hashtag #CollegeSnapStar.
  • Participants must submit their Spotlight video links on the official challenge portal.
  • A maximum of five (5) Spotlight links can be submitted before the deadline.
  • Spotlights can be submitted anytime during the submission window and may be updated until the final deadline.
  • The submission window is open from December 10, 2025 to January 10, 2026.

Rewards and Prizes:

  • Top 3 creators will receive:
    • An exclusive Snap Goodie Bag.
    • Invitation to Snapchat events and creator experiences.
    • A fast-track opportunity to become a Snap Star.
    • An official Certificate of Achievement from Snapchat India.
    • 5,000 Amazon Gift Voucher. 
  • Top 50 creators will receive:
    • An official Certificate of Achievement from Snapchat India.
    • 5,000 Amazon Gift Voucher.

Description:

  • This assessment is designed to evaluate the technical problem-solving and architectural thinking of mid-to-senior Software Development Engineers.
  • It goes beyond coding syntax to test how candidates approach system design, scalability, and code maintainability.
  • The questions simulate real-world engineering challenges, such as handling high-concurrency traffic, debugging production bottlenecks, and refactoring legacy systems.
  • This is an application-based challenge that identifies engineers who can write efficient code, make trade-offs between speed and complexity, and build systems that are robust and scalable.

column45:
About the Competition:

The Eastman PowerUp Scholarship is a dedicated initiative to develop future-ready engineers
in Power Electronics, Solar Energy, Battery Systems, and EV technologies. With the rapid
expansion of clean-energy solutions and advanced power-conversion systems, Eastman— as a
leader in renewable and power-electronics innovation—aims to support talented B.Tech
students through access to high-quality, industry-aligned technical courses.

Students who excel in the assessment will be shortlisted, and Eastman will fully sponsor
specialised courses in areas such as Power Electronics, Battery Management Systems, Solar
PV Engineering, Magnetic Components, and Renewable Energy Systems.
Beyond supporting individual career growth, this scholarship reflects Eastman’s commitment to
strengthening the national clean-energy ecosystem by nurturing skilled engineering talent.
By empowering young engineers with cutting-edge technical capabilities, Eastman aims to
contribute meaningfully to the growth of the industry and the energy future of the nation.

About Eastman Auto and Power Limited:

Eastman Auto & Power Limited (EAPL), a subsidiary of JRS Eastman group, was incorporated in the year 2006, offering a superior and complete range of Residential power backup solutions, Solar solutions, and Electric mobility solutions. Since our inception, we have had a clear focus on customer centricity, which has led us to develop some of the best in the segment products. We are present across the nation with a robust network of 2200+ dealers and distributors. We have also expanded our footprint across the globe, registering our presence in more than 130 countries.

Eligibility:

  • All 3rd and 4th Year B.Tech Students from select colleges pursuing Electrical and Electronics Engineering are eligible to participate.
  • You must not have any active backlogs.
  • Eligible Institutes: 
    • ABES Engineering College
    • Galgotias University, Greater Noida
    • GL Bajaj Institute of Technology and Management, Delhi NCR, Uttar Pradesh
    • Maharaja Agrasen Institute of Technology (MAIT), New Delhi
    • Sharda University (SU), Greater Noida

Competition Structure:

  • The competition will have an MCQ Assessment for the initial screening.
  • Shortlisted students will be offered a list of courses that they can opt for. 
  • The courses will be reimbursed post the completion of the courses.

Prizes and Rewards:

  • All shortlisted students will be eligible for a Scholarship from Eastman Auto and Power Ltd.

column45:
Nerds AI Quest 1.0 marks the launch of an exciting AI quiz series presented by Nerds Room, a student-led technology community focused on building strong foundations in Artificial Intelligence and emerging technologies.

This first edition is a fast-paced, concept-driven quiz designed to test your understanding of AI fundamentals and real-world applications. It also serves as the perfect warm-up for the upcoming Nerds Room AI Hackathon.

Eligibility:

  • Open to school and college students
  • Beginners, non-coders, and AI enthusiasts are welcome
  • No prior AI experience required

Participation Type:

  • Individual participation only

Quiz Focus Areas:

  • Fundamentals of Artificial Intelligence
  • Types of AI
  • AI vs Machine Learning vs Deep Learning
  • Real-world AI applications
  • Core AI terminology

Quiz Format:

  • Mode: Online
  • Question Type: Multiple Choice Questions (MCQs)
  • Total Questions: 20
  • Difficulty Level: Beginner to Intermediate
  • Evaluation Criteria: Accuracy and time taken

Duration:

  • 20 questions in 20 minutes
  • Single-round quiz

Process:

  • Register for Nerds AI Quest 1.0.
  • Attempt the quiz online at the scheduled time.
  • Complete all 20 questions within the 20-minute time limit.
  • Rankings will be calculated based on correctness and response time.
  • Results will be officially announced by Nerds Room.

Perks & Rewards:

  • Social media shout-outs on official Nerds Room platforms for top performers
  • Winner certificates with rank for the Top 10 performers
  • Certificates of Participation for all participants
  • Priority access to the upcoming Nerds Room AI Hackathon

Important Updates (Mandatory):

All participants must join our official Telegram channel to receive:

  • Quiz announcements and reminders
  • Results, rankings, and certificates
  • Updates about the Nerds Room AI Hackathon

Rules:

  • The quiz must be completed in one attempt only.
  • The quiz is time-bound and will auto-submit after 20 minutes.
  • Any form of unfair practice or external assistance is strictly prohibited.
  • Answers cannot be changed after submission.
  • Nerds Room reserves the right to disqualify participants violating the rules.
  • The decision of the organizing team will be final and binding.

About Nerds Room:

  • Nerds Room is a student-led AI and tech community organizing quizzes, workshops, hackathons, and learning initiatives to help students build future-ready technology skills.

The Applied Management Program in eCommerce & Marketing by Digiaccel is India’s only industry-backed program of its kind. It follows a unique learn, intern, and get placed model that prepares you to start your career as an Analyst across media, marketing, eCommerce, growth, and business domains.

Details:

  • Industry-backed education in partnership with Founding Partners, like HUL, Honasa Consumer, WPP, 1digitalstack
  • Learn from Industry Experts who have built businesses
  • Application-first learning through case studies and simulations
  • Build skills and a body of work that companies hire for

Register Now to Appear in the AMP Aptitude Test:

  • To be among India’s 50 handpicked students
  • To win up to INR 1 lakh

Guidelines:

  • Eligibility: final-year graduating students & graduated students can participate 
  • Test Date: Jan 10, Saturday, 2026
  • Time: 12:30 PM to 2:30 PM
  • Mode: Offline 
  • Location: Digiaccel Cybercity Campus
  • Breakdown of Test:
    • 12:30 PM to 1:30 PM: AMP aptitude test 
    • 1:30 PM to 2:30 PM: Get a chance to be a part of a session with one of our industry experts.

column45:
CodeCrafter is an individual problem-solving and programming event where participants attempt timed coding challenges designed to assess logical thinking, algorithm familiarity, critical reasoning, and efficiency in implementation.

Guidelines:

Eligibility:

  • Open to all engineering undergraduate and postgraduate students.
  • Students from any specialization (CSE, IT, ECE, EE, ME, CE, etc.) can participate.
  • Individual participation only (no teams).
  • Participants must be enrolled in a recognized engineering educational institution.

Format:

Single Round – Offline Coding Challenge:

  • Participants will attempt coding problems individually.
  • The round will be conducted offline at IMI Kolkata campus.
  • The challenge will be conducted on IMI Kolkata’s official secured OLT platform, which is also used for institutional examinations.
  • Participants will receive problem statements and an integrated IDE within the platform.

What participants must do:

  • 2 to 3 coding questions/problems
  • Submit optimized solutions within the time limit.

Participants will write code using the provided IDE on OLT. Once submitted, the solutions will automatically be evaluated against 10 predefined test cases.
Scoring will be based on passed cases, and in the event of a tie, the participant with the earlier submission time will rank higher.

Duration:

  • Total duration of the round: 1 hour

Rules:

General Rules:

  • This is strictly an individual participation event.
  • Each participant must write and submit their own code.
  • Plagiarism, code-sharing, or seeking external assistance will result in disqualification.
  • Decision of judges and event coordinators will be final and binding.
  • Participants must report to the venue on time; delayed entries may not be allowed.

Round-Specific Rules:

  • Submissions after time expiry will not be evaluated.
  • Only one final submission per problem will be considered for evaluation.
  • Code must be executable and logically correct.
  • Partial scoring may apply based on test-case clearance.

Evaluation Criteria:

  • Number of test cases passed
  • Correctness of output
  • Submission time (used as tie-breaker)
  • Logical clarity and structure of code
  • Time and space efficiency

All evaluations and scoring will be generated directly through the OLT platform, ensuring transparency and uniformity.

column45:
Do you think you have what it takes to walk the extra mile, face challenges head-on and pass the test of grit and persistence? If yes, then here is the ultimate call for you! 
SIBM Pune is providing the ultimate arena to show off your mettle and become our ‘Last Man Standing’. The flagship event of Transcend 2026, Last Man Standing is a 3-day intense on-campus event where participants challenge each other, striving to be the ultimate survivor and claim the coveted cash prize of Rs. 1,50,000. The event is a 360° test to all your abilities and identifies the top contender. Prove your worth and be crowned ‘The Last man Standing’!

Join in and discover if you truly are The One! 

Details of the Rounds:

  • The event will be divided into 3 rounds: 
  • Eligible Institutes: All management and undergraduate colleges across India  
  • Participation: Individual  
  • Registration: Free 

Ready to start the grind? Well, before you move on to anticipating what happens at the hilltop campus, let’s test your all-around business and management acumen and more.

  • Time: 30 mins 
  • No of questions: 50

Guidelines:  

  • Online Quiz Maximum Duration: 30 mins  
  • Total questions to be answered: 50 
  • Participants can attempt the quiz anytime within the specified quiz window  
  • Please ensure that you attempt the quiz in one sitting  
  • Once the participants start the quiz, the timer will not stop  
  • There will be no negative marking for the online quiz  
  • Participants won’t be allowed to skip nor toggle between the questions
  • Participants won’t be allowed to switch tabs during the quiz 
  • Any participant resorting to unfair practices will be directly disqualified from the challenge   

Rules:  

  • This is a solo participation event  
  • The competition is open to students of all years from all management and undergraduate colleges
  • Rounds 1 & 2 will be conducted online and round 3 will be at the SIBM Pune campus  
  • Any participant resorting to unfair practices will be directly disqualified from the challenge  
  • All decisions in the matter of eligibility, authenticity & final judgment will be with Unstop & SIBM Pune 
  • It is the sole responsibility of the participants to regularly visit the website (Unstop) to take note of any changes
  • The Terms and Conditions of participation are subject to change at any time without specific notice
  • The amended Terms and Conditions of entry will be effective immediately upon being posted on Unstop

column45:
Welcome to the Robot Football Tournament, where innovation meets competition. Teams of intelligent machines face off in an electrifying game of football, showcasing precision control, smart design, and teamwork. It is not just a match, it is a test of engineering creativity and strategy on the field. Teams will compete in a knockout style tournament where the goal is simple, outscore the opponent using strategy, speed, and accuracy. Each team must coordinate their robots to push, hit, or drag the ball into the opponent’s goalpost while defending their own.

Competition Structure:

Round 1: Preliminary Screening (Online)

  • Participants must record a video of the basic navigation of the robot.
  • Upload the video as well as the codes for the robot to Google Drive and submit the shareable link (ensure access settings are set to "Anyone with the link").
  • Shortlisted candidates will move on to the final round.

Round 2: Grand Finale (Offline)

  • Shortlisted participants will be invited to IIT Hyderabad for the final round. 

Rewards and Benefits:

  • Prizes worth 50,000.
  • Certificates from Elan & nVision, IIT Hyderabad.

Eligibility:

  • Open to all groups.
  • Maximum team size is 4.
  • Participants may join only one team. 

General Guidelines:

  • Each match will last 6 minutes.
  • The field dimensions will be 300 cm by 200 cm.
  • Goalposts will be 40 cm in length, 10 cm in width, and 15 cm in height, placed such that the front side aligns with the field boundary.
  • The match ball will be a standard tennis ball with a diameter of approximately 6.6 cm.
  • The starting team will be decided by a toss and may begin only after the referee’s whistle.
  • Before the match begins, no robot may cross the halfway line into the opponent’s side.
  • In case of a goal, the team that conceded will restart from the center, with the judge placing the ball.
  • If the ball goes out of bounds, the opponent of the team that last touched it will restart from the center.
  • In the event of a tie, an additional 3 minutes will be played. If still tied, the team that did not start the match will be declared the winner.
  • No human interference or physical contact is allowed once the match begins.
  • The decision of the judges and organizers will be final and binding.
  • Each team may have at most two robots on the field at any point in time.
  • Robots can be wired, wireless, or autonomous, but wires must not interfere with another robot’s movement.
  • Robots must be submitted for inspection before the event begins to ensure they comply with all specifications.
  • Any technical details or repair requirements must be informed to the organizers before the match resumes after a stoppage.

Rules:

  • Each robot must not exceed 25 cm in any dimension and must weigh no more than 2 kg.
  • Only a DC power supply not exceeding 12V is permitted for each robot.
  • Robots must not hold, grab, or lift the ball to restrict opponent movement. They may only push, hit, or drag it.
  • Any misconduct, unsafe behavior, or tampering will result in disqualification.
  • Teams may inspect, repair, or substitute robots only during official breaks after a goal or when the ball goes out of play with the judge’s approval.

Event Overview:

  • India’s largest student-focused Cybersecurity Capture The Flag (CTF) competition
  • Prize pool of 1,00,000+

Designed to test:

  • Technical depth
  • Analytical reasoning
  • Collaborative problem-solving
  • Challenges span multiple cybersecurity domains

Challenge Categories:

  • Cryptography
  • Forensics
  • OSINT (Open-Source Intelligence)
  • Reverse Engineering
  • Web Exploitation

Competition Format:

  • Two-phase event

Phase 1: Online Qualification Round

  • Dates: 3rd–4th January 2026
  • Format: Jeopardy-style CTF
  • Mode: Online
  • Teams compete across all challenge categories
  • Top-performing and consistent teams qualify for the finals

Phase 2: On-Campus Final Round

  • Date: 31st January 2026
  • Venue: Ramrao Adik Institute of Technology, Navi Mumbai, Maharashtra, India
  • Top 50 teams advance from the online round
  • Features advanced, scenario-based challenges
  • Focus on:
  • High-level technical expertise
  • Strategic thinking
  • Team coordination

Eco-Champion Hackathon, in collaboration with TGPCB, invites innovators and problem-solvers to develop practical, technology-driven solutions focused on pollution control and environmental sustainability. Participants will address real-world challenges across air, water, and waste management through creative, data-backed interventions. The event aims to foster impactful ideas that support a cleaner, healthier future. Join us in driving purposeful innovation for environmental protection.

Competition Structure:

  • Offline Round: Participants will compete in an offline round at IITH. 

Rewards and Benefits:

  • Prizes worth 10,000
  • Certificates from Elan & nVision, IIT Hyderabad and TGPCB

Eligibility:

  • Open to all individuals 
  • Team size: 1-3 members
  • Participants may be part of only one team

Rules:

  • Participants must present their solution offline in front of judges.
  • Any form of Plagiarism is strictly prohibited and will lead to immediate disqualification. 
  • Decision of Judges and Event organisers is final and binding

column45:
Apertre 3.0 is a 30-day open-source contribution program by Resourcio Community, where students and developers collaborate, contribute to real-world projects, and grow their technical + community skills.

Participants can contribute to a wide range of repositories — web, app, ML, design, documentation, and more — under the guidance of mentors and project admins.

Guidelines

Eligibility

  • Open to all students and professionals across the world.
  • No prior open-source experience required.
  • Both individual and team contributions are allowed (team formation optional).
  • Inter-college and inter-specialization participation is allowed.
  • Minimum age requirement: 16+ years.

Format

The program runs for 30 days (1 Feb – 1 March).

It includes:

  • Project listing & selection
  • Mentor support and guidance
  • Task-based point system
  • Leaderboard tracking
  • Offline closing ceremony – ResCon 2.0

Process:

  1. Mentee Registration (from 7th December)
  2. Mentor & Project Registration
  3. Community Partner & Evangelist Registration
  4. Project Shortlisting & Reveal
  5. Apertre Starts – Contribution Window Opens
  6. Points + Leaderboard Updates
  7. Final Review & Evaluation
  8. Results Announcement on 3rd March
  9. Offline Event – ResCon 2.0 (22nd Feb)

Contribution Areas

Participants can contribute to:

  • Frontend / Backend / Full-stack Projects
  • Mobile App Development
  • DevOps / Cloud Projects
  • Design (UI/UX, branding, assets)
  • Documentation
  • Bug fixes / Feature additions
  • Sponsor-specific tasks

Event Deliverables

  • Projects live on GitHub
  • Mentors assigned to each repository
  • Tasks labeled Easy / Medium / Hard
  • Contribution guidelines provided for every repo

Rules

General Rules

  • Participants must use Git & GitHub for all contributions.
  • All PRs must follow the repository’s Contributing Guidelines.
  • Plagiarism or copying someone else’s work will lead to immediate disqualification.
  • PRs should be meaningful — spam PRs, irrelevant commits, or automated PRs will not count.
  • Participants must maintain professional communication with mentors and admins.

PR Evaluation Rules

  • PRs must be merged or approved by project admins/mentors to be counted.
  • Points will be assigned based on difficulty level:
  • Easy: 10 points
  • Medium: 20 points
  • Hard: 30 points
  • Documentation: 5 points
  • Bonus Tasks / Sponsor Tasks: variable
  • Extra points may be awarded for outstanding contributions.

Participation Rules

  • Maintain respectful behavior in Discord and event channels.
  • Follow deadlines strictly; late contributions may not be counted.
  • Participants who remain completely inactive for 10+ days may be removed.

Event Duration Rules

  • Contribution window: Feb 1 – Mar 1
  • Final results published after review: 3rd March

Round Details (for Unstop)

Round 1: Mentee Registration

  • Online registration
  • No screening required
  • Open to all

Round 2: Contribution Phase (Main Round)

  • Duration: 30 Days
  • Participants contribute to assigned or chosen projects
  • Continuous evaluation and point-based scoring

Round 3: Review & Result

  • Mentors review all PRs
  • Final leaderboard published
  • Winners announced on 3rd March

column2: TechSprint  Leveraging the Power of AI Hackathon
column11: 4VGG+WGQ, Tilwara Ghat Road, near Bargi Hills, Bargi Hills, Jabalpur, Madhya Pradesh 482008
column45:
TechSprint – Leveraging the Power of AI Hackathon is a campus innovation hackathon hosted by GDG on Campus – Gyan Ganga College of Technology (GGCT), aimed at empowering student developers to design real, practical, and AI-driven solutions using Google technologies.

What This Hackathon Offers

  • Build practical, AI-powered solutions
  • Use Google Cloud, Firebase, Flutter, Gemini, or other Google tools
  • Hands-on innovation experience
  • Opportunity to showcase technical skills
  • Potential invitation to the Grand Finale at the Google Office*

Participation Guidelines

  • Identify a real problem and develop an original prototype
  • Use at least one Google technology
  • Integrate Google AI tools (recommended for stronger evaluation)
  • Project must be created after 1 December 2025
  • Work must follow ethical and plagiarism-free standards

Mandatory Submission Requirements

  • Project Deck / Presentation
  • MVP or Prototype Link
  • Three-Minute Demo Video
  • GitHub Repository
  • List of Google Technologies Used
  • Solution Description (approx. 100 words)

Evaluation Criteria

  • Innovation and uniqueness
  • Technical feasibility and implementation
  • Practical usefulness and impact
  • Integration of Google technologies and AI

TechSprint provides a platform to experiment, learn, collaborate, and turn ideas into impactful solutions.

column45:
Dev Duel is an intensive development hackathon where participants collaborate to design, code, and deploy innovative solutions to real-world problems. It challenges technical proficiency, creativity, and teamwork under time constraints, fostering rapid prototyping and problem-solving skills. Participants showcase their coding expertise, UI/UX design, and project management abilities in a competitive environment.

Competition Structure:

Round 1: Online Round

  • Participants are required to submit their application’s source code in a GitHub repository (link).
  • The repository must be documented with a README, including instructions to configure the environment and run the application.
  • A short 3-5 minute video explaining their project must also be submitted (link).

Round 2: Grand Finale (Offline)

Final offline round on campus, upon selection through shortlisting online round to present their projects and showcase their work.

Rewards and Benefits:

  • Prizes worth 40,000
  • Certificates from Elan & nVision, IIT Hyderabad.

Eligibility:

  • Open to all individuals
  • Team size: 1–4 members
  • Participants may join only one team

Rules:

  • Teams will submit their final projects as GitHub repositories. The repository must include a README.md file with setup instructions.
  • Teams may optionally deploy their projects to earn bonus points.
  • All work must be original and created during the hackathon. Pre-existing projects will be disqualified.

column45:
Ignite your skills at Innov-AI-tion, presented by Elan & nVision, IIT Hyderabad! Join this online challenge to collaborate on real-world problems and showcase your coding prowess. Don't miss your chance to innovate and make an impact!

Competition Structure:

Round 1: Online round

  • Participants are required to submit their application’s source code in a GitHub repository (link).
  • The repository must be documented with a README, including instructions to configure the environment and run the application.
  • A short 3-5 minute video which covers the merit, unique features, and selling-points of their product must also be submitted (link).

Round 2: Grand Finale(Offline)

  • Shortlisted teams will be having an offline round on campus (IIT Hyderabad).

Rewards & Benefits: 

  • Prizes worth 50,000.
  • Certificates from Elan & nVision, IIT Hyderabad

Eligibility and Registration:

  • Open to all individuals.
  • Team size can be 1-4 members.

Rules & Regulations:

  • Participants can participate in teams of up to 4 members.
  • Code submitted will be subjected to a plagiarism check. Submissions found to contain plagiarized material will be disqualified.
  • Collaboration between teams is forbidden.
  • Any form of cheating leads to disqualification.
  • While providing the github repository link, make sure that the repository is public. Also provide proper documentation in the README file and mention all the steps required in the setup.

Don't miss the chance to participate in Innov-AI-tion! Register now and be part of this exciting coding challenge presented by Elan & nVision, IIT Hyderabad.

column45:
Web Odyssey is a hackathon designed for developers, innovators, and creators to explore the decentralized landscape. Participants will build functional decentralized applications (dApps) on specified blockchain protocols, contributing to the evolution of Web3 technologies.

Competition Structure:

Online Hackathon:

  • Participants are required to submit their application’s source code in a GitHub repository (link).
  • The repository must be documented with a README, including instructions to configure the environment and run the application.
  • A short 3-5 minute video which covers the merit, unique features, and selling-points of their product must also be submitted (link).

Rewards and Benefits:

  • Prizes worth 20000
  • Certificates from Elan & nVision IIT Hyderabad

Eligibility:

  • Open to all individuals
  • Team size: 1–4 members
  • Participants may join only one team

Rules & Regulations:

  • All projects must be developed during the hackathon period.
  • Use of pre-built or plagiarized code will lead to disqualification.
  • Submissions (Github repository link, demo video, project abstract and deployed application links) should be made on the designated platform  as instructed during the event.

column45:
Sound surrounds us, from the subtle hum of machines to the resonance of musical notes. Digital Signal Processing (DSP) empowers us to analyze, shape, and enhance these sounds through the lens of mathematics and computation.

This DSP Design Challenge invites participants to use their creativity into solving real-world audio processing problems. This year’s challenge features two distinct tracks, each emphasizing adaptive thinking, mathematical modeling, and signal insight.

Competition Structure:

  •   Solutions must be implemented using Python, MATLAB, or C/C++.
  •   Use of pre-trained ML models or AI-based libraries (e.g., PyTorch, TensorFlow) is strictly prohibited.
  •   Each team must submit:
    • Source code
    • Project report (max 5 pages)
    • Output files and visualizations
  • Participants have to upload them on Google drive and provide the link in the unstop submission.

Rewards and Benefits:

  • Prizes worth 15,000
  • Certificates from Elan & nVision, IIT Hyderabad

Eligibility:

  • Open to students and professionals across India
  • Team size: 1–4 members
  • Participants may join only one team
  • Inter-institutional teams are permitted

Submission Format:

  • Code Folder:
    • Source files (.py, .m, or .c/.cpp)
    • Instructions or README.txt for running the project
  •  Report (PDF):
    •   Algorithm description
    •   Results and visualizations
    •   Discussion and conclusion
  • Demo (Optional Bonus): Real-time implementation video or interactive demo.

Rules:

  • Solutions must address the official challenge statement.
  • 2 Problem Statements will be provided. Solutions to both must be provided.
  • All submissions must be original and developed during the competition.
  • Plagiarism or use of pre-built projects will result in disqualification.

column45:
Get ready to compete in the Real Cricket 1v1 Knockout Tournament, where players face off in fast-paced 5-over T20 matches. Each match will determine who advances to the next round, making every ball count. Bring your best game, stay focused, and fight your way to the top to claim the champion’s title.

Competition Structure: 

  • Offline Round: All registered players compete in a 1v1 offline knockout tournament until one champion remains.

Rewards & Benefits: 

  • Prizes worth 20,000.
  • Certificates from Elan & nVision, IIT Hyderabad.

Eligibility: 

  • Open to all individuals.
  • Participants can register anytime until the competition begins.
  • Each participant must use the latest version of Real Cricket.
  • Players must report to the venue 30 minutes before their scheduled match to remain eligible.

Rules & Regulations: 

  • Matches will follow a 1v1 knockout format, and the winner moves to the next round.
  • All gameplay settings (5-over match, T20 format, standard difficulty) will be preset and cannot be changed.
  • Any form of cheating, exploiting bugs, or unsportsmanlike behavior will lead to immediate disqualification.
  • Decisions made by the referees and organizers will be final and binding.

column45:
The Drone Challenge competition invites teams to design, build, and race high-performance drones through an obstacle course, completing payload pickup and delivery tasks in the shortest time. It tests speed, precision, and strategy.

Competition Structure:

Round 1: Preliminary Screening (Online)

  • Participants must record a video of the basic navigation of the drone.
  • Upload the video as well as the codes for the drone to Google Drive and submit the shareable link (ensure access settings are set to "Anyone with the link").
  • Shortlisted candidates will move on to the final round.

Round 2: Grand Finale (Offline)

  • Unmanned quadcopter, weight < 4 kg.
  • Propeller diagonal ≤ 50 cm.
  • Range: ≥ 150 m.
  • FPV allowed (720×480p max resolution, ≤ 180° FOV).
  • Arena: 30 m high, 50 m square. Drones must stay inside.
  • Course: Teams must pick up and deliver 3 payloads placed at corners, navigating through obstacles (hula hoops, poles, tunnels).

Rewards:

  • Prizes worth 50,000.
  • Participation certificates from Elan & nVision, IIT Hyderabad.

Eligibility:

  • Team Size: Max 6 members per team.
  • Open to all individuals. 
  • Teams can have members from different colleges or specializations.
  • One drone required, backup allowed.

Rules & Regulations:

  • At least 1 drone is required (backup allowed).
  • Drone must meet size, weight, and control specifications.
  • Teams must complete the course in the least time while maintaining control.
  • Tampering with other drones results in disqualification.

Important Info:

  • Teams must have drones ready 15 mins before race.
  • Charging stations available; teams must bring backup batteries.
  • Test flight required before race.

column45:
Maze Explorer is an autonomous robotics challenge where teams build bots to navigate an 8×8 maze without manual control. The event focuses on intelligent path planning, sensing, obstacle avoidance, and efficient decision-making. Bots must independently analyze the maze and reach the target cell with accuracy, speed, and optimized navigation logic.

Competition Structure:

Round 1: Preliminary Screening (Online)

  • Participants must record a video of the basic navigation of the robot.
  • Upload the video as well as the codes for the robot to Google Drive and submit the shareable link (ensure access settings are set to "Anyone with the link").
  • Shortlisted candidates will move on to the final round.

Round 2: Grand Finale (Offline)

  • Shortlisted participants will be invited to IIT Hyderabad for the final round. 

Rewards and Benefits:

  • Prizes worth 50,000
  • Certificates from Elan & nVision, IIT Hyderabad

Eligibility:

  • Open to all individuals. 
  • Team size: 1–4 members
  • Inter-college teams: Allowed
  • Inter-specialization teams: Allowed
  • Participants may join only one team

Rules:

  • Bots must be fully autonomous and self-contained
  • No manual control or communication modules (WiFi, Bluetooth, RF, ESP32, Raspberry Pi, etc.)
  • On-board battery only; bot weight ≤ 1 kg and must fit inside a maze cell
  • Excessive wall collisions may lead to disqualification
  • 5 minutes provided for PID/sensor calibration
  • Final code must be submitted; only sensor tuning allowed afterward
  • No plagiarism; hardcoded movement patterns are penalized
  • Judges’ decisions are final and binding

column45:
Physics Simulation is a technical competition where participants simulate a real-world physical phenomenon using code and relevant computational tools. The event tests scientific understanding, coding ability, and simulation design skills.

Competition Structure:

Online Hackathon:

  • Participants must make a report describing their simulation which should consist of:
  • Title of the simulation (same title must be used to submit code folder)
  • Name of your team and the names of your team members
  • Description of the physical phenomenon
  • Mathematical model and equations used
  • Approach and simulation methodology
  • Results and visual outputs (graphs, plots, animations)
  • List of software, libraries, and tools used along with their sources or link
  • Upload the report to Google Drive and submit the shareable link (ensure access settings are set to "Anyone with the link").
  • Participants are required to submit thier source code through a GitHub repository link. 
  • The repository must be documented with a README, including instructions to configure the environment and run the application. 

Rewards and Benifits:

  • Prizes worth 10,000
  • Certificates from Elan & nVision, IIT Hyderabad.

Eligibility:

  • Open to students and professionals across India
  • Team size: 1–3 members
  • Participants may join only one team

Rules:

  • Participants must submit their code file before the deadline.
  • Any form of plagiarism will lead to direct disqualification.

column45:
Enigma CTF, presented by Elan & nVision at IIT Hyderabad, is an online cybersecurity competition open to coders of all skill levels. Designed to test abilities through complex challenges, the event offers participants a platform to sharpen their skills, collaborate with teams, and compete for recognition in the coding domain.

Competition Structure:

  • The competition will be conducted online. It will be a 24 hour event, happening on 5th & 6th Jan 2026.
  • Flags must be submitted online on the specified competition site. 

Rewards & Benefits: 

  • Prizes worth 20,000.
  • Certificates from Elan & nVision, IIT Hyderabad.

Eligibility and Registration:

  • Open to all individuals.
  • Maximum capacity of each team is 3.

Rules & Regulations:

  • Zero Tolerance on Attacks: Brute-forcing, DOS, or DDOS attacks on the server are strictly prohibited and will result in immediate disqualification.
  • No Collusion: Sharing flags or hints with competing teams is forbidden.
  • Flag Format: All flags must be submitted in the exact format: enigmaCTF26{…}.
  • Dynamic Scoring: Challenge point values decrease as more teams solve them.
  • No Negative Marking: There are no penalties for incorrect submissions.
  • Tie-Breaking Policy: In case of a tie, the team that solved their last question the earliest wins.
  • Open Resources: Participants are allowed to use the internet and external tools during the 24-hour event.
  • Organizer Discretion: Organizers reserve the right to make final decisions regarding any rule or dispute.

Don't miss the chance to participate in the Enigma CTF! Register now and prepare to showcase your coding skills in this exciting online challenge.

column45:
Gear up for the BGMI Battle Royale Tournament at Elan & nVision 2026!
Compete in the online qualifiers, showcase your skills, dominate the lobby, and fight for a spot in the grand finals.

Competition Structure: 

Round 1: Preliminary Screening (Online)

  • All registered teams compete in an online screening match to qualify for the finals. This will be a Classic Battle Royale – Squad Mode.

Round 2: Grand Finale (Offline)

  • Offline Round: The top 25 teams advance to IIT Hyderabad for the live offline grand finals.

Rewards & Benefits: 

  • Prizes worth 30,000.
  • Certificates from Elan & nVision, IIT Hyderabad.

Eligibility:

  • Open to all college/university students across India.
  • Each team must have 4 players (1 optional substitute allowed).
  • Players must use the official BGMI mobile app — no emulators.
  • Every participant must register with their own BGMI account, IGN, and Character ID.

Rules & Guidelines:

  • Teams must join the online match lobby 15 minutes before match start.
  • Players must ensure a stable internet connection; organizers are not responsible for connectivity issues(For the online round).
  • Cheating, hacking, third-party tools, teaming, or stream sniping will result in immediate disqualification.
  • All players must use their own devices and accounts — account sharing is strictly prohibited.
  • Teams failing to join the room on time will be considered disqualified for that match/round.
  • Organizers may request screenshots/recordings as proof in case of disputes.
  • All decisions by the organizing team will be final.

column45:
Game Jam is a competitive event where participants design and develop innovative games from concept to prototype. It tests creativity, programming skills, design thinking, and storytelling. Contestants can work solo or in teams to build engaging, functional games that showcase technical expertise, gameplay mechanics, and user experience.

Competitions Structure:

Online Round:

  • Each team has to write a report describing their game. It should consist of:
  • Title of the game (it should be the same as the title you upload to Itch
  • Name of your team and the names of your team member
  • Concept and idea behind the game
  • Controls/instruction
  • Link to the game
  • List of themes used and in what ways were they incorporated into your game
  • List of software, assets, and resources used along with their sources (for example, links)
  • The game submission must be on itch.io
  • Each team has to take a small video of the gameplay of their game. 
  • Upload the report and the video to Google Drive and submit the shareable link (ensure access settings are set to "Anyone with the link")

Rewards and Benifits:

  • Prizes worth 20,000
  • Certificates from Elan & nVision, IIT Hyderabad.

Eligibility:

  • Open to students and professionals across India
  • Team size: 1–5 members
  • Participants may join only one team

Rules:

  • The game should be made within the stipulated time and be relevant to the theme
  • You are free to use any game engine, software, or library to create your game
  • You can also start with any base code that you already have
  • You can use assets that you previously created yourself.

column45:
Capture the beauty of the cosmos through your lens. The Astro Photography Competition invites passionate photographers and astronomy enthusiasts to showcase their talent by revealing the hidden wonders of the night sky.
Participants will submit astrophotographs highlighting celestial objects such as galaxies, nebulae, planets, and star clusters. The competition encourages creativity, precision, and technical expertise in capturing the mysteries of space. Images will be judged on both visual quality and the scientific accuracy of the details provided.

Competition Structure:

Online Round: The competition will be conducted online and partcipants will have to submit as per the submission guidelines. 

Submission Guidelines

Categories:

  • Deep Sky: Galaxies, nebulae, and star clusters.
  • Solar System: Planets, the Moon, and other solar system objects.

File Specifications:

  • Images must be in JPEG or TIFF format with a maximum size of 20 MB.

Naming Convention:

  • The file name must include the title and the word "Details" (e.g., Galactic Beauty Details).

Raw Data:

  • Raw data for stacking must be shared upon request.

Report Details:

The following information must be submitted along with the image:

  • Name of Picture: The title of the image.
  • Category: The chosen competition category.
  • Objects Identified: Names of celestial objects (if known).
  • Settings Used: ISO, exposure time, and aperture (specify "auto" if used).
  • Stacking Report: Description of methods (e.g., DeepSkyStacker), number of frames, and relevant tools.
  • Details of Enhancement: Post-processing methods applied.

Rewards and Benefits:

  • Prizes worth 10,000.
  • Certificates from Elan & nVision, IIT Hyderabad.

Eligibility:

  • Open to all groups.
  • Maximum team size is 4.
  • Participants may join only one team.

Rules:

  • All entries must be original and captured by the submitting group.
  • Minimal post processing is allowed, but images should represent real astronomical features.
  • Submissions without the required details will not be considered.
  • Each group must ensure proper permissions if using an observatory or shared equipment.
  • Technical Quality, including focus, exposure, and clarity of the image.
  • Accuracy of Information, correctness of celestial details provided.
  • Creativity, including framing and artistic presentation of the object.
  • Stacking Process, clarity and thoroughness of the stacking report.
  • Overall Presentation, including the scientific and aesthetic appeal of the entry.
