column45:
Strategy Storm's Case Competition is the flagship global case competition of the Consulting & Analytics Club, IIT Guwahati, designed to test participants’ business acumen, structured problem-solving skills, product thinking, and analytical judgment. The competition consists of multiple rounds that simulate real-world consulting and strategy challenges, giving participants an opportunity to showcase critical thinking, creativity, and practical decision-making.

Guidelines:

  • Open to all - students across global universities, freshers, and working professionals.
  • Team size: 2–3 members.
  • Inter-college teams are allowed.
  • Inter-specialization/program teams are allowed (B.Tech, B.Des, MBA, MSc, etc. can form a team together).
  • Deadline - 19th December, 11:59 pm IST.

Rules:

  • A team can submit only one entry for each round.
  • No changes in team composition are allowed after registration.
  • Plagiarism, use of AI-generated solutions without critical analysis, or copying from publicly available case solutions may lead to disqualification.
  • All decisions by the organizing committee and judges will be final and binding.
  • Any deviation from the prescribed submission format may result in penalties.
  • Use of unfair means during any of the rounds will lead to immediate disqualification.
  • Teams must adhere to the deadlines provided for each round; no late submissions will be accepted unless officially announced.
  • The organizers reserve the right to modify rules, timelines, or judging criteria if required; any changes will be communicated in advance.

column11: Datta Meghe College Of Engineering , Airoli , Navi-Mumbai
column45:
Details:

  • CSI DMCE presents the second edition of its flagship hybrid hackathon, CODE-A-THON 2.0, an innovation-focused competition designed to foster creativity, technical excellence, and futuristic problem-solving.
  • This year’s theme, Hack The Space, inspires participants to push boundaries, explore emerging technologies, and develop impactful solutions to the official problem statements provided by the organising committee.
  • CODE-A-THON 2.0 follows a two-stage hybrid format, combining online evaluation with an intensive offline hackathon - enabling students to demonstrate their skills from ideation to execution.

Event Format:

Round 1: Online Screening (Idea Submission)

Participants must submit:

  • A structured PPT describing their proposed solution
  • A short video explaining the concept
  • The PPT Template is given in the website 
  • The Problem Statement are also given on the website

Submissions must align with the theme Hack The Space and must be based on the official problem statements provided by CSI DMCE.

Shortlisted teams will be invited to participate in the offline hackathon.

Round 2: Offline Hackathon (On Campus)

Time: 9:00 AM – 9:00 PM (12 hours)
Venue: Datta Meghe College of Engineering (DMCE), Airoli

Shortlisted teams are required to start building their prototype from home. The offline round focuses on completing, refining, and presenting the final solution.

Teams must present:

  • A working prototype
  • Business model
  • Impact analysis
  • Target user segment
  • Technical feasibility and implementation details

Evaluation will consider innovation, usability, clarity, real-world relevance, and technical depth.

Important Eligibility Note:

The hackathon is recommended to students from the Mumbai Metropolitan Region (MMR), including:

  • Mumbai
  • Navi Mumbai
  • Thane
  • Kalyan–Dombivli
  • Panvel
  • Karjat
  • Nearby reachable regions within MMR

Participants from Pune, Nashik or any outstation location beyond MMR should register but based on your decisions and consent letters will be taken by organisers, as the offline round requires same-day travel feasibility.

Eligibility:

  • Open to undergraduate and diploma students within the MMR region
  • Teams of 2 to 4 members
  • Students from any branch with basic technical knowledge
  • A valid student ID card is mandatory

Why Participate:

  • Solve expert-curated real-world problem statements
  • Build a portfolio-ready prototype
  • Interact with mentors, peers, and industry professionals
  • Gain recognition through awards and certificates
  • Experience a complete innovation lifecycle from idea to prototype to pitch

General Guidelines:

  • Shortlisted teams must attend the offline round in person.
  • Participants must bring laptops, chargers, and required project components.
  • Evaluation will be based on innovation, feasibility, technical complexity, impact, and presentation.
  • Submissions must include documentation, repository/demo links, and a concise PPT.
  • Lunch will be provided during the offline hackathon.
  • Organisers’ decisions will be final and binding.
  • Event timings may be adjusted based on operational requirements.
  • Refer to the official event page or contact organisers for detailed instructions.

Prize Pool: 25,000

Overall Hackathon Awards (Not PS-based):

  • First Prize: 12,000
  • Second Prize: 8,000
  • Third Prize: 5,000

All winning team members will receive medals and certificates.
Participation certificates will be awarded to all shortlisted teams for offline hackathon.

Organised By:

  • Computer Society of India (CSI) – DMCE Chapter
    Committed to promoting innovation, technical leadership, and collaborative learning through workshops, projects, and high-impact events.

Contact Person:

  • Farhaan Shaikh : +91 70211 77410
  • Aniket Salvi : +91 84080 50673

Neetishastra is a one-of-a-kind live-consulting event that attracts participation from students of premier colleges across the country. It allows the participants to solve a challenging case study, experience real-time consulting, and provide solutions to the senior leadership of SMEs and startups.

Rules:

  • Team members should currently be pursuing their UG/PG curriculum at a certified college/ institution. 
  • There should be 2 members per team.
  • Round 1 will be an online quiz. Only 1 attempt per team is allowed. Rest rules and guidelines will be shared shortly.
  • Round 2 will be the live case round.
  • Round 3 (Finale) is the final presentation round. Teams will have to present their solutions online.

column11: Symbiosis Centre for Information Technology, Plot 15, Phase-I, Rajiv Gandhi InfoTech Park, Hinjawadi, Pune - 411057
column45:
Event Date: 10th January 2026

Graffiti presents an exciting IPL-themed auction event where teams use strategy, budgeting, and cricket knowledge to build the best squad. This document outlines rules, event flow, judging criteria, and prize distribution.

Eligibility & Team Formation:

  • Open to all college students
  • Inter-specialization teams: Allowed
  • Inter-college teams: Allowed
  • Team participation only
  • Team size: 1-3 members
  • Each team represents an IPL franchise in the Power Play 2026 Mega Auction.

Round 1 – Registration & Orientation & Qualification Quiz:

Teams report to the venue for:

  • Event briefing

Quiz:  Teams will go through an intensive cricket trivia quiz to get shortlisted for auction.              

  • Receipt of franchise paddle
  • Introduction to rules, purse system, and player categories
  • Clarification of squad composition requirements

Objective: Prepare teams for the live auction by ensuring fair play and rule clarity.


Elimination: Top 10 Teams Based on Quiz Results Will Be Selected for Further Rounds.

Note: The Quiz will be based on cricket trivia and will be pen and paper-based.

Round 2 – Live Ipl Auction (Main Event)

This is the heart of Power Play 2026.
Teams must build the best-performing squad using strategy, budgeting, and sharp decision-making.

Teams will receive:

  • Virtual Purse: 100 Crores
  • Player categories: Platinum, Gold, Silver, Bronze
  • Base prices & bidding increments announced live
  • Player slides with basic details (role, category, nationality, base price)

Rules:

  • Minimum Squad Size: 15 players
  • Maximum Overseas Players: 6
  • Mandatory:
    • At least 2 wicket-keeper
    • At least 4 bowlers
  • Only one bidder per team during live bidding
  • Once the auctioneer declares “SOLD”, bidding is closed
  • If purse falls below the remaining player base price, the team is frozen

Twist:

  • Player Ratings Are Secret and will NOT be revealed until the auction ends.
  • Elimination: None – all teams that complete their squad qualify for Round 3.

Round 3 – Fantasy Points Evaluation (Secret Scoring Round):

This is where the real test begins.

How it works:

  • Each player has hidden ratings (Batting, Bowling, All-round Ability)
  • Ratings → Converted into Fantasy Points
  • Team Score = Mean of all players’ fantasy points

Highest Mean Score wins Power Play 2026

Important:

  • The fantasy scoring system is not disclosed before or during the auction
  • Ensures surprise, suspense, and strategic unpredictability
  • Average score favours balanced teams, not just star-heavy one.

Winner Selection:

The top 3 teams will be decided based on:

  • Final Fantasy Mean Score
  • Highest team fantasy mean = Winner
  • If a tie occurs, then the Average of the Top 11 Players will be used as a tiebreaker

This makes POWER PLAY 2025 not just an auction
But a strategic cricket analytics challenge.

Disclaimer:

  • Organisers reserve all rights to modify rules, player data, or scoring methodology.
  • All decisions by the auctioneer and organizing committee are final.

Note:

  • The event will be conducted Offline.
  • Any damages to infrastructure, misbehaviour will lead to penalties and direct disqualification.

Event Overview:

  • A fun, high-energy quiz to test stock market knowledge, compete with peers, and climb the leaderboard to win cash prizes.
  • Suitable for beginners and seasoned investors alike to sharpen their skills.

What’s in it for you:

  • Exciting, competitive learning – challenge yourself with real-world market scenarios.
  • Cash prizes every week – earn while you learn.
  • Bragging rights – secure your spot on the leaderboard.
  • No entry fee – 100% free.

Details:

  • Date: 17th December, Wednesday at 6:00 PM.
  • Entry: Free.
  • Limited spots available.

Directions:

  • Join the Telegram: Click here (Must be a member of the Telegram community to participate.) 
  • Quiz duration: 15 minutes to answer 50 questions.
  • Switching browser tabs during the quiz will result in auto-submission.
  • Only one attempt per registration is allowed.

column2: Virtual Shark Tank  Pitch Your Startup Idea
column45:
E-Cell Virtual Shark Tank – Pitch Your Idea!

  • A National-Level Online Idea Pitching Competition
  • Get ready to dive into the ultimate startup experience!
  • Are you an aspiring entrepreneur with a groundbreaking idea?
  • Do you have a vision that can disrupt the market?

E-Cell Virtual Shark Tank gives you the opportunity to pitch your startup directly to experienced mentors and venture capitalists (VCs) who are actively looking for promising ideas and early-stage founders. Receive live feedback, learn how real startup pitches work, and showcase your innovation on a national stage.

What’s in it for you:

  • Pitch your idea to VCs & industry mentors
  • Get expert feedback to validate and refine your concept
  • Learn how to pitch like a real startup founder
  • Gain visibility and recognition for your idea
  • Network with entrepreneurs, creators & investors

Who Can Participate

  • Open to all college students
  • Individual or team participation allowed
  • Beginners & early-stage founders welcome

Event Details:

  • Date: 22 December
  • Mode: Online
  • Registration Deadline: 20 December

Event Flow:

  • Join the official WhatsApp group
  • Submit your pitch details as per the rulebook
  • Shortlisting
  • Live virtual pitch in front of VCs & mentors

Submit Your Idea Here:
https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSduvpsTY03nE4_omozxpNPwIlMCjIt-OSx2X43I2Skx1FzeYg/viewform?usp=dialog

https://drive.google.com/file/d/14gH6JC9kMHQwd9coo9-SDoG_Etyld5xx/view?usp=drive_link

https://whatsapp.com/channel/0029VbBBzsoAe5VpeCJKXp39

column45:
TransUnion CIBIL is India’s leading credit information company, committed to fostering trust and transparency within the financial ecosystem. It provides banks and financial institutions with a clear and complete view of your credit profile. This enables them to make informed lending decisions and helps make it easier for people and businesses to access credit when they need it.

With a legacy spanning over 25 years, TransUnion CIBIL has empowered millions of Indians by making credit more accessible and helping them achieve their financial dreams. 

To further its mission of financial empowerment, TransUnion CIBIL has launched CIBIL Saksham, a credit education initiative designed to improve one’s financial knowledge and confidence. Through this program, participants will learn how to manage credit wisely, make smart financial decisions, and prepare for a strong financial future

Think you're credit-savvy? Take the Saksham CreditWise Challenge!
This insightful quiz is a great way to test how credit-aware you really are.

Before diving in, why not brush up on the essentials?
Explore the Fundamentals of Credit course at CIBIL Saksham. This exclusive bundle includes:

  • CIBIL Saksham course – “Fundamentals of Credit – For Students” - https://www.cibilsaksham.com/courses/FundamentalsofCreditForStudents-27
  • CIBIL Score & Report - Basic 1-Month Subscription

With the right credit knowledge, you can make informed decisions and move confidently toward your financial goals.

Eligibility:

  • The challenge is open to all, and everyone is welcome to apply.
  • Participants will register individually for the quiz.

Structure:

  • The MCQ assessment will be conducted over a span of 20 consecutive days.
  • Each day’s assessment will consist of 20 multiple-choice questions.
  • The questions will be drawn from the domain of Credit - including topics such as loans, creditworthiness, and credit scores - to ensure a comprehensive evaluation of participants’ understanding of key concepts in lending and personal credit management.

Rewards:

  • Daily awards structure is as follows:
    • Winners: Cash prize of 5,000.
    • First Runner-ups: Cash prize of 3,000.
    • Second Runner-ups: Cash prize of 2,000.
  • Recognition for all participants: Every participant will receive a certificate of participation

column45:
Most analysis never leaves the notebook. The Zerve AI Hackathon challenges you to go further. Build an autonomous analytical system that doesn't just generate insights, but proves they work and deploys to production. Create a predictive or prescriptive workflow, validate its effectiveness, and ship it as a live API or scheduled job. No slides. No prototypes. Real systems that run.

Eligibility:

  • This hackathon is open to data professionals only - data scientists, data analysts, analytics engineers, ML engineers, and similar roles.

The Challenge:

Build a deployed, measurable analytical system in Zerve that:

  • Solves a real business problem: Churn prediction, demand forecasting, anomaly detection, recommendation engine, or your own use case
  • Includes a model or recommendation engine that makes predictions or recommendations
  • Proves it works: Include validation metrics (backtesting, holdout validation, accuracy metrics, business KPIs). Justify your approach.
  • Ships to production: Deploy as an API endpoint or scheduled workflow using Zerve's deployment features

You may use your own data or select from Zerve's example datasets (Titanic, Palmer Penguins, NASDAQ 100, Data Science Salaries, Hotel Reviews, and more).

Promo Code to avail 25 free Zerve credits: Hackathon-Unstop

Timeline:

  • Submission deadline: January 11th

Registration Process

  • Register on Unstop by clicking on the 'register' button.
  • Sign up for Zerve using the following link: https://bit.ly/4oCkygj

Submission Requirements:

Participants must:

  1. Click on the "Submit" button and submit:
    • Link to your Zerve canvas
    • Written report overview explaining what you built, the problem it solves, and your validation approach
  2. Post on LinkedIn OR X (Twitter) sharing what you built, with a link to your Zerve canvas. Tag @Zerve AI and @unstop on LinkedIn and @Zerve_AI on X.

Optional but strongly encouraged: Post a short video walkthrough (under 3 minutes) explaining your solution on LinkedIn or X, tagging @Zerve AI and @unstop or @Zerve_AI respectively. Video submissions will receive higher weighting in judging.

Rules and Guidelines:

  • Individual participation only.
  • All work must be built within the Zerve platform
  • Submissions must include deployed functionality (API or scheduled job)
  • Submissions must include validation metrics demonstrating effectiveness
  • One submission per participant
  • Submissions must be original work created during the hackathon period
  • By submitting, you grant Zerve permission to share and feature your work

Judging Criteria:

Criteria Weighting
Model/Recommendation Effectiveness: Does it actually work? Show us the metrics. 40%
Business Relevance: Is this solving a real problem someone would pay for? 25%
Production Readiness: Deployed, scheduled, scalable, robust. 20%
Creativity: Novel approach, unexpected use case, clever application. 15%

Video submissions will receive additional consideration in the final judging.

Rewards and Prizes:

  • 1st Place - $2,000 USD + Zerve Credits
  • 2nd Place - $1,000 USD + Zerve Credits
  • 3rd Place - $500 USD + Zerve Credits
  • All participants will receive a certificate of participation.

column45:
A 6-City Explosion of Ideas, Innovation & Investment:

  • Moonshot 6.0 marks a bold new chapter in India’s startup landscape. Organised by eDC IIT Delhi, this year’s edition takes the country by storm with six high-energy showcases across Delhi, Mumbai, Bangalore, Chennai, Jaipur, and Guwahati.
  • Designed for founders who dare to imagine big, Moonshot 6.0 brings the country’s most ambitious early-stage startups face-to-face with powerful investors, visionary mentors, and a thriving innovation community.
  • Whether you’re building in deep tech, consumer apps, healthcare, sustainability, or frontier technologies. Participate to accelerate your journey.

Why you should join Moonshot 6.0:

  • Direct Access to Investors: Pitch your startup to some of the most active VCs, angels and incubators.
  • Founder-Focused Feedback: Get clear, actionable insights from seasoned entrepreneurs and domain experts who understand early-stage challenges.
  • High-Visibility Spotlight: Featured startups gain media amplification through our partner networks, reaching investors far beyond the event cities.
  • Opportunities That Go Beyond Funding: Build long-term relationships with ecosystem enablers, accelerators, and future collaborators.

Moonshot 6.0 Highlights:

  • Funding Pool: $1 Million USD
  • 100+ Investors | 1000+ Attendees per city
  • Cities:
    • Mumbai
    • Bangalore
    • Chennai
    • Jaipur
    • Guwahati
    • Delhi 
  • Expert-led sessions, curated networking, high-stakes pitches
  • Pan-India platform bridging emerging founders with India’s strongest startup networks

Moonshot 6.0 isn’t just an event—it’s a countrywide movement to discover, empower, and elevate the next generation of breakthrough founders.
If you believe your startup can redefine the future, this is your moment.
Applications are now open. Launch your vision with Moonshot 6.0.

column45:
The Great Bull Investment Challenge is an engaging case competition designed to test participants' expertise in finance and investment strategies. It consists of three rounds: a financial market quiz followed by a case study, and a presentation on constructing the fund’s inaugural portfolios. Participants are tasked with making data-driven allocation decisions, evaluating macroeconomic factors, and optimizing portfolio strategies to balance risk, return, and long-term objectives.
Open to students and professionals, it combines knowledge, analytical skills, and strategic planning, culminating in a live presentation evaluated by a finance expert.

  • Team Size: 3 - 4 Members.
  • The team leader must register on behalf of the entire team, with only one leader allowed per team.
  • A student can be a member of only one team.
  • All team members must belong to the same institution or organization.
  • Teams may consist of members from different years of study as long as they are from the same institution or organization.
  • Team members can be of the same or different specializations.
  • Entries are open to both undergraduate and postgraduate students.
  • Any participant found engaging in unfair practices will be immediately disqualified from the challenge.
  • Violation of any of the above guidelines will lead to the disqualification of the entire team.
  • The final decisions regarding eligibility, authenticity, and judgment are at the sole discretion of Unstop & SIBM Pune.
  • The terms and conditions of participation may change at any time without prior notice.
  • Any updates to the Terms and Conditions will take effect immediately upon being posted on the website. Teams are responsible for regularly checking the website for any changes

column45:
OpsCon is a premier competition that tests participants' analytical, strategic, and logistical acumen. This three-round event begins with an online quiz and case study, followed by an on-campus finale featuring immersive activities inspired by the “GTA Vice City” theme. OpsCon takes you into a dynamic, Vice City–themed world of supply chain and logistics excellence.

  • Team Size: 2-3 members.
  • The team leader must register on behalf of the entire team.
  • Only one team leader is allowed.
  • Cross-specialization and cross-year teams are allowed.
  • A student can be a part of only one team.
  • All team members must belong to the same institution or organization.
  • Multiple entries from a single team are not permitted. In such cases, the team will be disqualified.
  • Any participant engaging in unfair practices will be disqualified from the competition.
  • Deviation from the above-mentioned guidelines will result in the immediate disqualification of the entire team.
  • All decisions regarding eligibility, authenticity, and final judgment will be made by Unstop and SIBM Pune.
  • Entries are open to both undergraduate and postgraduate students.
  • The Terms and Conditions of participation are subject to change at any time without prior notice.
  • The amended Terms and Conditions will be effective immediately upon being posted on the website.
  • It is the sole responsibility of the teams to regularly visit the website to stay updated on any changes.

column45:
Prometheus, organized by the Product Management & Technology Club at SIBM Pune, is a national-level case competition held as part of Transcend 2026. The event features three rounds: a quiz testing product management knowledge, a case study submission, and a final on-campus presentation. It brings together top B-school talent to tackle real-world challenges, fostering innovation and strategic thinking in product management.

  • Team Size: 1-3 Members
  • The team leader must register on behalf of the entire team. There can only be one leader. A student can be a part of only one team.
  • Cross-specialization and cross-year teams are allowed.
  • All the members should be from the same institution or organization.
  • Entries can be from students in both Undergraduate and Postgraduate courses.
  • Any participant resorting to unfair practices will be directly disqualified from the challenge.
  • Any deviation from the above-mentioned guidelines will result in the immediate disqualification of the entire team.
  • All decisions in the matter of eligibility, authenticity & final judgement will be with Unstop & SIBM Pune.
  • The Terms and Conditions of participation are subject to change at any time without specific notice.
  • The amended Terms and Conditions of entry will be effective immediately upon being posted on the website.
  • It is the sole responsibility of the teams to visit the website to take note of any changes regularly.

column45:
Marketshastra is a dynamic marketing competition that invites students to step into the shoes of a marketing leader while showcasing their creativity and strategic thinking. The event consists of three rounds - the first two involve online submissions, and the final showdown will take place offline at our hilltop haven, the SIBM Pune Campus.

  • Team Size: 2-3 member
  • The team leader must complete the registration on behalf of the team.
  • Only one team leader can be designated.
  • Teams can be formed across specializations and academic years.
  • A participant can represent only one team.
  • All team members must be from the same institute or organization.
  • Multiple submissions from the same team will lead to disqualification.
  • Any form of unfair conduct will result in removal from the competition.
  • Failure to comply with the guidelines will lead to immediate team disqualification.
  • Decisions related to eligibility, legitimacy, and final evaluation will rest solely with Unstop and SIBM Pune.
  • Open to both undergraduate and postgraduate students.
  • Terms and Conditions may be updated at any point without prior notification.
  • Revised Terms and Conditions will take effect as soon as they appear on the website.
  • Teams are responsible for checking the website regularly for updates.

column45:
“Strategy is not the art of planning for victory; it is the art of creating the path to it.” — Sun Tzu
Mindcraft: The Chief Strategizer 2025 is a national-level consulting & strategy case competition designed to test analytical rigour, strategic foresight, and operational thinking. The event blends a timed online eliminator with a case-driven submission round and a live grand finale, offering participants a full-spectrum consulting challenge.

Team Size & Eligibility:

  • Team Size: 1 – 4 members.
  • The team leader must register on behalf of the entire team; only one leader per team allowed.
  • A student may be part of only one team.
  • All team members must belong to the same institution or organization.
  • Teams may include students from different years and specializations (same institute).
  • Entries are open to undergraduate and postgraduate students.
  • Any participant found engaging in unfair practices will be immediately disqualified.
  • Violation of guidelines will result in team disqualification.
  • Final decisions on eligibility, authenticity, and judgment rest with Unstop & SIBM Pune.
  • Terms & Conditions may be updated without prior notice; participants are responsible for checking the website for updates.

column45:
Step into the shoes of a team manager and strategist in the ultimate competition - The 11th Hour! Designed for MBA students, this competition combines critical thinking, negotiation, and strategic planning. Form the best cricket team and craft innovative strategies to overcome real-world cricketing challenges.  
The 11th Hour presents a phenomenal opportunity for MBA students to compete and challenge their peers from renowned B-schools across the country and showcase your analytical, leadership, and problem-solving skills to create a winning team.

  • Team Size: 2 - 4 Members.
  • The team leader must register for the entire team, with only one leader allowed per team.
  • A student can be a member of only one team.
  • All team members must belong to the same institution or organization.
  • Teams may consist of members from different years of study as long as they are from the same institution or organization.
  • Team members can be of the same or different specializations.
  • Entries are open to both undergraduate and postgraduate students.
  • Any participant engaging in unfair practices will be immediately disqualified from the challenge.
  • Violation of any of the above guidelines will lead to the disqualification of the entire team.
  • The final decisions regarding eligibility, authenticity, and judgment are at the sole discretion of Unstop & SIBM Pune.
  • The terms and conditions of participation may change at any time without prior notice.
  • Any updates to the Terms and Conditions will take effect immediately upon being posted on the website. Teams are responsible for regularly checking the website for any changes.

column45:
Organized by the Academic Team of Symbiosis Institute of Management Studies (SIMS), INVICTUS 2026 is the flagship B-school case competition of the Academic Team, built around this year’s theme: Intelligence & Inclusive India.
The competition focuses on Rurban India — the powerful blend of rural resilience and urban innovation that is shaping the country’s future.
Set at the intersection of intelligence, sustainability, and inclusive growth, INVICTUS challenges participants to think clearly, solve and lead with purpose. It encourages future managers to understand real transitions on the ground and present solutions that are both smart and inclusive.

Round 1: Business Acumen Quiz (Online – Unstop):

  • 23rd December 2025, 08:00 IST – 27th December 2025, 23:59 IST
  • A fast-paced quiz testing business fundamentals, analytical ability, and awareness of real-world trends.

Round 2: Strategy & Insight Challenge (Online Submission):

  • 3rd January 2026, 08:00 IST – 11th January 2026, 23:59 IST
  • Teams will analyze a Rurban-focused business scenario and present their insights through a well-structured PPT highlighting how data, technology and inclusion come together to create impact.

Evaluation Criteria:

  • Strategic depth and relevance
  • Logical clarity
  • Creativity and visualisation
  • Feasibility of recommendations

Submission Format: PPT or PDF

Maximum Slides: – 3 (Excluding Introduction and Thank You slide)

Round 3: Battle of Perspectives (On Campus):

  • Date: 24th January 2026 (10 am – 5 pm) Tentative
  • A dynamic townhall debate will be conducted where participants will argue, counter, defend and present their perspectives on a topic provided relevant to the theme followed by a rebuttal round.

Round 4: Final Case Study Presentation:

  • Date: 25th January 2026 (10 am – 5 pm) Tentative
  • Teams will receive an additional part of the case and must refine their previous solution accordingly.

Evaluation Criteria:

  • Integration: How well the further details are incorporated
  • Adaptability: Logical updates to the earlier strategy
  • Coherence: Clear and structured final approach
  • Feasibility: Practical and implementable recommendations
  • Presentation: Delivery, clarity, and justification

Eligibility:

  • Open to postgraduate management students across recognized institutions in India.

Team Composition:

  • Teams of 2 to 3 members
  • Inter-college teams allowed.
  • Cross-specialisation teams encouraged diverse perspectives.

Format:

  • Each round is based on real-world business problems. Participants are expected to submit practical, well-reasoned and clearly articulated solutions.

Timelines:

  • All deadlines are strict, and late submissions will not be accepted.

Rules:

  • Participants must follow all guidelines.
  • Decisions by the jury and organising team are final.
  • Registration indicates acceptance of all rules of INVICTUS 2026

column45:
Everything you need to know about ImpactX—Social Innovation Challenge

This event encourages participants to create innovative solutions for social, environmental, or community problems. The aim is to develop ideas that are impactful, practical, and sustainable.

Eligibility:
* Open to all undergraduate and postgraduate students.
* Team participation allowed.
* Team size: 1 to 3 members.
* Only one participant must register from each team.

Rules:
* The social or environmental problem statement will be shared with all registered teams one day before the event.
* Teams must analyse the given problem and prepare their proposal before the presentation day.
* The solution must be original, practical, ethical, and feasible.
* Each team will get 5 minutes to present their solution.
* The proposal must clearly explain the problem, target group, solution, and expected impact.
* No unrealistic budgets, false claims, or copied ideas are allowed.
* Any form of plagiarism or misrepresentation will lead to disqualification.
* Teams must follow all instructions and time limits.
* Judges’ decisions will be final.

Process:
* Registration
* Problem statement shared one day before the event
* Teams prepare their proposal in advance
* 5-minute presentation (followed by Q&A if required)
* Evaluation and results

Evaluation Criteria:
* Clarity of the problem
* Creativity and innovation
* Practicality and feasibility
* Sustainability
* Social impact
* Presentation clarity

Robotics is at the forefront of global innovation, shaping industries and reimagining the way we interact with technology. To bring this excitement to young engineers, the IEEE NITK Student Branch, in association with the IEEE NITK RAS Student Chapter, proudly presents Robotrix 2026 -- a 24-hour immersive robotics hackathon designed to spark creativity, teamwork, and hands-on learning.
Robotrix 2026 isn’t just another hackathon -- it is a curated experience that blends learning, innovation, and high-energy competition. Whether you're taking your first steps in robotics or already building advanced systems, Robotrix offers an environment where ideas come alive.

Why Participate?

  • Gain practical exposure to robotics, an emerging field at the forefront of innovation.
  • Work on real-world problem statements that challenge your creativity and technical skills.
  • Learn from experts and build foundational knowledge through CoppeliaSim workshops.
  • Compete with some of the brightest minds from across India in an exciting and competitive environment.

What to Expect?

  • A full-day hackathon experience with: conceptual thinking, team-based problem solving, real-time bugging, and execution.
  • Access to expert mentors throughout the event.
  • A challenging yet beginner-friendly environment where learning is at the center.
  • A platform to transform your ideas into working prototypes or simulation-based solutions.      

Who Can Participate?

  • Robotrix 2026 is open to all 1st and 2nd-year B.Tech students from colleges across India.
    No prior experience in robotics is required -- curiosity and enthusiasm are all you need.

column2: Ops Odyssey - Kahoot: An Operations Quiz
column45:
OPEP the Operations and Supply Chain Club of IIM Raipur presents Ops Odyssey - Kahoot to acknowledge your perception and derive its implications in the field of operations.

Online Quiz:

  • This round will test the knowledge of the general concepts of Operations and Supply Chain Management.
  • Teams must complete the quiz within the stipulated time of 20 minutes.
  • The online quiz will be held on 04-01-2026 from 20:00 hours to 20:30 hours IST.
  • Only the team leader can attempt the quiz.

Rules:

  • Each team should have 1-2 participants.
  • Any deviation from the above will immediately disqualify the entire team.
  • All decisions regarding eligibility and final judgment shall rest with the OPEP team.
  • The format and rules of events are subject to change before the start of the event.

column45:
General Rules:

  • The quiz will be of 15 minutes and will cover questions from various areas of marketing and advertising
  • Questions, case studies, and the entire event are prepared by the quiz organizers, i.e., Marketing360°, the new age marketing club of IBS Mumbai.
  • All decisions in a matter of eligibility, authenticity & final judgment will be with the organizers
  • Round 1 is an elimination round, and shortlisted candidates will be eligible for the final round.

Details of rounds:

Round 1:

The battlefield is a scene of constant chaos. The winner will be the one who controls that chaos, both his own and the enemies”. Yes, so with this energy it starts with Round one of Social Ideate will help you to encourage your internal marketer and, take you on a roller coaster ride of marketing quizzes based on marketing concepts and majorly on ambush marketing, including a mix of marketing examples. This will be an elimination round which will be a short time-based quiz.

Rules: 

  • Quiz Window for Round 1: 
  • Quiz Duration: 00:15:00
  • The total number of questions: 25
  • All questions will appear at once.
  • There is no negative marking for this quiz.
  • The participant would answer the quiz, and subjective answers should be written in the space available below the questions.

Round 2:

  • "It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop." these great lines quoted by Confucius will guide you toward our 2nd round of Social Ideate. Marketing helps the business showcase its relations with its customer and we like to see how well you connect with your marketing concepts.
  • So, let us begin our Round 2-Think Bots, where you will have to submit a solution for the case study. 
  • The participants must read the case study and make a voice-over PowerPoint presentation for the relevant questions mentioned in the case study.

Rules:

  • Participants will be given a case study.
  • The window of submission for Round 2: 
  • The solution should be submitted in the form of a voice-over PPT.
  • The voice-over should be at most 120 seconds per slide.
  • No. of Slides Allowed: 3+1 [One slide is necessary to mention references taken] 
  • Submission Window: 48 hours
  • Participants will need to submit the file on the D2C platform- Unstop Round 2.
  • The format of the file submitted should be "Social Ideate_ParticipantName_CollegeName".
  • The case study solutions submitted should be original work.
  • Plagiarism would lead to disqualification from the event.

Criteria of Evaluation:

  • Content should be original and not plagiarized
  • Concepts, strategies, and methodological answers supported with facts and figures
  • Creative, innovative, feasible, and actionable solutions to the problem

We thank each of you for your overwhelming enthusiasm and eagerness to participate in the ultimate online Marketing Competition - Social Ideate.

Rewards:

  • All Participants: Participation e-certificates will be awarded to everyone who attempts the quiz
  • Winners: Cash prizes & certificate of excellence will be awarded to the winner and runner-up

column45:
MSystic Code is an online coding challenge designed to test the problem-solving skills, debugging ability, and logical thinking of students. This is not a simple coding contest — each problem contains intentionally placed mystery errors and twisted hint comments that participants must decode to identify and fix the logic.

The event consists of 5 interconnected coding tasks.

The twist?

The output of each corrected code becomes the input for the next code.

This chained-flow structure ensures contestants must think carefully, debug accurately, and maintain consistent logic throughout the entire challenge.

Whether you’re a beginner sharpening your debugging skills or an experienced coder looking for a unique challenge, MSystic Code offers an exciting opportunity to prove your mastery.

Event Structure:

  • The challenge contains 5 coding problems, each provided with
    •   A partially incorrect code snippet
    • Hidden bugs (logic errors, syntax errors, runtime traps)
    • Comments with indirect or twisted hints
  • Participants must:
    • Understand the intentionally flawed code
    • Identify & correct the mistakes
    • Produce the correct output
    • Use that output as input to the next problem

Rules & Guidelines:

  • The event is conducted online via Unstop.
  • Participants must complete all 5 questions within the given time.
  • Each code will be evaluated based on:
    • Correctness of output
    • Successful debugging
    • Clean and efficient logic
  • The initial input for Problem 1 will be provided.
  • The output of Problem 1 → Input for Problem 2 → and so on.
  • No external code templates are allowed; participants must debug the provided code.
  • Plagiarism or discussing answers with others during the event is strictly prohibited.
  • Decisions of the organizing team will be final.
  • Participants can use any supported language available on Unstop (C,Java, Python).
  • Multiple submissions are allowed within the time limit.

Who Can Participate?

  • Open to all engineering students, irrespective of year or branch.
  • Individual participation only.

Rewards & Recognition:

  • First Prize: 2,000 Cash Reward
  • Runner-Up Prize: 1,000 Cash Reward
  • Certificates:
  • E-Certificates will be provided to all participants
  • Achievement Certificates for Top Performers

Event Date:

  • 7th January 2025
  • Mode: Online (Unstop Platform)

column45:
Event Date: 10th & 11th January 2026

Step into the high-octane arena of the Valorant Showdown, where precision meets strategy in the ultimate offline esports battle!:

Prove your mettle as you clutch intense rounds, outmaneuver opponents, and claim glory for your team. With high-stakes gameplay, fierce rivalries, and a stage set for champions, this is where the sharpest aim and smartest tactics rule the day.

Event Format:

  • VALORANT – Tournament Details
    • Total Teams: 16
    • Teams will be divided into two pools for parallel scheduling:
      • Pool A – 8 Teams
      • Pool B – 8 Teams
    • Matches for both pools will be conducted simultaneously.

Tournament Format:

  • Knockout Format
    • Teams advance only by winning. Losing teams are immediately eliminated.
  • Day 1: Knockout Rounds
    • Round of 16 – 8 Matches
    • Quarter Finals – 4 Matches
    • Semi Finals – 2 Matches
  • Day 2: Grand Final
    • Final – Best of 3
    • Teams qualifying on Day 1 will compete in the offline LAN final on Day 2 at SCIT, Pune.

Eligibility Criteria:

  • Must have a competitive-ready Valorant account
  • Same Riot ID must be used throughout
  • Players may participate with only one team
  • Riot accounts must be public for verification
  • If any account is found to be a smurf, the entire team will be disqualified

Equipment Rules:

  • Players are encouraged to bring:
    • Keyboard
    • Mouse
    • Headset

Team & Roster Rules:

  • Teams must have at least 5 eligible players
  • Team Leader serves as primary contact
  • No vulgar or offensive usernames
  • No agent-based derivatives or misleading names

Match Process:

  • Tournament will use the official Valorant servers
  • Overtime:
    • If score is 12–12, a Golden Round will determine the winner
    • Applicable for all rounds except finals
  • Players must join the lobby on time
  • Organizers reserve the right to make match decisions

Game Rules:

  • Directed Pause: Officials may pause matches anytime
  • Awarded Victory: In case of severe technical failures
  • Forfeit Rule: Forfeit results are recorded as the minimum winning score

Code of Conduct:

  • Strict behaviour rules apply. The following may lead to immediate disqualification:
    • Use of cheats or unfair means
    • Abusive, vulgar, threatening, or discriminatory language
    • Insulting gestures
    • Harassment of players, officials, or audience
    • Any illegal or unethical manipulation of the match outcome
  • Organizer's decisions is final.

Note:  Any damages to infrastructure, misbehaviour will lead to penalties and direct disqualification.

  • Community-driven initiative to help students, beginners, and developers gain real-world experience by contributing to live open-source projects

What’s in it for you:

  • Work on real open-source projects
  • Learn Git, GitHub, pull requests, issues, and code reviews
  • Get guidance from experienced mentors
  • Network with 4,500+ developers across India
  • Receive a Certificate of Participation
  • Top performers receive exclusive swag kits and goodies
  • Get featured as a Project Contributor on LinkedIn and GitHub

Who can participate:

  • Students
  • Beginners
  • Developers
  • Tech enthusiasts
  • No prior experience required—only curiosit

Important details:

  • Duration: January to February
  • Mode: Online
  • Cost: Free
  • Seats: Limited


How to join:

  • Participants must register on Unstop to take part

column2: GHOST Ops - India's Biggest Strategy Hackathon
column45:
About GHOST Ops:

  • GHOST Ops (Growth & Hunting Operations for Strategic Territories) is a multi-stage national strategy hackathon designed to push the limits of problem-solving, creativity, and execution.
  • The competition brings together the brightest minds from top colleges across India to solve real-world business challenges through a Quiz Round, a Case Submission Round, and a high-intensity 24-hour Offline Hackathon hosted at the beautiful campus of Masters Union.
  • This is not a theoretical competition instead it is a battlefield of ideas, strategy, and endurance where teams unlock stages, submit reports, climb a live leaderboard, and present their final solutions to industry experts.

Here's what you will work on:

Throughout the competition, you will experience a complete end-to-end strategic problem-solving journey:

Stage 1 - Biz Quiz:

  • A 30-question quiz on business, strategy, markets, and structured thinking. Your first test of speed, clarity, and fundamentals.

Stage 2 - Case Deck Submission:

Teams receive a prompt and create a 6–8 slide deck outlining:

  • The problem statement
  • Initial solution hypothesis
  • High-level execution plan

This round evaluates clarity of thought, creativity, and feasibility.

Stage 3 - 24-Hour Offline Hackathon:

Shortlisted teams receive the actual problem set on the day of the event. Across 24 hours, you will:

  • Solve multi-stage mini-challenges
  • Submit 2-page reports at each checkpoint
  • Unlock new problem layers as you progress

Real mentors, real pressure, real innovation.

Here's why you should participate:

  • Real-world strategic experience: Work on complex, multi-layered problems under time constraints, exactly how top consulting, strategy, and founder roles operate.
  • Skill showcase: Demonstrate research, structured thinking, prioritization, and storytelling.
  • Exposure: Your solutions will be evaluated by industry experts, alums, and brand partners.
  • Network: Engage with mentors, judges, and top-tier talent from across the country.
  • Adrenaline of a real hackathon: A 24-hour immersive experience that pushes your endurance and creativity.

This competition ideally prepares you for roles in Founder’s Office, Consulting, Strategy, Product, and more.

Rewards & Opportunities:

Top-performing teams stand to win:

  • Cash prizes
  • Exclusive internships or mentorship opportunities from partner organizations
  • Spotlight on Masters’ Union’s official platforms
  • Recognition awards like On the Spot Award, Most Creative Approach, etc.

Every submission in the hackathon stage contributes to your live leaderboard score, unlocking competitive advantages and boosting your visibility.

Certificates:

  • Certificate of Participation for all participants who complete Stage 1
  • Certificate of Achievement to all the team who complete Stage 2
  • Finalists Certificate to all the teams who reach the finale
  • Certificate of Excellence for Top 5 teams
  • Special category certificates will be awarded during the finale

These certificates add significant value to placement portfolios, LinkedIn profiles, and internship applications.

Special Mention of our Sponsors:

This event is sponsored by:

  • Redbull - Energy Partner
  • ForeTeach - Learning Partner
  • UnStop - Platform Partner
  • Truscholar - Credential Partner
  • Mom's Mixes - Secret Receipe Partner
  • Eat Atlas - Snacking Partner

Theme: "Rest as Productivity: Why Breaks Make You a Better Worker"

Guidelines:

  • The articles will be evaluated based on content, research, creativity skills, and structure
  • Infographic illustrations would fetch additional brownie points
  • Published articles will be given a certificate of appreciation
  • The best article would be given a cash prize of INR 500 and the runner-up would be awarded a certificate of appreciation

Submission Details:

  • The naming convention for the file should be first name, last name, and college name along with the contact number
  • The word limit for the article is between 1000-1500 words
  • Plagiarized articles will not be accepted
  • File submission should be in .doc format only (submissions in PDF format will not be considered)
  • The results will be announced on 31st December 2025

column11: Maulana Azad National Institute of Technology Bhopal (M.P.)
column45:
Manthan 1.0 is an exciting innovation challenge organized at MANIT Bhopal under the cultural and technical festivals, Maffick & Technosearch. Participants will receive a problem statement and are expected to develop a functional prototype that showcases their creative solution. The shortlisted teams will be invited to the MANIT campus for an offline presentation and prototype demonstration. Manthan 1.0 offers students a platform to think critically, innovate, and bring their ideas to life.

Hardware Problem Statements: Drive Link attached

https://drive.google.com/file/d/1suQa4Ab0J58CtWE-rMvrg4b3J_A0ksIs/view?usp=drive_link

Software Problem Statements: Drive Link attached

https://drive.google.com/file/d/1CZntfoVV_SyQCv6KgsedfV3NCos-oULB/view?usp=drive_link

Guidelines:.

  • Participants may form teams of 1–4 members.
  • One member must be designated as the Team Leader for communication.
  • Incomplete or duplicate registrations will not be accepted.
  • Teams must provide valid contact details for communication.
  • The official problem statement will be released after registration.
  • Teams must develop a prototype strictly based on the provided challenge.
  • Solutions must be original; plagiarism or copied ideas will lead to disqualification.
  • Registration fees: The registration fee is free for MANIT students. For participants from outside MANIT, the registration fee is 400. Failure to pay the registration fee will result in cancellation of registration.

  Timeline:

Round 1: Online Submission Round

(PPT + CAD Model Submission)

  • Round 1 Opens: 6 December 2025

  • Online Submission Deadline: 31 December 2025

  • Submissions must include the PDF and CAD model (if applicable).

Result Announcement

  • Round 1 Results: First week of january.
    (Shortlisted teams will be invited for the on-campus prototype showcase.)

Round 2: On-Campus Prototype Showcase

  • Round 2 Date: 22 January 2026
  • Venue: MANIT Bhopal
  • Shortlisted teams must present their functional prototype to the judging panel.

Prizepool: Total (1 Lakh)

It is separate for both hardware and software category.

  • First prize - 25000 INR +trophy +certificates
  • second Prize - 15000 INR +trophy +certificates
  • Third Prize - 10000 INR +trophy +certificate

column45:
About InteractUp:

  • InteractUp is a dynamic, free, fast-growing platform empowering:
    • Students and professionals to:
      • Build public speaking and communication skills along with hard skills.
      • Gain industry connections.
      • Access real-world knowledge and mentorship.
      • Learn through interactive weekend sessions, midweek meets, debates, city meetups, Mind Nutrients groups, and more.
      • Be part of a free community designed to help people learn, grow, and build networks meaningfully.
      • Work on live business projects and gain practical experience.
      • Build friendships and participate in fun activities such as trips, casual meets, street stalls for learning, and house parties.
    • Founders/Students serious about pursuing entrepreneurship:
      • Mentorship and connection with industry experts.
      • Regular support to grow your business from scratch.
      • Opportunity for funding from VCs.
      • Support with marketing and legal work via partners.

About the Campus Ambassador Program:

  • The InteractUp CAP is a leadership opportunity for college students to represent InteractUp on their campus.
  • Ambassadors promote events, grow the community, and become part of InteractUp’s core student network.
  • Ambassadors act as the official link between InteractUp and their college.

Benefits for Campus Ambassadors:

  • Letter of Recommendation (LOR):
    • A formal, personalized LOR from InteractUp leadership based on real contributions.
  • Certificate of Excellence:
    • An official, verifiable InteractUp certificate appreciating your work.
  • Special Appreciation Letter from the Founder:
    • A unique recognition letter directly from the founder to top-performing ambassadors.
  • Access to Premium Courses (Worth 25,000+):
    • Exclusive access to premium skill-development courses.
  • Mentorship & Guidance:
    • Work closely with InteractUp’s growth team and industry mentors to build:
      • Leadership skills
      • Networking abilities
      • Career clarity
      • Speaking and presentation expertise
  • Work on Live Business Models + Win Cash Prizes:
    • Opportunities to work on:
      • InteractUp’s real business tasks
      • Community expansion projects
      • Event strategy and execution
      • Social media, marketing, and engagement tasks
    • Outstanding contributors can win cash prizes, rewards, and recognitions.
  • Exclusive Privileges:
    • Access to Mind Nutrients (invite-only knowledge group).
    • Free CV review, interview preparation, and referral guidance.
    • Opportunities to lead city meetups and local chapters.
  • Networking with 1000+ Students & Industry Leaders:
    • Engage with professionals who attend InteractUp sessions weekly.
  • Become a Recognized Leader in Your College:
    • Build visibility, reputation, and leadership presence on your campus.

Roles & Responsibilities of Ambassadors:

  • Promote InteractUp weekend and midweek sessions in your college.
  • Build a small community chapter on your campus.
  • Bring registrations for InteractUp events.
  • Organize small meetups or mini activities in your college.
  • Share InteractUp opportunities with peers.
  • Act as the single point of contact (SPOC).
  • Help strengthen the college-wise network.
  • Work on monthly tasks and challenges.
  • Collect feedback to improve outreach.

Why Your College Benefits from Having Ambassadors:

  • Free access to personal development sessions.
  • Exposure to industry experts.
  • Opportunities for students to interact and learn.
  • Workshops on communication, CV building, and more.
  • Recognition as a partner campus.
  • Opportunities for bulk CV review and interview preparation.
  • Chance to host InteractUp city meets on campus.

Eligibility:

  • Open to any student (UG/PG) passionate about:
    • Leadership
    • Speaking
    • Networking
    • Organizing events
    • Building communities
  • No prior experience required.

Program Duration:

  • 2–6 months (flexible based on performance).

Appreciation Tiers:

  • Gold Ambassador:
    • Maximum benefits.
    • LOR, Certificate, and Mentorship.
    • Special Founder Letter.
    • Programs worth 25,000.
    • Eligible for cash prizes and leadership roles.
  • Silver Ambassador:
    • Certificate and Mentorship.
    • Programs worth 25,000.
    • Bonus rewards.
  • Bronze Ambassador:
    • Certificate of Participation.
    • Basic perks.

column11: Symbiosis Centre for Information Technology, Plot 15, Phase-I, Rajiv Gandhi InfoTech Park, Hinjawadi, Pune - 411057
column45:
Event Date: 11th January 2026

Event Overview:

  • A high-intensity strategic competition simulating brand warfare.
  • Participants act as company decision-makers.
  • Tasks include:
  • Crafting competitive strategies
  • Defending brand identity
  • Exploiting competitor weaknesses
  • Adapting in real time
  • Focuses on brand positioning, competitor attacks, meme-driven perception shifts, and strategy refinement.
  • Enhances creative and strategic thinking under competitive pressure.

Why Participate?

  • Strengthen strategic thinking and real-time decision-making.
  • Experience realistic market-based brand warfare simulations.
  • Build creativity through memes, storytelling, and narrative crafting.
  • Improve communication, persuasion, and presentation skills.
  • Learn to defend ideas under scrutiny and competitive attacks.
  • Enhance adaptability and agility during strategy refinement.

Stage 1: Online Quiz (Elimination Round)

  • Mode: Online
  • Duration: 20 minutes
  • Participation: Mandatory for all teams
  • Leader attempts the quiz on behalf of the team.

Key Points:

  • 20 questions across 4 sections
  • No negative marking
  • Top 10 teams qualify
  • Results sent via email

Stage 2: Case Pitch Round (40%)

  • Teams get a 1-page case.
  • Required to deliver a 3–5-minute pitch explaining:
  • Problem
  • Insights
  • Brand positioning
  • Competitive strategy

Judging Criteria:

  • Depth of understanding
  • Narrative clarity
  • Strategic feasibility
  • Differentiation
  • Communication quality

Stage 3: Meme Battle Round (30%)

  • Teams attack competing brands using memes and creative messaging.
  • Focus on competitor weaknesses through humour and insights.

Rules:

  • Memes must be professional and non-offensive
  • Humour must be brand-based
  • No personal attacks

Judges Evaluate:

  • Creativity and originality
  • Relevance to brand positioning
  • Humour and storytelling
  • Competitive sharpness

Stage 4: Strategy Refinement Round (30%)

  • Teams respond to attacks and refine their strategy.
  • Demonstrates adaptability and strategic resilience.

Judges Evaluate:

  • Comeback strategy
  • Agility under pressure
  • Counter-arguments
  • Strengthened positioning

General Rules:

  • Team size: 3–5 members (same institute).
  • Cross-year & cross-specialization allowed.
  • No team changes post-registration.
  • A participant cannot be in multiple teams.

Online Quiz Rules:

  • Only team leader attempts the quiz.
  • Missing the quiz = elimination.
  • Must be attempted within allowed time.
  • Tie-breaker criteria:
  • Time taken
  • Section performance

On-Campus Rules:

  • All content must be original.
  • Offensive or inappropriate material leads to disqualification.
  • Time limits strictly enforced.
  • All members must be physically present for on-campus rounds.

Organizer Rights:

  • Can modify rules or timelines if needed.
  • Can resolve disputes at their discretion.
  • Judges’ decisions are final and binding.

Awards & Titles:

  • Best Strategists
  • Most Creative Strategy
  • Best Brand Defense
  • Meme Master
  • Funniest Team
  • Best Comeback

Note:

  • First round is online; remaining rounds are offline.

  • Any damages to infrastructure, misbehaviour will lead to penalties and direct disqualification.

column11: Symbiosis Centre for Information Technology, Plot 15, Phase-I, Rajiv Gandhi InfoTech Park, Hinjawadi, Pune - 411057
column45:
Event Date: 11th January 2026

Details:

  • Get ready for a high-energy brand challenge designed to test your speed, creativity, and strategy! The event begins with a rapid-fire decoding round where you must identify brands from jumbled taglines and emoji clues shown only for a few seconds. Next, your team enters a sketch-based logo round, where one member must draw the assigned brand logo—without any letters—while the team guesses within a minute. The excitement continues with an enactment round that relies purely on gestures and body language to communicate brand names under time pressure. The final stage shifts to a strategic bidding round, where teams use virtual points to buy hints of increasing clarity, balancing risk and reward to make the right guess. Quick thinking, teamwork, creativity, and smart decision-making will be your keys to victory in this multi-layered brand showdown!

General Rules:

  • Form a team of 1-3 members from the same college before the event begins.
  • Preferably a team size of 2-3 members is preferred.
  • No external help – Mobile phones, internet searches, and outside assistance are not allowed during any round.
  • Follow all round-specific instructions such as no speaking in charades or no letters while drawing.
  • Respect all time limits – Certain rounds are strictly timed, and late answers will not be entertained.
  • Maintain fair play and decorum – Cheating, disruptive behaviour, or not following instructions may lead to disqualification; organiser decisions are final.
  • The event is completely offline.

Note:  Any damages to infrastructure, misbehaviour will lead to penalties and direct disqualification.

column11: Symbiosis Centre for Information Technology, Plot 15, Phase-I, Rajiv Gandhi InfoTech Park, Hinjawadi, Pune - 411057
column45:
Event Date: 11th January 2026

Round 1- Code Decipher:

  • Teams receive a color-coded clue sheet and a book.
  • Time limit: 3 minutes.
  • Only a correct code unlocks the next stage.

Round 2- Safe Glass Challenge:

  • Teams must identify safe tiles using partially accurate clues.
  • Mix of logic and luck.
  • Time limit: 5 minutes per team.
  • Penalties are added based on time taken.
  • Only teams with at least one surviving member proceed.

Round 3: Laser Maze:

  • Each member must navigate through a laser maze.
  • Time limit cap: 15 minutes.
  • Touching lasers or requesting time extensions adds penalties.
  • Treasure map is revealed only if all members cross successfully.

Round 4: Final Treasure Hunt:

  • Teams use collected clues and the treasure map to find the final treasure on campus.
  • No time limit, but total time taken affects final ranking.

Note:  Any damages to infrastructure, misbehaviour will lead to penalties and direct disqualification.

column45:
Event Date: 10th January 2026

CTF is an offline, Jeopardy-style cybersecurity competition where individuals or teams solve challenges from categories like Cryptography, Steganography, Web, Forensics, OSINT, and Logic. It is a game-based learning format designed to enhance analytical thinking, technical skills, and awareness of common security vulnerabilities.

The event includes multiple difficulty levels (Beginner to Expert), making it suitable for both newcomers and experienced cybersecurity enthusiasts. Details of how the challenges and difficulty levels work will be explained during the event briefing.

Rules and Guidelines:

  • Participants can compete individually or in teams of 1–4 members.
  • The event features four difficulty levels (0–3) to accommodate both beginners and experts.
  • Participants may attempt challenges in any order, earning points based on difficulty.
  • The participant or team with the highest total score at the end of the 2-hour gameplay will be declared the winner.
  • Collaboration within the team is allowed; cross-team discussion is strictly prohibited.
  • The event will be conducted completely offline.

Note:  Any damages to infrastructure, misbehaviour will lead to penalties and direct disqualification.

column11: Symbiosis Centre for Information Technology, Plot 15, Phase-I, Rajiv Gandhi InfoTech Park, Hinjawadi, Pune - 411057
column45:
Event Date: 10th January 2026

Elimination Round Games:

Breached Intel (Analysis & Observation Challenge):

  • Teams receive a set of documents containing mixed information — some authentic, some misleading.
  • Your goal is to filter noise, spot inconsistencies, and identify the correct intel required for progression.

The Cryptic Vault (Decoding & Logic Challenge):

  • Using the clue obtained from the previous round, teams must break a coded pattern and extract a key that unlocks the next stage.
  • The faster you decode, the better your advantage.

 Scoring & Progression:

  • Teams advance strictly based on accuracy and completion time.
  • Each round must be cleared to move forward.
  • The fastest team to complete the final challenge wins.
  • Ties are resolved using earlier round performance.

 Rules & Regulations:

  • Mobile phones are not permitted during gameplay.
  • Mishandling or removing event materials is not allowed.
  • Participants must follow coordinator instructions at all times.
  • Judges' decisions are final.

Note:  

  • Preferably team size of 3-4 Members is preferred.
  • Misconduct or unfair practices, any damages to infrastructure, misbehaviour will lead to penalties and direct disqualification.

column45:
Event Overview:

  • Blends business analytics and marketing storytelling into a single interactive challenge.
  • Each team receives a dataset with major consumer categories and a randomly assigned product type.
  • Teams must analyze the dataset to define the product’s Segmentation, Targeting, and Positioning (STP) strategy.
  • Participants create a data-driven narrative that connects insights to marketing decisions.
  • Teams generate an AI-powered visual representing their imagined product concept.
  • The final pitch evaluates how well teams translate data into creativity, turning insights into a compelling marketing story.
  • A collaborative event between Analytics X Maverick.

column45:
International Simulation Fest simulates a sense of corporate competition wherein teams comprising various business heads coordinate to come out on top! You will act as Manager/Owner. understand the interplav of different functions and take business decisions in Sales and Marketing, R&D, Production, Human resources and on other functional areas. You will apply and demonstrate your business acumen and leadership skills and compete with the rival companies across financial years and changing market conditions.

Rules & Guidelines:

  • A laptop and Internet connection is mandatory
  • A pre session will be conducted for the better understanding of the game. Make sure you and your team attend that session on January 16, 2025
  • Team size 3-5
  • Team members can be across specializations
  • A student cannot be a part of more than one team
  • Modification of teams after registration will not be allowed
  • Date of the First Round is January 17, 2025

column45:
Opportunity Description:

  • The Pluto Drone Frame Design Challenge 2025 is a national-level competition where students, makers, and drone enthusiasts design a 3D-printable drone frame for India’s leading nano-drone platform — Pluto by Drona Aviation.
  • Participants will use CAD tools to create an innovative, lightweight, and flight-ready frame that fits Pluto’s core hardware. The best designs will be 3D-printed, integrated with real drone electronics, and flight-tested by the Drona Aviation engineering team.
  • This challenge gives students a unique chance to experience real-world aerospace design, rapid prototyping, and hardware testing directly with an drone startup.

What’s in it for Participants?

  • 50,000 Prize Pool
  • Real Flight Testing of shortlisted frames
  • Industry Mentorship from drone experts
  • National-Level Recognition
  • Certificate of Participation
  • Internship & Project Consideration with Drona Aviation

Who Can Participate?

  • Engineering / Design / Robotics students
  • Makers, hobbyists & CAD enthusiasts
  • Anyone interested in drone design
  • No prior drone experience required

What You Need to Do:

  • Register and get Official specification guidlines.
  • Design your custom Pluto frame using any CAD tool
  • Submit your CAD files + design explanation
  • Top designs will be flight-tested and evaluated

     For more details, read our Rule Book or visit our website: www.dronaaviation.com

    Please join Discord channel for Updates and Communication:  https://discord.gg/wucQ6jaE5a

column11: DAU (Formerly DA-IICT), near reliance cross road
column45:
Event Overview:

  • A collaborative hackathon by Dhirubhai Ambani University (DAU) and Intuitive.AI
  • Designed to help students enhance coding skills, unleash creativity, and build impactful real-world solutions
  • Focuses on solving challenges using modern technologies and innovative thinking

Domains:

  • Smart Education
  • Large Language Models (LLMs) and Generative AI
  • Disaster Management
  • Healthcare
  • Banking and Finance
  • Smart Automation

Accommodation:

  • Accommodation will be provided on a first-come, first-served basis
  • Only shortlisted teams after the initial screening will receive the accommodation registration link

Rules:

  • No pre-developed code is allowed in the offline round; all development must occur during the event
  • GenAI tools may be used for brainstorming and research, but not for code generation
  • Participants must remain on campus throughout the event and cannot leave without prior permission
  • Only the official PPT template must be used for Round 1 submissions

Disclaimer:

  • Winning does not guarantee an internship or full-time job opportunity
  • Intuitive reserves the right to interview any participant
  • Participants will be required to travel to the campus on their own for the offline round

Benefits:

  • Networking opportunities
  • Skill development
  • Personal and professional growth
  • Employment opportunities
  • Recognition and visibility
  • Portfolio enhancement

column11: United College of Engineering and Research ,Naini , Prayagraj
column45:
Event Overview:

  • UHACK is the flagship 28-hour software and hardware development hackathon of United Group of Institutions.
  • Designed to empower students to innovate, build, and solve real-world challenges.
  • Participants collaborate in teams to develop impactful solutions across diverse domains such as AI/ML, Web & App Development, IoT, Robotics, Cybersecurity, and Open Innovation.
  • Encourages creative problem-solving, rapid prototyping, and hands-on learning guided by mentors and industry experts.
  • Teams will work within a structured time frame to ideate, design, and present functional prototypes evaluated on innovation, feasibility, problem relevance, and execution.
  • Aims to foster a culture of technology, collaboration, and entrepreneurship by bringing passionate developers, designers, and innovators together.
  • Participants get the opportunity to network, compete for prizes, receive expert guidance, and showcase projects to academia and industry leaders.
  • Provides a platform to elevate skills, gain exposure, and celebrate the spirit of innovation at United College of Engineering and Research, Prayagraj.

column45:
Market making is at the core of modern financial markets — it provides liquidity, narrows bid–ask spreads, and enables continuous price discovery. This competition simulates a live market-making environment using the Nubra Trading API (UAT environment). Participants will build, test, and run a Python-based strategy that reacts to real-time order-book data, makes dynamic quoting decisions, and tracks PnL and inventory performance.

Guidelines:

  • Technical Requirement: Participants will design and implement a Python-based market-making algorithm that connects to Nubra’s UAT environment.
  • API Usage: Participants will use Nubra’s Python SDK (v0.3.5) to access UAT market data feeds. Key APIs include Authentication, Get Instruments, Market Quotes, and Realtime Market Data WebSocket.
  • Deliverables: Submissions must include a Python notebook/script, CSV logs with quotes and PnL data, and visualization plots comparing adaptive vs baseline strategies.
  • Reports: Reports explaining logic and key findings are encouraged.

Rules:

  • Strategy Objective: The algorithm must quote bid and ask prices dynamically around mid-price, adapt to order-book imbalance and inventory, and simulate fills.
  • Risk Management: Participants must manage risk by keeping their net position (inventory) near zero. Cap inventory and log every event with timestamps.
  • Data Handling: Handle prices in paise and reconnect sockets gracefully.
  • Mechanics: Dynamic spread adjustment and skew control are core to profitability and risk management.

Timeline:

  • 15 December: Online Webinar for Onboarding (Link will be updated accordingly)
  • 23 December: Event Day

Evaluation Criteria: Judging will be based on a total of 100 points (plus bonus):

  • Profitability (40 pts): Effectiveness of the PnL generation.
  • Risk Control (20 pts): Ability to manage inventory and exposure.
  • Responsiveness (20 pts): Speed of reaction to market data.
  • Stability (10 pts): Robustness of the code.
  • Presentation Quality (10 pts): Clarity of logs and reports.
  • Bonus (10 pts): Awarded for creative visualization.

WhatsApp Group Link

API Documentation Link

column45:
The Axiom Committee of XLRI Delhi-NCR is launching its Call for Articles for the Axon December Edition of our quarterly newsletter. This opportunity invites full-time MBA or equivalent students to submit their original articles on topics related to Operations and Supply Chain Management. Selected articles will be featured in the newsletter, and the best contributions will be rewarded with a cash prize and an e-certificate.
This year’s theme focuses on contemporary and future-oriented developments in Operations and Supply Chain Management. Students may choose from the example topics listed below or select any topic of their own that aligns with the theme. 

  • Leveraging AI Agents for Autonomous Demand Planning
  • ESG-Integrated Supply Chains: Metrics, Reporting Challenges, and Future Readiness
  • The Rise of Nearshoring and Its Impact on Global Production Networks
  • Blockchain for Supplier Traceability in Food and Pharmaceutical Supply Chains
  • Sustainable Logistics: Electric Fleets, Green Warehousing, and Carbon Optimization
  • Human–Machine Collaboration in Smart Manufacturing
  • Resilience Strategies: Multi-Sourcing vs. Onshoring in a Geopolitically Volatile Environment

Rules & Guidelines:

  • Eligibility: Full-time MBA, Engineering or equivalent students
  • The article should be original, properly referenced, and free from plagiarism.
  • References should be provided at the end of the article.
  • Font Style: Times New Roman
  • Word Limit: 1000-1500 words
  • File format: .docx
  • Naming convention for file submission: TeamName_CollegeName.docx
  • The decision by AXIOM, XLRI Delhi-NCR is final and binding.

This is a great chance to share your insights, get recognised, and contribute to the evolving field of Operations and Supply Chain Management!

column45:
The Math and Logic Sprint by ThinkWorks is a problem-solving contest designed for middle school and high school students from around the world. The contest evaluates analytical thinking, logical reasoning, and fundamental mathematical ability through a carefully curated set of problems. Participants will attempt a short, time-bound online quiz and receive certificates based on performance.

Eligibility:

  • Open to middle school and high school students worldwide (generally equivalent to Grades or Classes 6 to 12).
  • Participants must register on Unstop to access the quiz.

Format:

  • The contest consists of a single online quiz hosted on Unstop.
  • Participants will attempt 20 multiple-choice questions, comprising 12 mathematics questions and 8 logic questions.
  • The duration of the quiz is 20 minutes.
  • There is no negative marking.
  • Tie-breaking will follow this order: lower time taken, and earlier submission timestamp.

Guidelines:

  • Participants must attempt the quiz independently without external assistance.
  • Results will be announced on Unstop after validation.

Rules:

  • Any form of malpractice or dishonesty will lead to disqualification.
  • ThinkWorks reserves the right to verify submissions and adjust results if required to maintain fairness and integrity.

column45:
Test your understanding of Physics through a structured online quiz designed for learners, enthusiasts, and professionals. This assessment allows you to challenge yourself, compete with peers, and showcase your strengths in the subject.

About the Opportunity:

  • Think Works invites participants to take a curated physics test that evaluates conceptual clarity, problem-solving skills, and analytical reasoning. The quiz is divided into three difficulty levels, allowing students and professionals from varied academic stages to participate meaningfully.
  • The test is conducted online through Unstop, ensuring a smooth experience and fair competition.

Eligibility:

  • Open to all individuals.

Three parallel sections will be available:

  • Classes 6 to 10 – Section A
  • Classes 11 and 12 – Section B
  • Undergraduate and above – Section C

Participants must attempt only the section suitable for their academic level. 

Syllabus Guidelines:

  • Section A:  Fundamentals suitable for Classes 6–10
  • Section B: Globally Class 11–12 level physics
  • Section C: Core Undergraduate-level physics

These boundaries ensure that each participant is assessed within the appropriate conceptual depth for their academic stage.

In the test, there will be:

  • 20 questions per section
  • Mix of conceptual, numerical, and application-based problems appropriate for grade levels
  • Duration of the quiz: 60 minutes
  • Objective-type questions with single/multiple correct options
  • Total marks: 100
  • Negative marking: -1 for each incorrect answer

Tie-breaking will follow this order:

  • Lower time taken
  • Earlier submission timestamp

Guidelines and Rules:

  • Participants must attempt the test individually.
  • Any form of malpractice or dishonesty will lead to disqualification.
  • Questions are randomly shuffled for each participant.
  • Only one attempt per student is allowed.
  • Ensure a stable internet connection and start the test on time.
  • Results and certificates will be generated based on system-evaluated scores on Unstop.
