column45:
The Editorial Committee of TISS HRM and LR invites students, professionals, and experts from across India to participate in the Kaustubham National HR Article Challenge. The competition aims to encourage well-researched, original, and thoughtful writing on contemporary themes in Human Resources, work, and organisations.

Theme for the Competition: “Reimagining the Workplace: Human-first Leadership, Technology, and the Future of People at Work.”

Kaustubham is the annual magazine of the HRM and LR programme at the Tata Institute of Social Sciences. Selected articles from this competition will be published in the magazine and launched during Abhyudaya, the institute’s cultural and intellectual festival.

Participants will have the opportunity to present their ideas to a wide audience of HR leaders, faculty, alumni, and peers. The top three articles will receive a Certificate of Excellence signed by the Chairperson and will be featured in a special section for students in Kaustubham. Special mentions may be awarded based on merit.

This competition is ideal for students who want to contribute to meaningful HR discourse and share their perspectives on the future of work, leadership, culture, labour, technology, and human capital.

Eligibility:

  • The competition is open to students currently enrolled in any recognised undergraduate or postgraduate college in India.
  • Professionals from any recognised institution or organisation in India are also eligible to participate.
  • Individual participation only. Team submissions are not permitted.

Theme and Format of Submission:

  • Participants must submit an original article on topics related to Human Resources, Work, Talent or Organisations.
  • Suggested areas include:
    • HR and technology
    • Recent Changes in Labour Codes
    • Workforce analytics
    • Leadership and organisational behaviour
    • Industrial relations
    • Diversity, equity and inclusion
    • Talent management
    • Future of work and emerging labour markets
    • Sustainability in HR
  • Word limit: 800 to 2000 words.
  • File format: PDF or Word document.
  • Font style and size: Times New Roman, Size 12.
  • Line spacing: 1.5.
  • Referencing style: Harvard or APA, where applicable.For reference on the type of articles we publish and their structure, please visit the official website of the Editorial Committee: hrnexus.in.

Plagiarism

  • The article must be original and unpublished.
  • Plagiarism should be below 10 percent. Higher plagiarism will lead to disqualification.
  • AI-generated content should not form the core of the submission. AI tools may be used only for editing or grammar refinement.

Competition Process:

Round 1: Submission Round

  • Participants submit their article through the Unstop platform.
  • No additional questions or problem statements will be provided.
  • Duration of submission window: approximately 15 days from launch date.

Round 2: Evaluation and Shortlisting

  • Articles will undergo screening by the TISS Editorial Committee.
  • Evaluation parameters:
    • Topic relevance
    • Original insight and argument
    • Research depth and evidence
    • Writing quality, structure and flow
  • Shortlisted articles will move to the final stage.

Round 3: Final Selection

  • A panel consisting of faculty, industry experts and senior scholars will assess the top shortlisted articles.
  • Final scoring will consider:
  • Relevance to theme (20%)
  • Originality/Creativity (20%)
  • Research depth & analysis (20%)
  • Structure & clarity (20%)
  • Practical insights & applicability (20%)

Rewards and Outcomes:

  • Top 3 winners will receive a Certificate of Excellence signed by the Chairperson.
  • Winning articles will be published in a special section for students in Kaustubham, the annual magazine of TISS HRM and LR launched at Abhyudaya.
  • Special mentions may also be announced, depending on quality.
  • High-quality entries may be considered for future editorial features.

Rules

  • Articles must be original, unpublished and written solely by the participant.
  • Only one submission per participant is allowed.
  • Team entries are not allowed. Individual participation only.
  • Entries must follow the specified format, word limit and referencing guidelines.
  • Participants must upload submissions only through the Unstop platform. Submissions via email will not be accepted.
  • Articles exceeding plagiarism limits or using AI-generated content as core material will be disqualified.
  • Submission File Naming Convention: Full Name_College Name e.g., Vikash Khurana_TISS
  • The committee reserves the right to edit, excerpt or publish selected submissions in Kaustubham or associated communications.
  • Decisions of the organising committee and judges are final and binding.

Make sure to include the following details in the attachment:-

  • Full Name
  • Contact Number
  • Email ID
  • LinkedIn Profile Link
  • Professional Photo
  • College Name
  • Course Name
  • Batch/Year
  • Chosen domain for the article

column45:
Get Ready for Botline Bulletin:

  • Where News Gets twisted and AI Gets Awesome!Tired of boring, regular news?
  • Does your team have the brainpower to decode, the coordination to conquer and the creativity to go viral?
  • Welcome to the ultimate media mashup!Botline Bulletin is a lightning-fast, laughter-fueled media challenge that throws your team into the dizzying world of journalism and Artificial Intelligence.
  • If ready to think smart, act fast, and deliver the most engaging (and fun) news content under pressure! Do register .

Round 1:

Decode the Newsfeed: A rapid-fire knowledge challenge where participants must decode short, concept-based questions related to news, media, and technology within a strict time limit.

Round 2: 

A rapid-fire knowledge challenge where participants must decode short, concept-based questions related to news, media, and technology within a strict time limit.

Round 3:

Headline Blast: Teams draw random AI + News prompts and create a quick, dramatic fake news report. Using the assigned words, emotion, or action, they must record a fun and creative news-style video within the given time.

column45:
Sparkle Ascend is the senior track of the Student Entrepreneurship Bootcamp under UDGAM 2026, IIT Guwahati. It is designed for students of Classes 9–12 to explore innovation, creativity, and early-stage entrepreneurial thinking. Participants learn through curated resources, interactive workshops, and a guided process that helps them convert simple ideas into structured solutions.

Participation Opportunities:

  • Learn the fundamentals of innovation and problem-solving.
  • Access curated beginner-friendly resources.
  • Attend workshops by young entrepreneurs and mentors.
  • Showcase your idea in a national-level platform.
  • Earn recognition, certificates, and exciting prizes.

Eligibility:

  • Open only to students of Classes 9, 10, 11 and 12.
  • Individual participation (no teams).
  • Students from any school in India may register.
  • No prior experience required — only curiosity and problem-solving skills.
  • Registration is free.

Event Format:

The competition is divided into an online learning + submission phase and an offline (at IIT Guwahati Campus) finale during UDGAM.

Team Composition:

  • Solo participation only.
  • Each participant may submit only one idea.

Competition Rounds:

Round 1: Quiz Round

  • Mode: Online
  • Dates: 22nd–24th December

Covers:

  • Creative thinking
  • Basic logic & reasoning
  • Introductory entrepreneurship concepts

Round 2: Task Submission Round

Mode: Online
Dates: 25th Dec – 8th Jan

  • A simple idea brief
  • A clear problem → solution outline
  • A description of how the solution will function
  • The impact it aims to create
  • Any supporting information that strengthens the idea (research, observations, examples)
  • This round helps students understand how everyday problems can be shaped into structured startup ideas.

Final Round: Pitching Battle

  • Mode: Offline (IIT Guwahati Campus) (during UDGAM)
  • Dates: 24th–25th January, Shortlisted students pitch their ideas live online to founders, mentors, and evaluators from the startup ecosystem.

Rules:

  • Ideas must be original and created solely by the participant.
  • Plagiarism or copied content leads to disqualification.
  • AI tools may be used only for slide formatting, not idea generation.
  • Submissions must follow the given format and deadlines.
  • The decision of the evaluation panel is final.

Evaluation Process:

  • Creativity & originality
  • Problem clarity
  • Strength of the solution
  • Presentation quality
  • Understanding & effort
  • Conceptual feasibility (age-appropriate)

Evaluation is done by entrepreneurs, mentors, and early-stage startup reviewers.

column45:
Tired of solving Imaginary, Irrelevant, and Problems that companies faced during the 90s?

Welcome to the Product Construct - by Indian Institute of Technology, Madras!

India's Biggest Product Innovation Challenge!

A dynamic competition focused on Product Managers, Business Plan, Case Study, Conference, and Entrepreneurship.

A competition must for aspiring Product Managers and Entrepreneurs who are willing to solve real-world problems!

About the Opportunity:

  • Product Construct, hosted by the Indian Institute of Technology, Madras, is a dynamic online competition designed to challenge and inspire participants in the fields of Product Management, Business Plan, Case Study, Conference, and Entrepreneurship.
  • The event is a unique opportunity to showcase your skills and innovative ideas.
  • The competition is designed to provide a platform for participants to engage with real-world challenges, develop critical thinking, and foster a spirit of innovation.
  • All the teams selected after the second round will work with startups. A once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to collaborate with companies that are experts in their field.
  • The competition will help one understand what problems companies face in today's rapidly changing world, an opportunity to be part of the solution!
  • An opportunity for all the selected teams to represent their solution at IIT Madras, in front of highly experienced individuals!
  • Internship opportunities for all the selected teams!
  • Product Construct offers a chance to collaborate, learn from peers, and gain valuable experience in a competitive environment.

Startup Details: 

  • Culture Circle: Asia's #1 Hype and Luxury App! Also pitched on Shark Tank, securing an amazing investment of 3 Cr!
  • Hotelzify: Using cutting-edge technology, they help hotels find their right customers!
    Anirudh Ganesh (founder) has been be named one of the Top 25 Founders of H1 2025 by FounderSquare and powered by Redrob.

Rules:

  • Each team can have 1-4 members.
  • A student should be part of one team.
  • Any number of teams can participate from an institute.
  • A team can consist of members of different ages and from different institutes.

Guidelines: 

  • All the mentoring sessions by the startups will be conducted via online mode.
  • Cohorts will be formed for the teams selected in Round 2.
  • Each Cohort will be assigned its startups, with which they will collaborate and work.
  • Teams from Round 2 will be selected based on their Creativity, Presentation and Business acumen.

Round Details:

  • Round 1: Quiz -- To check basic understanding of UI/UX, MVPs, Product Life Cycle, Metrics, etc.
  • Round 2: Elevator Pitch Submission -- A two-slide pitch deck presenting the solution for the problem statement.
  • Round 3: Formation of Cohorts -- Each Cohort will work with a startup, and each cohort will have 1 winner.
  • Round 4: Offline Pitching at IIT Madras -- Teams selected in Cohort must present their ideas OFFLINE during the E-Summit of IIT Madras on February 7, 2026.

Terms and Conditions:

  • The judges' decision will be final.

Ready to learn, solve and compete? Join Product Construct today!

Join the WhatsGroup now!

column45:
Brandgorithm – Branding the Future is a dynamic branding and marketing event blending artificial intelligence with creativity. Participants engage in identifying AI content and developing innovative AI-based brand concepts. The event enhances strategic thinking, branding skills, creativity, and real-time decision-making, making it a perfect mix of technology and marketing innovation.

General Rules and Guidelines:

  • Teams of two are expected to arrive on time and follow event flow smoothly.
  • Professional conduct and fair participation are appreciated throughout.
  • Only permitted tools may be used; creativity should be original.
  • Time guidelines will be observed carefully.
  • Respect for the venue, coordinators, and fellow participants is encouraged.
  • Final decisions rest with the judging panel.

column45:
RoboWar at Aarambh 3.0, happening on January 5, is an exciting event where custom-made robots fight it out inside the arena. Participants will test their skills by building bots that can attack, defend, and stay strong till the end. With a prize pool of 25,000, the competition gets even more thrilling as teams push their robots to perform at their best. It’s a fun, high-energy event filled with loud cheers and jaw-dropping moments. If you love robots or fast-action battles, this is something you don’t want to miss! 

Eligibility:

  • Open to students from all colleges and universities
  • Participants must carry a valid college ID
  • Teams can consist of 1 to 2members
  • Students from different colleges are allowed in one team (Inter-college teams allowed )
  • Students from different branches/specializations are allowed (Inter-specialization teams allowed )
  • Teams must bring their own robot.

Registration Rules:

  • Limited slots available
  • Slot confirmation only after payment
  • No refund after registration

column45:
This fun-filled AI × Nature mashup challenges participants to think creatively and decode links between environment, sustainability, and technology.

The event is designed to be interactive, fast-paced, and engaging while staying true to Prakriti’s nature essence.

Rules & Guidelines:

General Rules

  • Individual or team participation allowed.
  • Same participants must compete in both rounds.
  • No misconduct; judges’ decisions are final.

Round-wise Rules:

Round 1 – Decode the Emoji

  • 5 seconds per emoji.
  • Answers once submitted cannot be changed.
  • Bonus for speed & accuracy.

Round 2 – Grid of Green

  • No external help allowed.
  • The crossword must be completed within the time limit.
  • Accuracy + time determines ranking.

column45:
Tech Tonic is a playful fusion of nature and AI where participants explore creativity, communication, and imagination through interactive rounds. The event highlights how technology and natural themes can come together in fresh, engaging, and expressive ways.

Rules & Guidelines:

General Rules:

  • Team strength must be 2 only.
  • No external help, texting, or internet searching beyond permitted AI tools.
  • Maintain discipline and fairness.
  • Judges’ decisions are final.

Round-wise Rules:

Round 1 – Say What

  • Headphones must be worn properly.
  • No hints, signs, or mouthing words.
  • Only slogans allowed.

Round 2 – Echo of You

  • Personality traits must be original, not copied from list examples.
  • No direct naming of nature element.
  • Timekeeper will record response time.

Round 3 – Green Frame

  • All 5 words must be used in the AI prompt.
  • Posters must reflect a nature theme.
  • AI-generated image + caption must be submitted within time.
  • No explicit, inappropriate, or off-theme content.

column45:
SHIELD 1.0 is a high-intensity, security-driven 24-hour challenge hosted in Jaipur, bringing together developers, cybersecurity researchers, innovators, and problem-solvers to build advanced technological solutions that strengthen India’s internal security, intelligence capabilities, and law-enforcement efficiency.
Over one focused day, participants will collaborate to design and prototype impactful systems centered around surveillance intelligence, digital forensics, cybercrime prevention, public safety, and AI-enabled enforcement tools.

Enhanced Participant Experience:

  • Part of the prize allocation supports participant engagement through meals, working infrastructure, and necessary amenities.
  • Prizes are structured to reward innovation depth, real-world impact, and technical robustness.

Why This Event Matters:

  • SHIELD 1.0 goes beyond traditional hackathons by focusing on solutions that directly contribute to national security and public protection.
  • The event emphasises long-term impact, encouraging participants to build systems that can evolve into deployable tools for law-enforcement agencies.
  • Top teams may progress into extended collaboration or pilot opportunities with BPR&D and partner organisations.
  • The hackathon aims to initiate a long-term pipeline of innovation for smart policing, cyber intelligence, and public safety technology.

Who Should Attend:

  • Open to anyone passionate about building technology for security, intelligence, and law enforcement.
  • Ideal for students, beginners, and experienced developers interested in:
    • Surveillance systems
    • Cybersecurity
    • AI/ML for public safety
    • Digital forensics
    • Open-source intelligence (OSINT)
    • Crime analytics and secure systems

What to Expect:

  • A sustained, high-energy 24-hour development sprint.
  • Close guidance from senior mentors, practitioners, technologists, and officers working in security and enforcement domains.
  • Deep exploration of:
    • Drone & AI-based surveillance
    • Social media drug trafficking analysis
    • Identity verification systems
    • Data ingestion, indexing, and cross-agency analytics
  • Final prototype presentations to a panel of judges from BPR&D and partner institutions.

Cybersecurity Challenges & Tracks

  1. Drone & Facial Recognition for Live Crowd Surveillance
  2. Software Solutions to Identify Users Behind Social Media Drug Trafficking
  3. Real-Time Database for Delivery Personnel Verification (Gig Workers) & Banking Agents
  4. Tools for Data Ingestion, Indexing, Analytics & Inter-Agency Sharing (AI/ML)


Further Information:

  • Detailed schedules, rules, facilities, judging criteria, submission guidelines, and campus policies are available at https://shield.cdtijaipur.in/

column45:
Innovation Crucible is a high-rigour technology commercialization challenge designed to build the next generation of innovation evaluators, IP strategists and deep-tech founders. It brings together analytical thinking, real-world technical assessment and strategic decision-making, all within a dynamic, competitive format. Participants not only learn how to assess technologies like professionals at a TTO or VC fund, but also get the opportunity to pitch to industry experts and investors at the grand finale in IIT BHU.

Eligibility and Participation Criteria:

  • The competition is open to students, working professionals and entrepreneurs with an interest in technology, IP and commercial strategy.
  • Each team may consist of one to three members, and cross-college or cross-discipline collaboration is fully permitted.
  • However, a participant may register only once and cannot be part of multiple teams. S
  • hortlisting at every stage will be merit-based, and advancement will depend solely on performance in the respective rounds.

Evaluation and Judging Criteria:

  • Progression from Round 1 will be strictly merit-based, determined solely by performance in the 30-question online quiz to be completed within 20 minutes.
  • Shortlisted teams will proceed to Round 2, where evaluation will rely on two mandatory submissions
    • A 500-word Problem and Market Validation Abstract identifying a singular, well-defined customer need and the most viable initial market segment
    • A three-page Technical and Strategic Report.

The Technical and Strategic Report will be assessed under a weighted rubric. Technical Feasibility and TRL Assessment (35%) will require a comprehensive TRL evaluation, identification of scientific and engineering risks, and a roadmap demonstrating progression to a TRL-5 validated prototype. Proprietary IP Strategy (30%) will evaluate the justification of either Patent-based protection, including three preliminary inventive claims and defensive scope consideration, or Trade Secret-based protection with three robust secrecy maintenance protocols. Market and Implementation Feasibility (25%) will assess the proposed business model, operational considerations, and the commercial entry strategy.
In the final round, teams will deliver a 7-minute Commercialisation Pathway Pitch, followed by a structured Q&A session. Evaluation will focus on the coherence of TRL defence, the robustness of IP strategy justification, and the clarity of concluding recommendation — whether the technology should be commercialized through Licensing or by establishing a Spin-out Startup. The final outcome will be determined based on cumulative scores from Round 2 and the concluding pitch.

column45:
About Prometeo

Prometeo 2026 marks the sixth installment of IIT Jodhpur's National Technical and Entrepreneurial Festival. Deriving its name and vision from the Greek fore-thinker“Prometheus”, who imparted the knowledge of technology and civilization to humanity, Prometeo aspires to elevate innovation, channeling creative ideas towards an enhanced impact at the forefront of progress. It features a dynamic blend of talks, workshops, and competitions that immerse participants in the vast world of emerging technology. In an age marked by formidable challenges confronting humanity, Prometeo aims to foster collaboration and nurture a community of innovatorscontributing to the world’s technological prowess to overcome, for its ultimate goal isto elevate,transformand conquer

About Quantopia

Greetings, tech enthusiasts and quant fanatics! Attention all math enthusiasts! Do you have what it takes to conquer the ultimate quant quiz challenge? Get ready to showcase your skills in the event you've been waiting for! This quiz will test your knowledge of probability, statistics, finance and logical reasoning. So bring your passion for numbers and a sharp mind to take on the challenge!

Guidelines:

  • The event is completely online, allowing you to participate from the comfort of your place.
  • It’s an individual competition featuring 45 questions focused on probability, statistics, aptitude and finance.
  • Questions will be numerical based and multiple-choice with four options, but only one correct answer.
  • You’ll have 60 minutes to complete the quiz, and each correct answer gets you 2 points.

Rules:

  • Incorrect answers will incur a penalty of 0.5 points.
  • Any form of cheating or unfair practices during the online quiz will result in immediate disqualification of the participant.
  • Any deviation from these guidelines will result in immediate disqualification of the participant.
  • The participant with the highest score will be declared the winner.
  • In case of a tie, the winner will be determined by the shortest time taken to complete the quiz.

column45:
Engage in the entrepreneurial crescendo at E-Summit IIT BHU with The Million Dollar Pitch, an event that seamlessly blends the art of pitching with unparalleled funding opportunities. This distinguished platform beckons aspiring innovators to unveil their visionary concepts before a discerning panel of venture capitalists and angel investors during the much-anticipated Demo Day.
Million Dollar Pitch is a gateway for startups to secure the funding they deserve. With a rigorous 2-round screening process, it culminates in a Demo Day where the top teams showcase their visionary ideas to a distinguished panel of VCs and Angel Investors.
Final round will be held offline and paid passes are needed.

Round 1:

  • The abstract and pitch deck should include the following points:
  • Brief overview of an existing problem
  • Customer segment
  • Your Solution/Idea/Product to tackle the problem
  • Revenue Stream i.e potential channels to earn revenue
  • Teams that participate in round 1 will thereafter be pruned based on the guidelines of the organizing committee

Round 2:

All participating startups would need to submit the following documents:

  • Founder's Details (Name, Contact Number, Email) (Required)
  • Pitch Deck (Must Include: Traction, Revenue Generated, Information about the previous funding rounds and ask) (Required)
  • Shareholder Agreement (Required)
  • CIN Number (Required)
  • Company Incorporation (Required)
  • Business Plan (Required)
  • AOA (Articles of Association) (Optional)
  • Certificates of recognition from the Government body (Optional)
  • MOA (Memorandum of Association) (Optional)

Round 3:

  • The final pitching round will take place in offline mode at the IIT BHU campus
  • The pitch will be followed by a Q&A round, where the panelists will get to ask questions concerning your startup
  • Select VCs and Angel Investors would also be provided with a judging sheet for the evaluation of the pitching competition on the basis of which the final winners would be decided
  • After the E-Summit, VCs and Angel Investors are free to invest in the startups of their choice

column45:
Hero Campus Challenge Season 10 is Hero MotoCorp’s flagship academic innovation platform, designed to ignite the next generation of thinkers, creators, and problem-solvers. Launched in 2015, the program opens the doors for students to step into the real world of business, technology and innovation.

These can be either particular problem-based challenges to choose a methodology to identify the top priorities for the organisation or scenario planning exercises to settle on Hero MotoCorp's long-term strategy.

Through HCC Season 10, Hero MotoCorp aims to understand diverse & unique perspectives and approaches toward scenario building/problem-solving from some of the brilliant minds of the country, studying at India’s leading B-Schools and Engineering Colleges.

Participants are expected to analyse past trends and other disruptions from the present world while keeping in mind how it would impact Hero MotoCorp and present their feasible and actionable solution to the current scenario.

Eligibility Criteria:

  • Engineering Colleges: B.Tech/B.E./M.E./M.Tech and dual-degree students from all years are eligible to participate.
  • B-Schools: First and second-year students pursuing MBA/PGDM programs and 1-year management programs are eligible to apply.

Team Formulation Guidelines:

  • Students must register in a team of 1-3.
  • All members of a team should be from the same institute.
  • Teams can be formed across specializations
  • All the team members need to provide their consent to participate in the competition.
  • A student cannot be a part of more than one team.
  • Only B-School and Engineering students can participate in HCC Season 10.
  • There is no restriction on the number of teams from an institute.
  • Once the registration closes, the teams won't be able to change their team members.

Competition Structure and Details:

Round 1: Online Assessment

  • All registered team members need to attempt the Online Assessment Round.
  • Every team will get only one opportunity to take the assessment. If you have taken it once anytime during the assessment window, then you won't be allowed to retake it. 
  • It is mandatory for all the members of a team members to attempt the online assessment round. In case a member of a team does not attempt the assessment round, that team's score will be considered null and void.
  • Participants will be assessed based on questions on Critical Reasoning, Logical Ability, and Analytics.
  • Teams will be scored on all the questions equally.
  • Participation certificates will be provided to everyone who attempts the test.

Round 2: Idea Elevator Video Pitch Submission

  • All shortlisted teams from both tracks will be informed about the challenge statements in due time
  • Teams will be required to submit a 1-slider PPT of their proposed solution in the prescribed format.  
  • Teams are also required to submit a 60-90 seconds video describing their idea along with the PPT.
  • Teams must keep in mind the ease of implementation of the solution in the current scenario and NOT consider the futuristic scenarios while working on the case study.
  • All the teams are requested to submit their entries a few hours before the deadline to avoid any last-minute hassle.
  • The teams would be able to view and change their submissions anytime before the submission deadline. Hence, we would recommend the teams to make their submission at the earliest.
  • Some Guidelines for Video -
    • The video should be in MP4 format only.
    • The file size of the video should not exceed 20 MB.
    • No special characters in the video file name apart from _ (underscore) are allowed.
    • Compress your videos through this link - https://www.ps2pdf.com/compress-mp4 
    • You can also convert your videos to MP4 format through this link - https://www.ps2pdf.com/convert-video-to-mp4
  • If you face any issues while uploading the submission, try uploading it in incognito mode.

Masterclass for Semi Finalists

  • A Masterclass will be conducted for the teams who will be shortlisted for the Semi Finale to refine their solutions.

Round 3: Semi Finale Presentation

  • Teams shortlisted for Round 3 (from both tracks) need to submit their detailed presentation before the start of this round.
  • Teams will get an opportunity to present their solutions virtually to the Senior Management of Hero MotoCorp Limited.
  • Each team will get 10 minutes to present and 5 minutes for Q&A (a total of 15 minutes).
  • All the important details will be shared with the shortlisted teams via email.

Mentorship for National Finalists

  • Top 10 National Finalists, 5 teams per track, will move ahead for Mentorship and the Grand Finale.
  • Each shortlisted team will be assigned a mentor from Hero MotoCorp's Senior Leadership for guidance, prior to the Grand Finale. This will also help the teams shape up their final presentations.

Round 4: Grand Finale

  • The shortlisted teams will be given 10 minutes to present, followed by a 5-minute Q&A round from the panel and audience in the Grand Finale to be held in Hero MotoCorp's office, Delhi/NCR.
  • Winners and Runners-up from both the tracks; Business and Engineering will receive Pre-Placement interviews (PPIs) from Hero MotoCorp. 

General Instructions for all rounds of HCC Season 10

  • Each team can upload only one submission, the size of which should not exceed 20 MB.
  • Each team needs to upload the submission for each qualified stage within the time schedule defined by Hero MotoCorp Limited.
  • Only the team leader of each team will be able to upload, view and change the submission before the submission deadline.
  • Each team has to go through the Terms & Conditions before registering for HCC Season 10.

Rewards & Prizes:

E-School Track:

  • Winner: INR 2,50,000 + Xtreme 125/Vida VX2 + Exclusive Merchandise (INR 30,000) + PPI
  • 1st Runners-Up: INR 1,50,000 + Xtreme 125/Vida VX2 + PPI
  • 2nd Runners-Up: INR 1,00,000 + PPI
  • National Finalists: PPI + Goodies + Industry Immersion with Hero MotoCorp

B-School Track:

  • Winner: INR 2,50,000 + Xtreme 125/Vida VX2 + Exclusive Merchandise (INR 30,000) + PPI
  • 1st Runners-Up: INR 1,50,000 + Xtreme 125/Vida VX2 + PPI
  • 2nd Runners-Up: INR 1,00,000 + PPI
  • National Finalists: PPI + Goodies + Industry Immersion with Hero MotoCorp

Terms & Conditions:

The participants are required to go through the following Terms & Conditions before registering for the event:

  • Your selection for any function/ department/ location shall be purely based on the company's business requirements at that particular point in time (with respect to the PPIs offered to the winners).
  • All decisions in matters of eligibility, authenticity & final judgments will be with Hero MotoCorp Limited.
  • The format, structure and timeline of events are subject to change.
  • Hero MotoCorp and its group companies may use your personal details submitted while registering for promotional purposes.
  • If a team fails to upload its submission within the prescribed timeline, Hero MotoCorp Limited holds the right to disqualify the team from the competition.
  • All your ideas/ solutions submitted for HCC Season 10 will be the property of Hero MotoCorp Limited.
  • Disputes, if any, will be subject to the jurisdiction of the courts in Delhi only.

column11: Vasantdada Patil Pratishthan's College of Engineering and Visual Arts, Sion Mumbai, Maharashtra
column45:
Quasar 4.0 is the upcoming flagship annual hackathon organized by Vasantdada Patil Pratishthan's College of Engineering and Visual Arts, set to take place on January 24-25, 2026. This event aims to unite young innovators and developers from across India to address pressing challenges in various sectors, encouraging creativity and problem-solving skills.

Key Details:

  • Terms & Conditions / Rules 
  • Hackathon is Completely Free of Cost
  • Eligibility: Inter-college/organization teams are allowed 
  • Event Dates: January 24-25, 2026
  • Prize Pool: 1,25,000
  • Format: Offline hackathon featuring multiple themes for participants to showcase their innovative solutions.

Previous Success:

  • Quasar has a strong track record of successful events. The previous edition, Quasar 3.0, has 2,000+ registrations, 700 participating teams across 200+ colleges in 81 cities and 18 states.
  • It featured a prize pool of 1,25,000, motivating participants to develop impactful solutions in areas such as Smart Education, MediTech/BioTech, Agriculture/Rural Development, and Smart Cities.
  • You can get a glimpse of earlier editions of Quasar here.
  • Follow Us On: Stay updated by following us on Instagram: @quasar_pvppcoe

column45:
Guidelines for ArthaShastra Article Submission:

  • Registration and Submission: Participants must register and submit their articles exclusively through Unstop.
  • Article Length and Format: The article must be between 500 to 1000 words and typed (not handwritten).
  • Originality and Content: Plagiarized articles will not be accepted. Articles must reflect the author's inference or opinion and should not be purely factual.
  • Prohibited Practices: Usage of AI-based software will lead to disqualification and blacklisting.
  • Source Citation: Sources used in the article must be cited.
  • Inclusion of Infographics: The inclusion of infographics, graphs, and statistics reports to support arguments is appreciated.
  • Quality of Graphics: All graphics, including images, graphs, and illustrations, should be of high quality.
  • Submission Format: Submissions must be in PDF format only, with a file size not exceeding 20 MB.
  • LinkedIn Mention: Mention your LinkedIn profile so that the top 3 performers can be tagged when the results are declared.
  • Publication in Econ 101: The best 3 articles will be published in the official magazine - Econ 101.
  • Result Declaration: Results will be declared after 31st December 2025.
  • Conflict Resolution: In case of conflicts, the decision taken by the conducting authority will be final and binding.

column45:
About the Event:

HR Bot Arena is a high-energy, fun-filled event where teams compete in six interactive games inspired by AI and HR challenges. From fast-paced coordination tasks to strategic toss-and-flip battles, participants connect, collaborate, and conquer through a series of exciting activities designed to spark teamwork, laughter, and friendly competition.

Rules and Guidelines:

  • Follow the host's instructions.
  • Only use the provided game items; no additional tools or modifications.
  • No rough play, pushing, or interfering with other teams' material.
  • Complete challenges within the given time limit.
  • Respect fellow participants.
  • Participants must maintain professionalism, respect fellow teams, and avoid disruptive behavior.
  • The decision of the judges will be final.
  • Have fun, stay energetic, and maintain good sportsmanship.

column45:
Round 1 – Neighbour Nexus:

  • The factory floor is roaring, machines are running at full capacity, and every second of downtime costs thousands.
  • A batch of newly installed machines is showing irregular readings — some harmless, some dangerous.
  • Stop failures before they stop you.

Round 2 – Forecast Frenzy:

  • “When randomness becomes your enemy... only simulation becomes your weapon.”
  • The fleet is restless. Demand is unpredictable.
  • The city never sleeps and neither can your operations.
  • Every week throws a new curveball — surges you never saw coming, dips that drain your resources.
  • You’re standing in the middle of chaos, and the only way to survive is to predict the unpredictable.

General Instructions (For all rounds):

  • Maintain the decorum of the event
  • Usage of cell phones is prohibited
  • Participants are requested not to engage in any sort of malpractice
  • No prompting/discussion is allowed

  • If any participant is found violating any of these rules, it would lead to a deduction of points

column45:
TRISHNA is The Annual Management and Cultural Fest of IBS Hyderabad. This national-level fest invites participants to tackle dynamic management challenges across Finance, Marketing, HR, Operations, simulating real-world business scenarios that foster strategic thinking and leadership. Megistanos 15.0”, the Hunt for Best Manager’ 3-day celebration of talent, creativity, passion, and some great competition. The Flagship event of our Club Sankalp.

Round 1 – Lock it In

  • Participants will face a series of everyday, practical scenarios that test their ability to make smart, balanced decisions under limited resources.

Round 2 – Work In Progress

  • Helps participants understand how resources and actions combine to create a final result.

Round 3 – The Main Character

  • Multiple unique characters will be introduced.
  • (For example – Bahubali)
  • Each character is linked to a specific company or product.
  • (For example – Cake)

Round 4 – The AI Praisal

  • Participant acts as the Boss/Manager.
  • The AI acts as the Employee asking for an appraisal.

column45:
About the Event:

  • A futuristic startup grows from scratch, powered by human intelligence and AI. Each round represents a stage of its evolution — from creation to market domination.
  • Participants play as AI Operations Strategists for a new company called “Nova Ops” competing to help it scale efficiently using OR models and AI tools.
  • It is one of the leading corporations, pioneers an AI framework known as GENESIS — an adaptive operations system capable of making end-to-end supply chain decisions without human oversight.
  • Are you ready to master the journey and leave your mark on OPSENTRIX?

General Instructions (For all rounds):

  • Maintain the decorum of the event
  • Usage of cell phones is prohibited
  • Participants are requested not to engage in any sort of malpractice
  • No prompting/discussion is allowed
  • If any participant is found violating any of these rules, it would lead to a deduction of points

Round Wise Rules and Regulations:

Round 1:

  • Instructions:
    • The dataset containing demand centers, coordinates, & weights will be provided.
    • Upload the dataset into Julius AI or ChatGPT.
  • Ask AI to:
    • Calculate the Center of Gravity
    • Interpret distance trade-offs
    • Suggest the best facility location
    • Copy AI results → build a Gamma presentation (2 slides) showing:
    • Plots of the coordinates
    • Final chosen location with justification
  • Submit both:
    • AI output screenshot/text
    • Gamma slides

Round 2:

  • Activity table (optimistic, likely, pessimistic times) will be given.
  • Upload table to ChatGPT/Julius AI.
  • Ask AI to:
    • Compute expected times (TE)
    • Draw network logic (text/diagram)
    • Identify the Critical Path
    • Flag high-risk activities
    • Use AI output to create a Gamma deck:
  • 1 slide → Project network diagram
  • 1 slide → Critical path & project duration
  • Submit AI output + Gamma slides.

Round 3:

  • A transportation matrix with supply, demand, and costs will be provided.
  • Upload matrix to ChatGPT or Julius AI.
  • Ask AI to:
  • Perform NWC
  • Perform LCM
  • Compare total costs
  • Suggest optimized allocation
  • Convert results into a Gamma presentation:
  • Slide 1 → NWC vs LCM table comparison
  • Slide 2 → AI’s optimized recommendation & cost difference
  • Submit AI outputs + Gamma deck.

Round 4:

  • You will receive Allocation, Max, and Available matrices.
  • Upload all matrices to Julius AI or ChatGPT.
  • Ask AI to:
  • Compute Need Matrix
  • Check if system is in safe state
  • Provide safe sequence if it exists
  • Explain instability if unsafe
  • Use results to create a Gamma 2-slide visual:
  • Slide 1 → Safe (or Unsafe) State Explanation
  • Slide 2 → Safe Sequence Flowchart
  • Submit AI analysis + Gamma slides.

Time Limit – (Round Wise):

  • Day 1 - Round 1 - 1.5 hours
  • Day 1 - Round 2 - 1.5 hours
  • Day 2 - Round 3 - 1.5 hours
  • Day 2 - Round 4 - 1.5 hours

column45:
LedgerLogic is a knowledge-based quiz designed by Codex Hire to assess an individual’s understanding of real-world accounting logic, financial decision-making, and accuracy in handling complex scenarios. This quiz presents advanced-level challenges that accounting professionals may face while managing records, interpreting financial data, and complying with regulations.
The questions focus on journal treatments under special cases, GST accuracy, reconciliation anomalies, accounting principles under IFRS, and use of Excel in resolving financial data inconsistencies. It’s crafted to test application, not memory.

Guidelines:
  • The quiz is individual and self-paced.
  • It contains 7 objective (MCQ) questions.
  • Time allotted: 25–30 minutes in total.
  • All questions are compulsory.
  • Participants are not allowed to use calculators or external help.
  • Open to candidates from commerce, finance, or related backgrounds.

column45:
About the Event

  • The Cryptic Hunt at Prometeo 2026 is a thrilling online puzzle-solving competition that mimics a digital treasure hunt. Participants must decipher clues, interpret hidden patterns, decode ciphers, and track digital breadcrumbs scattered across the web. 
  • Instead of simply using search engines for answers, players must combine logical reasoning, lateral thinking, curiosity, and technical intuition. The event encourages creative research strategies, resourcefulness, and pattern recognition. 
  • The hunt may involve themes related to technology, pop culture, trivia, internet artifacts, encryption, digital references, and obscure web-based hints. 

Eligibility & Team Structure

  • Participants may join in teams of 1–4 members.
  • No participant may be a member of more than one team.
  • Team switching, cross-team assistance, and sharing answers between teams is strictly prohibited. 
  • Each participant may only have one account, and multiple accounts or identity switching is not permitted.  

Format & Gameplay Mechanism

Game Access & Participation

  • The hunt is conducted entirely online, and the official website link will be provided to registered teams.
  • Teams must enter solutions into the submission window on the same page where the puzzle is displayed. 
  • Hunt duration: 24 hours from the release of the first level. 

Scoring System

  • Teams earn points for each level solved.
  • The fastest solving time per level (measured by earliest submission of any team member) is recorded.
  • Internal answer-sharing within the team is allowed, but sharing across teams is forbidden.
  • In case of tied levels solved, time acts as the tie-breaker.
  • Unlimited answer submissions are permitted as long as they are genuine attempts.
  • Brute forcing (rapid automated guessing, mass submissions) is forbidden and is designed not to work.
  • Intentional spam, system disruption, or scoreboard manipulation may lead to disqualification.
  • Time penalties may be introduced to maintain fairness if needed.  

Hint System

  • Official hints are posted at intervals on the official Discord channel.
  • Participants may ask moderators yes/no clarification questions.
  • Excessive hint requests can result in point deductions.
  • Personal/private hint requests will not be entertained, ensuring fairness.
  • Repeatedly demanding hints or negotiating for them is disallowed. 

Code of Conduct

  • Participants must uphold integrity, ethics, and fairness.
  • The following actions are strictly banned:
    • Any form of cheating or unethical exploitation
    • Obtaining answers from other teams
    • Tampering with event architecture, databases, or security (e.g., SQL injection)
    • Generating abnormal server traffic to disrupt the site
    • Manipulating the scoreboard or sabotaging other teams
  • If unsure about any action, participants should consult moderators on Discord.  

Communication

  • Discord is the official communication medium for announcements, hints, and issue reporting.
  • Participants must actively monitor the server for essential updates.
  • Queries should be directed to one moderator at a time.
  • Answers must never be shared outside the team.  

Rewards & Decisions

  • Moderators may disqualify teams at any time for rule violations.
  • All participants receive an e-certificate of participation.
  • Winning teams receive prize money and an official certificate.
  • All decisions by moderators in case of technical errors or disputes are final.   

Rulebook -    

Cryptic Hunt Rulebook

column2: Innerve X: Indias Largest Student Driven Hackathon
column45:
Key Highlights:

Event Stages:

  • 24-Hour Grand Finale: January 30 - 31st, 2026

Prize Pool:

  • 12 Lacs+ in cash prizes, exclusive merchandise, goodies, and premium services from sponsors.
  • Additional rewards for solving sponsor-introduced custom problem statements.

Themes and Challenges:

This year features nine themes including two newly added areas:

  • Web3 & Blockchain
  • Defence Systems
  • Healthcare
  • FinTech
  • Cybersecurity
  • EduTech
  • Game Development
  • AR/VR
  • Logistics

Open innovation is also encouraged; participants can submit any hardware/software projects.

Participants information:

  • Zero Registration Fee: Accessible to all, reinforcing inclusivity.
  • Free Food : Complimentary meals for all participants.
  • Free Stay: Complimentary accommodation from the night before the hackathon until the event concludes.
  • No Travel Reimbursement: Participants must manage their own travel expenses.

Core Values: Ethics and Excellence:

  • Inspired by the core values of the Indian Army: innovation grounded in responsibility and integrity.
  • Innerve X is proudly hosted at the prestigious Army Institute of Technology, an institution renowned for its discipline and values-focused education.

Networking and Career Opportunities:

  • Showcase your abilities to industry leaders.
  • Interact with expert speakers and mentors.
  • Work on real-world sponsor-based challenges for practical experience.
  • Access of exclusive internship and job opportunities.

A Growing Legacy:

  • Innerve 8: 8,000+ students from IITs, NITs, and BITS participated.
  • Innerve 9: Participation of 10,000+ students and teams, setting new benchmarks in student-driven innovation.
  • Innerve 10: Expected participation of 12,000+ participants across the country.

column45:
Overview:

K! Hacks 3.0 is a national-level hackathon organized by the CEG Tech Forum. It invites engineering students across the country to develop innovative, real-world solutions in domains such as Women Empowerment, EdTech, FinTech, Health Tech, Web3, Disaster Management, Environment & Sustainability, and Trust & Privacy.

The event consists of two rounds:

  • Round 1 – an online idea submission round
  • Round 2 – a 24-hour offline hackathon

Top-performing teams will receive exciting prizes and the opportunity to showcase their projects at Kurukshetra 2026. Participants will also gain valuable exposure, insights, and networking opportunities with industry experts and sponsors.

Tracks:

  • Women Empowerment
  • EdTech
  • FinTech
  • Health Tech
  • Web 3
  • Disaster Management
  • Environment & Sustainability
  • Trust & Privacy

Eligibility Criteria:

  • Participation is exclusively open to engineering students.
  • Idea submissions must follow the official Submission Template. (Download here)

Submission Rules:

Round 1 (Online):

  • Round 1 will be conducted completely online, with no participation fee.
  • Participants are required to submit their ideas for any problem statement relevant to the domains limited to Women Empowerment, EdTech, FinTech, Health Tech, Web 3, Disaster Management, Environment & Sustainability and Trust & Privacy on or before December 19th.
  • Submissions should strictly follow the template provided on Unstop or access it [here]. Any addition or modification to the given template is strictly prohibited.
  • The top 25 teams with the most compelling and domain-aligned ideas will be shortlisted.
  • Shortlisted teams will be announced between January 5th – 8th.
  • Results of Round 1 will be announced 15-20 days before Round 2 to ensure participants from different states can plan their journey ahead.
  • Evaluation of Round 1 will be done by multiple panels of sponsors and professors.
  • Selected teams must confirm participation within 2 days of the Round 1 result announcement.
  • Teams failing to confirm will not be considered for the finals.

Round 2 (Offline):

  • The 24-hour hackathon will be held offline on January 24th – 25th at Anna University, Chennai.
  • No registration fee is required for Round 2.
  • A fresh set of problem statements will be provided 7 days before the hackathon.
  • Teams must choose only from the official problem statements.
  • Participants should not bring existing projects from previous hackathons. If found without prior disclosure, the team will be disqualified.
  • Teams must bring their own laptops and required components.
  • Power supply and internet access will be provided.
  • Projects will be judged on innovation, implementation, impact, business value, feasibility, and presentation.
  • Jury decisions are final.

Team Rules:

  • Teams must consist of 2 to 4 members.
  • All members must be current engineering students in India.
  • Students from different engineering colleges may form a team.
  • Team changing or shuffling will not be encouraged.

 Travel and Accommodation:

  • Accommodation will be provided for the night of January 23rd, 2026.
  • Food and refreshments will be provided throughout the event.
  • Participants are expected to take care of their own travel costs.

Organizers' Decisions:

All decisions made by the organizers regarding team selection and problem statements are final. Participants may reach out to the organizers through the contact details provided.

Visit K! Hacks website for more details

column45:
About Prometeo ’26

Prometeo 2026 marks the sixth edition of IIT Jodhpur’s National Technical and Entrepreneurial Festival. Inspired by the Greek visionary Prometheus, who gifted humanity the spark of knowledge and progress, Prometeo envisions igniting innovation at scale.

It serves as a platform where ideas are shaped, technology evolves, and creativity fuels meaningful impact. With an exciting blend of talks, workshops, showcases, and competitions, Prometeo ’26 immerses participants in the vast world of emerging technologies.

In an era defined by unprecedented global challenges, Prometeo aims to foster collaboration and empower a community of problem-solvers dedicated to advancing technological excellence.
Its mission remains unwavering — to elevate, to transform, and to conquer.

About ProdPulse:

ProdPulse, the premier product management case competition of Prometeo x Econclave, brings together participants eager to explore the strategic, analytical, and creative aspects of product thinking.

The competition provides a platform to tackle real-world product challenges, encouraging structured problem-solving, deep user understanding, and innovative strategy building.

More than just a competition, ProdPulse nurtures a culture of curiosity and collaboration, motivating participants to push boundaries, experiment with ideas, and reimagine the future of product management.

Eligibility:

  • Teams of 1–4 members
  • Open to all participants, including non-students
  • Cross-institute and cross-year teams are allowed
  • Each participant may register with only one team

Rules:

Please refer to the official Rulebook for detailed guidelines and additional information.

column45:
Ideathon is a 24-hour brainstorming challenge where participants aim to develop the best possible solution to a real-world problem statement related to a business plan or product. Teams will utilize their problem-solving skills, creativity, and teamwork to devise smart and practical solutions for real-life business or product-related challenges.

Flow of Event:

  • On-the-Spot Problem Statement: The challenge kicks off with the revelation of a unique and thought-provoking problem statement, setting the stage for 24 hours of intense brainstorming.
  • Collaborative Environment: Teams will analyze, ideate, and develop a compelling solution, which they will present to a panel of esteemed judges.

Rules:

  • Participants must be from the same institute/university. Team members can belong to different programs or disciplines.
  • Each participant can register in only one team.
  • Registered teams are required to be physically present at IIT Jodhpur for the event.
  • The challenge will span 24 hours, during which the problem statement will be addressed, and the final presentation must be submitted before the deadline.
  • Solutions will be evaluated based on innovation, feasibility, and presentation quality by a distinguished panel of judges.
  • The panel’s decision will be final and binding.

Why Participate?

  • Dive into the world of design thinking and problem-solving.
  • Collaborate with like-minded innovators and strategists.
  • Gain invaluable insights and recognition from industry experts.
  • Gear up for Ideathon and showcase your ingenuity as you compete to solve challenges that demand the very best of strategy and innovation.

column11: Indian Institute of Technology (IIT), Jodhpur, Rajasthan, India
column45:
About:

Business Darbar, the flagship entrepreneurial event of Prometeo, redefines traditional pitching forums by offering a vibrant platform where aspiring entrepreneurs showcase their ventures to a distinguished panel of investors. This event goes beyond mere presentations, providing participants with constructive feedback, mentorship, and the chance to secure vital funding. More than just an event, Business Darbar serves as a hub where innovative ideas meet strategic guidance, empowering startups to scale new heights. Join us in this epicenter of entrepreneurial excellence, where innovation meets opportunity, fostering a thriving ecosystem for the next generation of successful entrepreneurs.

Vision:

Business Darbar envisions empowering young entrepreneurs by providing essential mentorship to address challenges and avoid critical mistakes that could hinder their ventures. By spotlighting India's innovative startups, the event offers a platform for founders to showcase their ideas, pitch to investors, and receive valuable guidance. It strives to foster a thriving ecosystem where entrepreneurial ideas can grow with expert mentorship and strategic support.

Event Tracks (Rounds):

  • Participants must submit their pitch deck during registration.
  • Shortlisted participants will receive information about their pitching slots and other details from Team Prometeo.
  • Startups will be given a designated time slot to pitch their business to the panel and present their investment needs.

General Rules and Guidelines:

  • Startups at any stage—whether in the ideation phase, MVP, PMF, etc.—are welcome to participate.
  • All details shared during pitching and demonstrations must be accurate and consistent with the information provided during registration.
  • Healthy communication and open discussions are encouraged throughout the event.
  • Participants should remain motivated and enthusiastic, engaging freely with the panelists.

Finance Club of Army Institute of Management, Kolkata (AIMK) organising a Stock Analyst Guru, Participate in an exciting 2-day Mock Stock Challenge on StockGro from 23th December to 24th December.

  • Test your trading skills, compete with fellow participants, and aim for the top of the leaderboard.
  • The event will be officially hosted on Unstop, and registration on Stockgro both platforms is mandatory.
  • Showcase your strategy, learn the markets, and stand a chance to win exciting recognition and rewards.
  • Winner's should upload the certificate & write a testimonial or video testimonial and Tag " Stockgro & Army Institute of Management" 

Guidelines:

  • Participants must register on both Unstop and StockGro to be eligible.
  • Only individual participation is allowed.
  • The challenge will run from 23th December (9:30 hrs) to 24th December (15:25 hrs).
  • All trading activity must be conducted solely within the StockGro platform using virtual funds.
  • Download Stockgro App using this Link : https://stockgro.onelink.me/vNON/h05qemdfWhat
  • Stockgro Register Link  :  https://tinyurl.com/StockGroRegister
  • Login using registered mobile number.
  • Go to trackers -> you will find Event Portfolio here. Please make sure your StockGro app is updated or else this will not be visible to you.
  • For Further Updates Join Official WhatsApp Group: link Below 
  • Open the Event Portfolio and start building your portfolio.

Rules:

  • Winners will be determined based on the final portfolio value, number of trades, risk taken at event.
  • Any attempt to manipulate trades, exploit platform bugs, or use multiple accounts will result in disqualification.
  • The winner must post a LinkedIn update about their experience and tag the organisers and platforms as specified.
  • Organisers reserve the right to modify timelines, rules, or prize-related details if required.
  • All decisions by the organising committee will be final and binding.
  • Whatsapp Link

column2: Call for Entries, Ramjas Economic Review (ISSN 2582-6093) Volume VIII
column45:
Ramjas Economic Review, a peer-reviewed, international academic journal, invites undergraduate students to write and submit original research papers and articles on topics related to the field of economics to be published in its 2025-26 edition. In such a brief existence, the journal has attracted entries from across India and from many eminent universities in other parts of South Asia. Previously the journal has published interviews of eminent economists such as Parthasarathy Shome, Jean Dréze, Devashish Mitra and many more.

General  Guidelines:

The following guidelines are to be strictly followed:

  • Format: Submissions should be provided in both pdf and word document format. The font sizes to be followed are 16 point for heading, 14 point for subheadings, 12 point for text and 10 forfootnotes. The font style must be Times New Roman. Line spacing should be 1.5 for the textand 1.0 for the footnotes and endnotes. The name of the file should be in the format “FirstNameLastName- PaperTitle.”
  • All figures and tables should be embedded within the text. They should be numbered and labelled properly along with the source. Numbering of figures and tables to start from 1 for each section/subsection (For eg., 2nd table/figure in the 3rd subsection of the 1st section
    numbered as 1.3.2). Equations and formulas should be numbered as well.
  • The cover page should include the name of the author, name of institution, title, course, year of study, contact number and email-id.
  • Please ensure that the language is configured to UK English throughout your paper.
  • The email should have the subject “Submission 2026” and the contact numbers of all authors. Additionally, mention whether you would like to present your paper at the Annual Winter Conference’s Paper Presentation Competition hosted by the Department of Economics, Ramjas College or not.
  • Citation: For the purpose of citations, strictly adhere to Chicago style referencing. References provided in any other formats are not entertained. In-text citations also have to be formatted in Chicago style and not to be kept as footnotes. Please refer to RER VOL. VII in the website for examples.
  • Plagiarism and AI: The act of plagiarism and employing AI for any form of writing is strictly forbidden, and any such actions will result in the entry being rejected.
  • Copyright: Authors whose paper gets selected will be required to fill a copyright form to be sent separately to them.
  • Only original and unpublished entries from undergraduate students will be considered for
    publication.
  • Papers that have 1-3 authors will be accepted and considered. However, the maximum number of co-authors for a submission should not exceed 3.

Specific Guidelines for Research Papers:

  • Word Limit: The maximum word count is up to 5500-6000 words.
  • Abstract: Submissions under this category must include an abstract of 250-300 words, comprising of a brief description of the hypothesis, research methodology and tools used, coverage of the data (countries/states/data collection units, etc., and time period), summary of the results and contribution to the existing literature.
  • Introduction: A general overview of the research topic, its background, the question of the need for research in this field, the outcome of the research and the structure of the paper, are to be addressed in this section.
  • Literature Review: Aspects such as the evolution of theory/thought/responses to a topic and personal reaction or thoughts on the same are to be covered in this section. Additionally, critical analysis of selected documents of existing literature on the research topic, with relevant references wherever applicable are to be included.
  • Numbering: All sections and subsections must be clearly numbered using Arabic numbers i.e. Section 1, 1.1 and so on. Sub-sub headings are also allowed (numbered 1.1.1). Subsequent subsections beyond sub-sub headings are not allowed. Tables and figures in Appendix must be numbered A-1, A-2 and so on.
  • Methodology: Research methodology, techniques used, sampling methods, data sources and related aspects are to be included here.
  • Conclusion: This section should include the conclusion drawn from the research, together with relevant charts and tables. Topics such as limitations and scope for further research in the area too should find a mention here.
  • References: A list of all works (including the works highlighted in the literature review) must be cited in the paper. Strictly follow the Chicago style referencing format.
  • For research articles: Refer to the general guidelines mentioned above and strictly adhere to the word limit of 2000 words.

column45:
The Finance and Investment Club, IIM Rohtak invites articles from all Business Schools and Corporates across India for its monthly magazine Arbitrage.

Theme:

  • The article must be original and related to finance and economics

Prizes:

  • The ‘Article of the Month’ and the second-best article will be honored with e-certificates
  • Apart from the magazine, selected articles will also be published on the club’s official website

Rules:

  • Deadline for submission: 30th December 2025
  • Topic: Contemporary Topics in Finance and Economics
  • File format: .doc or .docx only (PDF files not accepted)
  • Font: Times New Roman
  • Font size: 12
  • File naming convention: Author 1_Author 2_Institute Name.doc/.docx
  • Members must be from the same institution
  • Number of authors: Maximum of 2 persons
  • Word limit: 750 to 1250 words
  • Articles must be original and free from plagiarism or AI generation

Note:

  • All sources and references for external data or images must be properly cited
  • Articles must be submitted through this link.

Result:

  • Results will be declared on 31st December 2025

column45:
Revive Quest is a dynamic business innovation challenge where teams step into the shoes of turnaround strategists. Your mission is to take charge of a once-promising company that has collapsed and bring it back to life. Participants will analyse the company’s downfall, rethink its business model, and craft a bold revival strategy suited to newage market disruptions. By leveraging hindsight, creativity, and smart execution, teams will showcase their techno-entrepreneurial mindset and prove how the company can rise again, stronger than ever.

Eligibility:

  • Teams must consist of 2 to 5 members.
  • A student may participate in only one team.
  • Cross-institute teams are allowed.
  • Cross-year collaboration is allowed.
  • Any deviation from these guidelines will result in immediate disqualification.

Competition Structure:

Part 1 – Distribution:

A failed business/company will be allotted to all teams, along with detailed insights about the changed market conditions in which the revival has to happen.
The competition may feature surprise market shifts introduced mid-event. If activated, they will be applied uniformly to all teams and will assess how quickly and strategically participants can adapt their revival plan.

Part 2 – Preparation:

Teams will receive 3.5 hours to:

  • Research the allotted failed business case,
  • Analyse the reasons behind its downfall,
  • Design a fresh and feasible alternative business model,
  • And explain how that model strategically transforms the company in the current competitive scenario.

This is your window to think, analyse, innovate, and plan.

Part 3 – Presentation

Each team will get 10 minutes to pitch their revival model and justify its adaptability in front of the jury.
This will be followed by a 4-minute interactive Q&A where judges will question, challenge, and evaluate the depth of your understanding and strategic reasoning.

Rules & Guidelines

  • Originality First: Plagiarism is strictly prohibited. All external content, market data, and research insights must be credited properly.
  • Tech Focus: The proposed business model must reflect innovative and relevant use of modern technology wherever applicable.
  • Time Discipline: Teams must strictly follow event timings and presentation slots.
  • Final Authority: The judges’ decision will be final and binding on all participants.

column45:
Overview:

  • Trade Tussle is a dynamic trading competition based on paper trading in the Indian equity market.
  • Participants trade virtually using the top 500 BSE stocks.
  • Objective: Maximize profits within the given time frame.
  • Focus areas include:
  • Strategic decision-making
  • Risk management
  • Market trend analysis
  • Provides a realistic yet risk-free environment to test trading strategies.
  • Ideal for tech enthusiasts, finance learners, and quant enthusiasts.
  • Note: The trading market may change based on organizers’ discretion and will be communicated beforehand.

Guidelines:

  • Open to all individuals interested in stock trading and the Indian equity market.
  • No prior experience required, but basic stock market knowledge is recommended.
  • Team size: 1–4 members.
  • Inter-college teams allowed.
  • Teams may include students from different colleges or institutes.
  • Participants must belong to a recognized engineering college/institute.

Rules:

  • Participants must refer to the official rulebook for complete rules and detailed information.

column45:
BizQuiz is an on-campus business and entrepreneurship quiz designed to test how well students understand the world of startups, innovation, markets, and modern business strategy. The event gives participants a chance to think like entrepreneurs—spotting opportunities, analysing business models, understanding funding, and keeping up with rapidly changing market trends.

More than a quiz, BizQuiz encourages quick thinking, teamwork, and the ability to make decisions under pressure. It’s a great platform for anyone curious about how startups grow, how founders think, and how businesses respond to real challenges.

Event Type: Offline (On-campus)

Registration: both on Unstop and On-site

Duration: 3 hours

Venue: IIT Jodhpur (Second Day of PROMETEO)

Round 1: Qualifier (Screening Round)

  • Format: Written quiz consisting of 20 multiple-choice questions (MCQs).
  • Focus: Startups, Business Awareness, Marketing, Strategy, and Corporate Affairs.
  • The top-performing teams from this round will qualify for the final stage.
  • Scores from this round will not carry forward to the next stage.

Round 2: Final Round (Buzzer Round + Rapid Fire)

  • Format: Live quiz round with a buzzer system.
  • Includes audio-visual questions, rapid response segments, and situational case questions.
  • Duration: ~90 minutes.
  • The top-scoring team wins the title of BizQuiz Champions.

Rules and Guidelines:

  • Team Size: 2-4 participants per team.
  • Cross-College Participation: Not permitted.
  • Cross-Year Participation: Allowed.
  • Participants can represent different academic programs within the same institution.
  • An individual can register through a single team only; multiple entries are not allowed.
  • No external reference materials are allowed during the quiz.
  • Electronic devices must be completely switched off.
  • Any form of academic misconduct will result in immediate disqualification.
  • The organizing committee reserves the final decision-making authority.
  • Precise scoring mechanism will be communicated during the event briefing.
  • Tie-breaker protocols will be established and announced.
  • Scoring is transparent and based on objective criteria.
  • Any unsportsmanlike conduct may lead to team disqualification.
  • Comprehensive prize structure for top-performing teams.
  • Event details are subject to final modification.
  • Participants will be notified of any changes promptly.
  • The organizing committee's interpretation of rules is final.
Quiz Content Focus Areas:
  • Business Strategy
  • Financial Management
  • Marketing Principles
  • Global Business Trends
  • Entrepreneurship
  • Current Economic Scenarios
  • Corporate Governance
  • Innovation and Technology in Business

column11: Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) Jodhpur, Jodhpur, Rajasthan, India
column45:
Overview:

  • Teams solve real-world business problems through field research.
  • Participants conduct business interviews and validate problem statements.
  • Teams design innovative business models and present them in a 10-slide pitch deck.
  • The challenge runs 36 hours live at the IIT Jodhpur Campus.

Rounds:

Online Round:

  • A Problem Statement related to end-to-end business planning will be provided.
    Participants must analyse it and submit their preliminary business plan.
    All submissions for this round will be made via Unstop only.

Offline Rounds:

Round 1:

  • Teams create a brief document file outlining how they plan to design a business plan for the given problem.

Round 2:

  • Selected teams present their detailed business plan to the judges.

Eligibility:

  • Teams may have up to three members.
  • Open to all UG and PG students across India.
  • Ideal for students interested in entrepreneurship and business planning.

Rules & Guidelines:

  • Team members can be from different programs and institutes.
  • A participant can register with only one team.
  • The business plan must include:
    • Company Overview
    • Products & Services
    • Marketing Strategy
    • Operations
    • Financial Summary
  • Document submission word limit: 500–800 words.
  • Final presentation length: 6 minutes max.
  • Presentation file may be of any length as required.
  • Judging will be based on the final presentation.
  • Content must be unique and strictly relevant to the provided problem statement.
  • Plagiarism or unfair practices will result in disqualification and penalties.
  • Decisions made by the judging panel are final.

column45:
Rule Book:

Rule_Book_Robo_Soccer

Event Format:

  • The event will be conducted offline over 1–2 days at indian Institute of Technology, Jodhpur as a part of Prometeo, the Techfest of IIT Jodhpur (16th to 18th January, 2026)

Team & Robot Specifications:

  • Each team may have 2 or 3 robots (wired or wireless):
  • 1 Defender robot
  • Max dimensions: ≤ 30 cm
  • 1 or 2 Attacker robots
  • Max dimensions: ≤ 25 cm
  • Total combined weight of all robots must not exceed 10 kg.
  • No external weights allowed.
  • All robots must be designed, built, and assembled only by the participants.
  • Outsourced, ready-to-assemble, or plagiarized robots are strictly prohibited.
  • Battery voltage limit: ≤ 16V per robot.

Arena Rules:

  • The arena includes two goals and a central white circle for ball placement.
  • The defender robot cannot cross its own half of the arena.
  • Attacker and defender robots are non-interchangeable during the match.

Robot Restrictions:

  • Robots must not emit infrared light or create magnetic interference.
  • Minor reflective IR components allowed only if they don’t affect others.
  • All electrical connections must have proper insulation to prevent hazards.
  • Activation of robots allowed only:
  • Inside the arena/testing zone, or
  • With organiser’s approval.

Team Responsibilities:

Teams must carry:

  • Extra batteries
  • Spare components
  • Tapes
  • Tools for quick repairs
  • Fixing/repairing robots allowed:
  • Before or after the match, or
  • During approved technical breaks only.

Actions Considered Fouls:

  • Kicking/throwing the ball outside the arena.
  • Damaging the arena or intentionally damaging opponent robots.
  • Aggressive or offensive behaviour.
  • Defender robot crossing its designated half.
  • Cross-teaming or mutual fixing between teams can cause direct disqualification.

Penalty System:

  • 1st to 3rd foul: Warnings
  • 4th foul: Disqualification
  • Every foul results in a restart from default positions.

Winning Criteria:

  • The team with the maximum goals at the end of playtime wins.
  • If the match ends in a tie:
  • An additional round is played.
  • First goal wins (Sudden Death).

column45:
Rulebook:

https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1O4LMRKVAL3ndvMrwWSeT2scpukoEdZOe?usp=drive_link

About Prometeo:

  • Prometeo 2026 is the sixth edition of IIT Jodhpur’s National Technical & Entrepreneurial Festival.
  • Features a blend of competitions, workshops, and talks centered around emerging technologies.
  • Aims to promote collaboration, innovation, and impactful problem-solving.
  • Provides a platform for students to explore ideas, experiment with technology, and contribute to future advancements.

About Designathon:

  • A fast-paced 12-hour design sprint, one of Prometeo’s flagship creative events.
  • Participants create a complete end-to-end design solution within the given time.
  • The problem statement is revealed at the start of the event.
  • Encourages creativity under pressure, originality, and multidisciplinary thinking.

What Participants Must Create:

Logo Design:

  • A meaningful and theme-based logo representing the product or concept.

UI/UX Design:

  • Detailed app or website designs with polished mockups.
  • Must reflect user-centered thinking and aesthetic clarity.

3D Models (if required):

  • For visualizing product features or interaction elements.

Additional Assets:

  • Any extra components requested in the prompt or created to enhance the concept.

Eligibility:

  • Open to students from any institute across India.
  • Teams must consist of 3–5 members.
  • Cross-institute teams allowed.
  • A participant cannot be part of more than one team.

Submission Guidelines:

Presentation

  • A well-structured, professionally crafted presentation.
  • Must be uploaded to Behance and the Behance link included in the Drive folder.

Component Files (ZIP Folder)

  • All source files, design elements, and assets.
  • Files must be neatly organized, compressed, and consistent in format.

Evaluation Criteria:

  • Creativity: Originality and innovative thinking.
  • Feasibility: Practicality and viability of the solution.
  • Clarity: How clearly the design communicates the concept.
  • Plagiarism Check: Strict scrutiny; copied work results in disqualification.

Rules & Ethics:

  • Plagiarism, outsourcing, cheating, or collusion is strictly banned.
  • Violations lead to immediate disqualification.
  • Judges’ decisions are final and binding.

column45:
About Prometeo: Prepare yourself for an unforgettable expedition as IIT Jodhpur proudly presents Prometeo 2026, our annual celebration of technology, creativity, and engineering excellence! Inspired by the foresight of Prometheus, this edition continues to spark innovation, ignite curiosity, and foster a thriving community of creators and problem solvers. 

As part of this grand celebration, RC Racing returns with an electrifying fusion of speed, precision, and engineering mastery challenging participants to design, build, and race high performance electric RC cars on a dynamic, obstacle filled track.

Problem Statement: RC Racing Rulebook

Event Highlights: RC Racing is an adrenaline-filled racing event where teams bring their electric, wireless remote-controlled cars and battle it out on a challenging race track designed to test skill, precision, and control.

  • Only electric RC cars are allowed for this competition.
  • Participants will compete in a team-based format, where each team has a driver and a marshal.
  • The event will follow multiple stages spread across two days, including time trials, heats, and a final race, depending on the number of participants.
  • The track will feature sharp turns, mixed terrains, ramps and obstacles, ensuring an exciting and unpredictable racing experience.
  • Competitors must showcase driving accuracy, quick decision-making, and smart race strategies to claim victory.
  • Performance will be judged based on speed, lap completion time, and overall race discipline.
