column45:
About Prometeo: Prometeo 2026 marks the sixth installment of IIT Jodhpur’s National Technical and Entrepreneurial Festival. Deriving its name and vision from the Greek fore-thinker Prometheus, who imparted the knowledge of technology and civilization to humanity, Prometeo aspires to elevate innovation, channeling creative ideas towards an enhanced impact at the forefront of progress. It features a dynamic blend of talks, workshops, and competitions that immerse participants in the vast world of emerging technology. In an age marked by formidable challenges confronting humanity, Prometeo aims to foster collaboration and nurture a community of innovators contributing to the world's technological prowess to overcome, for its ultimate goal is to elevate, transform and conquer.

Event Overview: Tech Trivia at Prometeo 2026 is a two-round quiz competition designed to challenge and test participants’ knowledge across diverse technology disciplines. This event is an exciting and intellectually stimulating platform for students to push the limits of their technical know-how and quizzing skills. The competition blends fun with challenge, enabling participants to engage deeply while competing to be among the top tech minds.

Rulebook for the quiz

Eligibility and Team Formation: Teams can consist of a maximum of three members, with no limit on how many teams a single college can send. All rounds are held offline on-site at the event. The first round, a pen-and-paper prelim, filters the top 8 teams who then advance to the final round. The final round’s format and specific question types are revealed by Quiz Masters on the day of the event, adding an element of surprise and adaptability to the contest.

Competition Format and Rules:

  • Round 1 (Prelims): This is a pen-and-paper round consisting of 20 questions. Each question has a time limit of 30 to 60 seconds according to its difficulty. Teams are scored by the number of correct answers. Strict adherence to the code of conduct is required, with any violation leading to disqualification.
  • Round 2 (Final): All members of the qualifying top 8 teams compete, with the detailed structure and rounds of questioning announced during the event by the Quiz Masters. The decision of the Quiz Master is final in any dispute or ambiguity.
  • The organizing committee holds the right to disqualify teams violating decorum or using unfair means, ensuring fair play throughout the competition.

Why Participate?

Tech Trivia offers a unique opportunity for students to showcase and sharpen their technical knowledge under pressure, engage with peers from across institutes, and demonstrate quick thinking and problem-solving in tech-themed questions. It is ideal for those passionate about emerging technology fields and eager to test their competence against a competitive cohort. With the thrill of a live quiz format and the prestige of competing at IIT Jodhpur’s premier festival, this event is designed to inspire and challenge the brightest minds in technology.

column45:
Event Type: Online Hackathon

Team Size: 2-5 Members

Event Timeline: 25-30 December

About the Event:

  • Get ready to embark on a coding marathon where innovation meets real-world problem-solving! DevQuest is the flagship development hackathon of Prometeo '26, IIT Jodhpur’s National Technical and Entrepreneurial Festival.
  • In this thrilling online challenge, developers, designers, and engineers will come together to build impactful web or mobile applications that tackle modern-day technological challenges. Whether you are a backend wizard or a frontend artist, this is your stage to ideate, design, code, and deploy solutions that "Innovate, Implement, Improve".

Competition Structure & Format

  • Mode: Onlie Team Event.
  • Challenge: Teams must build a web or mobile application aligned with a problem statement released prior to the event.
  • Deliverables: Participants must submit the source code and a presentation covering the tech stack, solution walkthrough, scalability, and future scope.

Key Rules & Guidelines:

  • Fresh Code Only: The solution must be developed entirely during the hackathon. Pre-developed work without significant new additions is disqualified.
  • Open Source: All software dependencies must be open-source or properly licensed.For more information, refer the rule book for clarification or contact the organizers :

  • As part of our ongoing collaboration with Devdock.AI, every participant is required to complete the registration process by following the steps provided in the document. This will help us streamline technical access, ensure authentication, and enable smooth coordination for upcoming activities. (Also this is an important criteria for participating and only participants who have successfully completed the Devdock registration and have been verified will be eligible to apply for the hackathon.)

    What you need to do (In detail instructions provided in the doc):
    1 Download the Devdock extension
    2 Sign up using your GitHub account
    3 Follow the instructions in the this PDF 
    4 Upload your screenshot in the Google Form

    Google Form

    Your quick response is important — please complete the process at the earliest!
    If you face any issues, feel free to reach out. Let’s get this done together!

    If you have any doubts contact:
    8269928840
    Atharva Waghmare

Access the rulebook here : Rulebook Link
(Typo in rulebook : The event is ONLINE)

column45:
Opportunity Description: Battle of Traders is an engaging and competitive paper-trading event where participants test their trading skills using virtual capital on the top 200 stocks of the Indian equity market. The competition is designed to assess analytical thinking, risk management, decision-making, and strategy formulation in a realistic, market-like environment.

Eligibility:

  • Open to students from any recognized college/institute.
  • No prior trading experience required; basic stock market understanding is recommended.
  • Team size: 1–4 members.
  • Inter-college teams allowed — members may be from different colleges.

Event Structure:

Round 1 – Online (Paper Trading)

Dates: 1st January 2026 – 7th January 2026 (EOD)

  • Participants will paper-trade for one week using the top 200 stocks of the Indian stock market.
  • A commission fee of 0.03% will be applied to every successful order.
  • Goal: Maximize virtual profits by making strategic and well-timed trades.
  • Only top-performing traders with the highest profits move to Round 2.

Round 2 – Offline (Strategy Presentation)

Date: 17th January 2026

  • Shortlisted teams present their trading strategies, analysis, and trade logic used in Round 1.
  • Participants must justify their decisions using market analysis, risk management, and reasoning.
  • Judges may ask follow-up questions.
  • The best 3 presenters will be declared winners.

Judging Criteria:

  • Profitability in Round 1.
  • Quality of strategy & rationale behind trades.
  • Presentation clarity, structure, and depth.
  • Creativity & innovation in market analysis and approach.

Rules:

Round 1:

  • Only virtual trading allowed; no real-money trades.
  • Trading must be done strictly within the given timeline.
  • Only top 200 Indian market stocks can be used for trading.
  • Any unethical behavior or platform manipulation leads to immediate disqualification.

Round 2:

  • Participants must present the logic and strategy used in Round 1.
  • Presentation must include market analysis, risk management, and reasoning.
  • Judges may question participants on their decisions.

General Guidelines:

  • Judges’ decision will be final and binding.
  • Organizers reserve the right to modify rules, timelines, or structure if required.
  • Any violation of rules will result in disqualification.

Contact Organizers:

  • Priyanshu Khedekar – +91 8770814619
  • Mistry Heril Nileshkumar – +91 8320743025

RuleBook

column45:
About Prometeo:

Prepare yourself for an unforgettable expedition as IIT Jodhpur proudly presents Prometeo 2026, the sixth edition of our national celebration of technology, creativity, and entrepreneurship! Inspired by the spirit of Prometheus the bringer of knowledge this year’s fest aims to elevate innovation and empower creators across India. Prometeo 2026 brings together brilliant minds through talks, workshops, and competitions designed to spark imagination and push the boundaries of what is technologically possible.

ML Codefest – Event Overview:

What comes to mind when you hear “Artificial Intelligence” and “Machine Learning”?A future where technology learns, evolves, and transforms the world?

Welcome to ML Codefest — a thrilling ML hackathon where innovation meets competition! Challenge yourself, collaborate with brilliant minds, and build impactful real-world solutions through machine learning. Dive into 24 hours of creativity, problem-solving, and cutting-edge tech excitement.

Join us at ML Codefest and unleash your potential!

Rulebook 

Instructions

Note: Please ensure you complete the registration process and fill the form as described in the Instructions PDF attached. This step is mandatory for your registration to be counted and verified.

column45:
Event Description: The 5-Minute Presentation Competition is a flagship event under Prometeo 2026, IIT Jodhpur’s national technical and entrepreneurial festival. Rooted in the spirit of Prometheus, the bringer of knowledge, this competition celebrates ideas that push humanity forward. Participants will distill years of research, a project, or an impactful innovation into a power-packed 5-minute narrative that is clear, compelling, and grounded in real-world relevance. The goal is simple: communicate the essence of your work so effectively that it inspires, informs, and leaves a strong impression on the audience and judges.

This event invites thinkers, builders, and innovators to showcase how their work solves meaningful problems, contributes to society, or transforms existing systems. Whether your idea is futuristic, practical, research-driven, or experimental, the platform rewards clarity, creativity, and impact. Presentations beyond the suggested themes are welcome, and truly unconventional topics earn extra credit for originality and bold thinking.

Guidelines:

Eligibility:

  • Participation is open in teams of 1 to 4 members.
  • Inter-college teams are allowed.
  • Inter-specialization teams are allowed, encouraging diverse and interdisciplinary collaboration.

Themes (Recommended): Participants may present on any of the following:

  • AI for social good
  • Machine learning for real-world problems
  • Generative AI
  • AR/VR
  • IoT & smart living
  • Robotics for daily life
  • Sustainable energy
  • Genetics & biotech innovations
  • Healthcare for all
  • Climate-change technology
  • Inclusive education tools

Innovative topics outside these themes are also encouraged.

Format:

  • Each team gets exactly 5 minutes to present.
  • The timer begins the moment the presentation starts.
  • Participants must stop immediately once time runs out; exceeding the limit incurs penalties.

Judging Criteria:

  • Clarity of message: how effectively the core idea is communicated.
  • Real-world impact: the usefulness, relevance, and significance of the work.
  • Innovative approach: creativity, originality, and novelty in problem-solving.

Duration of Rounds:

  • Single round, 5 minutes per team.
  • Q&A may be included depending on organizers’ discretion.

Rules:

  • Participants must maintain discipline and professionalism throughout the event.
  • Any disturbance to the event environment may lead to immediate disqualification.
  • Cooperation, respect, and a positive research atmosphere are strongly encouraged.
  • All deadlines, instructions, and guidelines issued by the organizing team must be followed strictly.
  • The judges’ and organizers’ decisions are final and binding.
  • The organizing team reserves the right to modify rules or judging criteria if required.

Please find the rulebook here

column45:
About Prometeo: Prometeo 2026 marks the sixth installment of IIT Jodhpur's National Technical and Entrepreneurial Festival. Deriving its name and vision from the Greek fore-thinker “Prometheus”,who imparted the knowledge of technology and civilization to humanity, Prometeo aspires to elevate innovation, channeling creative ideas towards an enhanced impact at the forefront of progress. It features a dynamic blend of talks, workshops, and competitions that immerse participants in the vast world of emerging technology. In an age marked by formidable challenges confronting humanity, Prometeo aims to foster collaboration and nurture a community of innovators contributing to the world’s technological prowess to overcome, for its ultimate goal is to elevate, transform and conquer.

About the Event: CADastra is typically a CAD-based technical design event where participants use Computer-Aided Design software  to solve engineering design challenges. It tests creativity, drafting accuracy, 3D visualization skills, and real-world problem-solving abilities—similar to design tasks done in engineering and product development.

Event Details:
 
  • Duration: 12 to 24 Hours
  • Team Size: 1 to 4 Members
  • Eligibility: All participants must be students currently enrolled in an undergraduate degree program.

Instructions:

Every team must submit their design in the following formats:

  • AutoCAD File with extension .dwg, .iges, .sldprt, or .sldasm (for assemblies).
  • All work should be done during the event hours.
  • CAD files must be compatible with SolidWorks for easy access by the organizers.

Video Submissions:

  • A short 50-second video showing the team performing the design task live during the event.
  • An 8-minute presentation video explaining the design, its functionality, and the thought process behind the design. Submit the video via a drive folder or a YouTube link.

Rules:

  • All work should be completed during the event timeframe.
  • Teams must adhere to the time limit (3 days from the start of the event). Late submissions will not be accepted.
  • Organizers reserve the right to disqualify teams for breaking competition rules, unsportsmanlike behavior, or failure to meet the competition's standards.

Important Notes:

  • Teams are encouraged to be creative in their approach.
  • Teams will be judged based on the originality, feasibility, and technical sophistication of their designs.

Remember: Make sure your files are compatible with SolidWorks and uploaded on time to be eligible for judging.

Problem Statement will be released on January 9th and submission deadline will be January 10th EOD

Rulebook of Event

column45:
About Prometeo: Prepare yourself for an unforgettable expedition as IIT Jodhpur proudly presents Prometeo 2026, the sixth edition of our national celebration of technology, creativity, and entrepreneurship! Inspired by the spirit of Prometheus the bringer of knowledge this year’s fest aims to elevate innovation and empower creators across India. Prometeo 2026 brings together brilliant minds through talks, workshops, and competitions designed to spark imagination and push the boundaries of what is technologically possible.
This year’s Game Jam invites participants to immerse themselves in a world where artistic expression, engineering skill, and high level problem solving converge to build interactive experiences from the ground up.

Problem Statement:

GameJam Rulebook

Guidelines:

  • A platform where you will build a complete game from scratch during the jam using the themes and technical challenges mentioned in the rulebook.
  • Open to all students, startups, independent creators, and professional developers passionate about game development and interactive media.
  • Team-based participation only. Individuals cannot register alone.
  • Teams may consist of 4 to 15 members, and each participant may join only one team.
  • Ideal team composition includes game designers, programmers, artists, animators, sound designers, writers, and technical developers.
  • Use of any game engine or programming language is allowed, provided the final game is playable and all external assets used are properly credited as per the rulebook.
  • A short video pitch explaining your idea must be submitted before development begins, followed later by a demo video along with the final submission.

column45:
About Prometeo: Prometeo 2026 marks the sixth installment of IIT Jodhpur's National Technical and Entrepreneurial Festival. Deriving its name and vision from the Greek fore-thinker “Prometheus”,who imparted the knowledge of technology and civilization to humanity, Prometeo aspires to elevate innovation, channeling creative ideas towards an enhanced impact at the forefront of progress. It features a dynamic blend of talks, workshops, and competitions that immerse participants in the vast world of emerging technology. In an age marked by formidable challenges confronting humanity, Prometeo aims to foster collaboration and nurture a community of innovators contributing to the world’s technological prowess to overcome, for its ultimate goal is to elevate, transform and conquer.

About the Event: Boat Racing is a thrilling competition where teams build and battle custom robots, testing their engineering skills and strategy in intense combat. This is thrilling event where teams propel sleek, fast-moving boats across water courses using strength, coordination, and strategy. Precise teamwork and timing are crucial, as even slight mistakes can cost victory. The cheering crowd and high-energy atmosphere make these races exciting to watch. Boat racing celebrates endurance, unity, and the spirit of competition.

Guidelines:

  • Only wireless robots are allowed in the event.
  • A team must have a minimum of 3 members.
  • There is no bound on a number of teams per college.
  • All rounds will be conducted at the Indian Institute of Technology, Jodhpur.
  • Everyone can apply.

Rules:

  • All rules are mentioned in rulebook.
  • Rulebook maybe changed as and when required. Please always refer to the latest rulebook.

RuleBook

column45:
Problem Statement:

Wire Wizards Rulebook

Guidelines:

Theme & Objective:

  • The competition focuses on creating hardware solutions using Arduino and sensors.
  • Solutions must target one or more of the following domains: Healthcare, IoT, Automation.
  • Participants must design circuits and propose a meaningful real-world application.

Eligibility:

  • Only students are allowed to participate.
  • Students from any institution may join.
  • Inter-college teams are allowed. Inter-specialization/branch teams are allowed.
  • Teams must consist of 2 to 5 members.
  • Every team must choose an appropriate team name which cannot be changed later.

Team Representative Requirements:

  • Each team must appoint a Team Representative (Leader) during registration.
  • The representative handles all communication with organizers.
  • They must provide valid contact details (mobile number, email).
  • They must also submit college details for each team member.

Event Structure:

  • The event has two rounds: Online Submission Round and Offline Round at IIT Jodhpur.

Online Submission Round:

  • Teams must submit a PDF report before the deadline (16th January, 23:59 IST).
  • Late submissions are accepted with a 5% penalty.
  • The report must include:
  • Problem description and how the solution addresses it
  • Detailed technical explanation
  • Hardware and software components list
  • Step-by-step user guide
  • Optional Tinkercad model (bonus points)

Offline Round (16–19 January at IIT Jodhpur):

  • Shortlisted teams present their hardware prototypes to judges.
  • Teams must bring all necessary hardware components themselves (Arduino, sensors, modules).
  • IIT Jodhpur does not provide any hardware.

Judging Criteria:

  • Projects are evaluated on:
  • Innovation and creativity
  • Quality of deliverables
  • Quality and clarity of the demo
  • Relevance and alignment with the event’s problem statement
  • Judging criteria may undergo slight changes at organizers’ discretion.

Important Notes:

  • The online round is purely qualifying—only genuine reports are considered for the final stage.
  • The final offline round requires physical presence at IIT Jodhpur.
  • The report must follow all guidelines strictly to remain valid.

Rules:

Original Work Requirement:

  • All tasks, submissions, and hardware work must be completed solely by participants.
  • Outsourcing, external assistance, or third-party involvement is strictly forbidden.

Ethical Conduct:

  • No cheating, match-fixing, plagiarism, or manipulation is allowed.
  • Any unethical behavior results in immediate consequences.

Disqualification Policy:

  • Discovery of unethical conduct leads to instant disqualification, regardless of justification offered.
  • Disqualification decisions are irreversible.

Final Authority:

  • Judges’ decisions are final and binding.
  • No appeals, re-evaluations, or reconsideration requests will be entertained.

Submission Integrity:

  • Only teams submitting an authentic, complete report are eligible for the offline round.
  • All deadlines must be strictly followed.

  • Inspired by Prometheus, the Greek fore-thinker who brought technology and knowledge to humanity.

column45:
Rulebook:

https://drive.google.com/file/d/1z1Qh1s09FSbHwAnCerOEfxhac8A1JVT_/view?usp=drive_link

Event Overview:

  • Robotics competition to design and build a fully autonomous maze-solving robot.
  • Tests skills in:
  • Sensor integration
  • Motor control
  • Algorithm design
  • Mechanical engineering
  • Real-time navigation
  • Robot must explore an unknown maze, map it, and reach the center with speed and precision.
  • Provides a platform to apply theoretical engineering concepts to a real-world robotics problem.

Eligibility & Participation:

  • Open to students from any recognized engineering institute in India.
  • Teams: 2–4 members.
  • Cross-college teams allowed.
  • Unique team name required; cannot be changed later.
  • Must appoint a Team Representative (TR) for communication.
  • All updates and official announcements sent only to the TR.
  • Participants must carry valid college ID.
  • No limit on number of teams per college.

Micromouse Specifications:

  • Teams must build the robot from scratch (no LEGO kits or prefabricated robots).
  • Maximum dimensions: 18 cm × 18 cm (length × width). Height unrestricted.
  • Self-powered; energy source must be safe and non-polluting.
  • Maximum onboard battery voltage: 12V.
  • Robot must include:
  • Actuators for movement
  • Steering system
  • Wall-detection sensors (IR, ultrasonic, etc.)
  • Navigation logic
  • Microcontroller for decision making
  • Stable power system
  • Sensors must be secure; robot must not damage maze walls.
  • No material may be deposited inside the maze.
  • Wireless systems allowed only with omnidirectional antennas that do not cause interference.

Maze Details:

  • Maze size: 16 × 16 grid, each cell 18 cm × 18 cm.
  • Perimeter walls fully enclosed.
  • Start cell at a corner; closed on three sides, open toward the “north.”
  • Maze layout revealed only on competition day.

Competition Format:

  • 5-minute calibration time after maze reveal:
  • Allowed: sensor tuning and parameter adjustment.
  • Not allowed: new program upload or manual maze data entry.
  • 10-minute competition window per team.
  • Up to 5 attempts.
  • Best valid run time determines the score.
  • If no run reaches the center:
  • Partial scoring based on distance, navigation quality, and stability.
  • Between attempts, teams may:
  • Replace batteries
  • Adjust sensors
  • Modify speed
  • Fix minor mechanical issues
  • A run is considered failed if the robot re-enters the start cell.
  • Judges may stop runs for safety or rule violations.

Scoring, Qualification & Safety:

  • Progression to finals based on:
  • Best run time or
  • Judged performance if no successful run.
  • Touch penalties applied for manual interference—added to best runtime.
  • Tie-breakers based on:
  • Total completion time
  • Number of touches
  • Mandatory safety inspection before competing.
  • Teams must bring their own tools; repairs only in designated areas.
  • Pre-event demonstration video required, showing micromouse construction and working.

column45:
Prometeo 2026, the national technical and entrepreneurial festival of IIT Jodhpur, brings to you the Prompt Engineering Challenge, a unique competition where creativity meets artificial intelligence. Inspired by Prometheus’s legacy of empowering humanity with knowledge and technology, this event continues the spirit of innovation by inviting participants to explore the growing world of AI-assisted design. In this challenge, participants will be provided with a blurred and grayscale reference image along with a theme. Using the power of prompt engineering and DreamStudio AI, teams must recreate the original image as accurately as possible while adding their own creative and thematic interpretation. The event tests precision, reasoning, prompt-craft, and artistic imagination, making it ideal for AI enthusiasts, designers, and innovators.

Guidelines:

  • Eligibility & Team Size: Participation is open to students across institutions. Teams must consist of 2–3 members as specified in the rulebook 
  • Mode of event & No. of rounds: Online event with a single round.
  • Inter-College / Inter-Specialization Teams: Both inter-college and inter-disciplinary teams are allowed, encouraging collaboration and diverse creativity.
  • Task Format: Each team will receive a blurred grayscale image along with a theme revealed on the event day. Using the AI provided by us, teams must attempt to recreate the image as closely as possible while showcasing a creative twist relevant to the assigned theme.
  • Round Duration: Teams will be given a fixed time window of 60 minutes to analyse the reference, build prompts, generate outputs, and upload the final submission. No extensions will be given.

Rules:

Submission Format:

  • All submissions must be uploaded through the Google Form/link provided on the day of event.
  • Accepted file formats: JPEG, JPG, PNG.
  • Prompt submission must include:
  • Positive prompts
  • Negative prompts
  • A brief explanation of the logic behind the prompt decisions.
  • File Naming Convention:
    Format: TeamName_PromptEngineering (e.g., TeamPhoenix_IITJodhpur) as mentioned in the rulebook.
  • Multiple generated images can also be submitted in a single ZIP file.

Evaluation Criteria: Judging will be based on the following parameters:

  • Image Accuracy: How closely the generated image matches the hidden reference.
  • Creativity & Innovation: Uniqueness and originality in interpreting the theme.
  • Prompt Engineering Quality: Clarity, effectiveness, and cleverness of prompt design.
  • Technical Execution: Proper utilization of DreamStudio AI features.
  • Explanation: Clear reasoning behind prompt structure and approach.

Prize Pool:

  • Exciting rewards worth 5,000 are up for grabs—recognizing the best prompt engineers of Prometeo 2026.

column45:
Rulebook: Click here to open the rulebook

About Code Wars:

  • Flagship competitive programming event under Prometeo 2026, IIT Jodhpur’s National Technical & Entrepreneurial Festival.
  • Inspired by Prometheus—representing knowledge, innovation, and progress.
  • Designed as a high-intensity, Codeforces-style showdown testing:
  • Speed
  • Logic
  • Algorithmic thinking
  • Strategic time management

Event Overview:

  • Two-stage competitive programming contest: Online Round + Offline Round.
  • Follows official Codeforces rules and dynamic scoring.
  • Ensures fair competition with:
  • Transparent scoring
  • Limited access
  • Strict supervision
  • Problems require efficient algorithms, optimal coding, and precise execution.

Stage 1: Online Round

  • Conducted on official Codeforces platform.
  • Scoring uses dynamic decreasing score per problem.
  • Incorrect submissions result in penalty time.
  • Hacks disabled for this contest.
  • Number of problems and scoring distribution announced prior to the round.
  • Top 20 teams from the online leaderboard advance to the offline round.

Stage 2: Offline Round (On-Site at IIT Jodhpur)

General Structure:

  • Conducted under strict supervision.
  • Scoring remains identical to online round.
  • Contest includes:
  • Main Offline Round
  • Knockout Stage for Top 4 teams

Knockout Format:

  • Match 1: Rank 1 vs Rank 2
  • Match 2: Rank 3 vs Rank 4
  • Winners → Finals
  • Losers → 3rd Place Match

Additional Rules:

  • Problems shuffled randomly, not sorted by difficulty.
  • Each team can have up to 3 members.
  • Only one designated laptop allowed per team throughout offline stage.

Eligibility Criteria:

  • All team members must be from the same recognized college/institute.
  • Participants must have a verified Codeforces account with correct identity.
  • Only registered teams may participate—no substitutions allowed once the contest starts.

Rules & Restrictions:

Device Policy:

  • Only one laptop per team allowed.
  • No external devices or USB storage permitted.
  • Organizers may inspect devices anytime.

Prohibited Items:

  • Mobile phones, tablets, smartwatches.
  • Printed, handwritten, or digital notes.
  • Any external storage or connectivity device.

Internet & Tools Policy:

  • Internet access restricted to:
  • Codeforces contest page
  • Contest announcements
  • No external browsing, documentation, or forums allowed.
  • Use of AI tools (ChatGPT, Copilot, Gemini, etc.) strictly prohibited.
  • No online debugging platforms, code generation tools, or collaborative tools allowed.

Contact:

Sadat Wani:

9622928609

b24cs1103@iitj.ac.in

column45:
About Prometeo:

  • Prometeo 2026 is the 6th edition of IIT Jodhpur’s National Technical & Entrepreneurial Festival.
  • Inspired by Prometheus, the Greek visionary who brought knowledge and technology to humanity.
  • Aims to elevate innovation, channel creative ideas, and promote impactful technological advancement.
  • Features a combination of:
  • Expert talks
  • Interactive workshops
  • High-engagement competitions
  • Focuses on fostering:
  • Collaboration
  • Technological excellence
  • A community of innovators addressing global challenges
  • Vision: To elevate, transform, and conquer through innovation and collective progress.

Event Overview:

  • A robotics and aerospace challenge involving remote-controlled drone navigation.
  • Participants must fly drones through a complex obstacle maze.
  • Key focus areas:
  • Precision navigation
  • Flight control
  • Payload delivery
  • Technical innovation
  • Obstacles include:
  • Hoop rings
  • Rectangular hoops
  • L-shaped tunnels
  • Objective: Deliver a 25g payload from start to end in the shortest time.
  • Ideal for students passionate about:
  • Aerospace engineering
  • Robotics
  • UAV development

Rulebook for the challenge

Eligibility and Team Guidelines:

  • Open to teams from any recognized engineering institute.
  • Cross-college teams are allowed.
  • No limit on number of teams from a single college.
  • Team size: 3–5 members.
  • Requirements:
  • Unique team name
  • One team representative for all communication
  • Valid ID card for every participant
  • Registration must be completed on Unstop with accurate:
  • Contact details
  • College information

Drone Specifications & Maze Details:

Drone Requirements:

  • Must have custom-built frames (pre-built acceptable; off-the-shelf drones prohibited).
  • Rotor-to-rotor distance: 25–55 cm (±5 cm tolerance).
  • No metal propellers allowed.
  • Must safely lift a 25g rectangular payload.
  • Maximum allowed height during flight: 20 meters.
  • All drone components must remain attached throughout the run.
  • Mandatory pre-event safety inspection.
  • Maze / Obstacle Details
  • Obstacles include:
  • Hoop rings: 70–80 cm diameter
  • Rectangular hoops: 70–80 cm sides
  • Horizontal L-shaped tunnels: 70–80 cm sides
  • Exact maze layout:
  • Revealed only on-site
  • Dimensions subject to change

Competition Format & Scoring:

  • Two randomized rounds, each team gets one run per round.
  • Each team gets 3 minutes for calibration/testing before their run.
  • Judges monitor:
  • Flight path
  • Obstacle interactions
  • Drone stability
  • Completion time
  • Penalties applied for:
  • Out-of-bounds flight
  • Touching or hitting obstacles
  • Instability
  • Possible disqualifications for:
  • Unsafe flight
  • Component failures
  • Tampering or intentional rule violations
  • Winners determined by:
  • Shortest valid completion time
  • Penalties considered in final score
  • Tie-breaking:
  • Fewer penalties
  • If no team finishes: judged on best overall performance

Why Participate?

  • Enhance drone piloting and hardware integration skills.
  • Gain hands-on experience in:
  • Payload delivery
  • Navigation under constraints
  • Rapid prototyping
  • Compete at a national-level platform hosted by IIT Jodhpur.
  • Ideal for students in:
  • Aerospace
  • Robotics
  • Mechatronics
  • Opportunity to:
  • Submit a short flight demo video for qualification
  • Network with innovators and tech leaders
  • Showcase creativity and engineering excellence
  • Register on Unstop to compete, innovate, and excel.

column45:
Event Overview:

  • Robotics competition focused on designing a manually operated Pick-and-Place bot.
  • Tests engineering skills, control precision, teamwork, and problem-solving.
  • Bots must grip, lift, and accurately place objects in designated zones on a challenging arena.
  • Problem Statement : Pick n Place

Bot Specifications & Rules:

  • Bot size must strictly fit within 300 mm × 250 mm × 300 mm before the run.
  • Allowed: Wired or wireless manual control.
  • Not allowed: Autonomous operation during the actual run.
  • Design must be original:
  • Custom grippers and gear mechanisms allowed.
  • Pre-made Lego parts and ready-made grippers prohibited.
  • Only one operator may control the bot at a time.
  • Compliance with safety and technical rules is mandatory.

Arena Details:

  • Arena dimensions: 250 cm × 250 cm with uniform track widths.
  • Contains multiple obstacles, including:
  • Thermocol blocks
  • Semi-circular pipes
  • Requires navigation with stability, accuracy, and precise placement of objects.

Event Phases:

Dry Run:

  • Teams explore the arena and identify optimal routes.
  • Bots may detect the ‘End’ zone using indicators (e.g., LED sensors).
  • Teams may use pathfinding algorithms to record turns and strategies.
  • Time taken in Dry Run reduces the time available for the Actual Run.

Actual Run:

  • Bots must retrace their optimized route from the Dry Run.
  • Required to pick, carry, and deposit blocks accurately and quickly.
  • Performance is timed, increasing the importance of strategy and execution.

Scoring:

  • Points awarded for:
  • Crossing obstacles
  • Accurate object pickup and placement
  • Efficient navigation
  • Penalties imposed for:
  • Unsafe circuitry or conduct
  • Violating size constraints
  • Using prohibited components
  • Breaking event rules
  • Disqualification possible for major infractions.

Event Essence:

  • Promotes innovation, manual control excellence, and mechanical creativity.
  • Encourages strategic planning, precision, and teamwork.
  • Designed to simulate real engineering challenges in a competitive yet educational environment.
  • A celebration of technical skill and collaboration within Prometeo 2026.

column45:
Join the Whatsapp group.

Competition Overview:

  • Participants must build a robust machine-learning solution using a dataset involving nuts, washers, and related components.
  • The hackathon consists of two rounds:
  • Round 1: Kaggle ML Challenge + PPT Submission
  • Round 2: Prototype Presentation before Judges

Eligibility:

  • Open to all students from any college/university.
  • Participation allowed solo or in teams of up to 4 members.

Round 1: Kaggle Round + PPT Submission

Kaggle Round:

  • A private Kaggle competition link will be shared after registration.
  • Participants must build, train, and submit predictions on the test dataset.
  • Leaderboard ranking (public LB) determines performance.
  • External datasets or pre-trained models on similar domains are not allowed.
  • Code must be fully original — plagiarism or code-sharing leads to disqualification.

PPT Submission:

Teams must submit a PPT on Unstop covering:

  • Problem understanding
  • Approach and model architecture
  • Data preprocessing techniques
  • Feature engineering (if any)
  • Evaluation strategy
  • Dataset insights
  • Why the solution is scalable & reliable

Note: Round 1 selection is based on both the PPT + Kaggle score.

Round 2: Prototype Presentation (On-Campus)

  • Shortlisted teams will present their prototype at IIT Madras.
  • Teams must showcase:
  • Working prototype or model pipeline
  • Key insights from Round 1
  • Improvements made after the Kaggle round
  • Deployment feasibility or business relevance

General Rules:

  • Register before the deadline — no late entries accepted.
  • All decisions by the organizing committee/judges are final.
  • Teams must strictly follow deadlines and file formats.
  • Any unethical practice (plagiarism, model leakage, submitting others' work) leads to immediate disqualification.
  • Use of GenAI tools for coding/explanations: allowed.

column45:
The Poster Presentation at nVisionX’26 provides a platform for researchers, students, and innovators to showcase their work in sustainability, green energy, climate action, and environmental technologies.
This track highlights impactful research—from emerging ideas and conceptual frameworks to experimental studies and field analyses—that contribute to building a cleaner, more resilient future.

Participants will present their findings to an audience of academicians, industry experts, government officials, and sustainability practitioners, gaining valuable visibility and feedback.

Poster submissions are invited across the following broad domains:

  • Renewable Energy Technologies
  • Energy Storage & Battery Systems
  • Hydrogen Energy & Fuel Cells
  • Smart Grids & Power Systems
  • Sustainable Materials & Green Manufacturing
  • Circular Economy & Waste Valorization
  • Carbon Capture & Climate Action
  • Environmental Monitoring & Pollution Control
  • AI/ML & Computational Sustainability
  • Sustainable Cities, Mobility & Infrastructure

Rewards and Benefits:

  • Certificates from Elan & nVision, IIT Hyderabad
  • Opportunity to present before professors, policy leaders, and industry experts
  • Showcase your research to corporates, startups, and labs at the Innovation Expo
  • Potential collaboration or research interest from attending organizations

Eligibility:

  • Open to students, research scholars, and professionals across India
  • Only individual submissions are allowed
  • Work must be related to sustainability, energy, environment, or climate-focused domains

Rules:

  • Posters must be based on original research, analysis, or innovative concepts.
  • Submissions must follow the official poster template and guidelines provided after registration.
  • Plagiarism or previously published work without disclosure will lead to disqualification.
  • Shortlisted participants will present their posters in the On-Ground Finale at IIT Hyderabad during the summit.

column45:
The Case Study Competition at nVisionX’26 challenges participants to develop community-focused, research-driven solutions in the domain of energy.

Participants will be provided with a specific list of real communities, each facing unique energy, accessibility, or infrastructure challenges. Using these as baseline contexts, teams must research successful models from other regions and propose adaptable, scalable, and locally implementable solutions for any one selected community.

The competition focuses on analytical thinking, contextual design, and practical sustainability, encouraging participants to bridge global best practices with India’s on-ground realities.


Rewards and Benefits:

  • Prizes worth 20,000
  • Certificates from Elan & nVision, IIT Hyderabad
  • Opportunity to present before industry leaders, policymakers, and academic experts
  • Exclusive visibility during the summit for shortlisted teams

Eligibility:

  • Open to students, researchers, and professionals across India
  • Team size: 1–5 members
  • Participants may join only one team

Rules:

  • Submissions must directly address the official case study problem statement.
  • All ideas must be original, well-researched, and developed during the competition.
  • Plagiarism or use of pre-existing submissions will lead to disqualification.
  • Shortlisted teams will present their solution in the Grand Finale (Hybrid) at IIT Hyderabad during the summit.

column45:
Overview:

  • Year 2025 is coming to an end, and everyone cherishes memories—both good and bad—of their campus experiences.
  • PInterview is organizing the "Student of the Year 2025" contest to recognize outstanding achievements during the last one year of campus life.
  • The contest highlights interesting experiences, challenges faced, and lessons learned.

Qualifications:

  • Applicants must have been in school or college for the last 1 year.

Benefits:

  • Certificate of Award for "Student of the Year 2025".
  • Certificates will be provided in two categories:
  • School Students
  • College Students
  • Social media coverage on PInterview’s official handles.

Important Dates:

  • Last date to apply: December 21, 2025
  • Announcement of Award: Last week of December 2025

Selection:

  • The winner will be selected by Team PInterview.

column45:
About the event:

NationBuilding is India’s largest undergraduate case study competition! It is an annual event designed to engage the youth in the nation-building process by working on some of the most pressing issues facing India. Participants will dive into a 2-month extravaganza across multiple online and offline rounds which will be evaluated by a distinguished panel of judges.

Why are we doing this? We believe that our youth can energize India’s future with their passion, creativity, and innovative ideas weaving a stronger, more progressive India, thread by thread.

The theme of the third edition of NationBuilding is "Preventive Healthcare". The problem statement is “Enabling India’s next generation towards an extra decade of healthy living through individual-driven action."

Eligibility:

  • Participants should be currently enrolled in an undergraduate program in India. Participants are required to submit a scanned copy of their college ID upon request by the organizers at any round of the competition for verification purposes.
  • Candidates who participated individually in the online Quiz Round need to form a team of two to participate in the further rounds. Please note that both members should be from the same college.
  • Cross-specialization and cross-year teams are permitted.
  • Each student is allowed to be a member of only one team.

Process:

1. Registration (1st December 2025 - 31st December 2025)

  • Registration details can be completed by the team leader but team member's consent will be required to formulate the registration. 
  • The zones assigned during registration will be determined based on the location of the college and will remain unchanged throughout the entire competition, with no modifications allowed between rounds.
  • The details for the State/Union Territories and zone mapping are given below:

Note: Any deviation from the aforementioned guidelines will result in the immediate disqualification of the team. Additionally, English will be the primary language for all communications and assessments.

2. Online Quiz (4th-6th January 2026)

Format:
  • Registered teams will receive login details for the Online Quiz via their registered email address.
  • The quiz will be conducted in a Multiple Choice Questions (MCQ) format.
  • Teams will be tested on their general awareness and knowledge of current events.
  • Correct answers will earn the team 1 point each, and 1 point will be awarded based on the time taken to answer each question.
  • There will be no negative marking for incorrect attempt(s).
  • The Team Leader is designated as the primary member who is eligible to take the quiz.
Results and Next Steps:
  • The top-performing teams from each zone will qualify for the next stage.
  • The result will be published on the website. Qualified teams will be notified via their registered email addresses.
  • Qualified teams will receive detailed instructions about the requirements for the subsequent stage of the competition.

3. Presentation Submission (8th January 2026 - 18th January 2026)

Format:
  • The qualifying teams will receive a problem statement on the theme of Preventive Healthcare.
  • Candidates who participated individually in the online Quiz Round need to form a team of two to participate in the further rounds. Please note that both members should be from the same college
  • The teams will be required to submit their solution as a short 5-slide PowerPoint presentation in PDF format.
  • You will be required to add the following details on the Cover Page (first introductory slide) of your submission:
    • Title of your presentation
    • Names of both team members
    • College Name 
    • Zone
  • Presentations will have to be uploaded only on the Unstop platform before the deadline of 11:59 PM, 18th January 2026.
  • Only one submission per team will be allowed.
Results and Next Steps:
  • Following the evaluation of presentations, the top-performing teams from each zone will qualify for the next stage.
  • The official results will be made available on the website. The qualified teams will also be communicated on their registered email address.
  • Qualified teams will receive detailed instructions regarding the zonal finals.

4. Zonal Finals (21st January 2026 - 5th February 2026)

Format:

  • Qualifying teams to present solutions for a given problem to a judging panel online.
  • The qualifying teams will develop their solution to a given problem and submit the PowerPoint presentation in PDF format by 27th January 2026.
  • Only one submission per team will be allowed.
  • The Zonal Finals will be held from 3rd February to 5th February 2026. The teams will present their solutions in front of a distinguished panel of judges virtually.
  • Teams will be assessed by the judge panel based on several parameters: understanding of the problem statement, clarity and effectiveness of the solution, presentation, and communication skills, and performance during the Q&A session.
  • Winners and Runners-Up from each Zonal Finals will qualify for the National Finals.

5. National Finals (6th February 2026 - 13th February 2026)

Format:

  • Detailed instructions about the National Finals will be shared on their registered email address.
  • The qualifying teams will develop their solution to a given problem and submit the 12-slide PowerPoint presentation in PDF format by 11th February 2026.
  • Only one submission per team will be allowed.
  • The presentation for the National Finals will be held on 13th February 2026 in New Delhi. The teams will present their solutions in front of a distinguished judge panel.
  • Teams will be assessed by the judging panel based on several parameters: understanding of the problem statement, clarity and effectiveness of the solution, presentation and communication skills, and performance during the Q&A session.

Note - Transportation and accommodation arrangements for the finalists will be taken care of by the NationBuilding team.

Prizes worth 16 Lakhs are up for grabs. Round-wise prize details are as follows:

  • National Finals:
    • Cash Awards: The top 3 teams will be awarded a total cash prize of 10 lakhs, as follows:
      • Winner: 5 Lakhs
      • First Runners-Up: 3 Lakhs
      • Second Runners-Up: 2 Lakhs
    • Other Prizes:
      • Members of the winning team will each receive a MacBook.
      • Members of the First Runners-Up and Second Runners-Up teams will each receive iPads.
      • All National Finalist teams, except the winners, will win 30,000 each.
      • Placement and internship offers for selected students.
      • Exclusive merchandise for all national finalists.

Note: Only the final year students from the teams reaching in National Finals will be eligible for placement opportunities. Other students participating in the National Finals will be considered eligible for internship opportunities.

  • Zonal Finals:
    • E-certificates will be issued to all participants and winners.
  • Presentation Submission:
    • E-certificates will be issued to all participants.
  • Online Quiz:
    • E-certificates will be issued to all participants.

All final decisions lie with Nation with Namo and Unstop.

column2: AI x MedTech: Startup Hackathon & Cohort 2025
column45:
About the Opportunity

AI x MedTech: Startup Hackathon & Cohort 2025 is India’s first healthcare entrepreneurship program that combines a virtual medical innovation hackathon with a 6-month startup acceleration cohort supported by clinicians, hospitals & investors.

This program aims to empower founders and innovators solving real medical challenges with AI — from diagnostic precision to hospital workflow efficiency, from women’s health to NCD management.

Over 6 months, selected teams will progress through:

  • Clinical validation
  • MVP building
  • Pilot deployment support
  • Investor readiness
  • Healthcare personal branding
  • Real hospital + patient access

Why You Should Apply

  • Direct mentorship from doctors, MedTech entrepreneurs & healthcare VCs
  • Cloud credits, grants & pilot deployment pathways
  • Showcase at India AI Impact Summit & Centrum Lucknow
  • Investors & hospitals working with you from Day 1

This is not just a hackathon — it’s a company-building launchpad.

Eligibility Criteria:

To participate, you must:

  • Be a student / working professional / founder interested in healthcare innovation
  • Form a team of 2–5 members (Tech + Healthcare mix recommended)
  • Have skills in AI/ML, product development, clinical domain, or design
  • Be committed to a 6-month execution program if selected

No prior startup or healthcare experience required — we provide mentors!

Join the official WhatsApp group for updates:
https://chat.whatsapp.com/D2RArcP2MfdGYzYdeve0YP

Themes & Problem Areas

Participants will work on high-impact healthcare categories:

  • Telemedicine & AI Clinical Decision Support
  • Open Innovation in Healthcare
  • Women’s Health & NCD Management
  • Medical Imaging & Diagnostics
  • Health IT Systems & Data Privacy
  • AI in HealthTech Innovation

Rules:

  • All development must be done during the hackathon duration.
  • Original work only — plagiarism leads to disqualification.
  • At least 1 founder must attend mandatory mentorship sessions.
  • Top teams must be available for:
    • Lucknow Showcase
    • Cohort onboarding
  • Teams must maintain professional conduct & ethical standards (patient safety first).

Rewards & Benefits:

10,00,000+ in grants, credits & perks

Who Should Apply?

If you are:

  • An AI/ML developer
  • A med student / doctor / healthcare specialist
  • A designer or PM passionate about healthtech
  • A student innovator wanting to build a startup

This program is engineered for you.

column11: Tata Institute of Social Sciences, Mumbai
column45:
The Social Venture Challenge is a key event of iPreneur’26 — India’s largest student-led Social Entrepreneurship Summit, hosted by the E-Cell, Tata Institute of Social Sciences (TISS), Mumbai.
It is designed to empower promising social ventures by offering a platform to pitch for funding, build meaningful networks, and showcase their impact. While ventures from Tier-1 cities are welcome, the Challenge places a strong emphasis on highlighting and uplifting enterprises emerging from Tier-2 and Tier-3 cities, villages, and grassroots organisations.

Note: We, the E-Cell TISS Mumbai, act as a platform provider to investors and enterprises. This is mainly a platform for enterprises to pitch their ideas and secure funding opportunities from investors. However, any communication between the investors and the enterprise regarding funding within the 6-month period should be routed through E-Cell, TISS Mumbai.

Eligibility:

  • Your venture should be registered and operating in any South Asian country.
  • You may apply if you are an early-stage venture.
  • You can participate individually or as a team, with a maximum of 3 participants.
  • Your venture should be solving a critical and pressing social problem.
  • Your enterprise should not be registered for more than 5 years.
  •  Only registered entities can apply. If you're still in the ideation stage, we’ve got you covered too — check out the Social Business Idea track: https://unstop.com/o/DrOWKk8

Final Pitch:

  • Date: 6th February 2026
  • Venue: Ipreneur’26, TISS Mumbai Campus

Shortlisted teams will be pitching their ideas to a panel of judges comprising entrepreneurs, incubators, and investors. Further, they will have to submit necessary documents for verification.

Incentives at a glance:

  • Winner gets cash prize of 1,00,000/- 
  • An opportunity to get an investment from impact investors, seasoned entrepreneurs, and industry practitioners.
  • Networking opportunities with potential partners and industry experts. 
  • Constructive feedback and getting mentored by entrepreneurs, professionals, and academicians. 
  • Participation certificate to the finalists.  
  • Opportunity to get incubation and mentorship by esteemed incubators like TIF (Tiss Incube Foundation, etc.)

column45:
Social Business Idea is a key event of iPreneur’26 — India’s largest student-led Social Entrepreneurship Summit, hosted by the E-Cell, Tata Institute of Social Sciences (TISS), Mumbai.

This initiative is designed to encourage young innovators to explore fresh perspectives and develop solutions to pressing social challenges. It provides a platform for aspiring entrepreneurs to conceptualise, refine, and present their ideas to a panel of experts. Constructive feedback from the judges aims to guide participants in strengthening their ideas and advancing their entrepreneurial journey. With this event, iPreneur’26 seeks to nurture socially driven ideas that hold the potential for long-term impact.

Eligibility:

  • Participants must be 18 years or older and citizens of South Asian countries.
  • Participation may be individual or in teams of up to three members.
  • Only non-registered start-ups or early-stage ideas (not older than one year) are eligible. Registered ventures will not be considered.
  • The proposed idea should demonstrate financial sustainability and the potential for long-term viability

Event Rounds:

  • Round 1: Registration and Submission
  • Round 2: Final Pitch 
  • Date: 5th February 2026
  • Venue: iPreneur’26, TISS Mumbai Campus

Shortlisted participants will present their ideas before a panel comprising incubators, faculty members, and industry experts.

Incentives at a Glance:

  • The Winner will receive a cash prize of 20,000 and the Runner-Up will receive 10,000.
  • Opportunity to secure investment from impact investors, seasoned entrepreneurs, and industry practitioners.
  • Networking opportunities with potential partners and industry experts.
  • Constructive feedback and mentorship from entrepreneurs, professionals, and academicians.
  • Participation certificates for all finalists.
  • Opportunity for incubation and mentorship through esteemed incubators such as the TISS Incube Foundation (TIF) and others.

column2: Odoo x SNS Coimbatore Hiring Hackathon '26
column45:
Register Here To confirm your Participation: https://hackathon.odoo.com/event/odoo-x-sns-coimbatore-hackathon-26-7/register

Welcome To The Odoo x SNS Coimbatore Hackathon '26:

  • Welcome to the Odoo x SNS Coimbatore Hackathon '26 - by SNS College of Technology (SNSCT), Coimbatore, Tamil Nadu!
  • A dynamic online coding challenge in the realm of Hackathons.

About Odoo Hackathon:

  • Odoo India's hackathons are open challenge to all tech enthusiasts and a great tool for Odoo to hire best coders and designers to join Odoo India's growing team.
  • Odoo India’s hiring hackathon journey began in June 2024 with Odoo Combat, our first open recruitment hackathon, attracting over 3,000 students and discovering exceptional young developers.
  • Encouraged by its success, Odoo India collaborated with leading universities to bring hackathons closer to emerging talent, transforming a simple idea into a nationwide hackathon series.
  • Today, Odoo India has replaced traditional campus placements with hiring hackathons.

About The Opportunity:

  • Join the Odoo x SNS Coimbatore Hackathon '26, presented by SNS College of Technology (SNSCT).
  • This online coding challenge invites teams to unleash their creativity and technical skills.
  • This is your chance to showcase your abilities in a dynamic online environment.
  • Collaborate with your team, develop innovative solutions, and make your mark in the world of Hackathons.

Open Challenge:

  • Virtual Round: 8-hour online hackathon
  • Final Round: 24-hour on-site hackathon for shortlisted teams
  • No participation fees
  • Teams of 1 to 4 members (Age: 18+), with cross-institution teams allowed
  • Problem statements are revealed only at the start hour to ensure fairness and creativity
  • Once you register for any Odoo hackathon, cannot apply again for next 3 months for other Odoo hackathons

Eligibility And Registration:

  • Open for all tech students, freshers, and coding enthusiasts (Age: 18+)
  • No prior experience required – just your passion for coding!
  • All programming languages are welcome!

Must Have:

  • Use real-time or dynamic data sources, and avoid relying on static JSON unless it’s for initial prototyping.
  • Create a responsive and clean UI (Consistent color scheme and layout).
  • Validate user input robustly.
  • Use intuitive navigation with proper menu placement and spacing.
  • Use version control (Git) properly; one member managing the repo is not enough.

Nice To Have:

  • Ability to design backend APIs, model data, and set up a local database.
  • Understand AI/code snippets thoroughly before using them; don't blindly copy-paste without adapting them to your project.
  • Plan for offline or local solutions and don’t rely entirely on internet connectivity or cloud-based tools.
  • Use trendy technologies only if they add real value to your project.

At Odoo, We Value Your Skills:

  • At Odoo, we value your skills, more than your resume.

What If You Win?:

  • Winning the hackathon and receiving a job offer are two separate outcomes.
  • You may win and still be ineligible for hiring based on criteria, and it’s equally possible to not rank in the top three teams yet get a call with employment opportunity.
  • At Odoo, we hire for talent, mindset, and determination and not just project completion.
  • We look for problem-solvers who think beyond the obvious and are ready to join the Purple Army.

column45:
Please find below some repositories from Pathway. We encourage you to save/star these repositories for participating. 

https://github.com/pathwaycom/pathway
https://github.com/pathwaycom/llm-app

Rules & Round Structure

Round 1: Submission Round

  • Participants must submit their project idea, prototype, or solution before the specified deadline.
  • Submissions should clearly outline the problem statement, approach, technology stack, and expected impact.
  • Teams must ensure that their submission is original, free from plagiarism, and developed solely for this hackathon.
  • The judging panel will evaluate submissions based on innovation, feasibility, technical depth, and clarity of thought.
  • Shortlisted teams will advance to the next round.

Round 2: Presentation Round (at IIT Madras)

  • Selected teams will be invited to IIT Madras for the final presentation round.
  • Teams must present their solution through a live demo, prototype walkthrough, or pitch deck.
  • Judges may ask questions to assess understanding, implementation, and scalability.
  • Evaluation criteria will include creativity, completeness, presentation quality, problem-solving approach, and real-world applicability.
  • Winners will be announced based on overall performance.

General Rules

  • Teams must adhere to the timelines and instructions provided by the organizers.
  • Any form of plagiarism or pre-existing code without disclosure may lead to disqualification.
  • Respectful behaviour, teamwork, and sportsmanship are expected throughout the event.
  • Decisions made by the judging panel and organizers will be final.

column2: Official SNAP Mock Test by SCMHRD
column45:
Overview:

  • The Official SNAP Mock Test by SCMHRD is designed to closely replicate the real SNAP exam.
  • Helps aspirants improve strategy, speed, accuracy, and confidence before the actual test.
  • Ideal for candidates targeting admission to top Symbiosis institutes, including SCMHRD.

Why You Should Take the Official SNAP Mock Test:

Real Exam Simulation:

  • Replicates SNAP’s exact pattern, difficulty level, and time pressure.
  • Mirrors actual question types, section structure, and test-day environment.
  • Helps you feel familiar and comfortable during the actual exam.

Benchmarking Against Top Aspirants:

  • Compare your performance with candidates across India.
  • Understand your national rank, strengths, and improvement areas.
  • Get a realistic picture of your standing in the competition.

Time-Management Training:

  • SNAP is a high-speed exam; this mock helps you practice quick decision-making.
  • Sharpens your ability to pace attempts effectively.
  • Reduces last-minute panic and improves accuracy under pressure.

Strategic Exam Insights:

  • Learn effective approaches to each SNAP section:
  • General English
  • Quantitative, DI & DS
  • Analytical & Logical Reasoning
  • Helps you build a tactical, exam-ready mindset.

What Makes This Mock Test Unique:

  • Created by SCMHRD, one of India’s top B-schools.
  • Aligned with SNAP’s evolving exam trends and rigor.
  • Enables performance comparison against thousands of national-level test takers.
  • Offers one of the closest experiences to the real SNAP exam.

Who Should Take This Mock:

  • Dedicated SNAP Aspirants: Aiming for top percentiles and elite Symbiosis programs.
  • First-Time Test Takers: Understand SNAP format, flow, and pressure before the actual day.
  • Repeat Candidates: Identify past mistakes, close gaps, and strengthen weak areas.

A Stepping Stone to SCMHRD:

  • Strong mock performance builds the exact skills SCMHRD values in candidates.
  • Helps you align your preparation with SCMHRD’s expectations.
  • Acts as a strategic stepping stone toward securing admission.

column11: Lal Bahadur Shastri Institute of Management, Sector 11, Dwarka, New Delhi - 110075
column45:
Welcome to Chaos CEO Simulation:

  • Welcome to Chaos CEO Simulation, the wildest, most unpredictable Gen-Z entrepreneurship challenge of TATVA 2025.
  • This event is not about perfect business plans, polished pitches, or textbook strategies.
  • This is about chaos — the real world of entrepreneurship where:
    • your supplier ghosts you,
    • your co-founder quits on the launch day,
    • customers demand refunds for “emotional damage”,
    • and the universe throws curveballs every 10 minutes.
  • Do you have what it takes to stay calm, think smart, and lead like a true CEO in crisis mode?
  • Let’s find out.

Event Format:

  • The competition consists of three thrilling rounds, each designed to test your entrepreneurial instincts, humor, quick thinking, and Gen-Z creativity.
  • Multiple entries from the same college allowed.

Judging Criteria:

  • Creativity
  • Problem-Solving Ability
  • Practicality of Solutions
  • Humor & Gen-Z energy
  • Communication & role-play skills

Rules:

  • Plagiarism or copying from AI tools is NOT allowed for the crisis plan.
  • Content must not be offensive or inappropriate.
  • Decisions by judges are final.
  • Failure to submit within timelines = disqualification.

Why Should You Participate:

  • Because entrepreneurship is not just about Excel sheets and pitch decks.
  • Sometimes, it’s about pure chaos, instinct, and your ability to lead when everything is breaking down.
  • If you’re a real Gen-Z hustler, this is YOUR arena.
  • Join the madness. Survive the chaos. Become the CEO.

Contacts:

  • Altamash Rahman: +91 63863 71161
  • Pooja Kuntal: +91 98101 95806

column45:
AI Quiz 2K25 is an online Artificial Intelligence quiz competition organized by Learnix Labs, designed to test participants’ understanding of AI fundamentals, LLM concepts, prompt engineering techniques, and real-world reasoning skills. This quiz is perfect for students and AI enthusiasts who want to challenge themselves, compete with peers, and showcase their AI knowledge in a timed 15–20 minute quiz.

Eligibility & Rules:

  • Open to all students (school, college, or university).
  • Individual participation only.
  • No registration fee – participation is completely free.
  • Participants need a stable internet connection to take the quiz.
  • Each participant can attempt the quiz only once.
  • Campus Champion Incentive: If at least 3 participants register from the same campus, the top scorer from that campus will receive a special certificate.

Important: All quiz updates, reminders, and result announcements will be shared on our official WhatsApp Channel.
Join here: https://bit.ly/Learnix-Labs-whatsapp

column45:
Event Date : Jan 4&5 2026
Venue : College of Engineering Karunagappally
Event Name : PRAYATNA a 24 Hr AI Future Hackathon

Eligibility:

  • Open to all college students and All Years with valid ID.
  • Team size: 2–4 members.
  • Inter-college teams: Allowed.
  • Registration Fee is Per person in a team
  • Inter-specialization teams: Allowed.
  • Registration is confirmed only after form submission and payment.
  • No refunds after registration.

Format & Process:

  • Duration: 24 hours continuous hackathon.
  • Teams will receive problem statements at the start of the event.
  • Event Flow:
  • Registration & Check-in
  • Idea Pitch
  • Continuous Coding
  • Mentoring Sessions
  • Final Project Demo
  • Judging & Result Announcement
  • Number of problem statements will be announced during the briefing session.

Evaluation Criteria:

  • Innovation & Creativity

  • Technical Implementation

  • Practical Impact & Feasibility

  • Presentation & Team Coordination

Rules of the Competition:

  • All work must be developed during the hackathon period.
  • External APIs/libraries are allowed but must be disclosed.
  • Pre-developed or plagiarized projects will be disqualified.
  • Maintain discipline and professionalism throughout the event.
  • Any misconduct or harassment will lead to immediate disqualification.
  • Participants consent to photography and media usage.

Facilities Provided:

  • 24-hour Wi-Fi and power supply
  • Refreshments and first-aid support
  • Provide Food and Refreshment
  • Mentor and volunteer assistance throughout the event

Prizes:

  • Cash prizes and certificates for winners.
  • Participation certificates for all verified teams.

column45:
Event Description:
  • Portfolio Playoffs is an immersive, simulation-based investment challenge designed to test participants’ financial acumen, market interpretation, and strategic decision-making skills.
  • Participants step into the role of portfolio managers, where they are tasked with building and managing a virtual investment portfolio over 10 dynamic rounds. Each round will feature real-time market news and macroeconomic updates, forcing teams to think critically, respond swiftly, and optimize returns in a competitive environment.
  • The event blends financial knowledge, analytical reasoning, and quick decision-making, offering an experience that replicates the thrill and pressure of real-world investing.

Key Highlights:

  • Real-time investment decision simulation
  • Practical exposure to market reactions and portfolio management
  • Enhances analytical and teamwork skills
  • Ideal blend of finance education and strategic gaming

Contact:

  • Rishi Khare: +91-7697399747 
  • Mukul Ramnani: +91-8209342257

column45:
About the Journal:

Ecolloquial is the Annual Journal of Economics of Lady Shri Ram College for Women, University of Delhi, first published in 2004. It aims to nurture intellectual curiosity amongst undergraduate economics students and contribute to contemporary discussions in economic thought by publishing high-quality, original student research.

This year, for its 22nd edition, the journal is advancing its objective of upholding the highest standards of academic integrity and publication ethics. In line with
this, Ecolloquial is in the process of transitioning to a peer-reviewed model and is aligning its practices with UGC guidelines.

The journal is published annually in both print and digital (via the LSR website) formats, and is distributed across Asia. It strives to make undergraduate research accessible to a wider academic-oriented audience. It features research articles, papers, book reviews, and interviews with leading economists and practitioners in India, offering insights into emerging issues in the field, and importantly, in the world around us.

Word Limits:

  • Research Papers: 4000–5000 words
    (includes references, tables, and figures but excludes abstract)
  • Research Articles: 1000–1500 words
  • Book Reviews: 500 words

Formatting Requirements:

  • Font: Times New Roman
  • Font Size: 12 pt
  • Spacing: Double spaced
  • Margin: 1” on all sides
  • Alignment: Justified
  • Below Title: Author’s name and email address
  • The title must be in sentence case, 14 pt, Times New Roman, followed by each author’s name and email address.
  • Tables must be typed, clearly labelled and placed within the main body of the text
  • Any superscripts or asterisks must appear next to the relevant item, with corresponding explanations provided as footnotes to the tables or figures
  • Use the bold function rather than underlining to emphasize any part of the submission.

Guidelines:

  • All written submissions should be sent as a Word Document (.doc) to ecolloquial25[dot]lsr[at]gmail[dot]com.
  • All research papers must include an abstract of 100 or fewer words, followed by the JEL classification codes and keywords of the paper.
  • All references must be in APA style (7th Edition).

Rules:

  • Only current undergraduate students may submit.
  • Refer to the themes in the below given attachment.
  • Maximum two authors per submission.
  • If written as part of a research internship, include project details as a footnote on the first page.

Ethical Policy:

  • Plagiarism and excessive use of AI are strictly prohibited.
  • All borrowed material must be properly cited.
  • Suspected academic misconduct will be investigated by the Editorial Board in accordance with UGC guidelines.

column11: Kamla Nehru Institute Of Technology (KNIT) Sultanpur
column45:
UPDATE: Timeline For The Hackthon Is Updated:

Welcome to the Purvanchal Technical Hackathon – by Kamla Nehru Institute of Technology (KNIT), Sultanpur:

  • PPT Template: https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1snhDHgq78nuc6xRtXfs_XDNefp4GX3zm/edit

About the Opportunity:

  • The Purvanchal Technical Hackathon, hosted by Kamla Nehru Institute of Technology (KNIT), Sultanpur, is a Hackathon challenge designed to ignite your passion for innovation.
  • This event is a prime opportunity for teams to collaborate, ideate, and build solutions within the exciting realm of Hackathon.
  • Participants will have the chance to showcase their skills, learn from peers, and contribute to cutting-edge projects.
  • This online hackathon is your gateway to making a real-world impact in the Hackathon domain.

Challange Tracks:

  • Smart Cities & Sustainable Urban Tech
  • AI-Powered Health & Well-Being Solutions
  • Clean Energy, Climate Action & GreenTech
  • Next Gen Cyber threat detection and response
  • Inclusive Education & Digital Equality
  • Open Innovation

Eligibility and Registration:

  • Team Participation is required.

Rules:

  • Team Formation: Participants can form teams of 2 to 4 members.
  • Group leader need to fill the online registration form and fill the details of all members.
  • We encourage multidisciplinary participations
  • Student can participant in only team
  • At least one member must be present on the allocated area
  • All work must be created during the hackathon.
  • Teams have to present their solution in the form of a prototype
  • Projects must align with the given hackathon themes or challenges.
  • All projects must be submitted by the designated deadline includes project description, code, and Presentation
  • Time Limit: The Hackathon will have a specific time limit.
  • The use of pre-existing code or projects is not allowed, except for open-source libraries or frameworks.

Accomodation:

  • We’ve got you covered. Complimentary accommodation will be arranged for all participants during the event on a very minimal payment.

Ready to innovate:

  • Join the Purvanchal Technical Hackathon today and transform your ideas into reality.

column45:
Event Overview: 

  • Cyber Cypher is NMIMS's only official hackathon where creative minds unite to showcase their expertise and problem-solving abilities through innovative solutions and teamwork in various domains.

Team Size: 1-3 members

Registration Deadline: 7th January

Dates & Mode:

  • Round 1 (Qualifier): 31st Jan - 1st Feb | Mode: Online
  • Round 2 (Finals): 26th & 27th Feb | Mode: Hybrid
  • Platform: Discord

Incentives You Will Get:

  • Prize pool worth INR 2,00,000
  • A chance to get PAID internships at top tech companies
  • Hampers and vouchers
  • Direct entry into the flagship event "The Talk" show
  • Certificates from Unstop

Domains & Themes:

  • Elementary Level:
    • Focused on reimagining the digital tools we use every day, including emails, notes, calendars, and more through creativity and human-centered design.
    • Theme: Everyday Apps, Reimagined
    • Participants will craft prototypes that transform mundane workflows into intuitive, emotionally aware experiences. Emphasis on simplicity, functionality, and beauty without writing a single line of code.
  • Advanced Level:
    • The frontier of autonomous intelligence, where AI systems evolve from obedient tools to independent thinkers.
    • Theme: Agentic AI
    • Participants will explore the architecture of intelligent agents that understand intent, take initiative, and collaborate meaningfully, pushing beyond automation to create AI partners that think, decide, and achieve with purpose.

Additional Information:

  • Participants will receive detailed rules and guidelines via email.

column45:
DarkCode Rising is TechDome’s first offline hackathon — a high-energy, 10-hour sprint where beginners and budding innovators come together to build, learn, and create something impactful. If you love solving problems and working with amazing people, this is your arena.

  • Date: 17 January
  • Duration: 10 Hours
  • Theme: Open Innovation
  • Organized By: TechDome Community
  • Mode: Offline

Who Can Join?

  • Beginners welcome
  • Duo or team participation
  • Anyone excited to build or explore tech

What’s Inside?

  • 50,000+ Prize Pool
  • Free swags & goodies
  • Free meals for all participants
  • Speaker sessions & expert mentorship
  • Network with passionate creators
  • Fun activities & community vibes

Judging Criteria:

  • Innovation
  •  Technical execution
  • Problem relevance
  • User experience
  • Presentation

Join our community for more updates:- https://chat.whatsapp.com/DnDRCiKrraZ6Tqux581Y9n

column45:
Ecollectual, the monthly newsletter of the Department of Economics, Lady Shri Ram College for Women, is accepting submissions for its third edition, Academic Session 2025-26. 

Eligibility: Open to all years, departments, and colleges
Deadline: 25th December EOD

Each month, Ecollectual publishes articles on a wide range of topics, including current affairs, finance, geopolitics, consumer behaviour, everyday economics and even pop culture. The upcoming edition introduces a new section that will challenge readers to step into the shoes of policymakers, suggesting solutions for real-world economic problems. To learn more about this section, and for detailed information on submissions, please register to access the official document with guidelines.  

Read the online Flipbook of our first edition: https://heyzine.com/flip-book/e9d4679179.html
