column11: Pimpri Chinchwad College of Engineering and Research
column45:
Description:

  • ResQlympics is a high-intensity robotics rescue challenge where a manually operated bot, controlled solely through a live camera feed, must navigate a concealed arena filled with diverse obstacles. The objective is to identify and rescue three different types of hostages, each carrying specific time constraints and point values, and securely place them into the bot’s carrier.
  • The event focuses on precision control, time-bound decision-making, strategic rescue sequencing, and efficient obstacle navigation.

Guidelines:

Eligibility:

  • Open to all college students.
  • Inter-college teams: Allowed
  • Inter-specialization teams: Allowed

Team Size:

  • A team may consist of a maximum of 5 members.
  • All bots and members must be registered before the event.

Prize Pool:

  • Total: 70,000
  • 1st Prize: 30,000
  • 2nd Prize: 25,000
  • 3rd Prize: 15,000

Rules:

  • Robots must follow the size and technical specifications provided in the competition rulebook.
  • All bots will undergo a mandatory compliance check before Round 1.
  • Hostages must be rescued within their designated time constraints.
  • Hostages must be securely stored in the bot’s carrier to earn points.
  • No manual intervention is allowed once the round begins.
  • Safety protocols must be followed to avoid harm to equipment, audience, or participants.
  • Any form of unsportsmanlike behavior (e.g., arguing with officials, damaging equipment) will result in penalties or disqualification.
  • Judges’ decisions regarding penalties, scoring, and compliance are final.
  • Rules may be updated; all participants will be notified of changes before the event.

column45:
The Computers & Mathematics Society (CMS) of Shri Ram College of Commerce (Asia's top commerce college), established in the 1960s is a student-led society dedicated to exploring technology, mathematics, and their intersection with various disciplines.

We are thrilled to announce the Shri Ram Mathematics Olympiad (SRMO) 2025 - a national-level competition that aims to identify, challenge, and celebrate exceptional mathematical talent among school students across India.
This Olympiad offers a golden opportunity for young minds to test their skills, challenge their intellect, and compete on a prestigious academic platform.

Eligibility:

  • Students from Classes IX, X, XI, and XII are eligible to participate.
  • Each grade will have a distinct syllabus and a separate test, ensuring fair evaluation suited to the participant’s academic level.

Exam Structure:

The Olympiad will comprise two sections designed to assess analytical and mathematical aptitude. While the question format may vary slightly, the structure will broadly include:

  • Preliminary Round – 60 questions, assessing; 60 minutes
  • Final Round – 30 questions; 45 minutes

Important Dates:

  • Preliminary Round: Saturday, 10th January 2025
  • Final Round: Saturday, 17th January 2025

Registration Details:

  • Fee: 149 per participant 

Rewards and Recognition

  • The Top 3 students from each grade (IX, X, XI, and XII) will be recognized as winners.
  • All participants will receive certificates of participation in recognition of their enthusiasm and commitment to learning.

Why Participate?

  • Strengthen your logical reasoning and mathematical problem-solving abilities.
  • Compete with some of the brightest students from across the nation.
  • Gain national-level recognition from SRCC that enhances your academic profile.

How to Prepare?

  • Revise your NCERT Mathematics syllabus thoroughly.
  • Practice logical reasoning and quantitative aptitude questions regularly.

Platform:

  • The Olympiad will be conducted online via Unstop, ensuring a smooth, secure, and convenient experience for all participants.

Registration Now Open!

Don’t miss the chance to demonstrate your mathematical excellence and shine as one of the brightest young minds in India.

column11: Pimpri Chinchwad College of Engineering and Research
column45:
Description:

Chakravyuh is an exciting robotics competition where participants design an autonomous bot to successfully complete two distinct stages: Stage 1 – Line Following and Stage 2 – Maze Solving. The winner is determined based on the total completion time across both stages. This competition challenges students’ technical, logical, and problem-solving skills in robotics design and navigation.

Guidelines:

Eligibility:

  • Open to all undergraduate students.
  • Inter-college teams allowed.
  • Inter-specialization teams allowed.

Team Size:

  • Maximum 4 members per team.

Registration:

  • Teams must register their bots and members prior to the event.

Competition Format:

  • Stage 1 – Line Following:
    • Bots follow a designated line track.
    • Deviation or getting stuck at any point returns the bot to the last checkpoint.
    • Repeating the same loop three or more times triggers repositioning at the last checkpoint.
    • Time taken to complete the track is recorded.
  • Stage 2 – Maze Solving:
    • Bots enter a maze after completing Stage 1.
    • Switching to maze-solving mode can be manual (button press) or automatic.
    • Repeating the same loop three or more times returns the bot to the last checkpoint.
    • Touching walls incurs penalties.
    • Objective: Reach the exit in the shortest possible time.

Rounds:

  • Round 1: Compliance check of bot specifications.
  • Round 2: Performance round – Line Following + Maze Solving.

Time Limit:

  • Each team has 10 minutes total for both stages.
  • Timer runs continuously; no pauses allowed.

Emergency Handling:

  • Officials may reposition a stuck bot at the last checkpoint.
  • Technical adjustments are allowed but the timer continues running.

Prize Pool:

  • Total: 30,000
  • 1st Prize: 15,000
  • 2nd Prize: 10,000
  • 3rd Prize: 5,000

Rules:

  • Bots must comply with the registered specifications.
  • Each team’s performance will be timed across both stages.
  • Repeated loops or deviations trigger repositioning at the last checkpoint.
  • Penalties apply for touching maze walls.
  • Completion time is the primary criteria; tie-breakers consider line-following accuracy and maze-solving efficiency.
  • All team members must adhere to event conduct guidelines.

Additional Notes:

  • Teams should ensure bots are fully functional and tested before the event.
  • Judges’ decisions are final regarding time recording, penalties, and compliance checks.

column11: G H Patel College of Engineering & Technology
column45:
GCET Hackathon 2026, a 24-hour coding marathon where talent meets technology and innovation knows no bounds! Whether you're a student, fresher, or coding enthusiast, this is your chance to showcase your skills, push your limits, and craft innovative solutions to surprise problem statements.

Eligibility:

  • Open to all tech students, freshers, and coding enthusiasts (Age: 18+)
  • No prior experience required – just your passion for coding!
  • Teams of up to 4 members are allowed (cross-institutional teams are welcome)
  • All programming languages are welcome

What’s expected from you:

  • Use real-time or dynamic data sources (avoid relying on static JSON unless for prototyping)
  • Create a responsive and clean UI
  • Validate user input robustly
  • Use version control (Git) properly
  • Optional: Design backend APIs, model data, and set up a local database
  • Optional: Plan for offline or local solutions
  • Use trendy technologies only if they add real value

Prizes:

  • Winner: 45,000 + Goodies + Certificate
  • 1st Runner-up: 35,000 + Goodies + Certificate
  • 2nd Runner-up: 25,000 + Goodies + Certificate
  • Exceptional performers may receive a job offer up to 8 LPA

Important Dates:

  • 3 January 2026: Virtual Round (9 am to 5 pm)
  • 8 January 2026: Virtual Round Result
  • 31 January 2026 : Final Round at GCET (24-hour coding marathon)

column45:
About the Competition:

  • National-level challenge inviting young designers and creative students from across India (and worldwide) to reimagine play through dolls that are soft, sustainable, and soulful.

The Challenge:

  • Design a Contemporary Indian Doll with an original backstory that connects and inspires all ages. Focus areas: Cultural authenticity (rooted in Indian regional diversity), emotional storytelling (warm, relatable, collectible), global resonance (inclusive, gender-neutral appeal) and  sustainability (eco-conscious materials), .

Eligibility:

  • Design and creative students from India and worldwide.
  • Individual or team(Max 3) submissions allowed.
  • Minors must have parental consent.

Timeline:

  • Launch: 14th November 2025
  • Submission Deadline: 31st January 2026
  • Winners Announced: 15th February 2026

Submission Requirements:

How to Participate:

Step 1: Imagine

  • Start by exploring an idea that represents today’s India — modern yet rooted, diverse yet connected.
  • Think of a story, a personality, or a spark that could inspire your doll’s design.

Step 2: Design

  • Translate your story into form. Sketch, illustrate, or 3D-model your doll — showing details like facial features, clothing, materials, and accessories. Make eco-conscious design choices.

Step 3: Express

  • Craft a short backstory (up to 200 words) describing your doll’s personality, origin, and values.
  • What makes your doll special? How does it reflect who we are and who we can be?

Step 4: Submit

Prepare your final submission:

  • A3 Poster (PDF or JPEG) – Visuals + short description
  • Concept Note (A4) – About your idea and materials
  • Profile (A4) – Individual or team details (max 3 members)

Step 5: Celebrate

  • Shortlisted designs showcased nationally and celebrated for creativity, sustainability, and cultural authenticity.

Prizes & Benefits:

  • Grand Prize (1 Winner): 1,00,000
  • Recognition as lead designer of featured doll
  • Showcase across digital platforms and national exhibitions
  • Exclusive mentorship with industry experts
  • Certificate of Excellence
  • Gold Prize (3 Winners): 25,000 each
  • Special recognition for exceptional creativity
  • Feature on press, social media, promotional campaigns
  • Mentorship with creative professionals and industry experts
  • Certificate of Excellence
  • Silver Prize (10 Winners): 5,000 each
  • Recognition on national platform
  • Opportunity to display designs in showcases and exhibitions
  • Featured on Instagram, Facebook, LinkedIn
  • Certificate of Excellence

Rules:

  • Doll must be original creation of the team.
  • Participants agree to abide by all competition rules and terms.
  • Minors must have parental/legal guardian consent before prize award.

column45:
JoyStix (DTU’s Video Game Development Society) and Cosmo (DTU’s Astronomy & Cosmology Society) present the JoyStix x Cosmo Winter Game Jam 2025 — a week-long online game development challenge open to students and indie developers across India.

The theme and the Itch.io submission link will be announced on 24th December.

Rules

  • Plagiarism is strictly prohibited.
  • Your game must be built entirely during 24–31 December.
  • Games that do not follow the theme will be disqualified.
  • You may reuse your own previously created assets, or use third-party assets only if you have proper commercial usage rights.
  • Team size: 1–5 members.

Judging Criteria

  • Originality
  • Theme Implementation
  • Visuals & Asset Harmony
  • Gameplay & Fun Factor
  • Polish & Completeness

Prize Pool

To be revealed soon. Stay tuned!

column45:
With SNAP right around the corner, it’s time to strengthen your preparation and maintain consistency. After sharpening your skills with daily quizzes, take the next step through our Sectional SNAP Mocks and a series of Full-Length SNAP Mock Tests.

Test your speed, accuracy, and exam strategy in a realistic setup, and boost your confidence for the final SNAP challenge.

Guidelines

  • Daily quizzes are available on our Instagram page: @scmhrd_admissions_pr
  • Sectional SNAP Mock contains 15, 25, 20 questions to be attempted in 15, 25, 20 minutes for General English, Analytical and Logical Reasoning, and Quantitative, Data Interpretation & Data Sufficiency sectional mocks respectively
  • Each Master SNAP Mock contains 60 questions to be attempted in 60 minutes
  • All rounds are non-eliminatory; every participant can attempt all mock tests
  • Registered aspirants will receive access to all Sectional and Master SNAP Mocks
  • The event is open to all and participation is individual for fair benchmarking

Important Note

  • Winners will be considered only for submissions made on or before 4th December, 11:59 PM IST
  • All mock tests will remain open for practice until 19th December, 11:59 PM IST
  • Access the Answer Key for all Rookie 10.0 Mock Tests on our Telegram channel:
    https://t.me/+j9MBhcUWmUkyZmM9

column45:
CAD Master Challenge 2026 is a national-level online 3D modelling competition organized by MESA under the Department of Mechatronics Engineering, Vasantdada Patil Pratishthan's College of Engineering and Visual arts
Participants will design the official “CAD Master Trophy” by creatively modifying a base trophy template provided after registration verification. The winning trophy design will be 3D printed and awarded during the felicitation ceremony.

Theme:

  • “Turning Ideas into Realistic 3D Creations”

Eligibility:

  • Open to all undergraduate and postgraduate engineering students
  • Teams of 2–4 members
  • Any CAD software can be used: SolidWorks, Fusion 360, CATIA, Creo, Onshape, AutoCAD, NX, etc.

Event Format:

  • Registration Phase
    • Participants register through Unstop. After verification, the base trophy file will be shared with the team.
  • Design Phase (5 Days)
    • Teams redesign or enhance the trophy using their CAD creativity.
  • Submission Phase
    • Participants must submit:
      • Final model in.STL (STEP optional)
      • Concept description
      • Renders/screenshots

Submission Guidelines:

  • File Format: STL (preferred), STEP optional
  • File Name: Name_College_DesignTitle.stl

Guidelines:

Eligibility

  • Event is open to all college students across India.
  • Participants can join individually .
  • No age or branch restriction.
  • Participants must register before the deadline.

Rules:

  • Each participant must attempt questions individually.
  • Switching tabs / cheating tools strictly prohibited.
  • Coding language choice is open (C, C++, Java, Python, JS, etc.).
  • Auto-proctoring or manual monitoring may be used.
  • Plagiarism = direct disqualification.

column45:
Round 1: Online Quiz (Unstop Platform) 

  • Format: Online Quiz hosted on Unstop.
  • Content: A 50-question quiz focusing on cricket knowledge, including IPL history, player 
    stats, rules, and general trivia.
  • Participation: Open to all students; teams can consist of 2 members.
  • Time Limit: 10 minutes.
  • Evaluation:
  • Teams will be scored based on accuracy and speed.
  • The top 10 teams with the highest scores will advance to Round 2. 

Round 2: IPL Auction (On Campus)

  • Format: A strategic auction game conducted offline.  
  • Objective: Teams will use a virtual budget of 100 crores to create their ideal cricket squad.

Guidelines: 

Squad Requirements:

  • Team Size: 17-22 players.
  • Mandatory Picks:
  • At least 7 foreign players.
  • At least 2 wicketkeepers.
  • At least 2 uncapped Indian players.
  • Teams can choose to retain players from the IPL 2024 season at specified costs.

Auction Details: 

  • The auction will have 9 rounds, each featuring players from different categories (e.g., batsmen, bowlers, all-rounders).
  • A base price will be set for each player.
  • Teams must adhere to their budget constraints.

Evaluation Criteria: 

  • Squad completeness.
  • Strategic balance of player roles and team diversity.
  • Adherence to budget and requirements.
  • Breaks: Short breaks between rounds to maintain energy and engagement.
  • Decorum: Teams are expected to maintain professionalism and punctuality throughout the event.

column2: ATLAS AI Trailblazers: Ignite The Future of AI
column45:
About ATLAS Skilltech University:

ATLAS SkillTech University is India’s first new-age urban multidisciplinary university. Founded to forge a path to the future, ATLAS is where the confluence of design, technology, strategy, and leadership takes place. We believe in breaking paths and conventions. We are constantly defining, shaping, and redefining the future of education in India right here in the heart of an ever-booming, cosmopolitan, and enterprising Mumbai.

With India’s National Education Policy 2020 as the cornerstone, ATLAS endeavours to deliver a multidisciplinary education across 3 new-age streams: Design & Innovation, Management & Entrepreneurship and Digital Technology. It has adopted a futuristic model co-created with an international community of scholars, academicians, industry experts, and world leaders in education. Our undivided focus on academic excellence, world-class faculty, state-of-the-art infrastructure, global institutional collaborations and unique corporate connect empowers students to succeed in Industry 4.0 and become socially-responsible global leaders.

Vision: To create leaders of the future who are equipped with the skills of tomorrow.

Mission: To empower learners with 21st-century skills and transdisciplinary knowledge to excel in Industry 4.0.

About the Competition:

Welcome to the ATLAS Hackathon 2025, a nationwide innovation challenge designed for young tech enthusiasts of Grades 11th and 12th (Science stream). This unique hackathon aims to inspire future engineers to explore the possibilities of AI-driven problem-solving through coding, logical reasoning, and real-world innovation.

Hosted by ATLAS SkillTech University, this hackathon offers students a chance to compete, learn, and showcase their creativity — all while getting a glimpse into the world of technology and design thinking.

What’s in it for You?

  • Exclusive mentorship from ATLAS University’s faculty during the finale.
  • Opportunity to network with industry experts and academic leaders.
  • Exposure to AI and Coding platforms during the hackathon.
  • Top performers may be considered for special recognition during the ATLAS B.Tech 2026 Admissions.

Prizes and Rewards:

  • Winners: INR 1,00,000, 25% Scholarship at ATLAS Skilltech University and Trophy
  • 1st Runners Up: INR 75,000, 20% Scholarship at ATLAS Skilltech University and Trophy
  • 2nd Runners Up: INR 50,000, 15% Scholarship at ATLAS Skilltech University and Trophy
  • 10% Scholarship for the remaining 7 Teams in the Top 10! 
  • All finalists will get a Certificate of Excellence, ATLAS Goodies and Merchandise, Exposure to ATLAS Faculty and Mentorship sessions.
  • All participants will receive a Certificate of Participation.
  • Finalists will receive a Certificate of Excellence signed by the Chancellor of ATLAS SkillTech University.

Eligibility:

  • Open to all students currently studying in Grades 11 and 12 (PCM Only) across India.
  • Participation can be in teams of 2-3 members.
  • Each team can have members from the same or different schools.
  • A student can participate in only one team.
  • There is no restriction on the number of teams from a school.
  • Any form of plagiarism or unfair practice will result in disqualification.

Competition Structure:

Round 1: MCQ and Coding Round

  • Opens on: 1st December 2025
  • Participants must register through the Unstop platform to confirm their entry.
  • Registered participants will receive a confirmation email with competition details and updates.
  • Teams must ensure their profiles are complete before the registration window closes.
  • This round combines Aptitude (MCQ-based) and Coding challenges to test participants’ logical reasoning, analytical ability, and technical skills.
  • It will be conducted online via Unstop.
  • Duration: 60 minutes
  • The round will be eliminatory, and Top 25 teams will move forward to the Grand Finale.

Round 2: Grand Finale

  • Date: 10th January 2026
  • Venue: ATLAS SkillTech University Campus
  • The Top 25 Teams from the Online Challenge will be invited to the campus to present their final solution to an esteemed panel of judges.
  • Each team will have 10 minutes to present, followed by 5 minutes of Q&A.
  • The round will include:
    • Live project presentation or prototypes
    • Jury evaluation based on innovation, feasibility, and presentation
  • Winners will be announced on the same day.

All final decisions lie with ATLAS Skilltech University and Unstop.

column2: Hack The Winter - The Second Wave (Angry Bird Edition)
column11: Graphic Era Hill University, Bhimtal Campus
column45:
Hack The Winter - The Second Wave (Angry Bird Edition) is a 24 hour national-level hackathon. Unlike other hackathons, we will not be limiting the problem sets to healthcare, sustainability, education, and smart automation.

 

We use wedded high quality questions for hackathons which are challenging but in a good way. These problem statements are important to showcase your skills for the actual hackathon. The problem statements will be given at the time of hackathon or pre-released a few days prior.

Teams are not restricted to a particular college, you can plan a reunion with all your friends from different colleges also.

Only shortlisted teams qualify for the on-site (physical) hackathon. Accommodation, local travel across campus (From Haldwani station - Bhimtal Campus) in fixed times, food, and technical arrangements will be provided. Food and technical arrangements are included in the hackathon fee; due to high demand for accommodation, a small accommodation fee may be requested for a priority pass otherwise common rest rooms are provided by default.

Themes & Problem statements (For Round1 + Round2): 

  • Web / App (Any idea with a Web / App interface)
  • Fintech 
  • AR / VR 
  • Governance (Build anything for the Govt)
  • Web3 / Blockchain 
  • AI / ML 
  • IoT & Automation
  • Open Innovation 

Problem statements for the final offine-round will be coming from NITI Ayog (Govt. Of India), which will be released a few days prior to the hackathon.

Eligibility & Guidelines:

  • Open to all college students (UG/PG) across India.
  • Participants can register in teams of 4 members.
  • Inter-college teams: Allowed.
  • Inter-specialization teams: Allowed, you can form team from different courses.
  • Each participant must have a valid student ID card and aadhaar card.
  • No change in team members post-registration.
  • A team can submit only one project idea.
  • Teams must bring their own laptops and peripherals for the on-site round.

Rules:

  • Internet usage is allowed for references, but plagiarism leads to disqualification.
  • All work must be original and completed during the hackathon timeframe.
  • The decision of the judges will be final and binding.
  • Misconduct, inappropriate behavior, or rule violations will result in disqualification.
  • All shortlisted teams must attend the physical hackathon in person.
  • No judgement in UI/UX part, so rather than code we focus on concept, research and basic implementation.

Bird’s-eye Judging & Leaderboard:

  • To ensure fairness and transparency, project evaluations will take place every 6 - 10 hours throughout the hackathon.
  • Each team’s progress, creativity, and implementation will be continuously assessed and displayed live on the public leaderboard, allowing participants to track their standing in real time.
  • Final review by three specialized panels (industry + academia) for technology, innovation, feasibility / impact (holistic score).

Nests & Piggy Bank (Logistics):

  • Online Qualifiers: Accessible anywhere with an internet connection.
  • Offline Final Round: To be conducted at Graphic Era Hill University, Bhimtal Campus.

Find my team: https://chat.whatsapp.com/KHEb5s37poCCVVW5xrIobV

column45:
Are you ready to test your business knowledge and have a fun time quizzing with us at Shaastra 2026? The Biz Quiz is the perfect event for anyone who loves learning about the world of business and all the fascinating stories it has to offer. From the history of business to unexpected collaborations, technology advancements, and pop culture, this quiz has it all. Whether you're an experienced business pro or just a curious learner, the Biz Quiz is an exciting and educational experience that you won't want to miss.
Come join us and see if you have what it takes to be a top business quiz master! Don't wait – register now and get ready to test your wits and acumen in the Biz Quiz at Shaastra 2026.

  • Team Size: 1-3 members
  • Date: 3rd January 2026
  • Both the prelims and final round will be held on IIT Madras campus
  • Venue and further communications will be shared to team leaders email id prior to the event.
  • Join the whatsapp group for further updates: Join here

Compete against the best at the Biz Quiz at Shaastra 2026!  Don't miss out – mark your calendars and start preparing now. See you there!

column2: Niti Manthan: Translating Constitutional Values into Real-World Solutions
column45:
Participant Guidelines 
Theme: “From Rights to Reality: Advancing Safety and Dignity for Delivery Riders through Constitutional and Policy Innovation” 

Round 1: Concept Note Submission 
Objective: 
Participants are required to submit an evidence-based, constitutionally grounded Concept Note proposing an innovative and feasible policy intervention addressing the theme. 

Submission Guidelines 

  • File Type: PDF only 
  • Word Limit: 1000–1500 words (excluding visuals, tables, citations and mandatory details) 
  • Font & Spacing: Times New Roman, 12 pt, 1.5 spacing
  • File Name Format: TeamName_NitiManthan

Mandatory Details (on the First Page) 

  • Team Name 
  • Institution Name
  • Names and Emails of All Members 

Concept Note Structure (1000–1500 words) 

  • Each concept note should clearly present an innovative, implementable, and constitutionally aligned policy proposal. Participants are encouraged to structure their submission around the following key sections: 
  • Title of the Proposal 
  • Provide a concise, descriptive title that captures your idea. 
  • Example: “RiderSafe: A Constitutional Framework for Gig Worker Safety in Urban India.” 
  • Challenge Area and Root Cause Analysis 
  • Define the specific policy challenge (e.g., unsafe working conditions, lack of accident insurance, algorithmic bias). 
  • Explain why this issue persists despite existing laws or policy frameworks. 
  • Proposed Policy Intervention and Implementation Strategy 
  • Present your central policy idea and its alignment with the Indian Constitution (Articles 14, 19(1)(g), 21, 38, 39, 42, and 43A). 
  • Ensure your proposal is economically feasible, socially inclusive, and technologically adaptive. 
  • Outline the implementation pathway.
  • Identify possible challenges or bottlenecks (financial, institutional, or behavioural) and propose solutions. 
  • Impact, Outcomes, and Stakeholders 
  • Describe the expected outcomes. 
  • Provide measurable indicators  
  • Identify and analyse key stakeholders
  • Constitutional and Ethical Justification 
  • Explain how your policy actualises the constitutional vision of justice, equality and dignity. 
  • Mention relevant Fundamental Rights, DPSPs, and judicial interpretations supporting your proposal. 
  • Formatting & Academic Integrity 
  • Citations: All data, frameworks, and sources must be properly cited in APA citation style. 

Plagiarism: Any form of plagiarism will lead to immediate disqualification. Submissions must reflect original analysis and ideas. 

SELECTED PARTICIPANTS WILL BE ADDED TO A WHATSAPP GROUP BY THE ORGANISERS. 

Round 2: On-Campus Policy Presentation (For Selected Teams) 
Objective: 
Shortlisted teams will present their refined policy ideas before an expert panel and peers, demonstrating constitutional reasoning, policy innovation, and real-world applicability. 

Presentation Guidelines 

  • Format: PowerPoint Presentation (PPT) 
  • Slide Limit: Maximum 10 content slides (excluding cover and thank-you slides) 
  • Structure Suggestion: 
  • Title & Problem Statement 
  • Root Cause & Context 
  • Constitutional Linkages 
  • Proposed Policy Solution 
  • Implementation Strategy 
  • Stakeholder Analysis 
  • Economic Feasibility 
  • Expected Impacts 
  • Expected Challenges and Mitigation Strategies
  • Key Takeaways / Conclusion 

Content Focus: 

  • The policy must remain aligned with constitutional values and feasibility. 
  • Ensure clarity, precision, and a clear pathway for implementation. 
  • Finalist teams will have 8 minutes to present and 2 minutes for Q&A. 
  • Cross-institutional teams are allowed.

column11: Open Air Theatre, Indian Institute of Technology Madras
column45:
Event Overview:

Robowars 2026 is an international-level combat robotics tournament where participants design, build, and battle powerful robots in a high-energy arena.
The event challenges teams to combine engineering innovation, strategic control, and mechanical design to defeat opponents while ensuring full compliance with safety regulations.

Event dates:

  • Video submission round: December 15, 2025
  • Prelims: January 3, 2026
  • Finals: January 4, 2026

Guidelines:

  • Team Size: Each team can have up to 5 members.  
  • Bot Dimensions: Maximum size of 75 x 75 x 100 cm.  

Weight Categories: 

  • 8 kg Class: Includes a 1% weight tolerance.  
  • 15 kg Class: Includes a 1% weight tolerance.  

Event Format:

Round 1: Video submission round

  • Teams must submit a 1-2 minute video showcasing their robot’s design, working mechanism, and mobility (include weapon test or drive demonstration).
  • The video will be evaluated based on innovation, functionality, safety compliance, and control precision to shortlist teams for the prelims.

Round 2: Qualifiers 

  • All teams will engage in combat within their respective weight categories.  
  • Points will be awarded based on performance.    

Round 3: Semifinals & Grand Finale

  • Semifinals will be conducted based on points earned in Round 1.  
  • Winners from the semifinals will progress to the thrilling Grand Finale, where the champions of each weight category will be crowned.  

Gear up for an unforgettable battle of skill, strategy, and engineering brilliance!

For any updates and queries, join the WhatsApp group: https://chat.whatsapp.com/EpXIXOGKRYW03cwNZPUtbv

column11: OAT, Indian Institute of Technology Madras
column45:
Guidelines:

  • Team Composition: Team can have upto 5 participants, with each team allowed to compete using 1 or 2 bots. Team member cannot be part of multiple teams. 
  • Categories: 1 bot category in which the game will be 1vs 1. 
                         2 bot category in which the game will be 2 vs 2. 

Note: For participating in both 2 vs 2 and 1 vs 1  categories, there should be three working bots (i.e., no parts should be reused)

  • Only Team leader should register, team names should not be repeated and a participant can be part of only 1 team. 

Event Format:

  • Video Submission Round: Initial round via Unstop. (Video submission is must) 
    Just submit the working bot, basically a testing round whether the bot is working or not and also to suggest changes (if any). 
  • Knockout Matches: Each match is played in two halves, each lasting 2 minutes.
  • Quarterfinals and Semifinals: Two halves of 3 minutes each.
  • Final Match: Played in two halves of 4 minutes each.

Arena Specifications: 

  • Dimensions: 305 cm x 183 cm 
  • Goalpost: 60 cm x 16 cm 
  • Penalty box: 80 cm x 36 cm 
  • Centre Circle Diameter: 60 cm 
  • Side wall height: 8 cm 
  • Surface: Plywood base covered with green sticker. (Thick stickering) 
  • Ball: The cue ball used in 8-ball pool. Diameter: 2.25 inches or 57.15 mm, weight - 170gm 

Bot Dimensions: 

  • Size: The bot must fit within a maximum size of 300 mm x 300 mm x 300 mm (L x B x H), including tires and convex hull. 
  • Weight: Maximum weight upto 5 kg, with a tolerance of ±5%.

column45:
Asian Paints Alchemy is a pioneering global platform in the Coatings and Material Science domain, designed to bring together ideas from industry experts, academia, and budding scientific minds. This initiative aims to foster transformative innovation and cultivate future leaders. 

Participants will have the opportunity to win PhD sponsorships, secure internship opportunities, and earn cash rewards! Asian Paints invites budding scientists with a passion for chemistry to join this exciting event, where they will interact with like-minded future scientists in the Coatings and Material Science domain.

Eligibility:

Open to candidates from India or abroad who are:

  • B.Tech or M.Tech in Paint, Surface Coating or Polymer Technology 
  • M.Sc Chemistry 
  • Currently pursuing PhD students in Chemistry 
  • Working professionals in the coating industry

Structure:

Registration

  •  To participate in the competition, you must register individually or in a team of 2 before 31st December, 2025, 11:59 PM.
  • Make sure to provide all the required information accurately, adhering to the eligibility mentioned above.

Alchemy – Virtual Conclave and Case Study Launch

  • During the Case Launch Session/Webinar, you'll have an incredible opportunity to engage in lectures and discussions with Dr S. Somanath, an Indian space scientist and the former Chairman of ISRO (January 2022–January 2025) and leaders from Asian Paints.
  • They will then give briefs directly to participants with respect to the problem statements.
  • Following the briefs, there will be a Question-Answer session where leaders will address any queries participants may have.

Submission Phase - I:

  • You may submit individually or in teams of 2.
  • Each participant/team will have to submit a summary of their solution for the case in a 3 to 10-slider PPT format.
  • The first slide should contain the name of the participant/team members, and the remaining slides (up to 7) are for analysis and/or deliverables to the problem at hand. Any supporting Excel sheets etc. should be embedded in the PPT itself.
  • Due credits should be given to any references taken.
  • Naming Convention: CampusName_YourName (or) OrganizationName_YourName 
  • Students are requested to tune into the Live Case Study Brief Session to help understand the case study problem statements and shape their submissions with guidance from the Asian Paints team. 

Submission Phase - II:

  • The shortlisted participants/teams will have to fine-tune their submission basis the brief provided at a later stage.
  • Each team is required to submit their case summary in a 10-slide PPT format.
  • The first slide must include the team name, and the remaining slides (up to 10) should encompass analysis and/or deliverables related to the given problem.
  • Embed any supporting materials, such as Excel sheets, directly within the PPT.
  • Due credits should be given to any references taken.
  • Naming Convention: CampusName_YourName (or) OrganizationName_YourName 

Alchemy Grand Finale:

  • Finalist teams to present their case to the Jury in the Grand Finale.

What's in it for you?

  • Winners have the opportunity to win:
    • PhD Sponsorships: Valued at up to USD 6,000 or INR 5 lakhs. For current PhD students, if you win, your academic fees will be covered by Asian Paints (T&C Applied).
    • Cash Rewards: Up to INR 1 lakh or USD 1,200.
    • Internship Opportunities: Available at the Asian Paints R&T Centre.
  • Finalists will be considered from all cohorts: B.Tech, M.Tech/M.Sc students, PhD, and working professionals.
  • Want to become a Campus Ambassador while competing? Here’s your chance to shine!
    • Register now and stand a chance to win exciting prizes, exclusive merchandise, and internship opportunities with Asian Paints.
    • As an ambassador, you’ll lead the charge for Asian Paints Alchemy 2025 on your campus - driving registrations and creating buzz through engaging promotional activities!
    • Kindly note that this is not a mandatory task to be a part of the competition. Only the interested registrants are required to enrol themselves as Campus Ambassadors at - Click Here

Note: Past Winners of both the Alchemy editions will not be eligible to participate in this year’s edition.

column45:
About:

Quantified Dilemma is a unique blend of game theory, decision science, and human psychology presented through a series of strategic and analytical games. Participants will navigate challenges ranging from auctions and negotiation scenarios to dynamic optimization and uncertainty-based decision-making tasks. The event tests not only mathematical reasoning and coding ability but also intuition, adaptability, and strategic thinking under pressure.

The competition unfolds in two stages:

Round 1,2,3 – Prelims (Online):

  • Format: Submission-based round hosted on Unstop.
  • Description: Participants solve a set of strategy-driven and quantitative problems designed to simulate real-world decision environments. Analytical precision and reasoning depth are key.
  • Date: To be announced (tentatively mid-December 2025).

Finals (Offline):

  • Format: On-site interactive event conducted at IIT Madras.
  • Description: Shortlisted participants face live strategic scenarios — including negotiation simulations, team-based market challenges, and decision puzzles — that blend logic, psychology, and competitive gameplay.
  • Date: To be held during Shaastra 2026 at IIT Madras (early January 2026).

The event features both individual and team rounds, encouraging participants to showcase their analytical depth as well as their collaborative and strategic coordination.

column45:
RoboGP is an IC ENGINE powered buggy race, where teams design and control their own high-speed, manually operated robots to tackle a tough racetrack. The track is packed with twists, turns, jumps, rough terrain, and steep inclines that test every aspect of a bot’s design and control system. Each team’s goal is to build a robot that can cover the maximum distance in the shortest time while maintaining speed, balance, and precision. It’s a competition that brings together creativity, engineering skill, and sharp reflexes, pushing both the bots and their operators to the limit.

Competetion details:

  • VIDEO SUBMISSION: Each team must submit a clear video showcasing their robot’s design, functionality, and performance on a test track.The video should highlight the robot’s speed, control, and must be submitted before the deadline for evaluation and shortlisting.
  • QUALIFIERS: All teams participate individually in this round.Each car has given 2 laps.Each driver’s fastest time in this qualifying round will be considered
  • SEMI - FINALS:Qualified teams will be divided into groups, and each group will compete in a race.Winners of each group will qualify for the final round.Pit stops are available for fueling, tire changes and maintenance.Grid positions will be based on each driver’s fastest time in the qualifying round.
  • FINALS:Teams that qualify from the semi-finals will advance to the final race.The final race will be of longer duration.Pit stops are available.Grid positions for the final will be based on the number of laps completed in the semi-final (in the given time).

Rules:

  • Specifications of the car must be submitted at the start of the competition.
  • All participating cars must successfully pass a technical inspection before the race to ensure they meet all design and safety requirements.
  • If a car stops, falls, or goes off the track, a team member is allowed to place it back at the exact point where it stopped or left the track
  • Dimensions are specified in the PS.
  • The engine must be nitro-based two-stroke engine, with a displacement of 3.5cc - 4.5 cc.

column45:
"Financial resources sustain a company, but human resources shape its destiny."

National Human Resource Olympiad is a mammoth initiative by The Human Resource Development Cell of SRCC, designed particularly for aspiring HRs, or for those who are beginning their preparation for the corporate exposure, to test their knowledge and skills at the national level. 

Human Resource Management is the strategic and coherent approach to effectively and efficiently managing people in an organisation to help their business gain a competitive advantage.

This Olympiad aims to educate and motivate the country's students to achieve excellence in Human Resource & General Management.

Eligiblity:

  • Open to students from Classes 9 to 12 (all streams).
  • Only individual participation is allowed.

Olympaid Structure:

  • The Olympiad will be conducted online on 26 December 2025.
  • The olympiad consists of 50 questions per section, to be completed in 60 minutes. Questions will be in MCQs (Multiple Choice Questions) format: Concept-based, case-based, picture-based, assertion-reasoning, and match-the-following questions.

Subjects Covered:

  • Human Resources (HR), Business Studies, Logical Reasoning, General Knowledge, Economics

Marking Scheme:

  • +4 marks for each correct answer
  • -1 mark for each incorrect answer
  • 0 marks for unattempted questions

Preparation:

  • We have provided the Sample Booklet that can be accessed after registration to familiarize participants with the types of questions and basic framework.
  • The Olympiad covers a wide range of subjects, so review the topics thoroughly.

Perks of Participation:

  • Knowledge Expansion : Gaining in-depth insights into HR, business management, and more.
  • Developing Critical Skills: Helps sharpen logical reasoning and problem-solving abilities.
  • Recognition: All participants will receive a Participant Certificate, acknowledging their hard work.
  • Win Big: All the participants will compete for a share of the 80,000 prize pool that contains both cash and in-kind prizes.

column11: Indian Institute of Technology, Banaras Hindu University (IIT - BHU)
column45:
Design Rush is the ultimate UI/UX competition, where teams take on real challenges provided by startups. The participants craft wireframes, prototypes, and dynamic solutions as they showcase their design prowess and help startups navigate the digital landscape in this thrilling competition.

Participants will be provided with a design-based challenge to assess, solve, and present their solutions to. We aim to encourage the entrepreneurship and problem-solving skills of the participants by letting them go through different rounds of the event, with each proceeding round with a greater level of zeal and difficulty.

Participants will form teams consisting of 1-4 members and will choose a challenge of their own choice from a given set of problem statements, on the basis of which they will prepare an interactive UI as a solution to their chosen PS. 

Final round will be held offline and paid passes will be required.

Eligibility Criteria:

  • Team Size: 1-4 members.
  • Open to all including undergraduate or postgraduate students, professionals, entrepreneurs etc.
  • Cross-college teams are allowed.
  • An individual can be a part of one team only.

Judging Criteria:

Round 1: Wireframing Round

  • Originality and innovativeness of the design.
  • Relevance of the design to the startup.
  • Minimalism of the design.
  • Presentation and impact of the design on the audience.

Round 2: Prototyping Round

  • Problem framing: Capturing the essence.
  • User experience: efficient, effective, memorable, learnable, error-free, smooth.
  • Impact: Comprehensibility and emotional significance.
  • Presentation of the entry and quality of the deliverable.

Round 3: Presentation Round

  • The teams will need to present their prototypes in front of the jury panel

Submission Guidelines:

  • Submission of Round 1: Team leaders have to upload their files on google drive giving access and share the link in the submission box.
  • Submission of Round 2: Team leaders have to submit the UI/UX prototypes.
  • Only 1 submission is allowed per team.
  • Nomenclature: The submission files should be named in this format "TeamName_DesignRush_RoundNo.".

column11: The Indian Institute of Technology Varanasi IIT (BHU)
column45:
AdVenture: The Branding Challenge, hosted by E-Cell IIT BHU as part of E-Summit 2026, is a platform for college students to showcase their creativity and marketing skills. The competition has three rounds: a quiz testing knowledge on startups and innovation, a creative ad campaign reel submission addressing a real-world product problem, and a live pitch where finalists present their campaign through a dramatized performance. This is an exciting opportunity to demonstrate strategic thinking, creativity, and effective communication in a competitive environment.

Eligibility Criteria:

  • Open to all (students, professionals, entrepreneurs).
  • Cross-college teams allowed; one individual can join one team only.

Judging criteria:

  • Clarity of Thought
  • Time Management
  • Creativity
  • Feasibility
  • Presentation & Pitch

Guidelines:

  • The video submission must not exceed 60 seconds in length.
  • The video title should be formatted as: "TeamName_AdVenture".
  • Only one submission is allowed per team.
  • Participation is allowed in teams of 1-4 members.
  • Each participant can only be part of one team.
  • No prior experience in marketing or branding is required; a passion for innovation and  entrepreneurship is encouraged

column11: Indian Institute of Technology (Banaras Hindu University), Varanasi - 221005
column45:
Details:

  • What if you could live the startup grind — the rush of bold ideas, the weight of impossible choices, and the thin line between success and collapse?
    Founder’s Gambit throws you into a simulated startup journey where every decision shapes your company’s fate.
  • Across multiple unpredictable stages, you’ll face real entrepreneurial challenges — from launching your idea to surviving market chaos — each demanding strategy, instinct, and courage.
  • No two paths are the same. Some startups soar. Others vanish. Will yours outlast the gambit?

Guidelines:

  • A team shall consist of 1–3 members.
  • All teams start from the same opening challenge — but your decisions will determine your journey ahead. Two teams might begin together yet find themselves in entirely different worlds by the next stage.
  • A team may be eliminated mid-round if their simulated startup collapses or their path leads to a dead end.
  • All matters of eligibility and judgment lie solely with the e-Summit organizing team, whose decisions will be final and binding.
  • Participants are expected to uphold professionalism and decorum throughout the event.
  • For any uncertainties or clarifications, the organizers are your point of contact — but remember, even the best founders must sometimes face ambiguity alone.

Eligibility:

  • Open to all — undergraduates, postgraduates, professionals, entrepreneurs, and anyone daring enough to test their startup instincts.
  • Cross-college teams are welcome.
  • However, no individual may be part of more than one team.

Judging Criteria:

Your startup’s fate will be evaluated on:

  • Relevance to the Problem
  • Clarity and Presentation
  • Feasibility and Practicality
  • Strategic Thinking and Timeline

column45:
Calling all the visionaries, are you ready to make your research read and ideas heard?

"Research means that you don't know, but are willing to find out." - Charles F. Kettering, an American engineer and inventor

The Hindi Sahitya Sabha of Shri Ram College of Commerce is back with the third edition of its annual magazine- Drhan, a magazine revered for its excellence in all the domains of literature and writings.

The world needs your insights, let your paper make the impact it deserves!

From the timeless realms of literature to the evolving frontiers of science our themes invite you to think deeply, write boldly, and question freely. Choose your topic, craft your perspective, and let your words spark dialogue.

A platform for innovation, inquiry, and impact your ideas deserve the spotlight.
Let’s dive deeper into what awaits you.

The themes that matter :

  • Art and culture
  • Indian writers and poets
  • Innovation and technology
  • Science and health
  • Society and Lifestyle

Please find the detailed list of the topics below.

Click here for : "List of the topics"

For the Thinkers of Words and Worlds:
Submit your articles that reinterpret classics, question narratives, or uncover forgotten chapters. Celebrate the beauty of language, the power of literature, and the emotion behind expression, because every word can ignite thoughts.

For the Curious Beyond Boundaries:
From science to society, from innovation to introspection, your ideas belong here.
Write pieces that dissect contemporary issues, unravel hidden patterns, or imagine bold solutions. Be it a thought experiment, a cultural reflection, or a scientific insight, Drhan is your canvas for curiosity.

Ready to make the mark?

Grab the topics, explore your domain, and let your ideas take form.
We can’t wait to witness your creativity and intellect come alive in Drhan 2026 — where thought meets expression.

Please adhere to the following guidelines when submitting your article for the competition:

  • Submission Deadline: Upload your articles before 9th January 2026, 11:59 PM.
  • Submission Details: Include the following details with your article:
  • Name
  • Institute
  • Contact Details: Email ID, Contact number, LinkedIn profile
  • Batch
  • Formatting Guidelines:
  • Font: Mangal
  • Size: 12
  • File Format: Word (.doc/.docx)
  • Do NOT send PDF files, and kindly stick to the format.
  • Language: Hindi only
  • Author Details: Maximum 3 authors, need to be from the same institute.
  • Word Limit:  Maximum: 2000 words & Minimum: 1000 words
  • File Naming Convention: Name1_Name2_Name3_InstituteOfTeamLeader.doc/docx
  • Image Guidelines: Any image without a source or label will not be accepted.
  • References: References should be cited wherever necessary.
  • Originality:
  • The article should be original and should not have been/should not be published elsewhere.
  • Any instances of plagiarism will lead to disqualification.
  • Submission Details: Submit your articles on darshani.hss.srcc@gmail.com

Note:

  • Participants can be enrolled in any program at the time of registration. Cross-year participation is encouraged.
  • Team Leaders will be the primary point of contact for all communication and updates.
  • The selection of articles will be solely based on the decision of the editorial board.
  • Failure to comply with the rules will result in disqualification.
  • A letter of appreciation will be provided to the top participants/team, and their articles will be featured in our magazine with due credits.
  • Certificate of Participation will be provided to all the participants.
  • All graphics, including images, graphs, and illustrations, should be of high quality.
  • Infographics will fetch you brownie points.

The pen is your power, it’s time to wield it!

column45:
L’Oréal Brandstorm is a global innovation challenge by the L’Oréal Group, offering young minds a platform to reimagine the future of beauty through technology and innovation. It’s designed to enhance your creativity, entrepreneurial mindset, and problem-solving skills while tackling real-world business challenges.

Echoing L’Oréal’s philosophy of innovation, entrepreneurship, and excellence, Brandstorm encourages you to think boldly, collaborate globally, and turn ideas into impact. Supported by mentorship from senior leaders, brand managers, and HR, the competition unfolds through domestic and international rounds, providing a truly transformative experience.

Get ready to learn, innovate, and grow - because in Brandstorm, you don’t just compete; you create the future.

Brandstorm mission – what we expect from you 

Your Brandstorm 2026 mission is to:

CRAFT THE FUTURE OF LUXURY FRAGRANCE POWERED BY CREATIVITY, TECH & SCIENCE

The world of luxury fragrance is ready for reinvention. Consumers crave sensorial journeys and emotional connections that go beyond the bottle.

Your mission: transcend traditional perfumery — design bespoke products, services, and immersive experiences that redefine how people connect with scent.

Join L’Oréal Brandstorm 2026, in partnership with L’Oréal Luxe Division, and bring your boldest ideas to life.

Eligibility Criteria:

  • Students and working professionals can register for the competition online through this link: https://brandstorm.loreal.com
  • Participants must register themselves individually on the platform first and then form teams of 3
  • Brandstorm 2026 is open to:
    • Everyone between 18 and 30. No prior experience or specific background required.
  • You cannot participate in this competition if:
    • You have already participated in the Competition in a previous year and reached the international finals 
    • You are an employee of - L'ORÉAL and its Affiliates 
    • You are a trainee and/or student who did an internship at L'ORÉAL in the department of the brand or division concerned, and/or exercised a relevant function linked to the case study subject matter during the two (2) years preceding the Competition 
  • Teams need to submit their ideas on https://brandstorm.loreal.com
  • The format for the submission is a 3-slide PDF along with a video (Duration: 3 minute) of your team explaining the idea
  • All the deliverables must be done in English
  • The presentations submitted to the organizers at every stage of the competition must be compliant with the guidelines that will be shared during the competition and comply with intellectual property

Team Formation Guidelines:

  • Each participant is allowed to register for one team ONLY
  • The participants can be from any specialisation
  • Inter-campus teams are allowed to participate
  • There is no restriction on the number of teams from an institute
  • Only entries submitted before the due date will be considered for evaluation. Any exception to this will be purely at the discretion of the management
  • If the participant is found to have plagiarised any aspect of their entry, the participant will be disqualified
  • The final eligibility of the participant will be subject to the discretion and approval of the management
  • Any extensions in the deadlines will be at the sole discretion of the management
  • All information related to timelines/case rules will be updated on the Unstop website and L'Oréal's Facebook, Instagram & LinkedIn pages

Stages:

Each team needs to register and successfully complete each stage.

Stage 1: Registration 

  • Go to the Platform: https://brandstorm.loreal.com
  • Click on the log-in button at the top right corner or scroll down for the Registration button and follow the registration procedure. Fill in the registration form, providing all necessary information for managing participation
  • Click on [SIGN UP] to confirm their registration
  • Participants must register themselves individually on the platform first and then form teams of 3
  • Release of the case:
    • Additionally, participants get access to confidential data and materials to help them execute their pitch and presentation.

Treasure Hunt:

  • It is a non-eliminatory round.
  • All the team members will be able to attempt the Treasure Hunt.

Stage 2: Case Submission

  • All teams are requested to represent case solutions briefly on a 3-slide PDF along with a video (Duration: 3 minutes) of your team explaining the idea
  • You can add additional slides for the cover and appendix, i.e maximum slide limit is 5 slides
  • Teams need to submit their ideas at https://brandstorm.loreal.com

Stage 3: Masterclass by L'Oréal Leaders: There will be 4 Masterclasses that will offer the participants a chance to refine their presentation skills and gain valuable insights for optimising their submissions.

Stage 4: Detailed Submission: Shortlisted teams must fine-tune their deck and the 3-minute video and submit. Details for the same will be shared with the shortlisted teams over email. Shortlisted teams will move to the next phase where they present in front of the jury. 

Stage 5: Semi-Finals: Shortlisted teams will present in front of the jury during the Semi-Final, with the top 6 teams advancing to the next round.

Stage 6: Mentorship: The L'Oréal team will assign mentors and coaches to guide these 6 teams in refining their submissions.

Stage 7: National Finals: The top 6 teams will compete for the National Grand Finale. Teams will be presenting their solutions to the eminent jury members from L'Oréal India.

Final Stage: Worldwide Finals

  • International Finals: The national winner will be invited to join the International finals.

Judging Criteria:

At each step, the projects will be evaluated out of 25 points. The weighting of the evaluation criteria is mentioned below:

                     EVALUATION CRITERIA         MAX POINTS
                             INNOVATIVE                  5
                           SUSTAINABLE                  5
                              INCLUSIVE                  5
                               FEASIBLE                  5
                              SCALABLE                  5
                           TOTAL GRADE                 25

What are we expecting from you?

  • Innovative - We want your team to be bold and bring to the table products and solutions never seen before.
  • Sustainable – We want your team to take responsibility and be mindful of the impact that your project will have on the planet.
  • Inclusive – We want your team to be mindful of diverse needs in our society to not exclude any particular social groups (gender, sexual orientation, socio-economic and multicultural origins, people with disability, all ages & generations...), and to make your project as equally accessible as possible to all potential users.
  • Feasible – We want your project to be realistic and possible to implement.
  • Scalable – We want your team to present a project realisable on a large scale.

Please bear in mind the relevance of the project regarding the division and market’s needs, the team spirit, and the general appearance of the presentation. In the event that there are several submissions with the same score, the jury will be free to decide which project they want to select. 
 
The evaluation will be the same regardless of whether the presentation is held in person or online.  For the World Final only, in addition to the criteria mentioned above, the jury members will be able to grant a “special like” to the projects of their choice. 

Rewards:

  • MEGA AWARD - Intrapreneurship Award: During the Worldwide Final, one prize will be awarded to the Winning Team according to the criteria mentioned above. The reward will be an Intrapreneurship program. The winning Team will get the opportunity to work (an appropriate type of contract, collaboration, internship agreement or any other type of agreement will be proposed to each winning team member depending on their profile) in one of L'ORÉAL head offices as any L'ORÉAL employee. This award gives the opportunity to live an intrapreneurship experience with L'ORÉAL experts. L'ORÉAL will have all reserved rights on all the intellectual property built by the students during the Competition if any. L'ORÉAL will assign mentors and coaches to guide the Participants throughout the program. The Participants of the program will be paid according to L'ORÉAL payroll standards. More information on this will be given throughout the competition
  • Get Spotted: National Winners will be extended Pre-Placement Interview Offers with L’Oréal  and will also get the opportunity to compete against other national finalists from different countries in the battle for the title of International Winner. L’Oréal India also extends PPIs to select students from the Preliminary Rounds, depending upon their individual performance during the competition
  • Build Your Network: Connect with the L’Oréal Leadership and Students from 65+ countries at the International Finals. Last but not least, live the life of a Brand Manager through the Competition Journey and learn, from close quarters, how L’Oréal is leading innovation in beauty

column45:
BYPASS CTF 2025 is a national-level Capture The Flag (CTF) competition designed to challenge and identify India’s brightest cybersecurity minds.
The event brings together passionate students who love solving complex puzzles, breaking barriers, and defending systems.
Organized by a dedicated team of security enthusiasts, BYPASS CTF aims to inspire curiosity, collaboration, and innovation among the next generation of ethical hackers.

Event Overview:

The competition will be conducted in two rounds — an online qualifier followed by an onsite grand finale.

Round 1: Online Qualifier

  • Duration: 36 hours (non-stop CTF)
  • Mode: Online (accessible nationwide)
  • Eligibility: Open to all college students across India
  • Team Size: Individual participation or teams of up to 2 members
  • Format: Jeopardy-style CTF with multiple challenge categories
  • Domains Covered:
    • Web Exploitation
    • Steganography
    • Digital Forensics
    • Reverse Engineering
    • OSINT (Open-Source Intelligence)
    • Cryptography
    • Miscellaneous Challenges

Top 30 teams from the online leaderboard will qualify for the onsite finals.

Round 2: Onsite Grand Finale

  • Venue: Army Institute of Technology, Pune
  • Duration: 2 days
  • Format: Live, in-person CTF battle
  • Participants: Top 30 teams from Round 1

Join Whatsapp Group : https://chat.whatsapp.com/GMFy9UkfbLkIEo87S003ap?mode=wwt

Workshops & Activities:

Before the main battle, participants will attend interactive workshops by industry experts covering emerging trends, tools, and techniques in cybersecurity.
Fun, tech-based mini-games and challenges will also be conducted to foster collaboration and excitement before the competition begins.

Main CTF Battle:

Teams will compete head-to-head in an intense cybersecurity arena to capture the most flags in the shortest time.
Each challenge will test a unique skill domain, requiring technical expertise, creativity, and teamwork.

The team with the highest score on the leaderboard will be crowned BYPASS CTF 2025 Champion .

Team & Eligibility Guidelines:

  • Open to all college students (undergraduate, postgraduate, or diploma).
  • Inter-college teams are allowed.
  • Inter-specialization teams are allowed.
  • A team may have up to 2 members or participate individually.
  • Participants must have a valid college ID.

Process & Timeline:

  • Registration Phase: Teams register on Unstop.
  • Round 1 – Online CTF:
    • Duration: 36 hours
    • Mode: Online (link and credentials shared via email)
    • Platform:  CTFd or similar.
  • Evaluation: Based on leaderboard ranking and accuracy of flags captured.
  • Round 2 – Onsite Finale:
    • Top 30 teams invited to AIT Pune.
    • Includes workshops, networking, and the grand finale CTF.

Rules:

  • Participants must compete using their own accounts; no flag sharing or collusion is allowed.
  • Use of automated tools or scripts that unfairly manipulate the platform is prohibited.
  • Teams must maintain academic integrity and sportsmanship throughout the event.
  • Organizers reserve the right to disqualify any team violating the rules or engaging in unethical behavior.
  • Decisions of the organizers and judges will be final and binding.
  • The top teams may be required to verify their identity and college credentials before prize distribution.

Judging Criteria:

  • Leaderboard Ranking: Based on total points accumulated.
  • Time Factor: Teams solving challenges faster rank higher in case of a tie.
  • Rule Compliance: Any rule violations will result in penalties or disqualification.

Prizes & Recognition:

  • Exciting cash prizes, swag, and certificates for top-performing teams.
  • Winners and finalists will receive recognition across Unstop and partner platforms.

column45:
Backwaters presents "InQuizzitive", an exciting online business quiz that brings together the sharpest minds in the country. Participants will be challenged across diverse domains, including marketing, finance, general knowledge, current affairs, and more. Quizzing enthusiasts from around the world are invited to join this premier competition, hosted by the prestigious Indian Institute of Management Kozhikode as part of its annual management fest, Backwaters. 

Rules and Guidelines:

  • The event organizers' decision will be final and binding.
  • Cash prizes up to INR 35000 to be won.
  • Timelines of the event are subject to change at the discretion of the Backwaters Committee.

column2: Excel at Excel: Escape Room Challenge
column45:
In the dynamic world of business, mastering Excel is more than a skill - it's a superpower. Backwaters 2026 presents the 3rd edition of Excel at Excel, a thrilling competition designed to push your analytical prowess and creativity to the limits.

Guidelines: Step into the shoes of a data-driven strategist, with each “room” representing a real-world challenge that demands quick thinking, technical acumen, and Excel expertise. Navigate through progressively tougher puzzles - clean messy datasets, extract critical insights, visualise complex trends, and solve logic-based challenges - all within a ticking clock.

This competition is more than just formulas; it’s a test of speed, intuition, and analytical finesse in unravelling business complexities.

column45:
Welcome to Botman Begins, the ultimate AI-only challenge at Backwaters 2026!

This event is designed to push the boundaries of what artificial intelligence can do and how creatively humans can harness it.

From clever prompts to fully AI-generated creations, Botman Begins is a playground for anyone who wants to explore, experiment, and innovate with AI.

The core idea? To see how far you can stretch AI, and how humans can make it their own.

  • Show your mastery of AI tools to generate solutions, visuals, scripts, and ideas.
  • Think creatively within the AI ecosystem.
  • Integrate AI outputs into human-centred, practical solutions.

Rules 

  • 100% AI usage: All submissions must be generated using AI tools. No human-written outputs allowed.
  • Teams may use any AI platform at their discretion

column2: Big Bull: The Stock Trading Showdown
column45:
Big Bull brings you an exciting Stock Market Simulation where participants step into the shoes of an investor and test their financial knowledge - without the real risk of losing money. 

For 5 days, participants will trade in a simulated market, interpret real-time news, track live market data, and strategise to maximise profits. This is your chance to experience real-world investing in a safe environment and showcase your market acumen. 

Event Schedule:

  • Start Date: January 5, 2026 (Monday)
  • End Date: January 9, 2026 (Friday)
  • Trading Hours: 9:35 AM-3:25 PM (aligned with live market hours)
  • Duration: 5 consecutive trading days Guidelines for Trading Round 

Rules:

  • Each participant will receive virtual capital to trade in the stock market simulation.
  • Trades can only be placed during market hours (9:35 AM to 3:25 PM).
  • No trades will be accepted after the market closes.
  • Participants must adhere strictly to timelines.
  • The event is an individual participation.
  • Use of real-time market data and news updates is encouraged for strategy-making. 

Evaluation & Winners:

  • The winner will be the participant who has the highest portfolio value at the end of the event (January 9, 2026, 3:25 PM).
  • Portfolio = Cash Balance + Value of Stocks Held.
  • In case of a tie, winners will be decided based on risk-adjusted returns and consistency of performance. 

Why Participate?

  • Gain hands-on trading experience without risking real money.
  • Learn to interpret news, trends, and data like real investors.
  • Test and improve your financial knowledge and decision-making skills.
  • Compete for exciting prizes and recognition.
  • Build confidence for real-world stock market investing.

Get ready to experience the thrill of trading and prove your skills as the next Big Bull!

column45:
Abhivyakti - The student magazine of DMS, MNIT Jaipur proudly invites submissions for it's inaugural edition. 

We at Abhivyakti believe in the synthesis of Industry and Academia and want to create a publication that caters to the problems of the business world with nuanced and critical perspectives. 

A student can write for a maximum of one prompt from the following list. 

  • Marketing 
    1. Competitive Pricing Vs Distribution Channels - What's more important in achieving market disruption.
    2.Does your brain buy it for you? - Consumer psyhcology and it's impact in purchase behaviour. 
  • Human Resource
    1.Disconnecting to connect with oneself - Is India ready for Right to Disconnect?
    2.Constructive Disagreements -  The art of conflict management in the 21st century.
  • Data Analytics
    1.A myth called Privacy? - How algorithms influence our decision making and thinking patterns.
    2.From Carbon to Cash: The Analytics behind Sustainable Profits.
  • Finance/Economics
    1. Please Value Me - Deconstructing valuations in the Indian context.
    2.Majority Matters - Role of unorganized sector in India's growth story. 
  • Special Prompt
    How geopolitical conflicts have altered the global supply chains? 

Guidelines for Submission:

  • Article Length: 500 words 
  • Deadline: 15th November 2025
  • Format: .doc format only
  • Plagiarism & AI: More than 10% (in either case) will lead to automatic disqualification.
  • References & Citations: Mandatory as per usage (APA format). 
  • Author Bio: Short bio at the beginning of the article.
  • Limit: Each person may submit a maximum of1 article. 
  • Formatting: Times New Roman, font size 12
  • File Naming: Follow the convention - Author Name1_Author Name 2_Institution
  • Visuals: Infographics and graphs are encouraged for added points.

Featured articles will be getting a Certificate of Appreciation.

column45:
E-Contest: Unleash Your Coding Creativity!

Ready to embark on a coding adventure unlike any other? Dive into the E-Contest, where conventional coding takes a backseat and you’re invited to explore the fascinating world of esoteric programming languages! These quirky, unconventional languages challenge your logical skills and reward innovative thinking. Here’s your chance to think outside the box, tackle unusual coding problems, and compete for some fantastic prizes!

Why Join:

This isn’t your usual coding contest. In the E-Contest, you’ll test the limits of your programming knowledge, enhance your problem-solving abilities, and become familiar with languages you’ve probably never seen before. It’s the perfect opportunity to stand out, sharpen your skills, and win awesome rewards!

Event Format:

  • Individual Event: Each participant competes solo, ensuring a fair and focused experience for everyone.
  • Two Rounds: The contest consists of online prelims and finals at IIT Madras during Shaastra.

How It Works:

  • Esoteric Language Introduction: At the start of the contest, you’ll be introduced to an esoteric programming language along with essential guidance on how to use it. Don’t worry if you’ve never seen it before; a quick introduction will get you up to speed.
  • Challenge Set: A set of questions will be provided, each requiring creative solutions coded in the assigned language. The questions are designed to test your problem-solving skills and ability to adapt to unusual coding syntax and concepts.
  • Scoring:
    • Points will be awarded for each correctly solved problem.
    • The maximum points and fastest solutions will determine the winner, so accuracy and speed are both crucial.

Winner Selection:

  • The individual with the highest score and the least time taken to solve all problems will be declared the winner.
  • In case of ties or discrepancies, decisions made by the event coordinators will be final.

Important Notes:

  • The link for the event will be shared soon on Unstop.
  • Regular Updates: Stay tuned to our website for ongoing updates and information.
  • Queries & Support: Join our official communication channels to ask questions and receive prompt responses from event coordinators.

Are you ready to take on the challenge and dive into the world of esoteric programming? Test your creativity, showcase your skills, and make your mark!

Join now and prepare for the ultimate coding adventure!

column11: Vivekananda Institute of Professional Studies- Technical Campus
column45:
Get ready to unlock your creative potential at ACE Designathon, where imagination meets innovation! Participants will have the chance to showcase their design skills, think outside the box, and bring bold ideas to life — all within a thrilling race against time.

Details:

  • Date: 30th October 2025
  • Theme: Open Idea — Design Anything, Create Everything
  • Open To: Students from all colleges (inter-college teams allowed)
  • Tool: Any of choice (Figma, Canva, Photoshop, Illustrator, etc.)
  • Mode: Offline
  • Fees: 150 per team | 100 solo

Rules and Regulations:

  • Participants must register before the deadline to be eligible to participate in the competition.
  • The competition is open to all.
  • Participants must bring their own laptops and required design tools.
  • Designs must be created within the given time limit.
  • Entries will be judged based on creativity, originality, and presentation.
  • Any form of plagiarism or use of pre-made templates will lead to disqualification.
  • Participants must follow the instructions of the organizers and maintain a respectful attitude towards others.
  • Any form of unprofessionalism or misconduct will result in disqualification.
  • The organizers reserve the right to disqualify any participant found violating the rules and regulations.

column11: The LNM Institute of Information Technology
column45:
Participation Rules:

  • Teams can have 1 to 5 members.

Regestration Fees:

  • Rs. 500 after round 1.

Domains of Pitching:

  • Your idea should be submitted under one broad sector (only for categorization, investors and judges will evaluate all ideas):
  • Technology & IT
  • Healthcare & Biotechnology
  • Renewable Energy & Sustainability
  • Education & EdTech
  • Finance & FinTech
  • Agriculture & AgriTech
  • Logistics & Supply Chain
  • Consumer Goods & Retail
  • Social Impact & Public Welfare

General Rules:

  • Sector Alignment – Clearly mention the industry your idea addresses.
  • Timelines – All submissions and presentations must meet deadlines.
  • Authenticity – Plagiarism or reuse of unoriginal ideas will result in disqualification.

Why Participate:

  • Raise Capital – Convince investors to back your startup with real funding.
  • Mentorship & Networking – Build valuable connections with entrepreneurs, VCs, and subject matter experts.

Evaluation Parameters:

  • Originality – Freshness and creativity of the concept.
  • Viability – Can it be realistically executed?
  • Market Scope – Size of opportunity and customer adoption potential.
  • Business Model Strength – Revenue clarity and growth vision.
  • Investor Appeal – How compelling and fundable is the pitch?
  • Presentation Impact – Persuasiveness, clarity, and engagement.

Competition Flow:

Round 1: Pitch Deck Submission:

  • Task: Submit a detailed pitch deck with an executive summary. Shortlisted entries advance.

Round 2: Expert Jury Round:

  • Mode: On-Campus (LNMIIT)
  • Date: Day 2
  • Task: Deliver a 10-minute presentation + Q&A before a jury of professors, entrepreneurs, and professionals. Top-performing teams move to the finals.

Round 3: Investor Showdown:

  • Mode: On-Campus (LNMIIT)
  • Date: Day 3
  • Task: Face a panel of angel investors and venture capitalists in the ultimate pitch-off. The outcome? Investment offers, mentorship, and strategic partnerships.

Team Size:

  • Minimum: 1 member
  • Maximum: 5 members
